review_body: Never stayed before and it was the first time staying at that hotel with 3 other friends and the rooms were a good size and the beds were so comfy and had comfy sleep and the breakfast was very good had a different variety off cereals and toast and juices and loved swimming in the pool will definitely stay again

We stayed at this hotel with our group of students for 8 days in late Feb-March. The location is great, easy walk to the beach and to restaurants or shops. The rooms are clean and the service is great. The hotel is under renovation and some of the rooms didn’t have access to their balconies. Hopefully, the renos will be completed soon.

I emailed them about 15 days before check-in date requesting a quiet room for my 2 night stay because I have chronic migraine. However they gave us a lower floor room facing the busy street. They provide complimentary breakfast, but honestly it was terrible. Scrambled eggs were soggy, no boiled eggs and other options too were very limited. I got migraine due to the street noise one night and decided to rest in the room for few hours during the day. But, they were undergoing a major construction project due to which it was extremely noisy and almost impossible to stay inside the room during the day. They should be transparent and publish a construction notice on their Tripadvisor page and the hotel website!

Great location close to main strip of Waikiki , bus and trolley cars , very clean rooms and comfortable beds . Would highly recommend , found staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good however a little more variety of hot food ,and extended till 9am would good

The Coconut Waikiki is a great boutique hotel with excellent personal service and a wonderful location! Valet service is quick and easy, front desk staff was excellent. This is not a large hotel, but it’s an easy walk to the beach. There’s also lots of restaurants and shops on the way. Breakfast is offered daily of the same cereals, waffles, and eggs - they could mix it up a little bit. Otherwise the room was comfortable and cleaned everyday very well. The air conditioner could get loud at times, but overall we loved our stay. We are going to have to come back again!

Some of the bad reviews I’m a little surprised by. Stayed here and booked a standard room, get there and get upgraded to the view of the canal. Some reviews say it’s noisy because of the traffic. “Alright fancy man, live in your quiet suburban house.” There was traffic and noise, but not once I thought “Hey, the reviews are right, it is loud.” These reviewers should just stick to the main hub of tourist Waikiki. The staff are just fantastic and super nice. Breakfast was great. Added bonus. Popcorn throughout the day. Added bonus. Towels for the pool and beach. Added bonus. I have stayed before in the major hotels here and to be honest, this was a little more enjoyable. Great location. I am definitely going to stay here again next time. And across from the canal is a dog park too. Who does not love sitting on a balcony, drinking and watching dogs be stupid. Just do yourself a favour and book it. Do it.

This is a lovely small hotel. It is currently under balcony restoration so a little congested at times in the lobby during the day. The room was very nice and a lite breakfast is available every morning. The hotel is about 3 long blocks from the beach, but a good healthy walk.I would strongly recommend this hotel!

A 6 night stay mid February on the 7th floor overlooking Lewers Street.Check in and out friendly and fast.Room was large and clean, bed comfortable, shower hot with good water pressureDaily breakfast very ordinary and why is it turned off at 8.30 every morning? Its Hawaii and its a holiday destination, people like to sleep in. The hotel is situated at the canal end of Lewers Street and about a 10 minute walk to the nearest beach area.Hotel has big noise problems. The winds ripped around the building howling most nights. The traffic from 7 floors below in Lewers Street is loud. The noise from a roof top car park opposite over night is also loud.The two window mounted air conditioning units cannot be left on during the night, just too loud.The free hotel supplied ear plugs available in the room did help, but even our own ear plugs did not completely drown out overnight noise.Wind noise, traffic noise, car park noise, little the hotel management can do other than completely sound proof the entire building. Not recommended and would not stay again when next we find ourselves in Hawaii.

Joselito Pineda. Very knowledgable and efficient. He is very polite and pleasant always with a wonderful smile. It’s a pleasure to have him here to assist as a member of the staff here at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. Thank you very much Joselito for a job well done. Jim.

While most of the staff was super nice, there were a few major negatives about the Coconut.We paid extra for a mountain view, but there was so much noise from the street it was hard to sleep. The bed was lumpy with bad pillows. Breakfast was really bad. No decent fruits, just a lot of processed cereals. We paid over 200 a night, it should of been better than it was. You're better off staying at a remodeled hotel, not the outdated and underinvested Coconut.Disappointed !

Great value. Good friendly efficient service. Fairly quiet location a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach. Outdoor swimming pool is now heated! Substantial free breakfast now with more than just juice and pastries.

Coconuts Waikiki had no problem putting me in the streets with an already paid room. I was having a lil trouble with security deposit and they wouldnt allow family or friends to pay my deposit over the phone.... would never stay at such place again even if they paid me! Was a very scary experience!

Shadelle at the breakfast service was extremely pleasant, helpful and sweet. Made us a togo bag for our early morning excursion. As for the hotel, the beds are a bit lumpy and the pillows are so overfilled that it could break a neck! The windows are dated so you can hear all the traffic of the cars passing by. But the location is great and their pool is nicely warmed. My kid loved it. For 200$ a night it was average.

It was our good fortune to select the Coconut Waikiki as our hotel in Honolulu. It is conveniently located, less crowded than the nearby facilities but an easy walking distance to restaurants, the beach and the fun things to do in Waikiki. All of the staff is quite friendly, very helpful and knowledgeable about interesting the area. The facility is both charming and a very good bargain. We highly recommend it to all visitors to Honolulu.

We arrived on a Sunday and when we got to the hotel I didn't see anywhere to park for check in. I stopped in a no parking zone while my wife went in and asked about parking. I knew that we would need to find parking or use the valet. When she asked about parking they told us that you could find a place along the Ali Wai Road or use valet parking at $30. There are other parking garages around but we weren't informed of that. We chose valet parking for the convenience.We were told that breakfast was from 6:30 to 8:30. I thought that the 8:30 hour was a little early for a shut off but realized later that this was to make sure everyone was awake before the jack hammering started after 8:30. We were gone by 9 on Monday so didn't notice anything amiss. However we were a little later starting on Tuesday and heard the noise. I asked about it and they told me that it was construction going on that day. Then we had a tour on Wednesday that we waited for until later in the morning and heard the jack hammering start. You couldn't hear the TV unless it was loader than the noise. I went down stairs that there was a gentleman, quite irate at the noise. He was screaming how this was totally unacceptable along with a few other words. They offered to move him but it wouldn't have helped since we were in the lobby and it was juist as noisy as the rooms. The desk made a call and the noise quit. We left on our tour so I don't know what happened there. Thurday we were gone early again so missed the noise but when we got back to the hotel that night the AC wasn't cooling very much. We were going out for dinner so we figured it would be better when we got back. It was worse. We called the desk and they got someone up there. They couldn't make the AC work so moved us to another room.Friday more noise and I complained to the desk. They apologized and offered to move us again. Why it was still noisy. They said that this was the last day and it would end by 4:30. I asked them to make it right. Nothing happened. Now if you have gotten through this the good things are that the hotel does supply a breakfast and that would cost you a minimum of $40 within walking distance. If you drive maybe $25. The con is that the breakfast is scrambled eggs and sausage with a variety of breads or waffles. Cereal and fruit is also available.The location is good within a mile walk there are all sorts of plases to eat, shop and enjoy the beach. The rooms are good size but the bath is very small. 2 foot sink, toilet jammed in between the shower and sink with a minimum dimension allowed by code. The valet parking was nice and the attendants were pleasant and quick. If not for the construction and lack of acknowlegement of the problem I would have give the hotel a 4 but as it was don't stay here until they are finished with the construction.

I booked a suite...was great. Spacious, clean and roomy. Bed was VERY comfortable. Breakfast was a bonus. Nothing fancy, but included in price and worth it. If you are looking for a big pool, this is not it. I am disabled and there are no stairs to go in and out (just a little ladder to climb in and out) but you should be going to the beach anyway! Would definitely recommend this hidden gem.

Shadelle did a great job she is the best and I hope her boss see this!!!!! The hotel is a nice and clean place. People are friendly. If your planning a trip to honolulu hawaii I would recommend this hotel

I stayed here for 6 nights and hotel staff was kind enough to offer a room as we arrived at 9:00 am after long flight at a little extra charge.This hotel is only 2 blocks down to Waikiki beach and main street.Hotel also provides complimentary breakfast and then popcorns during the afternoon.Kids loved all the games that they have in the outside area.Absolutely good value for money.

We had a wonderful stay at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel in Honolulu in October 2019.The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is attentive, very warm and accommodating. The hotel is well located. The breakfast is generous and fresh.Bath towels are available to go to the beach.

The building was clean, well-maintained, and cheerful. The room and its furnishings were very welcoming. The complimentary breakfast was as good as any I’ve seen. The rates were reasonable. The location was very good, close enough to everything but not in the middle of the crowded places. Most importantly, the staff was pleasant and very helpful. We enjoyed our stay tremendously and would love to go back.

This was a nice quiet hotel. Great location. Great staff. Good food and snacks. I would definitely consider staying there again. This was my first time in Hawaii. It is close to shopping and food. I was very pleased!

We had an excellent stay at the Coconut Waikiki in November. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk gives you beach towels and chairs for free. One of the front desk girls even let my mother borrow her personal beach umbrella for the week. A decent breakfast was served hot daily but a little more variety would have been nice. We had a view of the canal which was very pretty to see the kayakers in the mornings. The location was excellent easily walkable to Waikiki beach. We decided to Uber more days because my mother is 71 and we had a bunch of beach and snorkel stuff. The room itself was nice with a small kitchenette with a microwave, sink, dishes, coffee maker and mini fridge. We bought some groceries and ate at the hotel a few times. In the lobby they have large dining tables where you can eat or play family games. There's also a tv. They hold craft events during the day. We got to make really cute "ALOHA " wooden signs as souvenirs. I saw them being sold at the stores for $30! It was a fun, quick, and free project....sooooo cute! The hotel itself is no frills but is just what we were looking for: clean, comfortable, cozy. Overall we had a great stay and will hopefully be back! You can't beat the price.

Stay was very friendly and efficient. Lobby is bright and clean. 24 gym, a few dumbbells and cardio machines. There is a small outdoor pool. Morning breakfast consisted of fresh orange juice, assorted cereals, oranges, scrambled eggs and breakfast sausage and very good coffee. We were very pleased with the hotel, location was perfect, just a 10 minute walk from Waikiki beach and recommend it .....we will stay here again in the future

We stayed at coconut Waikiki Hotel for 10 nights and had wonderful experiences. The hotel is everything described on the website. It is clean and well maintained. Our room has doubles beds, mini fridge, microwave, dishes and mugs. It also has a balcony, coffee table and chairs. The bathroom has all the necessary amenities. Breakfast is very nice. Coffee and tea are always hot and available in the lobby through out the day. The location is very convenient. Only 2 blocks away from the beach and minutes walk to ABC stores, buses and lots of great restaurants. Hotel staff are very kind and helpful. Everyone seems to love working there. We had very comfortable stay and will definitely go back again!

Room was good although a little small. We asked for a room away from the road next to canal which was very noisy. Pool area was great. Breakfast was okay but a bit of variation would have improved it.

The rooms are very small. The hotel was under construction and no advance warning was given. I did voice my disappointment and received a suite but again it was small compared to other suites. The same items were served each morning for breakfast, I would have appreciated if they switched it up.

We stayed here twice on the way out and back for our 50th anniversary cruise. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were smallish but clean and pleasant. It's about a 15 minute walk to the beach (Waikiki), but the hotel is on the Ali Wai canal, and there is a great walking/jogging path just across the street. You can arrange an early checkin (for a fee) and that worked for us since on the way back (from Brisbane) we arrived at 9AM. The lanai allowed us to sit outside and enjoy the Hawaiian environment. They offer a good breakfast in the AM. Would definitely stay here again.

Coconut Waikiki is one one many hotel along the Canal in Waikiki. Not a short walk to the beach. A ten story 50's building you can see some of the original mid-century touches in the cabinets in the main room and the bathroom. Our smallish room had 2 double beds, a little kitchenette, bathtub/shower and a balcony from which we could see a bit of ocean. We did not use any AC in January and found the louvered windows hard to open but once open a nice breeze came in. Free wi-fi was easier than most to use and the free breakfast was welcome. Why is it that the expensive hotels do not offer free breakfast but the lower price ones do?? With the windows open the noise from the street was an issue but it quiets down in the later hours. Ear plugs are provided in the rooms.Breakfast was usual - scrambled eggs, sausage, hot cereal, HB eggs, toast, juice and waffles - try the coconut syrup on them. Very tasty. Check in was easy and friendly. We were here for 3 days and the price was right.

OK hotel in good location. Room on the 7th floor was very satisfactory. Breakfast OK, however, they finish it at 0930, which is quite early. <big disappointment was that the swimming pool was under renovation, which fact came as a surprise. They offered to use their sister hotel´s pool, but it was very small and always overcrowded. Also the room, even thou being on the 7th floor, was very noisy during the night time due to street noise. <aida, however, kept our room very tidy and clean, thanks!

Stayed at Coconut Waikiki for 1 night while transiting through Honolulu. The room was pretty basic - don't expect anything fancy during your stay. The carpet did not appear to be very clean and the fixtures and furniture was quite outdated. The issue though is with the noise filtering through the balcony glass door if you're facing the street (which we were). The air-conditioning would randomly switch off in the middle of the night and you'll be stuck listening to the sound of cars whizzing by while you try to sleep. Better off staying at the sister hotel - Shoreline!

Good place, Clean room, the staff are helpful. It's take few minute to walk to waikiki beach, but near to bus stop, very easy to go to anywhere. And near to shopping area, continence stores and supermarket are nearby.

This was our best stay on the island! The room was clean, spacious, and cool; there was a delicious breakfast (french toast, cereal, fruit, yogurt, milk, juice, sweet rolls); and we could walk to the beach!

It is a very terrible hotel. Breakfast needs much improvement, now it is almost the same everyday. Also people should take notice of noises by strong wind outside, especially in January. Staff are very arrogant.

The hotel is basic and dated, but our room was huge and had two bathrooms. However, the pool was out of commission (January 2020) and the balcony was sealed shut against the construction project outside in the parking lot. They provide ear plugs, if that's any hint. It all feels a little sad, not the kind of fun Hawaii trip you're hoping for. I asked for (and got) a refund on the $33/day "resort" charge, given the lack of any amenities. They were nice about it at least.

On the beach, Dukes restaurant, helpful and friendly staff, and it is just a quick walk to Lewers Street for food or over to Waikiki beach, many shops and places to eat right there on the first floor ... can't praise this place enough.

As the other reviews say the staff were always brilliant - thank you for the great service. However, we checked out after two days and paid extra to stay somewhere else due to the following:- pool closed - we had to go elsewhere- fitness center (a rather generous term to use) virtually non-existent – we had to go elsewhere- breakfast very limited - we had to go elsewhere- window air conditioner very loud, constantly waking us up at night- room in a generally poor condition.

The Coconut Waikiki Hotel is a nice place to stay. Friendly, clean hotel knowledgeable staff. Our "city view" room had a king size bed and six drawer dresser with a ton of space for clothes and a large closet. The "American" continental breakfast, cereal, waffles, eggs, pastries, etc. was more that adequate.

Staff was very attentive. The hotel is very clean and they have activities available to guests throughout the week. There’s water, tea, coffee and a station to fill your water bottle. Pool was under construction but they redirected us to shoreline hotels pool. Better to walk to the beach anyway, you’re in Hawaii! Nice, comfortable place to stay in waikiki. Would recommend.

friendly staff, good service, wonderful free breakfast program and information when we didn't know what to do. Provided luggage storage after we checked out and gone for a local island circle tour on my last day in Oahu.

This hotel is perfect if you are in a budget and want to avoid paying resort fees. We checked in quickly and the valet parking as super slick and easy to use.Are room was slightly dated but clean and we left our bags and headed to Waikiki which was only a ten minute walk. The hotel tries its best to keep you there with a free buffet from 6:30-8:30 and fresh popcorn nightly.The staff are excellent and we will be back again next time we fly back to HNL!

Clean, nicely appointed room close to everything. Staff was fantastic, it was always nice to come back to the hotel welcome from a day out and about. Any issues were minor in comparison to the pluses of this hotel. Would stay again!

The bed sheets had a bunch of marks and stuff on it- it was brown and I didn’t want to touch it. I ended up not sleeping at the hotel because the sheets were so disgusting. But the receptionist was nice, and the outside of the hotel looks good. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are pretty nice and modern. They come with shampoo, conditioner, lotion? as well as cotton swabs, cotton balls, and makeup remover wipes which I found to be a nice touch that not every hotel has. The pool was closed but they do have a sister hotel that you could go to. The location of this hotel was really nice- super close to The Galleria and just many Waikiki shops and restaurants!

I booked into the Coconut based on good reviews I'd read here, and they were not correct. We booked in for several nights but checked out after one night there and found accommodations elsewhere because it's not a nice hotel at all. We were informed on arrival that the pool had been drained and would not be available for our entire stay due to "an incident" but wouldn't say what that was. They said there was a pool at a sister hotel up the road and we could walk up there if we wanted a pool. The room itself was cobbled together with the strangest layout. The bathroom door is translucent and couldn't lock and would slide open as you were on the toilet. Hope you're extra comfortable with the people you're sharing a double room with. Had to climb over one of the beds to get to the only "closet" (which was a section of room with a pull curtain, inside was a safe, teetering on a non-descript square of some kind. It was out of order and not useable. Just flashed "error". Couldn't use the dresser - the drawers were too close to the bed. There were earplugs on the nightstand due to excessive noise (I didn't hear any except from the wind and loud street noise, but we didn't stay long enough to hear renovation noise that we were told upon check in was going on). The air conditioning was a window a/c that needed a cleaning and the curtains in the windows were torn. We both woke up sneezing from allergies. The breakfast was fine if you are into sugary cereal and what seemed to be powdered eggs. The only thing this place has going for it is the staff, who were very accommodating and kind. They were all excellent. I was very grateful they were so lovely. And I was even more grateful to check into a nicer hotel and enjoy our vacation.

Exactly what we wanted. Clean, friendly and professional staff, could easily walk everywhere, and a decent price. The room was updated and nice. Staff stored our luggage for us after checkout so we could walk around before our flight. Would book here again if we came back to Waikiki. :)

Staff were friendly. The bed was comfortable and firm. Pillows were firm enough. Had an upgraded view of the water along Ala Wai boulevard. It's a nice view. The walk to the beach is about 10-15 min. There are shops nearby. However , the room is old. The air conditioner is the old school box in the window. So it's loud. The breakfast is so basic, it doesn't even have any ham or sausage or bacon. Worse of all, it's only from 6.30a.m. to 8.30a.m. You are not allowed to start taking at 6.25a.m. and they start packing at 8.30a.m. sharp. I've never been to a hotel that ends breakfast before 9a.m. except in Japan and I thought even that was ridiculous. How do you expect guests to get up so early on a holiday? It seems like an insincere gesture to provide breakfast. Although housekeeping is done every day, I hve had dirty towels (I.e. yellow stains) on the rack on two occasions. I find this unacceptable. The metal towel rack was old and a little rusty. The showerhead didn't work so well because the tap below (for a bath) would be running as well, wasting water. Because the tap is so old, you don't dare to yank so hard, in fear that the tap would be broken later. I appreciate the upgraded room but I am not sure I would stay here again.

First time in Oahu & I didn’t realise how far this place is from Waikiki beach. Yes, I looked at the map before reservation, but when you just want to got for a dip, the walk to beach seemed to take forever. Also, the pool was closed during our 10 days stay & nil advance notice were given + resort fee was collected regardless.

Great hotel, room amenities good and room clean, staff excellent; very friendly and helpful. Hotel good location only noisy with traffic below. Breakfast nice selection and activities provided for kids. Unfortunately pool not operational, however, hotel provided alternative pool at sister hotel. Will definitely recommend and use again for family.

It was our first time in Honolulu.This place is nice and clean.The staff is really friendly and polite.Good food.Espacially the show ice..the snow is on Tuesdays and Thursdays.I will recommend this place.Every day the bed is made.Sheets are fresh and soft.

Really lovely accommodation, and staff.I stayed at the coconut for two weeks over November-December.staff were always really helpful when I needed their assistance.My room was spacious, and kept very clean.

Coconut Horel is the ultimate property for both business and leisure travellers as it caters to families, groups and singles, it is absolutely fabulous.Centrally located close to the major shopping area and close to all Honolulu has to offer, it was an ideal base for our stay.It is lucky to have an amazing team of staff who want guests to feel welcome and enjoy their stay.We will be returning to this excellent hotel.
user_name:
Serena C
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is okay staff is friendly. Pool was closed . When I returned the first day after midnight, the lock did not work .Did take quite some time to get into my room.Not sure, if I would return to this place..

Courtesy greeting, held our bags before our room was ready so we could come back for a later check-in.Room was neat but just a little disappointed we had no notice about the pool closure, noisy aircon in the room in a very awkward spot (blocked by furniture), not able to have the included breakfast due to an early departure required for our flight.

We stayed 3 nights at Coconut hotel during Thanksgiving 2019 and it was very nice. Kind staff, clean rooms, simple but good breakfast, perfect location, really good sunrise.I recommend this hotel to everyone.Serena

Old hotel. Interior is run down. Needs an overhaul of everything. We had drainage problems in our sink and shower and the maintenance people were very responsive. We were moved to another room immediately. Thought we'd get an "upgrade" for our inconvenience, but that didn't happen. Yet, the positive attitude and helpfulness of the staff as well as the great location and fair price make this place a good place to stay. The free "loaner" beach chairs and towels were a plus too (yet the loaner chairs were torn and in useable but poor condition.

This hotel is very well located in downtown, Honolulu, close to restaurants, shops, public transportation and the beach. Staff is kind and very helpful. Checkin was fast. Breakfast buffet is great, specially the waffles and yogurt with granola. Coffee, decaf coffee and tea available all time at the lobby. Popcorn available from 2-6pm every day. Beach towels and chairs available upon request. Recently renovated. Around 150 dolars cheaper rate than hotels located at waikiki beach front. Rooms are small but clean and have a convenient small kitchen. I would definitely stay here again. After all great value for money!!!

We enjoyed our stay at the coconut. The staff were helpful and friendly. There was an issue with our room and they upgraded us to another room to resolve it. The location is within walking distance of the beach and many restaurants. The included breakfast was basic but consistent. Overall a good value and we would stay here again.

Great position to all amenities. Great value with breakfast included. Helpful and friendly staff.would definitely recommend.Daily activities were also included in tariff. Free towels and chairs to take to the beach.

One thing about traveling is that it’s hard and exhausting time especially when you’re traveling with young children. But the Coconut Waikiki Hotel made it so much easier for us to just enjoy our family time together. It was our first time in Hawaii and we will not stay anywhere else. We love it there. Will be back soon!!

Terrible room cleaning. Reception vague, inattentive, checked us in late and couldn’t give receipts when we checked out. Donovan was rude and a total no person that couldn’t provide any payment information. Breakfast is disgusting, waffles rock hard, toppings sickening sweet, eggs made from powder. Total rip off, bad service & bad food.

this was a great place to stay the staff were friendly and the room was clean and spacious, the original room I was allocated was under construction so I was upgraded to an executive suite at no extra cost. Jessica at reception was particularly friendly and helpful with maps and advice.

Had a very nice room near many things but yet far enough away to stay out of the craziness of Honolulu. Close to the Waikiki Trolley depot and nice walking along the canal. The included breakfast was more than sufficient to start our day and the flavored waters and afternoon popcorn were nice touches.

Room 602, is not suitable for two people, let alone even one. I have never stayed in a room so small,the bathroom door would not stay closed, slides back open immediately. Even though the staff was very nice, and the valet service superb, I would not recommend this place, the area they have set up for breakfast, was way too small, you could not get your food without bumping into each other. For the price, I know we could have done better, way too many hidden fees.

We were told upon check-in that our room was being swapped for a room far from the construction noise since we were told construction was being done exclusively on the top floors. However, we were woken up early in the morning the 2nd day to incessant drilling sounds from seemingly right above our ceiling. The construction continued the entire morning only breaking for lunch. We asked the front desk about the construction situation above our room and were told that construction was actually happening on our entire side of the building and that no other rooms were available for us to switch to. I mentioned that we were told upon check-in by a different associate that we were supposed to be nowhere near the construction but the associate we were speaking with simply said that assertion was inaccurate and was not at all apologetic about our situation. The associate that originally checked us in and told us we'd get a quiet room also never turned to look at us during this entire conversation. As such, we felt that we were simply set up to stay in the middle of all the construction.

The hotel was just right and close to Shops and Waikiki beach. When in Hawaii go for the long walks along the beach, Diamond Head and other areas with amazing scenery. Try locally prepared food and snacks.

We really enjoyed our short stay at the Coconut Waikiki. We were upgraded to a king room with a mountain view and the room was comfortable, had a great view (see photo) and had everything you needed (safe, iron, free bottled water, excellent wifi). The staff were great and we enjoyed the free 2487 coffee facilities and the free, fresh popcorn in the afternoon. The hotel pool was small, but good for a cooling dip after a day out. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to the beach and one block from the main bus routes and has lots of nearby bars and restaurants. The buffet breakfast didn't have a lot of variety, but was a good start to the day. Definitely recommended as a value for money Honolulu/Waikiki base.

I would have given a 5 rating but I had two issues with this hotel during the course of our 7 night stay. 1. Beach sand that had accidentally fallen out of my shoe on to our room carpet stayed there for two days, indicating our room was not vacuumed. 2.Eating the same breakfast for 7 days got pretty boring by the 3rd day. Overall this is a very family friendly hotel with lots of other perks like free use of beach towels. Great location, family friendly safe area. Walking distance to many amazing downtown shops/restaurants. Very happy staff. Did not like the $30 parking per night.

What a really friendly place to stay. The staff were very helpful. Would definitely stay again. They were doing exterior renovations while we were there but did not hear anything from the contractors. The room was basic and had a few minor issues, but these did not deter from us enjoying staying at this location.

This family, friendly, clean and tidy hotel, with an included continental breakfast sufficient to set one up for the day, met all our needs over a 10 day stay. The hotel, although not beachfront, is very central to everything you need in Waikiki. The Waikiki trolley hub is two short blocks away and suited our needs well. Hotel Staff are very efficient and friendly. If you book through the hotel website you don't pay a daily resort fee. Due to our length of stay we were upgraded to a mountain view king room that also overlooked the canal. We did not find noise a problem - we were out during the day and a comfortable bed gave us a good night's sleep. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't want to spend a fortune on accommodation.

We recently returned from our repeat visit at the Coconut. Again the staff here were awesome in all aspects. The Coconut is a few blocks off the beach, but within walking distance to everything. It’s smaller and much less per night than the expensive big hotels, but the overall package is well worth it. If you book direct with them, there is no resort fee, which can be upwards of $50(US)daily at other places. They include a continental breakfast daily, swimming pool, beach towels, beach chairs, fresh popcorn and varieties of water daily at no extra costs. Valet parking on site with excellent service. Overall the Coconut is the perfect place for your stay in Waikiki, full service at an economical price. We will be returning soon!

Great hotel. Especially if you’re here to mainly sleep! A plus free continental breakfast from 630-830am which serves it purpose! Friendly staff, service, clean rooms too. We got the king bed with mountain views plus Waikiki skyline with a balcony and couldn’t complain! They even gifted us a bottle of wine for our anniversary. Valet parking is $30 per day. Small pool but we were always exploring outside Waikiki. Pretty close to a lot of things! We pre-booked so we didn’t have to really pay a resort fee just the taxes of course! Wifi worked great and so did the AC. We were facing a street but we were so tired every night we managed to sleep quite fine! Only downfall was construction Monday to Friday until 4pm- pretty noisy if you’re coming back to take a nap after exploring. I would stay here again!

We stayed 2 nights before boarding a cruise ship. Hotel was nice a short walk to the busy shopping streets and a little further for the main beach access. Breakfast was good and a great perk. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful.

We stayed at the Coconut for 5 nights and I would have to say I was quite impressed with the quality of service for a 3* hotel. When we arrived there was some ongoing improvement works going on which were okay, as we were leaving it seemed that some of the exterior work was complete but there was some interior work that was audible during the day. This was for improvements though so I wasn’t too bothered by this.For a continental breakfast I though this selection was very good and tasty. The interior decor of the hotel was also nice for the price.One big issue for me was the road noise of a night. The hotel does provide ear plugs which were very good at blocking out the noise, but this shouldn’t be the long term fix for this. The balcony doors either need replacing or new seals need fitting. Also the air con unit was very noisy.Another issue was the fact that the air con spat out water all over the balcony, rendering the balcony useless during the daytime.When I was there I did do a price comparison to some of the hotels closer to the beach and they came out roughly similar. But aside from those things my stay was pleasant at the Coconut, and they clearly are upgrading to address some of these issues which I cannot complain about!

My wife and I stayed here for a few days and the staff was great. They were very welcoming and made us feel like we were on vacation. The hotel is old but it was in the process of being updated The location was great. We could walk to everything we needed. The breakfast area is a little small and you may have to wait for a table but we never had to wait more than a minute or two. Since the hotel is small, they only offer Valet parking, but never had an issue getting the car.

Staff are amazing, so friendly, always ready to help with any questions even offered other suggestions to me which was wonderful. Motel is great and in a really good location, breakfast is good. This motel is not the Ritz, I think it is better because the staff are so wonderful, always smiling and friendly. Loved our stay thank you!

This hotel was excellent and had everything you need. The staff were very friendly and informative, including a chalkboard in reception which showed the daily weather forecast etc. The local hawaiin man which manned the tour desk was so so helpful and gave us the absolute best tips on where to see for an authentic experience. This allowed us to find a secluded beach, in peak season. So magical. Although the hotel isn't on the beach side, it has river views which are just as nice, and it is only a very short walk to the beach and main shops/restaurants.

The rooms are very nice and clean, the breakfast is in a small place but with the essential to start the day. The reception works well with a vallet parking service.The swimming pool is small but functional.During our stay there were some renovation in the hotel, but without impacting the normal services. Pay attention to what you leave in your room balcony - the wind is strong and we found some swim suits on the street.Very well located with a 10 min wal to waikiki beach.

Really nice hotel with very friendly staff. Room was clean, and bed was comfy, we were on the 10 floor and a view of the Ala Wai canal. The breakfast was satisfactory... same everyday, but you can change what you eat daily...toast, pastries, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, and especially liked the make it yourself waffles. Popcorn snack in lobby 2-6pm, 3 different water dispensers with choice of sliced fruits to flavor it. The location is very convenient, bus lines were a block away that took us downtown and towards diamond head. Would definitely book here again.

I visited Oahu and the Coconut Waikiki Hotel for the first time in September this past year. My family, my better half (pregnant) and I and our 3 year old were excited about the trip and excited about he hotel and the "extras" and with the price and the size of the room we booked.Our trip however was highlighted by a extremely disappointing and gross experience due to lack of effort, practice or pride by the housekeeping staff upon changing over the room from the previous guest.We had booked the Executive suite for 7 nights. Upon arriving we found the room to be huge and it had 2 bathooms and was well laid out. Excited to see our double lanai's we go to the balcony {which had a view from the sliding door of the canal and mountains) and found both were locked due to construction. We traveled over 4000km to be stuck with out a balcony. This was not mentioned when we booked and only later upon arrival were there signs posted. We were not happy.We phoned down to the front desk to voice our displeasure and were told we could move to a room with a view which was much smaller. we declined and ask to see if anything could be done the next day.That night we went to bed late and I slept on the convenient sofa bed with my daughter well my partner slept on the bed alone.The next night, not being moved to a new room yet, my partner went to have a nap and woke up with her sweatshirt smelling like urine. She got up and smelt the covers and it smelt like pee. Since she had slept alone that previous night on the other side of the bed no one had been on that side of the bed yet. We peeled back the covers, sheet by sheet right down to the mattress cover and the scent become stronger and stronger. Someone or some pet had peed the bed and it had traveled down to the mattress. We called the front desk immeadiately and they sent up a nice and polite man who worked in some capacity for the hotel and he came into investigate. He was dismayed and grossed out as well upon seeing and smelling what had happened and said "that this should have been noticed when they changed the sheets."Obviously someone had skipped out on this practice and my better half woke up with wearing a shirt that stank like someone's urine.He then said tomorrow they would replace the mattress and i asked if we could move the mattress to the hall and he thought we shouldn't. We ended up moving it to one of the hallways in the suite and all three of us ending up sleeping on the sofa bed.After visiting the front desk we requested that the manager please call us the next day and we were assured they would.The next day came and after not hearing from the front desk we called down and asked if the manager was in yet. We were told they were in a meeting till some time and that they were looking to move us to a new room.Somehow the same suite type room was now magically available.We never got a call from the manager to talk about what happened.After finally being moved, the rest of our trip was very uneventful and we could see the promise of the hotel and what it offered. The day to day front staff were very polite and nice and they seemed to have some pride in their work.However the fact that we never got a real serious call from the management is quite appalling. To travel such a distance for a vacation to relax and unwind to find ourselves sleeping in a bed that was peed and never changed probably is totally unacceptable.No one would ever want to stay in any class hotel in those conditions. And the fact that we had to put in a lot of effort to fix the situation compared to a level of extreme importance once they heard and saw what had happened is even more wrong.Construction of the outside of the hotel...unfortunate. No balcony access in first room....disappointing....(eventually got 2 balconies albeit of a parking lot view)...But having to sleep in a bed that wasn't cleaned properly and quickly changed with new sheets.....GROSS and totally.

Maybe I was expecting too much from a 3 star hotel but I was disappointed. When we arrived we had difficulty getting round the scaffolding to get our cases through the front door and nobody came to help us.During our stay 1 of the two lifts was out of operation and I got the impression that it was unlikely to be mended.We could not sit on our balcony as there was a constant shower of water from the aircon above. We reported this but nothing was done about it. Our aircon left a constant pool of water on the balcony.The safe and the toilet roll holder were both hanging off the wall. If you could get on the balcony, part of the view was ok but straight ahead were guys carrying out building work on flats opposite and creating lots of dust.Breakfast was provided but it was buffet style and reminiscent of a youth hostel with plastic plates, eaten at bench tables, if you could find a seat, or otherwise on settees in the reception. The food was ok but the conditions were poor. The hotel did not have a bar or restaurant.On the positive side the staff were friendly, our room was clean and adequate and the pool basic but ok. We were due to return but cancelled.

We were happy with this location in Waikiki. The staff at This Hotel were very nice. And this Hotel was clean. I like the swimming pool and we swam everyday after our tours. Will stay there again. We had a small group of 16 persons.

This is a tired hotel. Pictures are deceiving. Towels are stained and sheets had a rip. The hotel is under renovation and pool is closed Monday- Friday. Construction noise is loud. Elevators are not functioning periodically so you may have to manage luggage up and down 10 floors! This is not what you want for a Hawaiian vacation! Keep looking!!!

The staff were friendly accommodation clean and all went well until the last day. There was a power failure in part of the building but not in our room which meant we did not get or wake up call and had to drag 4 suitcases down 10 floors with very limited assistance from staff. Staff advise that the power failure affected the entire block - that was not true - we had power in our room. They could not process my checkout and advised that the receipt would be emailed - 10 days later and still no sign of it. It would appear as though hotel does not understand contingency planning! I had aching arms and legs for the next 2 days.

Staff are Excellent and Friendly. The rooms are very good and it is a short walk to all activities. The Mountain View rooms get a great breeze every day. The hotel is undergoing renovation but is still clean and efficient.

Pictures are much nicer than reality. Room very dated. Ripped curtain on 1 window. Missing curtains on 2nd window. Ceiling had large stain which looked like a water type leak. Balcony closed due to renovations. It would have been nice to know ahead of time of the Reno. Bathroom has sliding door, no real privacy. Also, it's so small you can shower and use sink (which is past the toilet) at the same time. Too many lights in the room to comfortably sleep, if you are sensitive to that.Staff was very nice.

Wonderful hotel ; very good food ; very good customer service ;everything is walking distance or drivable distance from this hole very clean and crew are always willing to help ; I will again go back here in future.

Arrived in the night, got nice room, everything well organized. Hotel is very clean. Great management, all problems immediately solved.Hotel is very clean. Friendly staff. Located 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach but it was what we were looking for - not having too much party people around.

2nd time at the Coconut, right near the canal. Rooms are adequate and bed/pillows very comfortable and given early early checkin due to dawn flight in. This hotel is perfect for those not wanting to hang around the pool (yes has pool but in bad condition and ugly/univiting outdoors area) or get a drink or food at the hotel-it offers nothing but basic free breakfast only and free tea/coffee all day. Staff were lovely and parking is at a cost

This is a boutique hotel located on Lewers Street. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the Royal Hawaiian Centre on Kalakaua Avenue. This is the main street that has along the shops and restaurants cafes ect. along it. The rooms are old with worn out carpet, but clean and comfortable. I had a mountain view room and the view was lovely. There was a small balcony with 2 chairs on it. It had a small kitchen area with cupboards and sink. Along with a microwave and a fridge. There is a small pool, which is heated and they provide pool towels. The buffet breakfast consists of cereal, scrambled eggs, toast, crosaint, pastry, fruit, Hawaiian tea, coffee & juice. Everyday they have complementary fruit infused water in the lobby area. Every afternoon from 2pm is complementary popcorn in the lobby area. There is a filtered water station where you can refil your water bottles in the lobby area. Mon afternoon 2.30pm - 3.30pm complimentary snow ice in the lobby area. The staff are lovely, always friendly and helpfull. I would stay here again.

I booked the hotel through their website directly with good price as I made early booking. I had read through the website about the renovations. I just think maybe it's done but a little bit of disappointed that it's not finished. Therefore I don't swim at their swimming pool. However, overall, I am satisfied with staying there since the staff is nice and helpful. The location is good and quiet. I can walk to many different restaurants and shops nearby by few to 10 minutes walk. The security is good and safe. The self laundry service is good and convenient. Also not expensive. The popcorn treat after 2pm is nice too. However I was slightly disappointed about their breakfast without boiled egg and some meat like bacon or sausage. Actually they can make some difference for every few days so that I don't need to eat same food in my 7 night there. The room has good view but the toilet is slightly worn out. Basically it's still clean and fine by paying that price. I did enjoy my stay there. Hope their breakfast is better for my next trip there.

I think this was a good hotel for the value for money and location. I had a room facing the canal. The air conditioning unit was quite loud and noise from the street which is probably why they supply you ear plugs.. The air conditioning unit also made a weird scratching noise which was really annoying at night. I barely got any sleep for the 3 nights I was there (even with ear plugs) . I think the breakfast hours were a little short. 6:30-8:30am so if you need a sleep in you'll miss breakfast. The lift was a bit unreliable. I came home from a wedding at night and had to walk up 9 floors as it was out of service.

Our room faced the Ala Wai Canal with a great view of the mountains and City lights. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly, efficient and had much Aloha Spirit. The location was a short walk to the beach and all what Waikiki offers.

So much cheaper and quieter than those on the beachfront / Main Street yet a short walk to both.We rented a convertible for half of the week we stayed there to explore the island - and so glad we did.Room had views across the park and city and ridge but we didn’t spend much time in the room.Handy kitchenette for preparing meals and storing food for the next day’s adventures.

Large rooms with lanai. Great for long stay. Excellent location that doesn't cost a fortune. Made use of breakfast every morning, pool, beach chairs and towels, along with afternoon popcorn and snow ice hour. No complaints!

We were there in two occasions during our trip, and stayed in very different rooms. One was much smaller than the other, the second was quite comfortable and large. I think overall the hotel is very good, of course it is better if you have the larger room. The breakfast is not all that good but gets you going and is appreciated. Staff very courteous.

In heart of Waikiki area. Walkable to the nearby beach. Tons of walkable things like breakfast, drug store, gift store, park, beach, bus lines, and shopping mall. The room itself wasn’t great but wasn’t terrible. I wouldn’t stay for more than one night. It looks to be an very old hotel that needs major upgrades. The AC units are old school (hanging out the window) and make LOUD noises making it tough to sleep. The room was muggy most of the time. Our room was located RIGHT where they are doing some repairs outside the window, NO GOOD!!! So the next morning it was very very very unlike able to stay in the room and chill, too noisy. Thankfully we only needed to stay a night. The room had nice size bed, comfy enough for 4 ppl (2 small children). Has a couch u can pull out as well but they don’t give you extra bedding to even use it so it’s pointless. Bathroom didn’t have enough towels. Did like how our room had to separate bathrooms. Room had mini refrigerator and sink with dishes. They say the ice machines are on levels 2, 4, & 6 but I never found them. They do have courtesy bfast but we didn’t try it. No free airport shuttle service. Can leave bags after checkout if u need more time. Overall, served it’s purpose for us just to sleep for a night until the rest of our family arrived. Price still too high in my opinion. I won’t stay here again.

Great hotel if your on a budget. It has free breakfast. It’s a short walk to Waikiki beach and they have beach towels you can use. I rented a car to see more of Oahu and paid for valet parking which was great cause I didn’t have to find parking. The hotel is a good location also when leaving Waikiki to explore the island. It was quick to get on H1 and getting back to the hotel since it was on the outskirts of busy section of Waikiki. It was great coming back after a day of exploring then walking around Waikiki in the evening. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful with any questions or suggestions of where to go. I will definitely stay again.

These photos shows the lack of maintenance, care and quality of these rooms. *The CITY VIEW is overlooking a car park on which there is another block looking directly into your hotel room. Not to forget, that block also had ‘painters’ working from 8am - 5pm so quite noisy during that time. No point sleeping in!*Air con in located right next to the bed blowing directly on to my kids - which made them sick. No ceiling fans either, so we sweltered during the nights.*Putrid run off from the AC units that drop directly on to each and every balcony - which then drips into to pool! Disgusting!*Carpet “bandaids” around the skirting.* ONE PLASTIC FORK?*Broken fridge that barely kept anything cold.*The bathroom isn’t big enough to swing a cat in! The shower pressure is non existent.*The safe isn’t bolted to the floor so you could literally pick it up and walk out your room.*The continental breakfast is pretty poor. The area in which they serve it is squishy and all guests literally fight to get food. And 6:30am till 8:00 am is not long enough. You are on holidays, you shouldn’t have to rush!*My husband rang reception for a plate so that we were able to share a pizza. He was told that they were only able to give out plates during breakfast time! Really? He reluctantly gave us one in the end but wasn’t pleased about helping hotel guests.*The internet password would change daily, with no prompts by reception so you had to ring the front desk and ask for it. Minimal complaint but again, the front desk would huff * about it.*BUT most IMPORTANTLY there was no warning of construction work taking place on their website. Well, not in BOLD HEADLINES.. nor in their confirmation email, but in small fine print which is almost non existent! I would rather stay at Faulty Towers and have Basil & Cybil as our hosts then spend money on this hotel! (Aussie & British joke)Never.again!

This is our second time staying at the Coconut Waikiki. Our first time was back in 2008 and a was more positive experience. The current decor in the lobby and the rooms is not as bright and fresh as the previous one. The hotel is decent for the price and it’s in a good location, walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants in Waikiki. The staff are generally friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. Having two bathrooms was a plus. We were disappointed however, that we were not able to use the balcony due to the construction. The construction really did impact our stay negatively as it began with drilling and banging right outside our window around 8:00 am all 3 mornings we were there (in hindsight we should have asked to be moved) and we prefer not rise early on vacation. The complimentary breakfast was ridiculously early 6:30-8:30 and short (clearly not catering to to those on vacation) so we didn’t get a chance to partake. There was also signage saying you were not permitted to take food to your room otherwise one of us would have made the trek down and brought back food. This was surprising as I have never had an issue at other hotels and most other hotels usually offer breakfast until at least 9:30 am. I know even on our previous visit here it was offered longer. There was complimentary coffee and water in the lobby throughout the day which was appreciated and our daughter enjoyed the afternoon popcorn. The pool area is nice and the pool though small, is warm and never busy. I may consider staying here again but not while the hotel is under construction.

Pros: Friendly staff, location, affordableCons: Dated hotel, rooms are small, air conditioner in room is tucked in a corner, so one side of room is comfortable the other not so much.Other than that, it's not the worst. There is a lot of potential in this property for improvement.

We enjoyed our stay at Coconut Waikiki. It's a bit far from the beach and Main Street, but still walkable. Hotel is nice and clean. The provided breakfast which included waffles, yogurt and more was a definite plus. The pool is small, but we were the only one using it, so not bad at all. The lobby has a comfy couch area with a selection of board games to play, a very nice touch! Infused water and tea is available in the lobby at all times as is hot water for tea or coffee. During certain times each day a popcorn machine is also available.

I must admit that I was very nervous after reading some of the reviews about this hotel however I was pleasantly surprised.Check in was easy and our room was ready which was nice after a long flight! The hotel is currently undergoing renovations which is good because the carpets need to be changed. The room itself (executive suite)was clean and large enough for the three of us. It had a mini fridge and microwave which was wonderful when qe had left overs. The AC was noisy but the complimentary airplugs drained the noise out. The hotel is very central to shops (e.g. Waikiki shopping centre, Ross, ABC stores etc) and restaurants (e.g Roy's, Hard rock Cafe, Cheesecake factory) The Ala Moana shopping centre is accessible by taking the #8 which stops a block away from the hotel. The #8 also takes you to the Honolulu Zoo. My recommendation would be to extend the breakfast time to 06:30am to 9:30am instead of 6:30 to 8:30. The area is very small but there is enough room to eat outside. If you miss breakfast IHOP and Dennys are within a five to ten minute walk. Waikiki beach is also accessible along with Fort Deherry Beach (you can see fireworks here for free on Friday nights!)Special thanks to Jessica who is the epitome of competence and went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay memorable. The complementary Moscato and chocolates were also a nice touch.I would stay at this hotel again just to see what it looks like after the renovations are complete. It might not be a five star hotel but the service is top notch!

The hotel was under construction during our stay so we couldn't get a good view of the outside of the hotel, but the inside was really nice and clean. Our room overlooked the channel. It was fun to sit out on our balcony and watch the rowers. The pool was warm & clean and not very busy. We really liked how we could borrow beach chairs & towels from the front desk and walk to Waikiki beach. Everything is within walking distance - no need to rent a car. Uber drivers were very plentiful and very nice if you have to go anywhere far. Tons of great shopping and food choices close by.

Stayed here 3 nights. Location is very good- short walk to beach. Came in and out with rental car and valet service was very prompt. Breakfast adequate- coffee excellent. Pool was small but not crowded. Had it to ourselves two of three nights. Price was most reasonable for area and would definitely stay here again.

Very welcoming and helpful front desk. Clean rooms. Perfect location. Good breakfast, and pool area. The gym was small but had plenty of equipment open when we went. The room was very standard for a one bed king and worked perfectly for a two person stay. Clean and pleasant bathroom though small.

Coconut Waikiki Hotel has never let us down. The booking process is always a breeze! Isaac took care of our booking and made sure our stay would be as comfortable as possible by booking us in the same room we stayed in last time. We didn't even have to ask! Since our last stay the Hotel has added some new events to their calendar. They recently introduced "Snow Ice Hour" a mixture of shaved ice and ice cream with a variety of toppings. It was a sweet and cool treat that we took advantage of before heading out to the beach. They also had a snow globe making workshop during our stay that was really fun! I'm sure the events are always changing so if you're staying at this Hotel they make sure that "fun" can be enjoyed by the whole "family". Travelling can be stressful but we always feel welcomed at our "home away from home" known as the Coconut Waikiki Hotel with their lovely accommodations and friendly faces.We will be returning in just a few months and wouldn't think of staying at any other place but here.

Recently stayed for nine nights at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. As there were three of us and we did not wish to cram into two double beds, we opted for the Executive Suite. It was fantastic! It had a king size bed and a sofa bed which was really comfortable. Also two bathrooms which is a necessity. The room was really spacious and very clean. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Also the free breakfast was excellent. We were very happy with this hotel!

From what we've gathered, one if not the only hotel in the area offering free breakfast, a real bonus. Valet service 24/7 is fast. Folks working here very accommodating, very personable. Room had 2 double beds, fridge, microwave, kitchenette with dishes, flatware, sink. Very handy. TV large with many channels. We enjoyed our stay.

I recommend this hotel strongly. Easy walk to beach, shopping , restaurants and bus stop. The staff was so friendly and helpful! Quick to respond when I asked to change the room. I will stay at this hotel whenever I come back to Hawaii.

Very old and tired property. In desperate need of an upgrade some of which was going on as we were staying. Air con unit was very noisy, no access to the balcony and generally very tired condition. However a nice quiet spot and rooms were a decent size.

My friend arrived before me and I had no problem checking in because of awesome staff Donovan! It was modern and clean--I could tell the hotel was renovated for sure. Also, breakfast was awesome, especially the waffles with coconut syrup, and it's free so don't miss that! I had some questions regarding my room and Theresa helped me very well. Thank you to both of them for our memorable stay! I would definitely visit again!

We stayed here because it was in a quieter area of the city and two blocks from the beach. We were upgraded to an executive suite with a bath and a half bath. There was a good breakfast every morning and drinks and popcorn throughout the day. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are very clean though are in the process of some updates which are needed. The outside pool and terrace area were relaxing. Photos are views from the lanai.

The hotel is located a little further away from the beaches but it's an easy walk into the main part of Waikiki for restaurants and the beach. It's also close to a tramway stop. The staff were really welcoming and friendly on arrival. Our room was clean and comfortable and had all the amenities we needed for an overnight stay before flying out early the next morning. Our room was a little noisy with the sound of traffic in the early hours of the morning, being on the main street side - not sure if there are quieter rooms on the other side of the hotel but may be worth requesting. We didn't have a lot of time to enjoy the amenities as we left early the next morning, but breakfast was already being set up and we could help ourselves to coffee and a light snack before we left.

It was Now 3 times in 1,5 Years that i Stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. And After the long trip from Germany and you check in is it Very nice when you realize it is still the same staff there. That give you the feeling to come home far away from your real home.A big mahalo to the staff. Ok the road is not very quite there is probably in the US no decibel limit for cars.but you can sleep well and there are always earplugs in the room ready.The hotel is ca 8 minutes walktime to waikiki beach.The breakfast is Good no giant buffet but it is enough for a good start in a day..The yogurt with the fresh fruit is delicious.Some balconies do not look pretty anymore but they renovated is already startet.So in the 18 days where we were there we would never bothered by construction Noise.The big plus to this hotel is the staff.And i hope to become part of the coconut family again in 2020 for 3 weeks.The coconut is not a giant heartless hotel complex its Family.And in the end i apologize for my englisch.

The staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of activities were offered such as Zumba among other things. Complimentary breakfast, flavoured waters and afternoon popcorn. Overall a very enjoyable experience. Thank you for a great stay in Honolulu.

This is a great little hotel. The staff are very friendly, the complimentary breakfast, beverages throughout the day (infused fruit waters and tea and coffee) and afternoon popcorn and proximity to the local bus that stops at Pearl Harbour and walking distance to the beach, shop and restaurants all make ita perfect place to stay. The hotel also has activities such as Lei making classes, candle making classes etc. Tbere is also a small fitness centre and a sweet pool to lounge in. We had a budget queen room for our four night stay and it was just the right size. They were renovating the facade when we were there but we knew about that in advance and it wasnt too noisey. Our room was comfortable and clean and the provision of a universal chargerwas much appreciated.wealso used the guest laundry facilities and the reception staffwere happy to change our notes for coins.

The entrance was a little bit tricky to find, because it’s right on the street corner. Other than that the stay at this hotel was excellent! They only have valet parking which costs $30 a day, however you can come and go as much as you wish. Free popcorn in the afternoons and the breakfast was adequate. We loved that you could get towels to take to the beach whenever you wanted and the view of the mountain was beautiful! We could watch the sunrise from our room each morning! I highly recommend staying here it is in a great location in Waikiki.

Lovely little hotel close to everything. Staff were friendly and helpful and when our flight arrived well before check-in time, we were offered an early check-in and breakfast at no extra charge. Rooms were very clean. I'd highly recommend a stay.

King sized Mountain View bed is the way to go! Everything was clean. Front desk was very helpful and polite. Isaac was awesome! Great distance to everything. They offer coffee and fruit infused water at the lobby. Pretty decent

The Coconut Waikiki was a great place to stay while in Honolulu. They offer free breakfast, fresh popped popcorn in the afternoon and a wonderful variety of tea. The front desk staff was also very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel.

This is great value in Waikiki. The rooms are large. A simple but adequate breakfast is included. There are lots of nice touches like free popcorn in the afternoon and help-yourself to coffee, tea, iced tea or chilled water 24 hours.Laundry facilities are available to use.There is a nice seating area outside and a small pool to keep kids happy.The staff are super friendly and helpful

First time to Hawaii and we spent weeks trying to find the perfect hotel. I came across this hotel on a google search and I’m glad we did.The hotel is older, but recently renovated and had its exterior being done while we were there. The rooms are well taken care of and we enjoyed our stay in the rooms throughly. The continental breakfast was more like a full breakfast, and we loved the afternoon pop corn that was available.The big seller and why we would come back to this hotel was the staff. All of the check in staff were friendly and helpful. Recommending beaches, ensuring we took advantage of the free chairs and umbrellas for loan and what I enjoyed the most was one of the check in staff practiced his ukulele when he was on the night shift. We enjoyed coming back in to the sounds of it.One of word of caution, which they addressed through the black out shades, but if your room is a Mountain View, be prepared for the warm sun in the morning. We loved the view, but to cool the room while we were out, we had to close the shades.We will be back again.

Would recommend for families. Nice clean rooms, would recommend Mountain View room to fave the water side of building. Within walking distance to Waikiki beach. Decent breakfast included. Friendly staff.

This hotel is fabulous. Great location, about 10 minutes to the best part of Waikiki beach and strip. The hotel has some great options for breakfast, including a waffle station which is very popular. The coffee and juices are great. There are also different snacks and drinks through your the day which is an absolute bonus! We never made it in the pool as Waikiki Beach is so close, but it looked like a pleasant area, especially for small children. When we arrived, our names had the written on the black board with a nice welcome message - how very cute! There was activities on through out the day. Adult and children, so no one is left out! You can grab towels and even chairs for the beach. The staff are super helpful, I don’t think they once told us no! The rooms aren’t tastefully decorated, but you know what? I didn’t care! The atmosphere in this place really distracted me from that. It’s definitely made me re-evaluate how I pick hotels. Well done Coconut Waikiki Hotel - you’re awesome! I want to go back!

To begin with, we didn't have GPS and were having difficulty finding the hotel in the dark. We called and the young man who was the car valet led us to the hotel by phone! Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. We also discovered that the hotel was in a great location, close to restaurants, shopping, and Waikiki Beach.

The Coconut Waikiki is a very good value in most areas. They do seem to know that rooms are noisy from road traffic (earplugs are provided) so I encourage them to spend the extra $$$ to upgrade windows and sliding doors to double pane construction which would really reduce noise effects. We were never bothered by noise from other guests above or below so an investment here might really pay off to complete the experience. We paid for parking and appreciated the in-and-out privileges without hassle. Cost for overnight parking is in line with what you might expect to see in larger metropolitan areas. Our room was packed with features that make it a little tight on space, but I appreciated them all, especially a small kitchenette with table. A second chair for the table would be useful, too. I would also recommend it is time to tear out the cabinetry in the bathroom and replace with new to maximize the small space. Caulking and painting only go so far. There are some "dead" spaces in the cabinetry that could be used better with a new configuration. We enjoyed the "Ohana" or family orientation of the employees and the breakfast space. Keep that up.

The desk staff was professional and friendly. The afternoon popcorn is a treat. The location is perfect for walking to all destinations, or uber. I love the morning breakfast and the staff makes sure the breakfast is well presented. I also noticed the breakfast staff is also the house keeping staff... always sharing their aloha spirit and smiles.

We would love to stay in this hotel again and highly recommend it. We got the room with two double-bed and it is roomy. It has a balcony where we can sit to see the street and leave the wet beach shoes to dry it. The hotel is in walking distance to a lot of shops, restaurants, ABC stores, McDonald and the International Market. The breakfast is decent although it closes a bit early (at 8:30AM). The hotel provides coffee and iced water flavored with fruits (orange, lemon, peach etc) all day long, you just have to go to the lobby to get it. They also provide beach towels and chairs. The staffs are very friendly and do care about customers. I asked to have a room in lower floor and close to the exit stair due to my claustrophobia and they gave me a room just exactly what I need. Thank Coconut Waikiki hotel, I really appreciate it.

I stayed here during Memorial Week and I couldn’t be any happier. Front desk was amazing and really helpful. We were even lucky enough to get a room upgrade, and it made my hubby feel special seeing a happy birthday greeting on the board in the lobby upon arrival. Continental breakfast and free beach towels to rent out was a big plus, and my room was always very spot clean with all the sand I was bringing in from the beach. I didn’t use the little kitchen much but the fridge was a great touch for me to store bottled drinks and my lei. We opted for the overnight parking of $30 a night to get out of the tourist area and it was worth it. If you’re just going to stay in Waikiki the whole time then probably don’t recommend bringing a car.

My second time around staying here and I couldn't be happier. The hotel was undergoing some outside renovations while I was here so there was some noise during the day from workmen going up and down the outside walls but given I was rarely around in my room during the daytime, it wasn't a bother.As I had an early arriving flight from New Zealand, I'd arranged an early check-in and upon arrival, my room was ready and I was also offered breakfast, even though I'd just arrived. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed was super comfortable and it was an absolute pleasure to stay here once again. As always, the staff were incredibly friendly throughout my stay of 5 nights and ready to help with information when I needed it. It's close enough to the main Waikiki hub to make everything easily walking accessible while being just far enough outside the hub to not feel you're enveloped by tourists. I'll definitely be back for a third visit, I'm sure.

This hotel has been renovated and the lobby looks lovely. The games room/ lounge is nice and the pool (very small) is pretty.The breakfast was nice enough and the staff were all pleasant and professional.However, the first room I checked into stank of mold. The air conditioning unit was so loud I thought there was something outside and the curtains were covered in black mold. The smell was so bad I asked to change rooms. They were quick about giving me a different room... The second room was better, no visible mold but still didn’t smell “fresh”... I was tired and I thought that all the rooms must be a bit damp smelling so I didn’t make anymore fuss and just went to bed.The curtains were very thick and good quality but impossible to close properly, so as soon as the sun was up at 5am, so was I.Overall the hotel looks nice but the ac units need cleaning out and servicing much more regularly and the curtains need to be changed so they can actually be closed!

While we were generally pleased with out stay we were unable to use the balcony. The sliding door to the balcony would jam and we were unable to re-open it once we were on the balcony. Lucky for us I had my cell phone with me - had to call the hotel desk from our balcony so they could send a maintenance person to our room to free the sliding door. Other than that - rooms are a little dated but clean. All hotel staff were very friendly. Breakfast was adequate but would have liked to see bacon or sausage to go with the scramble eggs.

I did not like several things. The room had jalousie windows, a wall ac unit and the view was adjacent to an apartment building where other people could see into the room. Also I lost my wallet in the valet drop off area and they responded 4 days later with a response. No wallet found. The valet area is small and I don’t think it would accommodate a large vehicle.

Clean,prompt service, great staff very heipful. The pool was very clean and had life jackets available for the children. The sand toys and beach towels very much appreciated. This hotel was recommended by my travel agent. It is always helpful to get recommendations from your travel agent.

This hotel is within walking distance from the many restaurants and shops on Waikiki Beach. Hotel staff were personable and helpful. Rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable. Parking is available for $30 per day but we rarely needed the car. Would recommend to anyone that wants to stay away from the big name hotels on the beach.

We weren't familiar with Waikiki and so made the choice of hotel based on reviews. It was a bit off putting when we first pulled up, the exterior of the hotel was swathed in canvas as there were exterior repairs underway. But the lobby was updated, the room was comfortable and clean, although bathroom space was small for two, the staff was friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was ample. The hotel is located several blocks from the ocean and probably not practical if you are there for the beach. But we were on the last leg of a trip and were there for a trip to Pearl Harbor and we enjoyed just exploring the shopping area and experiencing a few good restaurants that were close by.

The Coconut Waikiki is centrally located which means there are plenty of good shops and restaurants within easy walking distance with the beach itself no more than 10 minutes away. Whilst the location is convenient it does come at the cost of a lot of traffic noise from the very busy road outside until the early hours of the morning . If you don't mind the sound of car horns, car radios blaring and other traffic related noises then you'll be fine.To be fair, it may well be quieter in other rooms that don't overlook the road and ear-plugs are provided if you are happy to wear them when asleep and this may well alleviate the problem.We were really impressed with size of the room and the facilities provided. The bed was large and comfortable, the pillows were fine and we slept reasonably well once the traffic noise had abated.A safe was provided in the room and the air conditioning was effective and good.The hotel was undergoing renovations outside at the time of our stay and whilst this didn't impact us at all as we were out during the day we couldn't help thinking that our room could do with a bit of a renovation as well. The paintwork was somewhat tatty and there was poor finishing in the bathroom. Our room had two toilets but one of them only flushed when it felt like it so we didn't use it. Had we stayed longer we would have reported the matter but for our short stay it was something we could manage without.The room could have done with a bit more of a clean as we discovered a previous guest's used ear-plug on the carpet which wasn't a particularly pleasant find.It was nice to have breakfast included in our stay and although there was a limited selection it was enough to start the day with.
