Breakfast is taken at two long tables so the likelihood is that you will be sitting right beside a stranger which may, or may not, be an issue for you.There did not appear to be any free parking within a reasonable distance so using the hotel car-park is the only option but it is expensive as you would expect when they have a monopoly on the situation.We would consider staying at this hotel again but would certainly look at other options first.

The room was fine the beds comfy. However Air conditioning unit is just old and noisy. WE have used this hotel 3 times before but thought they might have updated the air conditioning by now. Sadly they have not and if it were really hot we would not have been able to tolerate the noise. As it was we had to turn it off to get some sleep, before our flight back to aussie. I probably wouldn't use again. It is however central to the main street..staff were friendly and organised a breakfast bag to take to the airport for us as we were not going to be there for breakfast.

We've stayed on Lewers Street before and like it for the location and proximity to all of the action in Waikiki. We stayed in an executive suite. It is odd that you have two separate balconies so it appears at some time perhaps they merged two rooms into a larger room. The windows could be upgraded to prevent street noise and the bathrooms could use some upgrades but the room is adequate. They had construction going on but you really aren't in the room during the day so it didn't bother us. The lobby is great and the heart of the hotel where you can enjoy breakfast, snow ice and other activities. The staff are great, especially the ukulele playing. I would stay here again and recommend if you aren't looking to stay in a big resort but want to be close to Waikiki.

The hotel is in a fab location a few blocks back from the beach. Waikiki is more developed than we expected it’s like a city on the beach. The promenade is long and flat so if you like walking then it’s lovely to amble down the seafront. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The room had a good amount of clothes storage and the plumbing was good. The bed was comfy. We noticed that every night there was an increase in traffic at 2 pm outside which wok us up. It would last for 30 mins then go quiet again we thought this was odd. The breakfast is basic. We would recommend this hotel.

The hotel is in a great location. A few blocks back from the beach. The staff are friendly. The rooms are clean and the plumbing good. The breakfast is basic. I would recommend. Lots to do in Oahu. We did the grand circle tour; the paradise cove luau. One good tip is that there is a bus that circled Oahu so you can hop in and hop off. We were only there a few days so we did the tour but otherwise we would have gone on the bus.

The people at check in were marvelous. Everyone was friendly and helpful.The entrance was covered with scaffolding which took away from the appearance of building. Our room was bright and spacious with a mountain and canal view. There was also construction going on next door so could get a bit noisy during the day but we were out for most of it so it was ok. Breakfast was good but did need to get there early as it became very crowded. Pool is small but the area around the pool was very nice. Booked through a third party and we were unaware of the addition resort fees.Good location, about 2 blocks to main street and very close to where you can book hop on hop off tours.

We enjoyed the stay at the Coconut inn. We had a mountain view room with a balcony. We booked this hotel primarily based on location, costs and previous reviews we found. We get out an about early and all day, hotel time is very limited and not essential to us in traveling for the most part, at least most of the bells and whistles. Room was clean and had all the essential items, comfortable bed. We were welcomed with Hawaiian shaved ice when we arrived Friday which was nice. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The balcony view was nice for evening or watching the sunrise. It was a tad noisy at night on floor 4 close to a busy road. We travel with a white noise speaker so it drowned it out pretty easily but could be a issue for some. Free breakfast is nice, cant complain too much but would like to see some more healthier options. Better variety of fruit, fresh fruit, expand on the oatmeal bar, greek yogurt. Offer additional items to add with the eggs. Overall, we'd stay here again, good bang for your buck, great location if you're looking to explore Waikiki.

Wonderful property for a modestly-priced Waikiki stay. The cheery decor of rooms and common areas, helpful staff, breakfast and amenities compensate for the somewhat dated a/c units and finishes of the rooms.

Great service at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. My kids loved the breakfast too. Loved the majestic view from my room. Love it at Coconut Waikiki ❤. Thank you so much.

My husband and I celebrated his 60th birthday in Oahu. We are planning to visit all 50 states and Hawaii was our 39th state to visit. We have stayed in numerous of hotels and b&b over the years yes some more elegant than others and some we chose not too stay at and left. Coconut Waikiki Hotel isn’t one of the most elegant hotel we’ve stayed but the staff from front desk to valet drivers were outstanding and most welcoming, friendly, go above and beyond workers which rates this hotel a 5 star in our opinion. In fact, we have stayed in hotels that weren’t informative and knew nothing of their local attractions that could learn a lot from the staff at Coconut Waikiki. After our daily adventures the staff was eager to hear about it. The staff had suggestions of places to go and things to do. If we were ever to go back to Hawaii we would most definitely stay here again.

We stayed here in March 2019. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff friendly and helpful. Close to a bus stop and a nice stroll to the beach. The afternoon popcorn and snacks and refreshing drinks provided was great. The only down side was the noisy air conditioner! Will definitely stay again.

staff was friendly and very efficient . price was more affordable then many in the waikiki area. rooms were clean and were kept clean. parking was handled by valet .... all street parking is on meters. if we were to return, would stay at the coconut again.

Really nice property, great staff especially Robert and Issac! Great location, in the heart of Waikiki but not where a lot of tourist are. In walking distance of many restaurants, and great views of the mountains. Highly recommend

Loved this place! Warm welcome, warm pool, clean and updated rooms. Complimentary breakfast, modern amenities. Easily walkable and close to Waikiki. Friendly staff, front desk, and valet. Parking cost was $30/night, but car was safe and accessible.

We booked this room the week before and was upgraded to a suite after we arrived. What a beautiful surprise! The guy at the front desk was so helpful and friendly and booked us a last minute dinner at Duke's. There were earplugs provided, but we didn't need them. I'm a very light sleeper. Plus the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The breakfast on Monday morning stopped 8:30 am, but it was too early for us. We didn't miss it. It was nice walking along the canal to have coffee at the Hawaiian Coffee Company. We will definitely come back!

Love the hotel and the service. Arrived late at the hotel and couldn’t find the entrance to the hotel. The receptionist came outside to make sure we could find the place. Easy check in. Hotel room was clean and everything in place. 5 minute walking distance to restaurants, shops, and bars. 10 minute walking distance to the beach. Will come back!

We stayed here 5 day. mostly because we needed to stay within a 2 block area. the Coconut Waikiki is not luxurious but it is more than adequate. the room was adequate size and clean. closet small. bath slightly updated--shower newer surround, faucet and faucet handles newer, but towel bar and cabinet door hardware corroded?. furnishings on walls, TV, appeared newer. the building must be older; A/C (which worked fine) was a retro fit. original windows were louvre windows--could not tightly close; some street noise. (we were on the 3rd floor).smaller hotel; 10 rooms per floor with 10 floors in the building.good:breakfast providedresort fee not chargedrefrigerator, coffee maker, microwave in room.coffee and tea available 24/7 in lobby1 long block from main bus routes (Kuhio)clean"extra" activities--shaved ice 2 days, wine tasting one day while we were there.fitness room larger and better furnished than I would have expected. family friendlynot so good:pool--"cooling" size. not conducive to lapsfruit mix at breakfast was frozen fruit, not fresh. overall I probably would have rated the hotel a "4" except that in 5 days, contacting multiple employees each day, we did not have a single bad interaction.... customer service is great.

Booked room rate (city view king/ do note their "city view" is nothing more than street view) includes free upgrade upon availability, which was not honoured at check in. Check in staff quoted non-availability as the reason, despite the fact that a mountain/canal view room was available for the duration of our stay on their official website.Other staff members are way more hospitable and friendly, and that surely brightened up our stay. Fair bargain considering they don't charge guests amenities fee.

I was very impressed with the hotel staff and the level of customer service they provided. They were all very friendly and pleasant to interact with. The complimentary breakfast and refreshments provided are a plus. The hotel in general is very clean and inviting. However, the bathroom in my suite could use some upgrades, and the bathroom towels I received had some yellow stains on it. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here and will likely return again.

The hotel seems tired, dated and in dire need of refreshing. Has a 1970's feel to it. When's the last time you opened jalousie windows at a hotel? My balcony unfortunately had crime scene tape across it, do not enter! Included a window air conditioner, views of the Ala Wai canal, room painted in drab yellow. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn't try the pool, which was closed for maintenance in the afternoon. Convenient to shops, restaurant and not a far walk to the public beach, with hotel beach chairs and towels for carrying to the beach. Every morning there is a continental breakfast which is adequate. Bonus: front desk guy playing Hawaiian melodies on a ukulele. Hotel not a bad choice if you're looking to save money, college kids on spring break etc.

Staff is friendly and helpful, location is great with a wonderful view to the mountain side over the Ala Wai Canal. Only a few minutes walk to Kalakaua Ave. and Beach. Bus station is around the corner. Breakfast included with fresh waffles. Unfortunately no more boiled eggs and the scambled egg isn’t good ;-). We have been there 3 times and will definitely come back again.

We only had 2 nights at this hotel and frankly that was enough for us. When we arrived the small pool was closed for major maintenance. There was no water in it and tiles were being repaired in places. We had booked through their web site which stated an upgrade if possible. i think we got a down grade! The room was small and the balcony facing the road and canal was also closed due to maintenance! Rang down to reception to advise we were not happy with the room and they found us another larger room on the 4 th floor still overlooking the road and canal but with a balcony we could use.The bathroom was very small and the closet only had a curtain for a door. The TV was to the side of the room which meant you had to crick your neck to see it from the bed.There was a largish in room safe. Plenty of drawer space. There was a table with 1 chair a fridge and sink and some plates and mugs. There was also a coffee making making machine. Cleanliness was Ok.They supply ear plugs which you need. We usually travel with ear plugs so had a good nights sleep.Continental breakfast is included and looked Ok but we never ate there. It is poorly set up in a very narrow space and as breakfast finishes at 8.30am is very busy. The dining area is in the lobby and resembles a backpackers with long refectory tables. We couldn't get seats and you can't take food back to your room. Was like a zoo and my husband HATED it and refused to eat there! Toys out of cot comes to mind!!!The lobby area is a good size and they have a TV taking up space. The whole area could be reconfigured.It is 10 minute walk to the beach and the roads have plenty of places to eat and shopping. La Patisserie at the International market serves the best coffee and pastries.The staff were very good and location was good. Would we stay again - regretably no.A case of you get what you pay for and if you are on a budget it probably is a good choice.

I can not be more impressed with this hotel, stayed for 6 nights with my Grandmother who also adored the hotel. If your looking for something that doesn't kill the budget this is one hotel to consider. 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, 1 min away from bus stops, abc stores and IHOP and so many places to eat in walking distance. Hotel had comfy beds, spacious room with small fridge. Breakfast every morning and flavoured water, tea/coffee and popcorn every afternoon. Helpful happy staff as well, Issac was fantastic.

I really love this hotel me and my fiancé stay here last weekend and he really likes it too. Shoutout to Mr. JODEL, ISAAC, CORNELIO and ROBERT JR. All staff are awesome and helpful ☺ We enjoy our stay and love to get back here next time. Mahalo for taking care of us!

Was upgraded to a king suite with 2 bathrooms without asking. Far enough away from main shopping hub for quiet nights sleep, close enough to get anything we needed in few minutes walk. Complementary beach towels, umbrellas, etc was a wonderful surprise, and complementary breakfast was great every morning. Worked out perfectly for us!

I was staying part of my trip in one room on my personal account, and another part of the stay in another room for business. The staff arranged for me to stay in the nicer room for the entire stay at the lower room rate. They were very helpful and accommodating during the entire trip. Highly recommended

The hotel is just a short walk (under 10 minutes) to the heart of Waikiki. It has a nice reception area and the breakfast that's included certainly helps the budget. The rooms are worn but clean and the bed comfortable. Our room was on the Lewers Road side and very noisy from the street at night. They provided ear plugs that were definitely needed and didn't block all the sound. We had a suite so plenty of room for three. Our travelling companion family of 4 stayed in a standard room of two double beds and that was very crowded for them. We were only in Waikiki for three days so it wasn't too bad.

Sensational hotel. Highly reccomended. Thank you front of house Isaac for making us feel so very special and all your help with tours and vacation information.Executive rooms are sensational and luxurious

Within walking distance to shopping and the beach. Customer service was top notch! Complimentary breakfast was satisfactory with scrambled eggs, waffles, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, and assorted coffee, teas, and juices. The breakfast area is tiny and gets crowded so get there early. In the afternoon/evening they offer a complimentary snack and flavored water in the lobby. Outdoor pool and giant games like checkers and connect four make the small outdoor space usable. Comfortable seating area in the lobby with board games and books. Rooms are small and dated but clean and comfortable. Overall an excellent stay!

this place is set several blocks from the beach in Waikiki. it was clean , modern and staff were very pleasant and accommodating. the breakfast was plain and simple. the room was quiet. there are many places to eat within walking distance. nice lobby with many things to do//free popcorn, etc.

We chose this hotel after much research, including TripAdvisor reports. We expected a "good" hotel. The "surprise" was what a great place it really is. Friendly, efficient staff, well-maintained rooms, great location. Altogether, unbeatable value! We'll be back!

At the time of writing this review, this hotel is ranked 15 out of 68 presumably based on all the positive reviews, but you need to take care on what is taken into account. This hotel is quite cheap compared to the up-market hotels and includes breakfast, so in this respect it would be classed as value for money, but if you are looking for good in terms of quality, then this is a lot further down the list.To start with the positives:-- Friendly and helpful staff- Well decorated and spotlessly clean- We had a large room with two WCs- The bed was very comfortable- Hot water and a good showerNow the not so good:-- The building fabric and fixtures were very tired making the room very noisy eg slat windows at the ends of the patio doors did not keep out traffic noise, wall hung air conditioning units were too noisy to leave on at night, the fans linked to lights in the toilets were very noisy- There is a coffee machine with six pots provided, after this you need to use the coffee provided in the reception area which is not ideal for longer stays- The breakfast area is a small area by the lobby and has two long tables for guests to sit at that do not give much privacy- The breakfast was average at best- The pool is smaller than many domestic pools that I have seen and along with the patio is unlikely to get any sun at all- There is no bar or restaurantIn addition to this, it is located near the canal at the back of the Waikiki district on a junction of two busy roads and the area seems a little down market compared to the glitzy areas near the beach.We were booked in for 5 nights by a cruise company and left after only one night. Perhaps I should have checked the hotel in depth, but instead I relied on these reviews and the rating at the time. Strangely, we booked into a well known chain hotel across from Waikiki beach that cost a lot more, but had a far lower Tripadvisor rating than this hotel, hence the title of this review.

The staff here, especially Isaac, are fabulous. They bend over backwards to be helpful. The housekeeping staff do an excellent job - the hotel is super clean. Beds are comfortable, location is less than ten minutes from Waikiki beach and right along the canal. Would definitely stay here again.

Excellent hotel. The furnishings may appear a little dated but everything is immaculately maintained and it is spotlessly clean throughout. Staff are friendly and helpful. The communal breakfast set up works well in getting guests chatting to one another - as does the free afternoon popcorn. Only a short walk from Waikiki beach.

We stayed Feb 28 to Mar 4 in a double bed room. We were very satisfied. Room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good too. It could be better if the menu changes and if there were ketchup for eggs.

Got upgraded from the smallest room to an executive suite when I arrived. Free popcorn and breakfast every day, very nice employees and helpful with chairs and amenities. Walking distance to beach and shops. Highly recommended.

Have stayed at this hotel several times while visiting Hawaii. Always consistent in service, cleanliness and affordable availability. Stayed in a mountain view room on 9th floor and was an enjoyable stay for us. Nothing was too hard for the friendly staff. Ask for a standard rate taxi to be booked for trip to airport - no hassels with shuttle buses!

The hotel was clean and conveniently located. The front desk personnel are friendly. They have water and coffee available all day and popcorn as a snack. They offer chairs and towels to take to the beach but I did not use them so I can’t vouch for the quality of the equipment. Breakfast was pretty good. Just remember that Waikiki is in an urban area so it’s going to be a bit noisy but they do provide ear plugs to help light sleepers. I was only there for a night but hope to stay a couple days next time.
user_name:
angelah996
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I loved this place and would definitely stay there again. Hotels in Honolulu are expensive, but this one is reasonable. I liked the funky décor. It was clean and the staff was friendly. You could walk right to a lot of places and the canal is close by. What more could you want without spending a lot? There is a pool, though I did not use it.

Recently remodeled older hotel with views of the canal. Large rooms and very clean. Front desk was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was OK, Afternoon actives included free chocolate mint shaved Ice one day and free wine tasting on another day.

Visited from Feb 13-19/18. Check in no problems. Check out no problems. Hotel offeref to store luggage as we had a late flight out but we had a car so there was no need. We had a car rental and were aware of the $30 valet parking with in out privileges. There was no problem getting the car quickly or multiple times during the day when needed. The room was very clean and had a small kitchenette area with a sink, microwave, mini fridge, plates, bowls, glasses, cups and cutlery. This was great if you wanted to keep snacks or extra drinks in your room. When we used anything it was replaced the next day by housekeeping. Continental breakfast was served every morning from 6:30 - 8:30 and consisted of scrambled eggs, cereals, waffles and various toppings, yogurt, fruit, granola, bread and pastries and tea, juice, coffee. Great way to start the day. Popcorn is self served in the lobby daily at 1pm - 6pm. Unsweetened ice tea and flavored water (orange and lemon /cucumber) are available in the breakfast area daily. We used the beach towels daily and the chairs and umbrella once. Never used the coin operated laundry but did see several guests using them. Gym was tiny but fine if you wanted to use them. Never used the pill as we opted for the beach. There was a giant checker and chess game outside and board games in the lobby area for families to use. Check the activity schedule to see what is happening at hotel for the time you are there. Great extras that go a long way.Wanted to say thank you and a job well done to Jessica at the front desk who was a wealth of knowledge and extremely helpful. When asked for area suggestions on activities and restaurants she was spot on. Jessica suggested Top of Waikiki and Dorako and we were not disappointed. Go if you can. She even phoned to confirm there was Dole whip at Menchies for me. Keep up the great customer service Jessica!!!!A great trip for our first time in Hawaii. This won't be our last trip to Hawaii or this gem of a hotel!!!

We had an amazing time at Coconut Waikiki Hotel. The staff was so amazing and very helpful- I want to thank Isaac again for recommending us to several restaurants and things to do in Waikiki. The girls up in the front are also very sweet, they allowed us to store our luggage after we checked out so we can explore the city before our midnight flight. I cannot wait to come back and cannot wait to stay at Coconut again! Thank you all so much!

The service offered by staff was exceptional. All requests were handled promptly and they assisted in helping provide any service needed. It was my first time in Honolulu and I want to come back to Coconut Waikiki Hotel soon. Thanks for your help.

This hotel is clean, spacious, comfortable, and the staff are warm and welcoming! The breakfast was simple, but delicious (fresh waffles, assortment of pastries, eggs, cereal etc). Highly recommended!

Let me start off by saying the staff at the hotel were great. Everyone was very friendly. We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel in January 2019 for 3 nights. We stayed here at the end of our 11 night Oahu vacation. We wanted to get a taste of the city before we headed home. We were very excited about this hotel based on our research. We booked this hotel because it had a heated pool, fun classes, and proximity to the beach. After we checked in we went to our room to discover that there was construction going on outside the hotel on the balconies. We literally had someone drilling into the wall of our room. We immediately called the front desk and they moved us to a room farther away from the construction. It was better, but the construction could still be heard during the day. We decided to not worry about the construction and head down to the pool. We went to get in the pool and it was ice cold. I went and asked the girl at the desk about the heated pool that was advertised and she said it has been broken for a while and they were waiting for a part. That was a huge let down since we specifically booked this hotel because it had a heated pool. We had already spent 8 days at the beach and we were looking forward to a couple pool days to end our trip. I understand that issues happen, but we made our reservation months in advance and really think the hotel should have notified us about the construction and lack of pool so, we as a family could have decided if we wanted to stay there or not. The other thing that was a let down was the classes offered. My son and I were looking forward to trying ukulele lessons and found out when we got there that no classes of any kind were offered the days we were there. It would be great if a schedule could be posted on their website so people know in advance what is happening when they are there. When we checked out I let the young man know that we were really disappointed in our stay and he credited us one night of parking. That was nice of him, but really $30 does not make up for our disappointment. If we are ever in Waikiki again we will stay a lot closer to the beach and make sure our hotel has a nice heated pool.

Hotel was clean and room was big enough. The water pleasure was strong enough and got reluxed well. I was very satisfied with the menu of breakfast. I love their waffle!! I may stay there again next time!

Very friendly staff. Good basic breakfast included in price. Didn't use the pool (quite small) nor participate in the daily activities. They provide nice quality beach towels that you can take to the beach. Hotel faces the canal and is a few blocks back from the beach but still within walking distance. Bathroom was very old and small. Towels were fine but sheets were almost thread bear. Room was clean. We were on the 6th floor and room was still quite noisy at night due to traffic hence the earplugs that they provide. Enjoyed our stay but would not stay here again - for a little bit more money feel that we could have got something closer to the beach and more modern. No resort fee is a big plus.

Hi we visited Hawaii for a convention and was having so much trouble trying to book a room. Everywhere was sold out. Isaac K. from the coconut helped us tremendously. We stayed a night there then they were booked for a few days then we went back. Isaac went above and beyond helping us calling around to hotels and trying to find us a place to stay until they had an opening. Everyday he helped get us to where we needed to go. Out of everyone he was the most helpful and made our stay so much better and happier. Every year we will be back and will be staying at the Coconut because of Isaac. He needs a raise after all the help he gave. We really appreciate Isaac and the coconut for everything. thank youLaVerne Petry

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the start of our vacation, while we explored Waikiki, then one more night at the end, to be back in town to catch our flights home. The best part is the friendly staff who go out of their way to make sure everything is as you want. The hotel itself is nice and undergoing some renovations right now. There is a bit of street noise, but that is true almost everywhere in Waikiki. The value was very good, especially given the excellent breakfast that was included (breads, toaster, eggs, waffles, cereals, juice, yogurt, fruit, tea, coffee). Unfortunately, we did not time our trip to take advantage of the activities such as lei making. And it was too windy and cool for us to make use of the pool (late January). We would stay there again.

It’s a little tired looking and doesn’t give the best first impression, however the staff are lovely. We arrived early and whilst we couldn’t get our room we were told to have breakfast which we did, then used the restroom to get freshened up. We got our room at 3pm it was on the 4th floor with a balcony looking over the apartment block next door and the canal. The room was a good size, but clearly needs updating as it’s very old. The bathroom is also very old and with a strange bath and shower combination. The beds were fantastic though and the pillows excellent.the room has a fridge, microwave, safe, iron and board, TV and Kierug coffee machine. There is complimentary water in the fridge. The air conditioning is through window and quite old. The room was clean but not thoroughly as there was hair in the bathroom, I found tablets on the floor by the bed and a piece from a go pro under the drawers.The hotel gives complimentary breakfast, continental with a 2 hour window. Tea and coffee is available all day in the lobby, with popcorn in the afternoon and flavoured water. They have chairs, towels and brollies to borrow as well. There are board games to use, out door games and barbecue as well. The pool is minuscule adjacent to the lobby. There is a guest laundry which we used but it wasn’t that good a washing machine for some reason the powder didn’t dissolve and stained our clothes so we had to wash them twice. They have activities during the day, we saw lei making and Zumba advertised and joined an excellent wine tasting. I can see there is some renovation working being done and that is what this lovely place needs an update and some cleaners with pride in their work.

We stayed here as a group for four days. The rooms are spacious and clean , a little dated in the bathrooms but fine for their purposeNice touches include beach towels and umbrellas, plus the afternoon popcorn. Tea was available at breakfast and all day but wasn’t always very hot. The chalkboard in the front is also great !Breakfast ends at 0830, a little later time would be nice as some days we wanted to sleep in. The seating area inside gets very crowded. Breakfast had nice options (eggs, cereal, toast) but the fruit wasn’t fresh - tasted like tinned fruit- which is a shame in a place like Hawaii. Even some bananas or other cheap fresh fruit would have been nice. There was construction so 2 of 3 roomsWe couldn’t use the balconies. We didn’t know this when booking, so it was a surprise. We talked to management and after some negotiation got the resort fee adjusted but it would have been nice to know this before. Just a few adjustments and it would have been great.

Stayed in the executive suite for a week. The staff were the shining star of this property. They were very friendly and courteous. The 24 hour valet warmly greeted you upon arriving and the front desk checkin was very fast. They quickly went over all the amenities which included the breakfast, coffee, flavored water, popcorn, beach towels, beach chairs, umbrella and all the extra activities. The hotel could use a little facelift. Also, it is a tad bit noisy for rooms facing the street. There are slitted windows. However, for the price, it was an excellent value. The location was near all the Waikiki shops and restaurant. The beach was a little far walk (about 3 blocks). I would highly recommend staying here if you are on a budget or traveling with a family.

Coconut Waikiki Hotel provides a great stay near the heart of Waikiki in a family friendly setting. Staff are always pleasant & helpful. Nice breakfast including a mini-waffle iron; flavored water, tea, & coffee available 24/7, & popcorn in the afternoon. Wish we had time to attend some of their on site activities. Cute greeting on their lobby chalkboard welcomes you personally on your check in date!Nice Aloha spirit!

This hotel was exactly what I needed. Easy to find, comfy rooms, friendly staff, and peaceful. Nice variety for continental style breakfast.They have 24/7 valet service which was nice. Provided beach or pool blankets. Even offer events, though I was not there during any of the available events .

This is a relatively small hotel with lots of charm. It's location is very nice . . . . within walking distance of all Waikiki has to offer. The included breakfast was more substantial than we expected - scrambled eggs, waffles, yogurt, granola, a selection of pastries, juices, coffee, etc. Very nice. And, the front desk people were very friendly & helpful. Our only problem was with housekeeping. On our arrival, towels & other bathroom supplies were missing and the trash had not been emptied from the previous guests. They also did not replenish the coffee consistently. However, the front desk folks quick to remedy each of these. We would definitely stay here again.

Pros: Staff, location, beach towelsCons: Noisy (outside noise, traffic and building maintenance), breakfast, swimming pool.It was an ok experience, not bad, not great. Not sure I will come back in this hotel in particular.

Very clean, very friendly and professional staff. Great location. Everything was on time. i.e. breakfast, popcorn, exercises, activities, etc. Staff is very knowledgeable and very helpful. Great place to stay!

Jessica provides the best customer service and is truly committed to make her guests stay a memorable experience to meet and exceed our expectations. She is truly a value added resource for your hotel and the main reason that we will return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was my first stay at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. I enjoyed the location....a few streets back from the hustle and bustle. Enjoyable breakfast, thoughtful touches and activities. Friendly and accommodating staff. I didn't want to leave and I will return. Mahalo!!!

The room, staff, amenities are excellent. However, the noise from the street was annoying. We checked in and found complimentary earplugs. We weren’t sure why they were they so we didn’t use them. We found out that night. There was a great breeze so we opened the windows and did not have the A/C on. There were people yelling, numerous cars going by with loud music. The breakfast was good but my husband has Celiac disease so the breakfast they had wasn’t for him, we ended up going out. The games available, the lobby, bbq area and pool area are very nice.

Very nice room, with enough space for my family, a couple with two daughters. The best: the possibility to ask towels, umbrella and chairs for staying at the beach. Good breakfast too. Valet parking services is fast and comfortable.

Overall, was an average stay.Pros:All the staff were friendly and professionalFree popcorn and rice crackers in the afternoonFree beach towel rentalsWaffle maker and coconut syrup was goodCons:No warning of construction being done in the morning - it was very loud!Windows can not open as they were doing construction on the balconyEggs tasted like powder eggs

This hotel is close enough to everything in Waikiki , and close to public transport if you want to go to downtown Honolulu , it’s clean, staff is REALLY amazing, and can’t wait until they’re done with their updates to put this hotel over the top !

We stayed for a couple of nights at the start of our two week stay in Hawaii and the Coconut was the perfect place for us to begin our holiday. We arrived early in the day and they went out of their way to find a room for us which we greatly appreciated after a long flight from NZ. The room was fairly small but had a nice lanai and my only complaint would be the fairly noisy aircon, but they did provide ear plugs which was typically thoughtful.The hotel was nicely decorated for the Christmas/New Year season. The little extras of breakfast (not fancy but perfectly adequate), all day refreshments in the lobby (love the pineapple tea and popcorn) and games for the kids. They even have a sandpit! They provide beach chairs and towels for free and while the pool is unheated, it is a nice area to relax in. There's a bbq and some sunloungers. So everything you need for a great stay in Waikiki. The beach is two blocks away and the shops and restaurants one block away. Easy to recommend especially for a family.

The kindness and help from the staff here was amazing...so very friendly and willing to do anything to make your stay better..walking distance to to just about anything and everything..I can't think of a better place to stay..the hotel is very clean and the breakfasts are great!!

The coconut is just a nice,Accomodating hotel where the staff help with your needs and budget. The rooms were always cleaned. B’fast was more than enough and staff were really knowledgeable and actually helped a lot.

This Hotel is located within walking distance of Waikiki Beach, all the restaurants and shopping but is more affordable and quiet. The rooms are clean, bed is comfortable, free breakfast and afternoon popcorn
user_name:
Annette T
Twin Falls, Idaho, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed here in late November. The value for money was excellent. The property is clean and up to date. The location is perfect to walk to Waikiki Beach and the staff were accommodating and guest focused. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

This hotel was excellent for the price. It is not flash but the rooms are clean and well appointed. The front desk clerk, Isaac, was amazing. Very knowledgeable about the local area and helpful. An excellent stay.

Great location in the middle of downtown Waikiki, easy to walk to shops and restaurants. Our room was uncomfortably small and cramped at times, noisy parking lot and close to the elevator. The breakfast was appreciated and enjoyed having the beach towels. Staff were friendly.

A small group of us took a quick hop to Waikiki before the Christmas Holiday and for some it was their first time on the island. We had a GREAT stay at Coconut Waikiki! Jessica was absolutely amazing with her recommendations on places to eat and things to do! We were not disappointed at all! The hotel was great and provided everything we needed with a perfect location! We walked or took the trolley everywhere. Tons of shopping, restaurants and beaches within walking distance. A HUGE thank you to everyone's hospitality to making our stay fun and easy!

I had done a lot of research for accommodations for my one night solo stay in Honolulu. Because I had to be at the airport early in the morning, I was going to stay near the airport but then I found Coconut Waikiki. I was able to stay here for less and it was MUCH nicer. I felt very safe and enjoyed walking around Waikiki. Everyone at Coconut Waikiki was very friendly. I booked my airport transfers with VIP Trans ahead of time and everything went without a hitch. That is until I boarded my plane & discovered that I had left an important item in my hotel room. My husband was able to call the hotel from CO (since I was heading out of the country and didn't have cell service). They found my item and mailed it to me in New Zealand. What service!! The facilities are not brand new but the service is so worth it. I'm happy I chose to stay at the Coconut Waikiki.

Customer service was top-notch. Friendly, helpful and very accommodating. We ended up staying an extra 2 days and they made it very easy to keep the room. They also gave great info on taking the bus - the bus stop is just a block away. Terrific location - within walking distance to Waikiki Beach and everything around it. Lots of amenities and great for kids.

It was our home away from home for Christmas and it did not disappoint. They put our name on the chalkboard and it was a really nice touch. Everything we needed, the hotel staff promptly provided and they were happy to answer any questions. We didn't ask for it but we were lucky to get a room with a view of the canal. We have two children and the pull-out bed was good to have. We got hooked on spam musubi and 7-eleven is just a stone's throw away. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, church and the beach. Valet parking was a little steep at $30 per day but we paid for convenience. The car was there when you need it. They provide beach towels and they offer interesting and relevant classes for free! Had an amazing time. Will definitely come back.

We have been to Waikiki four times and we will always return to the Coconut Waikiki. The location is perfect. It is far enough away from the chaos yet close to everything we need. We walk everywhere. The rooms and hotel are spotless and the staff is friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

Tremendous, quite possibly the hidden GEM of Waikikii!!! The staff were amazing, from check-in to our ALOHA good-byes!!! I'll be back next year, for sure... Many Mahalos Coconut Waikiki, I'll be sure to spread the word.

The Coconut Waikiki is a reasonably priced, centrally located and friendly hotel. Excellent value compared to other hotels in the same proximity. The staff, especially Jessica and Isaac, make this a wonderful place to stay. They offered recommendations of the tours and the sites to see in Waikiki. Also, helped us to navigate the use of the public bus system, which we took to Pearl Harbor.Located approximately 2 blocks to the city bus stop and about a 10 minute walk to the centre of Waikiki. Very easy access to the beach and shopping. Beach chairs and beach towels are provided for your daily use. Nice added touch was the popcorn in the lobby in the afternoons for a quick snack. Breakfast was included, not fancy, but was okay to get you going for the day. Our room was adequate enough and was cleaned promptly every day.We did not pay a resort fee, I think that is because we booked directly with them. We recommend you take the Hop-on-Hop-off Bus, all the different colored routes. Also, it is a must to go to the Polynesian Cultural Center, we absolutely loved it there. We do not recommend Germaine’s LuauWe would recommend staying at the Coconut Waikiki and would stay there again.

The hotel is at a great location for shopping, restaurants etc. and easy to get to by rental car. While it is older, it has been well-maintained. We had a nice room, but had some issues with noise. Breakfast was included. Staff was great.

Fantastic hotel, a short two block walk from everything in the heart of Waikiki. Our Double-Double room (2 double beds) was clean, modern and comfortable, nice sheets. Staff always helpful and friendly. We had a Mountain view room, gorgeous view and nice breeze but there is traffic noise which didn’t both us as hotel provides ear plugs. Would definitely stay here again.

one of the few hotels i contacted that did not have a resort fee hiden in fine print. daily parking fee but in&out all day. daily breakfast was included. walking distance to the beach resturants and shopping. considering how expensive hawaii this hotel is an excellent value, the hotel is on the older side but Clean, and the staff great, Jessica seemed to be there all the time and was very helpful with directions and recomendations. .I would definitely stay there again

I stayed at the hotel while running the Honolulu Marathon. The hotel's location is convenient to Waikiki. The room itself was a bit dated, but comfortable and clean. The windows did not seal tightly so it was difficult to cool down the room without cranking the air conditioner. I booked the hotel through Hotels.com and neither Hotels.com nor the hotel told me in advance of the $70 resort fee that I was charged upon check out. This I found maddening. As such I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Great location close to beach at Waikiki. Bus is only one block away so everything is close. Check in and check out was fast. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Will definitely stay again when we go back to Honolulu.

Small but very functional room. Hotel staff was excellent. Excellent value considering how expensive everything can be in Hawaii. Breakfast was adequate, coffee very good. Popcorn and snack in the PM was a nice touch. We enjoyed our stay.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki, because I did the Start to park 10k and wanted to get a good sleep the night before. So we didn’t wanna go through the struggle of getting up early to drive down to Honolulu. However that might have been the better solution. The room design itself is ok, but we didn’t get any good sleep at all. We had a room facing the channel on the backside of the hotel on the 4th floor and the noise from the street down there just kept us awake all night. We would not recommend this Hotel unless they replace those windows, which might as well not exist at all. The lanai was under construction so we weren’t able to use that either. One can only hope they don’t just redo the lanai but also the windows. Complimentary breakfast was included and ok, nothing special and not a lot to choose from, which however seems to be normal in the US. Scrambled eggs were made from powder instead of real eggs.

Check-in: Fast and uncomplicated; 24/7 service; Room: Nice view over the Ala Wai canal but there was construction work, so we could not use the lanai; the bathroom has seen better timesBreakfast: decent variety but american continental style - plastic plates and cups, low quality, very little space for the number of guests

I stayed here for a long weekend in early December and it was great!The front desk staff were all very helpful in finding stuff to do in the area, navigating the bus system, and helping me get around. I wish my balcony was open, but I understand construction needs to happen sometime. I also wish the breakfast went a bit later, but I can only blame my laziness on missing that. The location is quite nice; you are far enough from the action to avoid the noise, but close enough to get to the fun in 5 to 10 minutes. It's a good pick for the bargain minded traveler who is looking to relax.

Very good Waikiki hotel that unlike others does not charge you hidden resort fees you if book directly on their site. Location is a little far from the beach but still walking distance and close to the bus stop. Good amenities: continental breakfast every morning, beach towels and chairs, popcorn in the afternoon.

The Coconut Waikiki has great service. Weather you're dealing with James the day Manager, Issac who works days and nights. Mike the front door attendant, or any of the support team including housekeeping, everyone is genuinely trying to make sure that you have a great day. The hotel itself is nothing to write home about. It's dated, the amenities are very average, and it's more a place to sleep and put your things, than hang out. But I honestly would stay here again for the service I received from the staff, and the convenient location.

This is 4th time we have stayed at Coconut and would not go anywhere else. Great location, handy to beach, good shopping and bus. Staff are superb. Offer workshops to those interested such as yukele playing, Zumba. Well equipped gym.

We have 3 daughters living in Hawaii and decided to stay in Waikiki for the Thanksgiving holiday. This place is aged, but very clean and comfortable. The staff is amazing...always going above and beyond expectations! Our vacation was for 9 days and I can't imagine staying anywhere for that long being made to feel more welcome. My only issue is that the breakfast (while delicious) was the same thing every morning.

The good:Room was good with a wonderful view.Breakfast included in the price was a bonus!All staff was extremely friendly and always smiling. I was amazed at how the valets kept bringing and parking your car with a smile a number of times in a day.Free Popcorn between 2-6 PMComplimentary coffee and fruit infused water 24 hrs. The misses:Noise:The rooms with the best view, come with unbearable noise on the drive below. Unruly drivers in mustangs and noisy bikes think it's a fashion statement to drive like its a race car track. This even at 3 am. They do provide complimentary ear plugs in the room. Breakfast- was the same day after day. We wished they brought in some savory items (hash browns?) to give some change for guests who stay 2+ days. After day 3, we had sugar overload.!Parking: this one can't be helped.$30/ day, but the mandatory valet service made it totally worth it.

The experience at this hotel was incredible. The first morning we woke up to the fridge leaking on the carpet in our room. I went down for the wonderful breakfast and told Jessica at the front desk and within an hour we were offered to change rooms to a suite at no additional charge. Amazing new room with 2 balconies. Then the first day going out Jessica took time to tell us about restaurants, the beach, shopping and where we could walk close by. I am so impressed with all of the staff at this hotel and everyone had a smile on their face which made our first trip to Hawaii extremely enjoyable. I've told friends about this hotel and they are planning to stay there if they ever get back to Hawaii.

If you are looking for a reasonably priced, centrally located, friendly hotel then this is for you.Our upgraded room provided the perfect tropical feeling, everything clean and fresh. Our mountain view balcony provided the perfect place to comeback to and enjoy a relaxing afternoon drink and rest.The small pool area was fine if you were looking for a non beach relax. Hotel provided towels and beach chairs for each days beach trip, which was only three blocks away.The continental breakfast was more then enough to get the day off to a flying start with the waffles the highlight. Could say the same for the scrambled eggs, as they seem to have been from a packet.Staff were always smiling,and helpful. Room were always cleaned each day, and could not be faulted.Shops and restaurants where all close by as was public bus transportDefiantly recommend for a very enjoyable and relaxing stay
My husband and i really like this hotel. We upgraded to a mountain view and staff are very nice and helpful. We are really coming back to this hotel Mahalo for giving us the true spirit of aloha!

We stayed for 2 nights before joining a Hawaiian islands cruise, so were just looking for somewhere clean and comfortable, with easy access to the Waikiki Beach area. Coconut Waikiki worked out very well for that. We had a mountain view room on the 8th floor. staff wee very welcoming, helpful and efficient. Breakfast was included, with cereals, fruit, yoghurt, scrambled egg, toast , pastries and fruit juices. During the days there was an assortment of fruit flavoured water available in the lobby, and popcorn as a treat in the early evening.It’s an easy walk into the centre of Waikiki - 5 to 10 minutes, and you can also stroll along the canal side to the Ala Moana shopping centre in about 30 minutes. The hotel was undergoing some refurbishment so the balcony in our room was not accessible, but we were advised of this in advance.The hotel has a small pool, and provides towels which you can use onsite or take to the beach. A very pleasant stay and good value for money if you aren’t in need of 5* facilities.

Loved the room, flavored water, and breakfast. The only problem is parking. The price is high for valet and street parking is hard to find but possible. The front staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms have a small table, frig, and microwave. Very good value.

Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The we room we stayed at was neat and clean although the air conditioning system wasn't working properly. Couldn't complain with the welcoming staff they have.

We were made to feel welcome as soon as we arrived (although it was in the morning). Upgraded to mountain view and even given a gift for our 20th wedding anniversary, was so lovely and thoughtful. The room was great and so clean and comfortable. The staff were amazing, friendly and helpful. The breakfast great as well as the infused waters, coffee, and tea readily available anytime. Loved the activities on offer, although we didn't make it to any, I'd love to try next time. We had to depart at 6 am and were kindly given a bag of breakfast goodies for our journey, have never had that thoughtful level of service before. Excellent location.Thank you for such an enjoyable stay, you demonstrate the meaning of "Aloha".

Great location, super friendly helpful staff, only criticism would be that it would have been good for their breakfast to go a bit later, to be finished by 8.30 meant we had to start really by 7.30, bit early when you're bit jetlagged.

What to say we were married in Honolulu 11-15-18 and our family and guest stayed at the Coconut hotel and your staff went out of their way to make our stay the best ever. You all are the best and we look forward to coming back for our first year anniversary.

Went to Hawaii for our honeymoon and I had an amazing experience. Isaac and the rest of the staff were super friendly and courteous. The hotel served free breakfast and had flavored fruit water and popcorn from 2-5 pm which my wife enjoyed and it was a 6 min walk to the beach. The hotel even had activities for the week such as hula dancing and wood sign crafting. We had so much fun, I just wish we could have spent a few more days here to enjoy their cozy pool and their lounge area. They even upgraded our room for free when we arrived. I would not hesitate for 1 second to book with Coconut Waikiki hotel again.

The staff was extremely accommodating, providing spacious rooms for a great value. The hotel is a work in progress, noise from the outside is loud overnight. The pool is not heated, however, the service was first class, supporting known issues within the first few nights. Some rooms are dated, however the suites are large and clean. Breakfast and no resort fee booking through the hotel is a nice perk, providing towels and beach chairs.

Loved this hotel’s location on the canal away from the crazy-busy beach area. The view from our 6th floor balcony was great! So many things are within walking distance, including the beach, bars and restaurants - just walk to the very end of Lewers Street and you’re there. We even walked up to Diamond Head summit (about 14 kilometres round trip) and the much closer Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Lots of reviewers mention the “basic” breakfast. Well, it’s pretty good for continental, where you wouldn’t normally get eggs. The hotel is a little dated and the pool area could use some work but it’s reasonably priced and has lovely, helpful staff. Little touches like cleansing towelettes make you remember a place (and a comfy king size bed will do the trick too). Kettles aren’t standard (for those who prefer a cup of tea to coffee) but I only had to ask and one was promptly delivered.

Flew in from Kona to see the show! Had a terrific time! The show and hotel service was amazing!Accommodations, breakfast, proximity to shopping and restaurants was excellent. I will recommend and return to the Coconut Waikiki!

we stayed here for two weeks in the month of October 2018 to celebrate my wifes birthday.. ( very nice present from the hotel was awaiting my wife when we arrived to room...great touch !!) Isaac checked us in and told us we had a free upgrade to a suite on the tenth floor...the room was spacious and was a little dated in fixtures but were totally adequate for a vacation stay(minor housekeeping issues of dirty vents and door hinges should be fixed or tended to). we enjoyed 14 complimentary breakfasts which consisted of the basics of cereal, toast, waffles, scrambled eggs and some pastries...juice coffee water were also offered...it was from 630 -830 and had 2 long tables to eat cafeteria style and a few round tables...we ate one on outdoor patio.during the afternoon there was complimentary popcorn and flavoured water...always great after a day of beaching and excursionswe had a rental car and only parking available was valet for 30 dollars a day...valet was always courteous and efficient.(on street parking is hard to find)the hotel location is approximately 20 min walk to Waikiki beach.....restaurants are plentiful within a short walkI may never visit Honolulu or Waikiki again but will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting from afar.

The hotel is located within easy walking distance from the beach, close to bus stops and everything you wanted to experience in Waikiki. Room we stayed in was very comfortable with good quality beds. Safe was included in the price and would be able to store smaller laptop. Hair dryer and iron is included as well. Small kitchenette included a fridge, microwave and Keurig coffee maker. Toiletries are always refilled and towels are refreshed every day. Air conditioning was functional though a bit noisy. Breakfast was included - scrambled eggs, waffles, pastry, yogurt, canned fruit, granola and cereal. Coffee and tea is available during the day and complimentary popcorn in the afternoon. Hotel offers complimentary beach towels and chairs. If it rains guests can also borrow umbrellas. You can even do your own laundry for a small fee though in the end we did not have to use this useful amenity. The baggage storage is available free of charge in case you have early arrival and your room is not ready yet or a late departure.Hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there and would book this hotel if we return.Thank you so m uch for making our visit to Hawaii so pleasant.

The room was spacious and clean. We had a nice view on the canal. The room had a kitchenette. The location is great, only a 10 minute walk to the major parts of Waikiki on a quiet street. Great value for money. Free breakfast, valet parking, friendly staff.

From the Valet (Ornelio and Mikey) to the Front Desk (Isaac, Alfredo, James, and Jessica) to the house keeping services...everyone was great. Their smiles, tips on places to go and what to get came in handy. The hotel was our base for four days and the workers made it feel like home. The hotel gave us everything WE needed. It's quaint and the hotel might be going through some renovations, but you couldn't really tell. The rooms were clean. Outdoor games kept the kids busy. The complimentary breakfasts (waffles, cereal, pastries, mixed fruit, granola, yogurt, oatmeal, coffee, tea, flavored waters, bread, and scrambled eggs) every morning was a good way to start the day before we would go out for hikes. The complimentary beach towels were great to have with us on our snorkeling excursions. We did bring a few snacks from home, so the microwave in the room came in handy for those late night popcorn bowls or to warm up leftovers. On our way out, there was a box by the front desk for a Food Drive, so we were able to donate some food items we were not taking with us. Great idea! Location:- Two blocks from Waikiki Beach/Main Drag.- There is an ABC Store around the block for any miscellaneous items you might need.- For a delicious and affordable meal: Marukame Udon Restaurant- Easy access to roads that lead to Highways. (There is FREE Parking on Ala Wai Blvd, but really hard to find, probably because it's the only place for free parking. However, the hotel's valet was great. It was worth it for time and ease from driving around looking for parking. )Overall: Great Place. Great Staff. Great Location! We would stay there again! Mahalo!

I was surprised to find this boutique hotel off the main streets of Waikiki, yet an easy 10 - 15 minute walk to the major parts of Waikiki. The valet parking definitely helps and the continental breakfast has make your own waffles and they also serve scrambled eggs. The rooms are boutique vintage and comfortable. The front desk were very friendly, something I would expect from a non chain hotel.

This hotel is great value for money. The shortcomings: a few blocks from the beach on a busy street. The worst scrambled eggs I have ever encountered. A strange little swimming pool that they heat for some reason. The upside: very reasonably priced, Great staff who will do their best to accommodate your special requests. You get what you pay for, plus.

Most of the team members were very helpful and friendly. Hotel located in a lively place and only 3-4 minutes walk to shops, restaurants etc. Also, the beach is within a stone's throw distance from the hotel. Breakfast was decent.One of the team members did not seem to have the spirit of customer service. Was just there to earn his bread.

We found the Coconut Hotel a freindly and comfortable place to stay. It is well placed just off the comercial ctre of Waikiki and walking distance t most places on the tourist strip. yes the place has a bit of aged to it, but we found it well presented and very clean and tidy. As we noted before we booked other found the air conditioning niosey. we turn the temp up to make the room just cool, not chilly and fournd it a good night sleep. A slpit system would be a good investment for the hotel.over all i would haveno hesitation staying again if we come back. i should also mention the staff were nothing but curtious and most helpful.

Had a whirlwind trip of 4 days with a girlfriend from New Zealand. We wanted somewhere central, clean and a good shower. This was perfect in every way - staff are a huge part of why this place is such a great find. Super friendly, offering recommendations or just a chat. We did want to lay by the pool but unfortunately the sun wasn't on it late afternoon - just a timing issue to be aware of.Breakfast is included if you book direct - which was very adequate to set you up for the day. Popcorn during the afternoon always smelt good and tasted just as good!Can't wait to return next year with my daughter to share this gem - my only concern is that with all the rave reviews the price will increase and/or you'll be hard pressed to get a room!

This was our 2nd visit here and we had a great experience both times! A great location great views f the canal and mountains . The breakfast was yummy and well stocked for everyone. The lobby was very welcoming and the activities are a great idea. Our room was super clean. We plan on returning every year when we visit.

Isaac, James, Jessica, Mike and Robert Jr. were wonderful, entertaining and helpful always. Our corner room mt. view was updated and had an accessible balcony (current renovations). Breakfast needs sausage

Spent 5 nights at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel and had such a nice time staying here. Hotel is walking distance to practically everything you wish to do on your trip. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable and will help you with whatever you need. Complementary popcorn and flavoured water was available in the lobby/dining area on a daily basis. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

It was great staying with Coconut waikiki, free upgrade to great mountain view room, good service, good location, free flavored fruit drinks and pop corns, as part of VIP, valet parking was just $15. Overall great experience.

What a great stay at a great hotel. Don’t let the size fool ya, it offers a decent view of the Ala Wai, the game station on the ground floor in the back of the hotel was so damn cute, they had human size chess and checker games with a cute sandbox as well. The lobby and board game area was great. We loved the complimentary breakfast and popcorn station. The hotel workers are amazing and I highly recommend this place for your stay. My husband and I had our babyshower here and it was a great turn out!!

We stayed for a 4 day conference at the Convention center. A bit too far to walk; take Uber of a city bike. There is a bike station 1/2 block away. The hotel is decent but aged and much updated. Staff is very friendly. Cleanliness was decent but some areas of the room/bath just look a bit dingy. The AC is a wall unit but functioned well. We asked for extra coat hangers and they promptly brought them. The pool is tiny. Included breakfast was waffles, scrambled eggs, pastries, cereal, coffee, juice, bread. Relatively cheap compared to others but you give up some things.

The hotel is pretty well located, near Waikiki famous beach, good restaurants and nice shopping places.The staff is really helpful and welcoming. They will assist you very well.There's a buffet style breakfast with lots of good things. And a nice touch with free popcorn in the afternoon.

We enjoyed our time at Coconut Waikiki. It was undergoing some renovations and the breakfast was quite basic and the same each day. On the plus side - and there were lots of positives. The service was lovely and professional and friendly. Amenities were clean and welcoming and we lived the relaxed atmosphere of the community spaces where there was complimentary coffee and pop corn, great with a toddler! We felt welcomed and relaxed and a late checkout was perfect!!

Love this hotel. Often the beaten track enough to be quiet yet close to all of the action. Clean rooms, superior service, very friendly staff. Charming hotal with that old Hawaii feeling. I will be back!

Very comfortable king bed with beautiful views of mountain area. Very friendly staff at front desk. As business stay, walk to convention center along canal felt unsafe. Pool is small and isolated. The continental breakfast was very good but bacon or sausage would have been appreciated. The hotel is nicely positioned close to the shopping/restaurant and beach areas. The availability of beach chairs and beach towels were also much appreciated.

Very pleased with the location of the hotel (within walking distance of beach, town,convention center). Customer service of every front desk person was extremely positive and helpful. The hotel is a bit worn and some of the lanais were out of service. If you're looking for comfort, friendly atmosphere , easy access to running/walking areas and nice little continental breakfast, this is the place.

Staff was welcoming & helpful. We travel interisland quite often and have been in many hotels. This one had everything we needed for discounted valet parking (making it the cheapest in Waikiki) to a very nice breakfast included in the cost.

Really liked this quiet hotel on the canal. Maid, Aida, provided more amenities and was nice. Isaac on the front desk could not have been more pleasant and positive. The in and out valet parking was convenient for us exploring Oahu. The infused water, snacks, and tea/coffee were nice gestures. No room service but the many restaurants and stores nearby made up for it. And the ability to do your own laundry in the building.

I have no good reason for taking 4 months to write this long overdue review. My and I stayed here 8 days/7night in late June 2018. This trip was a surprise graduation present to my son. I called and spoke to staff ahead of time. They surprised my son with a cool message which he loved the day we arrived. Amazing first impression! We were not inconvenienced by the renovation at all. The staff went above and beyond our whole stay, but a very special shout out to Isaac and Jessica!! I am 100% certain our stay wouldn't have been as amazing without their high level of customer service, kindness and were always going above and beyond what I ever would have expected. Aside from the exceptional staff lead by the high bar set by Isaac and Jessica, this hotel met all my needs. Comfortable accommodations, free breakfast (continental), no daily resort fee (if you book direct), AND an excellent location ALL with reasonable rates! The afternoon popcorn was a really nice touch. We often would arrange our afternoon return to the hotel based on popcorn time. We never used the pool, so can't speak to it. It was a tad small, but we we were in Hawaii - we walked to the beach! The hotel location was nice. We really enjoyed our morning and evening views of the canal and the short walk to get where we were going. My son and I are active and healthy, so we walked all around Waikiki daily with no complaints, which was easy with this hotel's location. I had no need or want for a pricey, upscale, extremely modern/new or extravagant accommodations. The Coconut Waikiki met all my expectations and more. Highly recommend if you want good value, convenient location and a comfortable stay for a reasonable cost. We had zero complaints.

We stayed here our first night after landing late on the island. We wanted somewhere good and comfortable with a decent walking distance to the beach. The hotel is being renovated but we were om the top floor and I would say they were refurbished. Still a lot of age to the rooms but new beds/furniture and such. The beds were comfortable but our room was 90 degrees when we arrived. I had put on the reservation that we had a 9 month old and required a crib, only to find out they wanted an extra $40 USD per night for the crib. What a joke! We had brought a portable so we set that up and got the baby down fast (and we cranked the air). Our room never cooled down. The only cooler spot was infront of the awful window air conditioner. It was so humid and hot that our little guy would not sleep. He is an excellent sleeper and was sweating buckets and screaming like crazy. We had to sleep with him in our bed but not touch him to try to keep him somewhat cool. Poor little guy was a hot sweaty mess all night. It was an awful start ti our vacation as neither my husband or I slept more than an hour. Such a waste of money and disappointing experience. Positives are few but the staff were wonderful although they couldn't help us as the hotel was "full". They were all very friendly and they tried to be helpful.

5 star rating due to being great value for money. Booked on a site that included the resort fee in the price which is worth checking. Loved the simple breakfast and great location with shops, restaurants, bars and the beach within walking distance.We requested a room high up (there are 10 floors and we were on 9) with a kitchenette (crockery and a microwave) and two double beds. The room felt spacious. There is some traffic noise on the canal side of the hotel but the views are worth a little noise at night (and the hotel provides ear plugs)Reception staff were fantastic. Loved hearing the staff playing the ukulele at night. The hotel is currently undergoing some external works which did not impact on our stay. We didnt have a car but heard resort parking is expensive like other hotels in the area. The City Bus costs $5 a day and will get you all over town including Ala Moana shops, the zoo and Diamond Head.

If you are looking for a nice hotel this is it. Clean and comfotable Amazing staff especially Jessica. Front rooms a bit noisy a small breakfast selection.popcorn in the afternoon close to ABC .helpful staff

Easy to access all of Waikiki on foot from the Coconut Hotel. Our room was very tired badly in need of a refreshing. Told we were being upgraded to a mountain view room, had a mountain view but lanai was not accessible, traffic noise very loud most nights. Would have preferred a renovated city view room. Breakfast was on lar with any similar hotel, staff were friendly.

Very clean! The free breakfast was perfect before you head out of the door every morning! Free popcorn and coffee/tea was a very nice touch when returning at the end of your day!! We enjoyed the big games out back! Played giant checkers! The valet was very convenient especially when you have kids and a lot of stuff, you don’t have to worry about finding or squeezing into a parking stall. Overall I’m definitely staying here again!

I had a very good experience staying at the Coconut Waikiki. It is located next to a scenic canal and is only a few minutes walk to the main shopping street, Kalakaua Avenue. It is also a fairly short walk to the beach. The hotel provides some small but very much appreciated bonuses. They have free towel and beach chair rentals. There is also coffee and tea available 24 hours, as well as four choices of fruit infused water during the day. I took advantage of the buffet breakfast several times and enjoyed the selection, especially the fresh waffles. I also liked the popcorn that they offered in the afternoons. They have a comfortable lobby area that you can relax in and play games. There are also activities that you can sign up for such as yoga, hula dancing and ukulele. My friend and I took a ukulele lesson and thoroughly enjoyed it.The hotel room was small but clean. It had a microwave, a mini fridge and a lock safe which were useful.I would recommend this hotel to people.

The good: Staff were all very friendly. walkable distance to all major attractions. The ok:The hotel is a bit outdated but you get what you pay for. Breakfast was better than what I was expecting but it can get old after a day or two. Not much selection, egg was the only protein. The meh: $25 per day resort fee. This isn’t much of a resort. I guess this goes into the breakfast and maybe popcorn/water selection in the afternoon. They have random activities at the hotel but we didn’t partake as they were during the day.
user_name:
JasonNewyorkcity
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located in a great spot. It is only steps to restaurants, malls and the main beach in Waikiki. You can't ask for a better location that isn't in a crowded location. The breakfast every morning is sufficient to getting your day started right (wish there was bacon/ sausage) but eggs, toast and waffles were a great start to my days. If you wish an alternative, McDonald's and Ihop are right around the corner.The staff are extremely friendly and eager to assist you with requests. Upon your arrival they will write your name on the board to welcome you to the building (awesome touch). They even do birthday shout-outs. Whoever does the boards is very creative. (Thank you Issac for the birthday greeting for my partner). They offer different lessons every day that you can sign up for at the front desk - Ukulele, Lei, etc....All the amenities that the hotel offers aren't really listed anywhere, so ask the desk first for : umbrellas, beach chairs, towels, etc.... When we arrived they were under construction which we weren't advised during booking but the staff did accommodate us and moved us to another room the next day so that we could see the sun rise with our morning coffee. The regular rooms are smaller than your average rooms at other hotels. But perfect for rest and relaxation. The suite rooms are larger and roomy. All the rooms, bathrooms were super clean. When i visit Waikiki again, this will be the hotel that I will stay at. Worth the money and the location is fabulous.

The breakfast menu needs to change at this place, the eggs are just powdered eggs and there are no bacon or sausages or even some salad options. maybe more variety on your milk options swell as my wife and i are both lactose intolerant. overall the staff are lovely real family orientated hotel.

Decent stay. Room was dated. Carpet and furniture a bit old, dingy. Bed was comfortable. It was very quiet at night. Room was not cleaned thoroughly when we arrived. Some hairs left from previous guests in the bathroom.Nice lobby where you can hang out. My family bought take out and ate in the lobby a few times as it was more comfortable than eating outside or in the room. Lots of tables and chairs in the lobby. Pool and gym were lacking but better than nothing. Free activities you can sign up for adds value. Yoga, ukulele, lei making, etc. They also offer free beach towels, chairs, umbrella, toys for the kids. It's a bit of a walk to carry all that to the beach though.Breakfast is okay. Gets a bit boring after a few days of the same thing. No meat (sausage, ham, bacon) is served. Eggs, cereal, bread/toast, yogurt, granola, fruit, waffles, coffee, OJ.Staff were all very pleasant. Front desk, cleaning, everyone were nice.All in all, a decent stay. The rooms are a bit old but comparable to other hotels in the same price range. Service was good and all the freebies were a nice touch. Would recommend to families looking for decent hotel on a budget.

Clean Room/ free water bottles everyday! Close to EVERYTHING! Breakfast was awesome too! Everything about our stay was easy and stress free and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Internet was fast!

The staff is friendly and awesome! I kinda feel cheated because I selected my room based on the website’s room description; for example the room was supposed to have a microwave and it didn’t. Also there were roaches which normally I wouldn’t care but I was on my honeymoon. The staff is definitely their saving grace.

Nice stay at Coconut Waikiki. Good location and I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a king room. As they are under going renovations I was unable to use the balcony. Room had a fridge, microwave, sink etc.

The hotel is in a great emplacement, in the very center of Waikiki just 2 blocks from the main street. The room was confortable and big: it was probably renovated because everything looked quite new (there are works going on but we didn’t hear any noise).Only point to improve is breakfast, which is quite poor (very very few choices) and on top of that is served very early (from 6:30 to 8:30 am!!!).Honestly for this price and in such a position, this is a recommended accommodation.

Friendly service,they were always there to help. Clean big rooms we enjoyed the size of the room. Enjoyed the breakfast supplied.Location was suitable as our friends have stayed before.We will recommend this hotel to our friends

Good location. quiet, low rise buidling, friendly staff. comfortable room but hotel in general feeling just a bit tired, and in need of a freshen up. Breakfast was good, popcorn in the afternoons, nice idea to have events happening in lobby during day time. Would have chosen 'good' for my rating if available, but felt it was shy of being very good which was my next option after average.

I stayed at the hotel 6 years ago and as we were going on a cruise leaving from Honolulu recommended it to my sister for the four of us to stay. The hotel did not disappoint me - and my sister thought it was wonderful especially the breakfast (it was supposed to be continental and included scrambled egg). The nice touch of popcorn was a hit as well at 4 pm. Will definitely be coming back!

This was our first stay in Hawaii, hotels are very expensive, we just expected a bit more, even for a 2 star. The staff were helpful, they gave us an umbrella and kettle for the baby. $30 per night for a cot is super expensive so we didn't bother. Breakfast was not great for us, it was good there were some low\no sugar options like (plain) oats and eggs, but more fresh local fruit would have been great. The aircon worked really well. The cups in the room for too small for the coffee machine, it filled them right up and slightly overflowed, bizarre choice. No plug for the bath so we couldn't bath the baby. Location was good, it was nice being in a quieter area, walking alongside the canal is good.I booked along time ago, and don't recall anything about the balconies being closed, that was disappointing and the extra noise during the day right outside our room was annoying.
