This is our third stay at the Coconut Waikiki and it was another good stay. When making our reservations Isaac was a huge help and even got us back into the same room we'd had on our previous stay. Customer service here is top notch and they let us store our bags here after we checked out.The location is great with an ABC store just at the other end of the block and the beach a few blocks beyond that.When we first stayed there five or six years ago, they had recently remodeled. The humid environment has worn on things a bit, but it was clean and they were in the process of painting the outside.Breakfast is basic but good and plentiful.We'd happily stay again if for no other reason than the great service they provide the guests. Their staff should be commended. Espically Isaac & Jodel.

Very clean. Amazing staff. We stayed here for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite as it was not a busy time of year. Greated with a beautiful card wishing us a Happy Anniversary and a bottle of wine. We had a very nice young gentleman bring our bags from the shuttle as soon as we pulled up and deliver them to our room. Donovan was on the desk and he was so helpful and friendly. The free breakfast was continental style and very adequate. Would definitely recommend this nice friendly hotel!

Service was ok. Room was a little dated. Was ok for us as we were only there for one night. There was building work going on which probably didn't help as we didn't have access to our balcony. Breakfast was provided which was good, though we were unable to sit privately which was a negative. The staff were helpful and friendly as you would expect Overall, could have been better.

Every time we go to O'ahu we choose to stay here! The staff are always friendly, smiling and show lots of ALOHA!!! The breakfast is amazing, a perfect way to start the day! I love the location and popcorn evenings!!!

I traveled here with my Aunt, and from the time we walked in to the time we left this hotel was amazing. The staff was excellent, but the best person there was Isaac, I felt like he was my personal concierge, he just went above and beyond to help us with booking things to do to locating great restaurants. I LOVE the atmosphere of the hotel and how family oriented you are, please do not change a thing, I will definitely be staying here again! Thank you so much for the wonderful service. This may be considered a 3 star hotel, but the staff is a perfect 5 in my book!

My wife and me had a good time in this hotel. The rooms were very clean and the service very friendly.Only at the breakfast we missed several fruits and bacon. It was good that we could drink coffee and water during the whole day.

Excellent staff All very friendly and helpful Always smiling.clean roomsactivities at hotel fun pool heated clean I think the pool area should be updated with nice plants nicer outdoor furniture give it a tropical look.

Great staff, excellent room service, and a really great breakfast. I didn't get the chance to use the pool or work out room, but all in all a great stay for an affordable price. It's not to far from the beach or popular shopping areas as well.

Staff were generally great. Only issue was being told that i was being "upgraded" to a better room but was then provided a room in which the Lanai was unavailable due to renovations.The renovators started work 9 in the morning and had clear vision in to the room leaving no privacy. Other then this issue i was happy with the service.

When we got here, we had a very small room - we came a couple nights earlier and that was the only one left, but it was super nice. Then, we moved to another room - much bigger!. Both rooms were super clean.The people at the reception were all nice and super friendly.The only bad thing about our stay there was the breakfast. Available until 8:30 and always crowded - sometimes it was hard to find a place to stay.

Comfortable and clean rooms and reasonably priced and a good location. The amenities are not luxurious but for travelers who are out for the day and touring this can be a value accommodation.Staff is helpful supplying towels and a basic complimentary breakfast, afternoon popcorn and small fitness room. No restaurant however there are many eateries in the area.

This is a cute little hotel with a throw back feel. The staff were great and friendly, we enjoyed the pool and exercise room, even the break and afternoon popcorn. Will definitely stay again as it had everything we needed and is centrally located.

We just happened to find this hotel on a website and thought we'd try. It was a beautiful room - the best we've stayed in! The hotel has a very nice breakfast selection. The only thing we didn't love was that the bed was hard (a bit too hard for us). Highly recommend!

They have the most friendly and helpful staffs ever! Feels like home away from home. Though we didn’t spend too much time in the hotel than sleeping but it left a great impression on us. Our bed sheets, towels and bathroom were regularly cleaned during our stay. Plus the city view is so beautiful! I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future. Special thanks to James and Robert for being so nice to us. See you guys soon again! Will definitely refer this to my family and friends.

The Coconut Waikiki Hotel is a gem in Waikiki. close to great shopping , restaurants, public transportation, bike rentals , bars and most of all the beaches... the coconut staff is first rate, friendly ,knowledgeable in all aspics if the city, accommodating to special request and most of all make you feel right at home. Wather for a short or long stay this hotel beats the large generic by the number hotels in Waikiki.... and did i mention the towels and beach chairs are at your disposal to bring down to the beach..... we recently returned from a 10 day stay and hit all the variety of beaches just a short walk away and it was great to have chairs use complimentary of the hotel... Isaac , Alfredo Jessica and all of James staff will make you feel right at home!!

Let me start by saying that this hotel exceeds my expectations. We stayed in Coconut Waikiki for 4 nights for such a good price. The room was well maintained and very clean, we also get to wake up with a beautiful mountain/city view. The hotel offers a tasty breakfast which is a bonus, but what I really admire is the great customer service by the friendly staff and also by the hotel’s manager; James. You can tell how much each one of the staff enjoys what they do with the genuine smile on their faces and with the great customer service they offer.We always visit Hawaii and will definitely stay here again with no doubt! Mahalo Coconut Waikiki, thanks for making our stay in Hawaii so comfortable and fun

We stayed here for 4 nights and we had an amazing experience from the great customer service from the hotel staff to cleam room with a beautiful mountain view. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you Coconut Waikiki and expect us to stay here again next time we visit Hawaii

This was our second stay at Coconut Hotel, and my husband and I will stay here again in the future, as we just like everything there. We just cannot praise enough this great team of people (mostly dealing with Jessica and Isaac), they just make you feel so welcome.Our upgrade to the Executive Suite was so appreciated, thank you so much for that.The hotel is so central, easy walk to the beach, breakfast included, free coffee & tea through whole day, in the afternoon popcorn, friendly team , so what is not to like.We really look forward to return the next year.

Staying at the Coconut is becoming a tradition for my husband and I. We love the central location, the rooms are neat and tidy and the staff are fantastic! The continental breakfast which is provided from 6:30am to 8:30am each morning offered a nice selection to choose from. We look forward to returning next year.

Not the greatest hotel . View outside we’re looking into trashy apt complex who played loud music. Didn’t get any feedback from management when complained about key not working and didn’t get any accommodation.

We loved our experience at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel! We needed a room just for one night on our honeymoon to avoid the east coast during hurricane Oliva and they put us in a very nice room at an affordable price. The room was very clean and well decorationed. The best part was the friendly staff that treated us like family and was more than happy to answer all of our questions. I would highly recommend this hotel!

To put it quite simply, the customer service here was great. They were friendly, accommodating, and super helpful; however, the hotel itself had a nasty old smell in the hallways, I found 4 bugs (1 dead cockroach, 1 spider, and 2 other unknown insects) in my hotel room, and the bathroom had a stench in it that just would not go away. On the elevator itself I found 1 spider and a cockroach roaming the walls... I myself cannot stand bugs- especially in my hotel room. Although the customer service was amazing, i cant look past all of the bugs and grotesque smells throughout the hotel. If you don't mind buggies, I'd recommend staying here because it's cheap, close to the beach & shopping, and the service was awesome. If you are a clean freak like me, I'd pay a little extra to stay some place with 4.5 + stars. All in all, love Waikiki! Thanks for the hospitality!♡

Hotel with balcony overlooking Ali wai canal, less than 10 min walk to Waikik beach, clean room and comfortahle beds, kitchenette in room, very welcoming and helpful staff, pool area with giant games, decent continental breakfast with scrambled eggs, cereals, pa s tries, toast, fruit salad and all day there is fruit infused water, coffee and afternoon popcorn available in the "living room" lobby complete with games and books, beach towels available, good place for families or extended stay, 24 hr secure valetparking below hotel with in out privileges is $30 which seems steep but less secure parking garages a few blocks away are $25 without in/out.

Enjoyed the staff who were knowledgeable, friendly and helpful! Hotel is located very close to everything. Excellent location to run or walk! Loved the ability to sit on the patio or open the windows and enjoy the breeze!

This is the second time staying at the Coconut Waikiki hotel. The staff provide excellent service, and the facilities are outstanding. Our room was ready well before check in time and we were upgraded without trouble due to issues discovered when we arrived. I strongly recommend staying here, and I wouldn’t imagine staying anywhere else

Great location - ~8 min walk to Waikiki beach, 2 mins from a convenience store, 3 mins from bus stop, overall close walking distanceThis is a very humble hotel. They are small, which means they provide quality, intimate service. We recognized the front desk clerk every time we walked in and were always warmly greeted. Free breakfast every morning. Other than the fact that there was construction happening outside our window (even though it didn’t bother us because it would usually take place during the day when we weren’t even in the room), everything was excellent. We would definitely come back if ever visiting Oahu.

We stayed as bed and breakfast guests and the rooms were clean, well organised and very comfortable. I cannot fault any of the facilities and the breakfast was tasty and well organised. The staff were very friendly and helpful and as we stayed when hurricane Lane was looming the staff gave us all the information they could and kept us calm and put our minds at rest.

Thank you for the warm hospitality and kindness!I and my wife were helped by your hotel.We were forced to extend one more night,because of the tragedy of Kansai airport by typhoon in Japan and we never thought for staying at any other hotels.We enjoyed your room,good breakfast,pool side asleep and smile!

Stayed at this location because the Hale Koa was booked out, but so glad we were able to stay here. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was good with plenty of items to choose from, water and popcorn given complimentary in the afternoons was a great touch. Will be staying here for future trips!

We had the best vacation, the Coconut Waikiki was perfect. The rooms were clean and the staff is amazing! We will be coming back again soon. The location is perfect to walk to everything. The pool was clean and WARM! Loved being able to sit out and look at the mountains. It is an amazing place to stay.

A great hotel far enough away from the crowds but very close to local Waikiki amenities. Friendly and helpful staff throughout the whole establishment who were only too happy to oblige. Breakfast every morning and popcorn in the afternoons were much appreciated. A little work going on outside the hotel but not enough to disturb us in any way. Loved our stay and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Had an 11 night stay. We were upgraded on arrival to the Executive suite, which was more than adequate for our requirements. The room was clean and tidy. The Staff were excellent and provided a high standard of service. Breakfasts were good. Would stay here again if we return. Location was excellent - close to shops, restaurant and beach

You will be hard pressed to find such a well-priced, convenient, and beautiful play to stay. The staff was very helpful. Free hot breakfast. Popcorn in the afternoon! What's not to like? Do the comparison on the travel sites. Then choose this place.

The Coconut Waikiki is in a great location and has lovely clean, quiet rooms. I have stayed here quite a few times and always had an enjoyable experience. The staff are all friendly and professional. I'm looking forward to my next stay. Whenever I am in Waikiki I stay at the Coconut.

Older hotel, room was clean but not very modern and bathroom could use an upgrade. There is a kitchenette with mini fridge and microwave, some dishes, iron, safe and free WiFi. There is a free buffet breakfast quite early (6:30 to 8:30) but choice is very limited and it is quite busy. Small pool area and small gym. Hotel is close to many bars, restaurants and shops.

Friendly staff, updated rooms recently remodeled and clean rooms with great wifi. I would stay again and recommend to anyone. Good location very close to the Waikiki downtown area with shops and restaurants.

I stayed at the Coconut Waikiki in August 2018. The staff was pleasant and the complimentary breakfast was good! The hotel is well kept and clean and I would stay here again. It is located close to the action and the beach is a few blocks away. The pool is very small so if your into that this hotel is not for you.

Within Waikiki but not lost in it.This hotel is a great place of you want to stay in Waikiki but want to go beyond it.They were doing renewal construction work, but with very limited discomfort to us.

Loved this boutique hotel - great position near beach and shops -they made our celebration truly special - we were upgraded to mountain view room and given wine and chocolate macadamia nuts . Staff couldn't do enough for you . Breakfast snacks tea and coffee all included - we will be back - mahalo

Good location not far from Waikiki Hotspots (just 5 minutes om foot), plain breakfast included, parking valet service that is very convenient and worth it's price (30 $ per day), the construction (will be finished April 30, 2019) did affect us only a little (no usage of balcony possible, ventilation of the room possible but a bit limited), very smooth check in and check out, you have to decide if you try to sleep with a loud air condition or with open ventilation windows and street noise (earplugs were provided)

The Hotel was clean and tidy, the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Issac. the location provides easy access to shopping and the beach and is on the aiport hotel shuttle route. Complimentary coffee and iced waters as well as fresh popcorn were appreciated.

If you are looking for a hybrid of city and Hawaiian natural beauty, this hotel is a great location. Centrally located, within walking distance of many restaurants and malls. Also fairly convenient to drive to many hiking locations. The rooms were a bit small, but cozy, modern-looking, and clean. The mountain views were beautiful from the rooms. The concierge parking price and amenity fee added some sticker shock to check-in (I'm sure we read the notice when we booked, but it was surprising to show up 6 months after booking and realize you owe $50+/night above what you already paid), and the balcony was under repair in the room so we couldn't open the sliding door, but the manager was very accommodating. I'm sure it was a great price for the area, so I'm not sure why more isn't included in the advertised/booking price rather than tacking it on as extras. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Nice to be back at the Coconut Waikiki. Desk staff and car valets were very pleasant and helpful. Everything was wonderful except for the complimentary breakfast. Too often the staff needed to be asked to refill food and coffee items.

We had some nice days in Waikiki where we stayed in this Hotel. The rooms are clean, the beds are average, the AC is a pain during the night (it blows directly to one of the beds and is very noisy, so we could only let it run during the day time and quite some hot nights).Since there is some renovation right now which is ongoing, the breakfast was rather chaotic: the buffet is like a continental with some bread, some eggs and some fruits. But then we had to search a place somewhere in the lobby, and since the breakfast is only from 6:30 to 9:30, this is rather crowded.The staff is very friendly and helpful though, Parking is only available as valet parking for 30 USD per night, but the reception and the parking is available 24hrs.The walk to the beach takes about 10 minutes, a little less for the main street with all the shopping and restaurant possibilities.

A great hotel. It was only a short walk from the beach and we found the staff to be very helpful. The room was very nice, I understand some people's comments about road noise, but as someone who lives in a city this was no problem for us.

Great location, breakfast wasn’t fancy but perfect to set you up for the day. Issac and the crew were all very friendly and keen to assist. Good value for Waikiki. Close enough to walk anywhere - but has a handy bus stop on the corner if your feet are too sore. Highly recommend.

I stayed only for one night but had arrived on a 6am flight. The hotel staff were wonderful and checked me in as soon as the room was available. Thanks to James and Jessica from reception.The room was clean and the bed and linen very comfortable giving me a wonderful night's sleep.If I was able to stay longer I would have definitely stayed here. Next time I'm in Waikiki I will stay at Coconut Waikiki again.

Okay experience. Very noisy and ineffective air conditioner. Balcony was closed for maintainence. Awkward bulkhead above desk was a hazard for those of us over 6 feet tall. Breakfast was disappointing—tiny narrow nook; only sugary cereals; no apples, oranges, or bananas; make your own waffles were mealy and inedible. But hotel was reasonably clean, staff was super friendly, and the location was great.

The hotel is located conveniently close to everything without being too close to the hustle & bustle that is Waikiki. Everything Waikiki is within walking distance but it’s in a snug quiet area by the canal.Pool is small so if a family is using it, it’s rather uncomfortable for anyone else to go for a dip.Cleaning staff forgot to clean room on 3rd day and arrived at 3pm to do it but I’d just got back from an early morning tour so was resting and didn’t want to be disturbed.
user_name:
Jacquiesimons
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: Overall the hotel was clean and quite. However the breakfast was a bit to be desired as there was no meat, i.e. sausage or bacon. Other than that it was a nice stay. Hotel personal were friendly and helpful.

Great place to stay, ideal location,close to everything. Staff and facilities are first rate. Rooms are spacious all the essentials including a kitchenette, second stay at this hotel and no hesitations in coming back

We loved the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. The location was perfect, in walking distance to the beach, the best shopping & dining. Our room was very comfortable, we had a view of Diamonhead. The staff fabulous, quick to help & always with a smile.

We stopped here for 3 nights as part of our Hawaii tour and enjoyed our stop very much. Breakfast and rooms were very good along with the fruit waters and pop corn, unfortunately they are currently refurbishing the outside which meant we couldn't use our balcony so do bare this in mind. They also provide umbrellas, towels and chairs for the beach to borrow which was very useful as it seems difficult to get loungers on the beach unless a guest at one of the beachside hotels. We enjoyed the location of this hotel as you are slightly away from the noise etc but 5 minute walk to the shops and beach.

Unfair to be too critical as this resort was undergoing refurbishment, however, the room was good, but tired [ie; couldn't control air conditioning, noisy bathroom fan woke sleepers when light switched on..Bathroom door disappeared into the wall. Bed very comfortable, facilities adequate and TV operated ok. Breakfast was a hurried affair, in dormitory conditions, due to the need to be finished by 8.30 and kitchen staff attitude let you know this - no time for a lie-in. Desk staff friendly and co-operative.

Great place to stay .Great location for walking and for valet parking your rental car. Rooms spacious and comfortable with good amenities . Breakfast included in common area. Pool area nice/small /not sure how often they vacume it? .Staff warm and attentive for any questions. For the price for a boutique hotel you cant beat it. Be sure to book online at website 30 days in advance for further discount

Great service! We booked it very last minute and couldn’t have asked for more! The only thing we found confusing was accessing the hotel. We had to drive around the block to figure out the driveway/valet situation.

Family stayed for 9 nights on 8th floor canal facing room with mini fridge & great view from balcony. Free upgrade thanks guys ! Great customer service from all staff - special mention to Isaac for his warmth. Beach towels and chairs always available. Valet price reasonable for Waikiki area. Pool small but lounger area well styled, relaxing and a sun trap. Complimentary waters/coffee/popcorn and breakfast. Breakfast stops abruptly at 8.30 & it would have been great to have had boiled eggs an odd day but those are small niggles. Would recommend this hotel highly.

The hotel is nice, not too far from the beach and the main street. The room was noisy, beds are double (not queen).The bathroom was very small, but clean.The swimming pool was also very small. Popcorn is provided and was good.

Great location and incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast included but a little less chilled on the fruit for breakfast would be kinder on the teeth. Was concerned when we found earplugs for our use when entering our room and the first night proved to be the case but thereafter we were too tired to notice from all the activities we had been off enjoying.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. It is nice and close to the beach, shops and restaurants but also up the quiet end of the street. Everything is within walking distance. Breakfast included was a great bonus but does get a little busy during peak holiday periods, so there can be a shortage of food and seating. Just have to know the right times to be down before everyone else. Once the renovations are finished this should not be an issue. We would destroy here again when in Oahu.

We were very pleased with our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. our room was a bit on the small side, and had no refrigerator, however we did select the cheapest room option available. after a two week stay, We realized we did not need the in room refrigerator. We got on ok without one. The room had all the other necessities, and was very clean. The hotel is boutique style, and offers a free continental breakfast each morning. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The hotel is situated on Lewers street, which is a short stroll & few blocks back from the beach front, arriving in Waikiki in peak holiday season, this hotel is away from the busyness & madness of Waikiki, but is central enough to everything.. would recommend staying here again...

the hotel room was very nice, we booked a room with a pool view and little garden, its so fantastic, the room was clean, tidy and comfort. The staffs there was amazing, always smile and helpful. Thanks...!!!

I discovered this hotel 3 years ago and made a point of booking again this time. The location is great, just a few blocks from Waikiki but without the noise. It's pleasant on the canal, which we could see from our room--thanks for the unexpected upgrade! There's a small pool but we didn't use it (who comes to Waikiki to use a pool?) They even gave us beach towels. Great staff who have the genuine Aloha spirit. Very comfortable beds, everything clean. Breakfast is a little crowded (it's included) but it's a chance to chat with visitors from elsewhere. We will be back.

First visit to Hawaii and can't handle Sheraton and Royal Hawaiian next to Waikiki. Coconut gives a reasonable price with only 10-15 minutes away from Waikiki and shopping areas including International Market. They have free breakfast, complimentary drinks and towels. Very nice customer service from staff! absolutely will come back on my next visit. Mahalo.

Pros:(1) Location is at Waikiki. It's about a 10 min walk to the beach. Not as near, but not as far as staying in Ala Moana. (2) Location is near a bus stop. Buses can take you to Downtown / Ala Moana / Diamond Head(3) Rooms are clean and comfortable(4) Nice breakfast spread. Includes waffles, bread, eggs, muesli, cereal.(5) Friendly hotel staff and always willing to help or guide you. Cons:(1) Room could use more amenities (i.e. kettle, mini fridge)(2) Car valet is pricey at $30 for 24 hours. But not much options in Waikiki

This is a great value hotel with a near perfect location. The staff were absolutely wonderful from start to finish! There is however one very important issue with this hotel, the noise pollution from the road is a big problem. We started on the second floor and as a light sleeper it was impossible to ignore the boy racers that were reving there engines and playing loud music into the early hours. The staff moved us to the 9th floor the next day and everything was great from then on. Be aware of this issue and you will have a great stay!

We had both friendly and efficient service from the reception staff. We were most fortunate to be upgraded to an Executive Suite which was superb - the best room hotel accommodation we've ever stayed in. The Suite was beautifully clean with lots of facilities available including a double balcony. The hotel is ideally situated being very close to the centre of the city, and very close to the beach. An excellent breakfast was most appreciated.

During our Hawaii roundtrip we only booked 2 x 2 nights at Coconut Waikiki. So after the first two nights are over we are fuly satisfied with service, breakfast and stay. It was a little loud at night but this should be normal in a big city. Equipment of the room is upper standard (big fridge, microwave)

Great location with great staff. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They were very knowledgeable about the island and the best tours to take. Always had a smile and very welcoming. Breakfast was basic however all that was required as all other meals are so large.

Great hotel convenient to Waikaki Beach, shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing. Staff friendly and helpful in planning visits to local sights. Good breakfast and reasonable rates. Clean room with nice view.

Nice location about 1 block further than the much more expensive hotels.Service was good and everything requested was provided promptly. Room was clean.However, double beds are small and breakfast is subpar.Overall, recommend this hotel but keep your expectations a bit lower in relation to the rooms and breakfast.

The room space for King size is too small. Also the King side bed are too small. It is not a regular King size bed. Breakfast is not good_No Variety for hot meals (only steam eggs and its taste were not very professional).

This was our fourth trip to Waikiki and one of our main requirements is a room with space. After a lot of investigation, we opted for an executive suite and it certainly delivered. We stayed in room 908 which was clean, spacious and the added bonus of a 2nd toilet/powder room + kitchenette - fantastic when travelling with a teenager. Yes, it is a little further out from the beach where we normally stay but it's good exercise after eating American sized portions for 10 days!The staff are amazing! So friendly and accommodating, they all appear to love what they do. The included breakfast ( a rarity for Hawaii) was a great way to start the day and coming back to the hotel in the afternoon to fresh popcorn and fruit waters/iced tea was also lovely.Lastly - no resort fee. I detest having to pay an additional charge on arrival to hotels and will always try to seek out those that do not charge. Coconut Waikiki gets a big tick of approval regarding this.There really is nothing to fault and I would gladly stay again on our next visit - mahalo!

Nice lodging within walking distance to everything. Lots of restaurants within 5 minutes beach within 10 minutes. Breakfast was included. Friendly staff was the highlight of the stay. There was some ongoing construction happening, as they posted flyers around the property, but i didn’t notice any noise problems.

Super-helpful and friendly staff and very roomy accommodations for an excellent price. Walking distance to the beach. Free towels and beach chairs that you can take anywhere during your stay! Exercise room more than adequate. Lot's of help setting up reservations for dining and tours. Valet parking at $30 a day but very friendly and near-instantaneous producing the car on command.

We had a lovely stay at the Coconut Hotel. We stayed in 3 hotels in Waikiki and this was the best. Lovely staff, good sized rooms and great included breakfast. They have beach chairs and towels you can take to the beach and there is a pool at the hotel.

Great hotel, easy to find, easy location to shopping and beach. very good breakfast served to set you up for the day and a family friendly pool and outdoor area for relaxing. Staff were efficient and friendly and offered 24hour service.

Coconut Waikiki offers clean and comfortable rooms on the quiet side of Waikiki only a few blocks from the main strip and famous beaches. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Excellent complimentary breakfast. Very satisfied during our recent vacation stay.

Our extended family stayed here for 2 nights before taking a Hawaiian cruise. It is a basic hotel - nothing fancy - but in a great location and with good service. They provide bottled water every day and have afternoon snacks, juice and iced tea in the lobby every day. They also provide beach towels and beach chairs if you want to visit the beach. The included breakfast was not very good (cold eggs, no protein). We had a suite with sleeper sofa and two bathrooms. Good size for a family of 4. Overall the hotel isn't amazing, but good for the price.

Aloha! I want to write and tell you how grateful I am for your wonderful staff and the culture they provide in your hotel.We had the very best greeting and the very best first impression of a hotel stay that I've ever had in any of my travels. Isaac was so responsive and welcoming. I had a migraine headache when we arrived, and he helped us get our room a little early, and I was able to chill out in quiet, comfortable area off the lobby until it was ready. I'll always be grateful to Isaac and Coconuts for that.In addition, we just a had a plain great time staying at Coconuts!  All the staff that we met were friendly and eager to help. The continental breakfast was well-laid out. The food area was clean, with different cold drinks and coffee through the day, and fresh-popped popcorn in the afternoon. The lobby and breakfast area are open, clean, calm, and relaxing. The pool area is so cute! So is the giant games area! From our room we had a nice view over the canal toward the hills. The bed was very comfortable. We were close to everything we wanted.All the staff helped quickly and gladly when we asked about anything - help our room checkout, making bus connections, which tours might be best for our timeframe, and restaurants.Mahalo nui loa! When we return to Waikiki, of course we'll stay at Coconuts!Aloha, and best thoughts.

We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is very conveniently located. The Waikiki trolley stop is just a few minutes away by walk and so is Waikiki beach, International market place, Royal Hawaiian Center and T-Galleria. The free coffee and popcorn in the lobby were nice perks. Will definitely stay here again on future visits.

I seriously don't understand the other reviews.To start, the room wasn't bad. It seemed clean and somewhat dated, but was good enough. Not 5 star though.The front desk agents were all over the place. Some were super friendly, like the woman in the early mornings. Later, some of the guys (like the big dude working in the front) seemed seriously annoyed when you asked for things like towels, or to get your car.Continental breakfast was also not bad, but not great. When I was told it was pretty much just cereal and yogurt, I skipped out. They also have popcorn in the afternoon.The real kicker was checking out. I was rushing out in the morning, and realized on the way out that I hadn't grabbed a couple dress shirts on the way out. These are dress shirts I didn't wear during the trip, and unpacked/placed in the closet. I called the front desk, who, over the course of several days and several calls, "confirmed" that no one had checked into that room before the initial call, and when they were finally able to get a hold of her, said the housekeeper did not find anything. They were adamant that no one there had it and refused to entertain the possibility otherwise/investigate this issue.There is literally nowhere else they could have been, and were discovered to be missing on the way out of the hotel.If you ever stay here, I'd lock everything you can in the safe, and consider anything you leave behind for even a moment lost.

Hotel is in a great location a few minute walk to CBD (central business district) and waikiki beach. All staff provides excellent customer service. I want to thank Robert, Alfred, Honoreen, Jessica & Guia (the housekeeper) Thank you for your exceptional customer service.

I was very happy with this hotel and I must say the bed and the pillows were just the best and I already miss it. Upon check in we were upgraded to a suite with 2 bathrooms which was very nice. The room itself was large, nicely decorated and clean. It was not that warm so we had the AC on only shortly and had it off during the night as it made noise and it was not needed. The only thing that was little annoying was the wind as it was very loud some nights. Some of the windows were not actual windows but had holes in them that could not be properly closed so it made sound but we were tired from the sun anyway so it was ok because you cannot control the weather.The breakfast was very basic just eggs, waffles, a bowl of fruits and yogurt and 3 types of cereals but better something than nothing. The time was a bit early 6:30-8.30 but at least we got up early and had a full day ahead of us. In the afternoon there was flavored water available which was great and from 2-6 there was a popcorn, which is a nice gesture. The pool is very small but the area was clean and it is okay to chill for a while as you are here for the ocean, not the pool. The staff was friendly and nice and even let us park our rented moped behind the gate for free. The location is good as well. Close enough to the beach and all the shops and entertainment. I think it would be around 10 minutes to get to the beach. I think you are close to everything for a much cheaper price. I liked staying here but you need to know that it is not a resort hotel with large pool and all the entertainment and restaurant which I did not mind as we were at the beach or other places all day long anyways.

Nice place, 10 minutes walk to the beach and 2 minutes to a bus station.The breakfast is good, but only starts at 6:30, and two days we had to skeep it because we went to a tour at 6:00 and there is no options to ask to have something to go...

Although I was only staying overnight, my short time at Coconut Waikiki Hotel was a great stay. I wish I got all the worker’s names while I was there. They all showed great customer service from beginning to end. The valet greeted me. The front desk agent was so welcoming - absolutely loved him. Such a awesome personality. They upgraded my room - absolutely loved the small suite. It was simple, but great! I almost didn’t want to leave the room all night. Valet is available 24/7, which is cool. You’re going to want to pay for valet because there’s barely any street parking. Don’t rely on street parking being available all the time. I also had a hard time trying to find the drive-in entrance of the hotel when I first got there. But other than parking, I have nothing bad to say. It was absolutely a great stay for me. Definitely will be back here again. Mahalo nui!

A clean, pleasant hotel within a short walk to the beach and shopping. Breakfast provided was adequate for our needs. Sadly the issue with noise from the road and outdated airconditioning unit means that I would be unlikely to use again.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel during our 14 night stay in Waikiki. The location is great and it is easy to walk to the beach, restaurants, bars and even Ala Moana shopping mall from the hotel. The hotel has all the amenities which were required during our stay and the continental breakfast has plenty of variety and is a good option if you are up in time to enjoy it! There is complimentary tea, coffee and cold drinks available in the foyer 24/7 and complimentary popcorn available in the afternoons. There is a small pool and loungers available at the hotel, and you can get beach towels from the front desk which was great as saved on packing space! The staff are friendly and helpful, we had a lovely stay here.

I recently stayed at The Coconut Waikiki hotel with both of my children (ages 17 and 11). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly! I felt comfortable asking them questions about places we wanted to explore and they were knowledgeable on how to get there and gave us tips on where to go! The breakfast every morning was much appreciated as the thought of venturing out to find food every morning would have taken away time for exploring the island! There was a variety of foods to choose from and my family was able to start the day with a good breakfast. Try the hurricane popcorn in the afternoons—very tasty! We will recommend this smaller hotel to our friends and to anyone that wants to be close to the main part of Wakiki but prefers a quieter place to stay. We felt at home at The Coconut! Thank you for the friendly atmosphere and place to land while exploring your beautiful island! The Evan Family

The coconut was like a second home. We were comfortable and happy with the service and we loved the location. Washing machine and dryer on site was so convenient. Close to Ross dress for less and moose mccully for $3 mai tai

WE stayed for 8 nights at the Coconut and found it to be a really friendly hotel from the moment we arrived. Having travelled Jetstar from Australia, we got to the hotel at 7am and they let us into our rooms (thankyou so very much!!). It didn't stop there, they offered us breakfast the first day (unheard of anywhere else!) and later when asked where the bar was they advised they don't have one, just go to the bottle next door and you're welcome to sit in our lounge and enjoy a quiet drink.There were 9 of us in our group and we were joined by Kiwis and Poms (New Zealanders and English) and everyone agreed it was such a friendly hotel.The rooms were fine (a little noisy) and the complimentary breakfast each day was good. Well worth staying and it is only an easy 10 minute walk to the beach.

I loved everything about the Coconut Waikiki Hotel!Mostly I loved the value. First off, if you book with them directly, they wave the $25 to $40 amenity fee that ALL THE OTHER hotels charge.Second, the free early breakfast (6:30 am to 8:30 am) offers a value that is very hard to find in Waikiki, and it gets you up and out of the hotel early. You will find scrambled eggs, bread to toast, croissants and danishes, mini-belgian waffles with hot syrup, cold cereals, hot oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, and granola. Also, complementary coffee, decaf coffee, hot water for tea, pineapple infused iced tea, cucumber-lemon infused water, blueberry-orange infused water, and apple-cinnamon infused water is offered 24 hours a day. Furthermore, free, fresh, hot popcorn is popped everyday from 2 pm to 6 pm. Who doesn't love fresh, hot popcorn?The location of the Coconut Waikiki Hotel is also a big selling point. It's next to the beautiful Waikiki Canals right on Lewers Street. A twelve minute walk straight down Lewers takes you to a slightly less populated area of the Waikiki beach. There are plenty of restaurant options (including some more affordable ones) close by, open early, and open late as well.I cannot say enough about the Coconut Waikiki. All of the staff is friendly, courteous, and wears a smile. Jessica, at the front desk, was especially knowledgeable and helpful with information about the island of Oahu.

The Coconut Waikiki is a reasonably priced smaller hotel with friendly, excellent, customer service. My family stayed a week and especially appreciated their caring employees. We also very much enjoyed the view of the canal and mountainside near the hotel. The continental breakfast which included scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal,waffles, rolls, and juice was especially nice and the afternoon treat of popcorn and fruit infused water and tea was a refreshing break during the day If you are a light sleeper ear plugs are provided for a good nights sleep.

Great boutique hotel alongside the canal. Rooms clean, excellent friendly staff and great service. Rooms big enough for two people. We are traveling in a group of 9 for a family holiday for adults. Small outdoor area for us to have drinks. Small outdoor games area for children however if you have older children l would recommend a bigger resort. They do supply beach towels and chairs for the beach at no cost and breakfast is included.

Room - nice, clean, nice décor, 2 BATHROOMS!!!!!Staff - GREAT, FANTASTIC!!!!Free breakfastPool is a little small but is HEATED !!!The walk to the beach is short in distance but takes a bit due to all the foot traffic. Difficult when carrying all our beach stuff.

This is our 5th stay at the Coconut Waikiki, and over the years it has gone from strength to strength. We first stayed here when it was a Best Western, then a JDV hotel, until it became its independent brand. We recognise a lot of the staff, meaning it must be a great place to work. They all exude the aloha spirit from the moment you walk in the door. It is truly a personable experience with everyone you encounter. Amenities are the usual with hotels (except you don't pay a ridiculous resort fee here), with infused waters/teas, coffee and tea readily available at all hours. Along with hurricane popcorn available every afternoon. Such great value for a boutique hotel only moments from the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Ave. Clean and comfortable rooms with everything that you need. We cannot wait to stay here again. Thank you team for everything that you do, and all that you are.

Thanks to the welcoming staff and comfortable room, I really enjoyed my weekend getaway to Honolulu. If you are looking for a smaller hotel at the quieter edge of Waikiki, yet within easy walking distance to all the action, this is a great choice. It has been recently renovated. My room had a small kitchen area with microwave, sink, refrigerator, and a bit of a view of the Ala Wai Canal and mountains from the balcony. Breakfast buffet is included with waffles, eggs, cereals, toast, sweet rolls, yogurt, fruit, juice and coffee. You can eat inside or outside on the lanai. Staff are friendly and helpful. Only valet parking is available, but this was no problem.

This place was a pleasant surprise. Located about a 10 min walk from Waikiki beach and shopping strip it was much better value than the larger beach front hotels. Waikiki is super expensive in general and this hotel was worth the extra 10 min walk. The hotel was very quaint, with a pool and free breakfast. It was really clean and the rooms, while small, had everything you need. They have really made the best of the space available. We had a mountain view room that looked over the street and there was a lot of traffic noise. You couldn’t open the balcony door because of it but they did provide earplugs. The staff were great and couldn’t do enough to help. Parking was $30 a day and the resort fee was $25 per night but the location made it one of the better value hotels. Would definitely recommend.

Great stay. Comfortable bed and good sized room. All staff were friendly and helpful. Bus stops, shops, eateries all easy walking distance from the hotel. Lewers St is busy with noisy traffic. Well catered breakfasts.

I stayed in this hotel with a friend for a week, and it was such an awesome experience. On the second night, we walked into the room and the air conditioning had leaked coolant EVERYWHERE, we called the front desk and they quickly moved us to a bigger room without any extra charge! All of the staff are so friendly and will help you in any way that they can. The included breakfast was really helpful, although I was really disappointed that they did not have any fresh food to offer. But, their selection was rounded enough, I have a strict eating restriction and I was able to eat most things they had to offer. While it is not right on the beach, the walk is not bad at all. There are a few convenience stores close to the hotel, and plenty of food. Take advantage of their beach chairs and towels, they are awesome!

This was a trip with my 4 year-old son to visit my adult niece who moved to Honolulu this year. Everything in HI is so expensive - it took me forever to find the right hotel. Book online through the Coconut website - they waive the

My husband and I and another couple we were traveling with spent 2 nights at the Coconut Waikiki. We had a great stay here! We loved the location as it was within walking distance to numerous shops, restaurants and the beach. The breakfast was filling and good. We had a fridge and microwave in our room. We would definitely stay here again!

The quality-price-location ratio is very good with Coconut! I personally liked tha fact that is wasn’t as colossal as the big beach hotels and that is was on a side street so the immeadiate area was more quiet and peaceful. But it takes like 2 minutes to walk to the busy main streets of Waikiki and 5 or so to the beach so it’s also very close to everything happening in Waikiki!Breakfast was okay (basic American brekkie) and as an added bonus they have popcorn on afternoons! Plus flavoured water all throughout the day. The lounge area is quite comfy as also the rooms. Ours had an amazing view of the mountais!The staff is extremely friendly and nice! Can’t compliment enough!I would recommend Coconut to everybody who doesn’t feel the need to be on the beach immediately after stepping out of their room.

The coconut Waikiki Hotel is a nice place to stay, they have great prices. The breakfast was more than we expected and also the infused waters. The staff here we re all professionals an very nice, they give good recommendation of place to go and see. I will be considering the place again I we come back to Hawaii.

The three of us stayed in a double double (2 double beds, 2 adults, 1 teen). I don't need to tell you that double beds are small and everything about the room is small. However, I really liked the hotel. The rooms are kitschy and have a sink, fridge and microwave (with drinkware). The morning breakfast was great for carb lovers with fresh tiny waffles and a cereal bar. (The eggs were meh) The pool is also tiny but, oddly, they have giant board games to play, which we did.The best part of this hotel is location! It is the perfect walking distance from waikiki and easy access to the highway. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. I would absolutely stay here again.

The team at Coconut were amazing during our 10night stay. As our flight arrived at 6am in the morning, they didn't even hesitate to give us a free early check-in to our City View room on the 9th floor. They also allowed me to have packages sent to the hotel (as I did some online shopping from US brands that don't ship to Australia or ship for lots of money) without charge which apparently other hotels charge. They always greeted us with a smile and made sure we were having a good time. The free popcorn was delicious- make sure you put a little salt and alot of the seaweed/sesame mix (amazing!). And the free iced drinks and tea/coffee in the lobby 24/7 was delicious and came in handy. Breakfast included waffles, vanilla yoghurt, oats, choc chips, fruit (not sure if fresh or tinned), toast, crossaints/danish/etc, scrambled eggs, cereal. All included in the room cost. Pool was heated, and the outdoor area was nice. Big versions of chess, checkers, etc out the back. The only thing was the seating in the sun and the pool had water dripping from the aircon units of the rooms above. The rooms were clean. They could do with a detail, but the bed was good, clean sheets and towels, fridge was cold, etc. The USB charging station on the nightstand was super helpful. I usually dislike hotel toiletries, but their shampoo and conditioner were amazing. We weren't bothered at all by the traffic outside as others have mentioned. We did run the aircon all night- it is a little loud, but it managed to drown out my snoring husband and the traffic, letting me enjoy a full night's rest every time. We booked directly on the Coconut website as they had a better deal going on at the time :) And we would definitely stay here again!!

Our family stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel for 7-nights in late May. We found it to be a gem of a place. It was clean, and conveniently located. Our kids loved the free popcorn and the swimming pool. We liked that it was situated near to a couple of great restaurants in Mahina & Sons and Siam Square Thai. Oh, and the Hi5 Hawaii circle tour recommended by the front desk was exceptional too! We'll definitely be back again.

We stay 17 Nights and Had a Great Time Shops the beach and the bus stop is in 5 min walktime to reach.The Breakfast is good all what you Need for a Good way to Start the day.The staff in the Hotel are Very Friendly and helpfulOn the next vacation on oahu gladly again in the coconut waikiki hotelThe Street is a Bit Loud so Not the normal car Traffic but for tuned cars there is probably no decibel limit as in germany so is Not a problem of the location of the hotel because the tuned cars Drive all over waikiki i will say you can stay in the best hotel in oahu but when a tuned car drive Passes by it is loud well we we're all young The pool is ok i am Not a pool guy who goes in the pool when he has one of the most Beautiful Beaches by the seaSorry about my bad englisch.....I Hope i can help you with my few words

What a lovely hotel, in a perfect position, 5 minute's walk to the hub of restaurants and bars. The breakfast is basic but all you need really, toast, scrambled egg, cereal, porridge, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, waffles, juice and coffee. The best thing for me was the lovely staff, especially Issacc & Jessica who were fantastic and helped us out with everything, trips etc and printing off boarding passes. We loved this hotel and if we ever came back it would be here, the staff made it for us.

I was very disappointed with my visit to Coconut Waikiki. I saw some really mixed reviews but decided to give it try since the rates were decent. I should have known it was a red flag and stayed away...The process of getting your car valet is confusing when you drive up the roadway. There were a ton of cars at the time I was checking in and no valet guy present. Since there were cars just sitting there, I decided to leave my car there and check-in. The staff in the front weren't the nicest and seemed like they didn't want to be there. The hotel itself looks old and at the time of my stay in late May 2018, the balcony was under construction. The room was the typical hotel room size, but the bathroom was horrible.. The bathtub was SO uncomfortable as it made sounds while you were showering. It seemed like the bathtub was not placed in correctly so it would make loud

We stayed here for an overnight layover and had a great time. Beach, shops, and good restaurants were all in easy walking distance. The room was just right and had a beautiful view of the mountains. The breakfast included with the stay was also very nice.

Everything was perfect, the most loveliest staff (thanks Isaac, Jessica, Mike, Robert and all the other staff too) the room was a great size, fresh towels every day...yummy breakfast served every morning!! It was close to everything we needed & wanted, but far enough away from all the hustle of how busy Waikiki can be! Thank you so much, we will come back & stay there again...well worth the extra money spent!! But must that the BIGGEST thank you to Isaac & Jessica, you both made our stay that much more memorable... we miss your faces!! Oh and the lovely young girl in the kitchen was so lovely, friendly & helpful every morning, so sorry I didn’t get her name or to thank her!!

Great little boutique hotel. Nice extras like flavoured water, hurricane popcorn and beach equipment. They are undergoing renovations but we were not bothered by it at all. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite for our 10 day stay. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. Breakfast was limited but they try to have a little of everything. The only negatives were the pillows/bed, the pool being always in the shade and the crazy windy location off the canal.

A first time visit to Hawaii, came about this affordable, comfortable, well located hotel in Waikiki. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room amenities were good, free WiFi, free towel lending and complimentary American style breakfast made the stay very easy and enjoyable. Loved that central Waikiki was just a short walk away. Well recommended.

Liked my room, especially the microwave and fridge. Helped lower my expenses; the breakfast was pretty good. Pool did not have steps, so that was difficult for me as I have trouble with knees. Lots of cordial people there, but almost everyone was from another country and spoke in their language which made it hard to be friends.

Stayed here a few days during our trip to Wakiki. This hotel is nicely located away from the the craziness of the beach hotels but close enough to walk down to. Despite some construction the rooms were still nice and well kept. The staff was very nice and helpful with local places to go visit. Definitely would recommend staying here if you want a quieter place to relax.

This hotel is in a great location not too far from shops and restaurants and only 10 minutes from the beach great hotel there is a great little pool and plenty outdoor games like chess draughts etc outside tables and chairs and a buffet breakfast is included we will certainly return

friendly staff, convenient location, reasonable prices. they upgraded us to an executive suite before we even checked in! this was great because we had two bathrooms to prepare for our day in. room was clean and comfortable.

This hotel was a great find and up to our expectations. Away from the hustle and bustle but still within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach and shops. Also close to general stores, cheaper eats and buses. The staff were great, friendly, helpful and available 24hrs. Rooms were tidy with cleaning available daily. Buffet breakfast is limited and a little boring. Some board games and books are available to borrow. Happy to recommend and return.

Staff was great, rooms were comfortable and clean and when booked directly through their website, you'll save on the resort fees ($200). Downside: $30 a night for valet parking...good luck finding a spot on the street for free!

Cute,cleaned, and very friendly staff. Great location to shopping and eateries. No room service but microwave & fridge are provided in room. Reasonable rates compared to other nearby hotels. A great find for those on limited budget!

A great location for the hotel - very quiet at night. It is definitely one of the better mid range hotels and acts as a great stay for visiting the surrounding areas. While I liked staying here I definitely preferred to be outside. The breakfast was reasonable but the air conditioning is a little old. A great choice if you prefer quiet nights.

Great hotel! Book online for good deals on rates (waived resort fee, discounts, etc). Valet parking was convenient and relatively inexpensive compared to other hotels near Waikiki. Amazing location--within walking distance from Waikiki shopping, beach and restaurants, and close access to major highways. Breakfast was simple and filling, could use more fruit. Clean room, exceptional service.

The staff was awesome from the desk help to the parking attendant to our runner when we needed items like pillow or towels. Room was cold there was 2 toilets do that was a plus. Bed was very comfortable and very roomy to fit my family. Need to bring back the meat for breakfast although I cant complain cause it was free and filling. Will reccomend to others.

Wasn't sure of hotel because it was my first time staying here but it surpassed my expectations. Employees were very welcoming, friendly and accommodating, felt like the aloha spirit was alive and well. No complaints in either service or room. Mahalo.

Although we stayed only for 1 night, we are very satisfied with the service. The location was prime with the min shopping street withing walkable distance. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast can be improved.

The room was nice. The hose keeper was so honest that when a left paper money in the sink as a tip, they assumed it was not their and simply took it out of the sink and placed on the counter. Breakfast was adequate, but nothing special.The staff was quick to unlock my safe when I messed up the numbers and could not reopen it. The availability of free beach towels and chairs was convenient.

I did a lot of research before choosing this hotel and found it to be reasonably priced. Once we stayed there I can verify that it's a great find. Although right on the Ala Moana canal, it's not a long walk to the beach and even shorter walk to all the nightlife\restaurants on Kuhio and Kalakaua. Staff was exceedingly hospitable and helpful and room was spacious and clean. Bed was really comfortable and free breakfast was very good. Only negative was that the balcony was unavailable due to renovations. I understand that renovations are occasionally required, but felt that the hotel could have done something as a goodwill gesture like a comp champagne, etc.

We were very happy with this hotel. The staff were helpful and the room clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great. Waffles, fruit, yoghurt or scrambled eggs.Any maintenance issues we had were fixed at once so if something needs attention just report it,Free beach towels and beach chairs are on offer daily.Do not hesitate to book here.

This hotel is truly a recommendation to stay. The place is amazing, the staff very polite ad helpful. The hospitality is wonderful. The breakfast is very tasteful! If you want a good place to spend a few days, this hotel will serve you well!

Friendly, Affordable, Clean Accommodation a short walk to the Heart of Waikiki. We both enjoyed our accommodation at the Coconut after a 17 day cruise and 3 days at Coconut, when we return which will be soon we shall most likely stay here again...ThanksWayne & Tammy

We stay for one night. We found a welcoming room with an updated decoration. The bathroom could be renewed. The windows face the mountains, unfortunately the balcony was in repair which hides the beautiful view.

The hotel is right next to the Ala Moana blvd, and a short distance to the busy Kuihio and Kalakaua avenues with the restaurants and shops. The breakfast was OK (although the fruit could be unfrozen before placed on the counter) although some items sometimes run out. The rooms are standard, clean. Friendly and helpful receptionists. I stayed for almost a week which in hindsight seems a bit masochistic. The receptionist placed me right into a room that next to the major construction project, with pounding and drilling that started every day at 8 PM. I was not notified of this beforehand, nor given an option to choose a more appropriate room. The hotel was not sympathehtic to my complaints, which in my view does not reflect well on the quality of the management. To keep assigning guests to rooms that are terrorised by construciton is the height of irresponsibility.
user_name:
Kai C
Half Moon Bay, California

review_body: This is a very unique place to stay. The style and decor makes for an Hawaiian experience. We had a great view of the channel. We were short walking distance from the beach and main area. This makes it nice for you far enough away to be quiet and peaceful. But close enough to get to everything.

My mother and I stayed for a week. It was great, especially for the value. Yes, not a massive room/bathroom, and has some dated elements. However, the staff, amenities, location, price, made us very happy with our stay. Not one complaint and would recommend.

We had a 13 night stay in early Feb this year. We were upgraded thi a king mountain view as were the other couple we traveled with. The room isn't massive but has a comfy bed good pillows and nice crisp linens and a nice size tv. Our room was serviced daily so we would come back and find bed made and lovely clean bathroom and towels. The balcony was nice to sit out on. Checkin was easy we were in on a very early flight and they made every effort to get our rooms ready easy before actual checkin time that was most appreciated as we all felt like a nice shower and a short rest. The front desk staff were ultra helpful with any question such as where to eat best way to get to places how to live the local bus. Breakfast was included. We'r only used it a few times when we had early start as it wasn't really our thing. No fresh fruits and as Aussies we found the bread really too sweet. But as it was included in our room rate you can't complain. We found lovely places to have breakfast outside of the hotel. The hotel itself is in a great spot so close to everything.. bus stop, ABC store, a good coffee shop, the main shopping strip and even the beach is not too far. Yes there is a lot of traffic but we honestly didn't find it any issue to our sleep. Access to a laundry with coin operated washers and dryers was nice to doour washing and a small pool area for a swim. Popcorn every afternoon in the lobby. If you're looking for a smaller boutique hotel with a more personal touch and the same staff each day who you get to know and at a reasonable price this is the place to stay. You'll be able to afford to stay longer.

The room was spacious and cute. I really felt comfortable. I love how close the place was to all the stores, restaurants, and the beach! The place was also near the water. Awesome place. The only part I didn't enjoy was the parking.

My travel agent here in Canada booked this hotel for us for a one stay before our flight back to Canada - We were met by a very nice gentleman by the name of James. We stayed on the 5th floor in a very nice comfortable clean room. Continental breakfast was included the next morning. We also had some fresh fruit filled drinking water and popcorn in the afternoon which i thought was a very nice gesture - friendly atmosphere - also had the wifi in our room as well as the really nice lobby with couches, tables and tv. The walk to the International Centre was not far, many stores to visit and a great walk in the area - not far from Waikiki beach if you like the 10 minute walk or less. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel in the future. Thank you James and the rest of your staff for a wonderful stay - Wish it would have been longer - Thank you very Much !!!!

I’ll preface this with the kind staff did find a new room for me but as I was out all day I couldn’t get back in time to change ... I had mountain view which was a nice room, comfortable, very clean ... but does overlook a very busy road. If this doesn’t bother you no problem ... if it does possibly not for you. Mind you, the price is pretty good for Waikiki ! I’d stay again but request a different side of building ...

We decided to stay at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel because of the reviews we read. The price we paid for our room was reasonable. We booked 30 days in advance and received an additional discount. If you need to cancel your money is non refundable if you choose to do the 30 days in advance. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist and valet. The check in was quick and easy. The receptionist informed us that they had upgraded us. So we were excited until we reached our room. The room was facing the main highway and construction was going on right below our room. On the night stand we found two sets of ear plugs. You definitely needed them if you wanted a good night sleep. The room was adequate and was very clean. The other reason I rated this hotel as average is our bath towels had holes in them. Housekeeping should have caught this and thrown them away. Breakfast was average. The day we were there it was raining and there was no where to sit in the dinning room and lobby. If your looking for an average hotel with no frills. This is a good bargain. Also parking will be $30.00 a night.

We keep coming back to Coconut Waikiki as we have always had lovely staff, lovely clean rooms and enjoyable facilities. More affordable than the bigger chain hotels with many of the rooms being larger than normal and a convenient location to the strip and beach.Fantastic having breakfast included as breakfast is challenging to find in Waikiki.

Our stay at the Coconut was really good because all members of staff we're so helpful and welcoming and did all they could to make our trip to Hawaii very enjoyable ...thanks for making our trip to Hawaii so memorable

We’ve been staying at this hotel on each of our annual trips for the past 3 years now. We keep coming back to Coconut because the staff are the nicest people we’ve met at any hotel that we’ve so far been to (and we’ve been to a bunch) I still remember Kia who worked there 3 years ago, he always had a smile and was very helpful. Although he's no longer part of the establishment the current staff at the hotel are equally friendly and accommodating.We returned last year and again this year. When you travel for a lengthy period like we do (we usually stay for over a month) having a comfortable place to stay and people that are welcoming is exactly what Coconut Hotel delivers on. We haven't had one bad experience in our 90+ days of staying at this hotel over the past few years. This hotel is very consistent, from the kindness of the staff to the cleanliness of the rooms. They’ve gone above and beyond, making sure that you have the best room available, even if you didn't book that view or bigger bed :) Thanks Jordan (Manager) for upgrading us and giving us the same room we stayed in last year! We really appreciate your attention to detail and hospitality towards us.When any issues arise they are quick to resolve it with your comfort in mind. On one day towards the end of our stay, the AC in our room stopped working and Isaac (who is a sweetheart) was quick to book us in to another room for the night on the same floor while they fixed the AC in our room. We didn’t have to move any of our stuff over, it was just to make sure we got a comfortable nights sleep. We really appreciated the attention they gave us. We feel safe staying here knowing that if a problem might occur, they're on our side.So thank you Coconut Hotel for another wonderful stay, we will be returning again :)

Pros: Good location, everything in walking distance. Room was clean and quiet. Daily popcorn and flavoured water was a nice treat. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Cons: The breakfast selection never changed, there was no fresh fruit or meat options. Small eating area that was always packed and unable to take food to room. High parking price was expected for area but when we couldn't find street parking for one evening we still had to pay full price.

Always wanted to visit Hawaii, staff were always helpful and made my Birthday. Variety of food for breakfast. Popcorn and different flavored waters were on offer in the afternoon which was very refreshing.

It was an overall great staying in your Hotel. Staff and the whole service team was very responsive and friendly. Breakfast was okay . Room small but clean. Only the traffic sound was a bit negative .anyway we would come again once we visiting Hawaii again.

My partner and had an memorable stay at the hotel. A short walk away from shops with views from our balcony. Staff were friendly and we enjoyed the complimentary snacks available in the lobby. Great value for money!

My husband and I stayed at the Coconut Hotel from April 4-13th. I cannot say enough about the staff and the great service and hospitality we received during our stay. Jessica, Issac, Donovan & Anne who worked the front desk were so helpful and friendly when addressing our questions or needs. the hotel is kept very clean and tidy at all times. Our room was cleaned thoroughly everyday. we enjoyed all the amenities of the hotel including the continental breakfast, popcorn in the afternoon, the private patio and pool etc. I would also like to mention that the valets Mike and Robert were also very helpful and had great suggestions for things to do or places to go and eat dinner. My Daughter and her Husband were staying at the hotel as well for their honey moon and were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne, a box of chocolates & a lovely card from the Hotel staff congratulating them on their marriage. We will definitely be returning in the near future! Thank you Coconut Hotel staff for making our first visit to Hawaii everything we expected and much more!

The front desk staff is the best! They made helpful suggestions and answered all of our questions. we were given a room on the top floor overlooking the mountains. The room was clean and the air worked well. The noise was not too bad at all. The laundry service was handy and it costs $2.50 per load. Lots of ABC stores near by to grab the necessities.

Friendly staff and as were on an early flight we were allowed to book in early. Wonderful after a nights flight. The pool was heated though a bit small, but with a beach a short walk away who needed it! The room was large and had a fridge and microwave. Only bad point was the noise of the air conditioning machine.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel & our stay was fantastic. Ths hotel should be proud of their wonderful staff, friendly, helpful & caring. We had a suite on 8th floor & it was kept really clean, towels & bedding changed often. Tea, coffee & fruit juices available all day. Loved the fact they have do it yourself laundry room, makes such a difference & wasnt exoensive. Free continental breakfast included. Lovely position took 10 mins slow walk to beach. We came from Scotland & would definitely recommend this hotel to family & friends

We only stayed one night and found the Coconut Waikiki staff friendly and helpful. The executive room was ok and conveniently had two bathrooms. A few blocks back from the main ‘strip’ but it was not a hassle to walk to. If you do not like noise then this is probably not the place for you. They did provide ear plugs in the room. Overall the stay was pleasant.

The room was fine and clean with nice view. The staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed there and needed additional supplies for our two daughters staying with us. The staff was helpful and prompt. Breakfast in the morning was hot and enough for us to have late lunches. We couldn't use the outdoor hot-tub/ swimming pool as the weather was too cold. In summary not a obstentious hotel, but well worth the money.
user_name:
Peetambar2003
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Coconut Waikiki wasn't a luxury hotel, but they more than made it up with the hospitality they provided. The staff were all very friendly and likeable. At some of the more expensive hotel, you can feel that some staff hated being there. Never once did I see a staff resenting their work here. That, and just the small things: board games at the lobby, self-serve drinks, popcorns... They all made the stay quite comfortable anf cozy! I seriously wanted to stay in and hang around in the lobby all day! (I was initially wondering why I see guests in the lobby pretty often. I know why now)

We wanted a cheap but nice hotel for 4 days. Good location. Sleep was difficult due to aircon blasting straight onto the side of the bed. They did provide ear plugs which helped. Cleanliness was average. Service was mixed,some staff lovely and some not so bothered. Security was concerning. We had someone come into our room in the night and staff couldn’t tell us who it was. Pool was nice, as were the free beach and pool towels. Prepaid valet parking was very good and the valets were great and very prompt. Breakfast was very average to not great and not much room to sit if it was raining. Good location, average everything else.

Coconut Waikiki is a great place to stay. An ideal location away from the busier tourist trail. Staff at reception very friendly and helpful with good local knowledge. Room very clean and beds very comfortable. Breakfast has a good selection that should keep anyone happy and is an added bonus. Hotel is great value for money.

The Hotel is in great place not far from Galliera where you can pick up the Waikiki trolly. Staff were helpful and polite. Great Serive by the whole team. Breakfast is American Style but will be the same throughout your stay which can be bit boring but everything else about this hotel was great. 5star service by everyone.It’s Close by to 5he beech and Canal and round the corner from pick up points for tours near the Hyatt Centric.I had great time and will use them again.

My friends and I wanted to have a small get together and decided to choose Coconut Waikiki Hotel because it was so affordable. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the staff who were very attentive and asked if we needed help with our luggage. We got the penthouse and let me just say that it was amazing. The rooms were a good size, clean, and had all the necessities you could think of. The location was great, it was a short walk from the shopping centers and many different eateries. The hotel also offered breakfast which had a variety of breads, cereals, coffee, yogurt, waffles and more. Our stay was too amazing, even as I am typing this I am having withdrawals from this hotel. My friends and I agreed that this is definitely the place to stay if you are looking for comfort, good location and affordability. Definitely will return again for our next get together.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. The location was great away from the touristy area of the downtown area. Enjoyed our walks on the path by the canal. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony, which we really enjoyed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast had a variety of offerings from eggs, waffles, rolls, cereal, and fruit and yogurt. We also enjoyed the free fresh popcorn and flavored waters between 2 & 6 PM. Very affordable and no resort fee.

We had a splendid ,large room on the top floor.It was well equipped with balcony overlooking sportsfields..Breakfast was rather chaotic as 45 schoolchildren from Wales were in attendance.They were splendid however the area allotted was fine for about 20 people.Staff were helpful and most pleasant.We thoroughly recommend as the prices were very fair.Only problem it was noisy at night.

What I love about the coconut hotel is the service at reception. The staff are all attentive, professional and helpful. The pop corn and fruit water in the afternoon is a plus. If you want to go to airport, pearl harbour and downtown it’s just a single bus ride merely 2 mins away from the hotel

The Coconut Waikiki is a wonderful hotel in a great spot very convenient to plenty of shopping, restaurants and the beach. The balcony provided amazing views of Honolulu. We were welcomed by the very helpful front desk staff whom gave us great directions and information on bus transport or activities for our stay. Anything we needed was happily taken care of. The room was small but very clean and completely adequate for 3 of us. There was a small kitchen area with fridge, microwave, and keurig, complete with dishes. Shower, air conditioning and all facilities worked very well. Nice pool and the balcony was such a wonderful place to sit and watch the canoes rowing along the canal while enjoying the breeze. The hotel had a nice breakfast and offered free popcorn in the afternoon. There was always refreshing fruit infused water available in the lobby. Beach towels, umbrellas and whatever else we needed was readily offered. Very helpful securing transportation to the airport. Highly recommend this reasonably priced hotel.

The staff was wonderful and accommodating, the room was clean and spacious, the location was good! We came in, late check in about 11:00 and once we got to our room we were exhausted. Room was so comfortable, we crashed!

This was the perfect place to base ourselves in Waikiki. Breakfast included and everything provided for a comfortable stay not far from the action, beach or shopping. Go the early checkin for the early arrival.

This lovely hotel gets top marks for affordability in Waikiki. Book directly with the hotel and they waive the $25 nightly resort fee. The hotel is within easy walking distance (5-10 mins) to restaurants, bars, the beach, the bus, and an ABC convenience shop. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The king room was big enough for us for our 5 night stay - the bed was super comfy, the WIFI worked perfectly and we appreciated the fridge.
