The coin laundry room came in VERY handy to dry the clothes we were wearing when we got caught in an unexpected rain storm walking back to the hotel on our last evening. The only issue we had - I can sleep through anything but my husband who is a light sleeper had to use the hotel supplied earplugs due to traffic and/or air conditioner noise. Mahalo to Jordan and his team for the room upgrade and the birthday card/chocolates in our room - a nice surprise! Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Breakfast - great, view - great, staff - great, location - convenient, amenities - great, bedroom/bathroom/kitchen - great, valet parking and bell hop assistance - great. Would 100% stay here again =]

Our room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Breakfast was waffles, scrambled eggs, frozen fruit, yogurt, granola, toast and cereal. An easy walk to Waikiki Beach.

Staff was very friendly, room was clean, and the breakfast that is included with the stay is very nice :) Walking distance from everything of interest in Waikiki. Even though checkout is at noon, our flight was at 9pm and they kindly kept our luggage safe for the rest of the day. I recommend.

This was our first visit to Honolulu. Stayed three nights here. Lovely hotel. Bed was comfortable. Room was clean, staff was very polite and helpful. Hotel is within walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping.

Good location, fine breakfast, afternoon snacks, clean pool and extremely friendly staff. Bike rental rack just by entrance. 1 block from Waikiki Beach Walk. Exclusive stores very close. Lots of tourists shops also near

We really liked this hotel. It's a charming place with spacious rooms. Everything was perfectly clean in the room. Lots of nice touches are added above and beyond other places. Simple buffet breakfast is included with cereal, toast, croissants, waffles, fruit, juice, coffee and tea. Plenty of options to keep you full for a few hours. My only gripe is that breakfast is between 6:30am and 8:30am, and the staff start removing items from the buffet as soon as 8:30 hits regardless of if you're getting food or not. I think they really need to extend the breakfast to around 9:30am like most other hotels.Complimentary tea, coffee, ice tea and fruit flavoured water are available 24x7 (serve yourself), and popcorn is freshly popped in the afternoon which is great for a snack to keep you going.The location was great for us, it's around a two block walk from the main drag of Waikiki, which is good as you don't have to deal with the busy factor of the main street. The hotel is across the road from a beautiful river, and there's a conveniently located 'Biki' bike share rack just out the front where you can hire a push bike if you want. Lots of souvenir and convenience shops are located within a two minute walk. McDonalds and iHop are only one block away.There is a heated pool, but it's quite small. Beach is only a ten minute walk away, and they let you borrow beach towels and sand 'play' toys for the kids. We took some pool noodles and floaty rings to the beach. Was nice not to have to purchase them.If you hire a car, be aware that the hotel charges you $30 per day for valet, and there's no nearby free options unfortunately (well there are, but the parks are always taken).All in all we had a great stay and would come here again.

Stayed here based on TripAdvisor reviews and wasn’t disappointed. Very friendly staff, quiet rooms and all very tidy. Didn’t realize we got upgraded to an executive suite was was much appreciated. Lovely views of the mountains from our room. Quick walk anywhere you want to go. And the Biki bike hire just up the road. Reasonably priced compared to the big resorts with value for money! Must agree with the critiques of the breakfast though - would be nice to run a bit longer and be restocked a bit more frequently. We would get there before 8 and much of the food was gone and not replenished. Overall - a great little place to stay and would return!!

We were very happy with the room and service at the Coconut. It is located a ten minute walk from the beach and only minutes from the shops and public transport. The room was quite spacious and very clean. A minor disappointment is that the free breakfast is served only until 8.30pm. A bit early if you arrived late at night or early morning.

We booked this hotel for three nights not really expecting much. That being said, I am please to say I was wrong. This is a great little hide away right in the middle of downtown. Staff was outstanding, doing everything in their power to assist us in having a good time during this short visit to the island. The rooms are on the smaller side but comfortable. They serve a very good continental breakfast. The hotel is only a half block off the major public transist that can get you to most if not all major sites on the island. It is also only four blocks to the beach. The hotel even offers towels and chairs you can take to the beach. Skip the big name tourist hotels and resorts and slow down a bit. This is a great place to feel at home while on the island.

Nice, reasonably clean, spacious room, good sized bathroom, great coffee, water, popcorn and breakfast. Pretty good location Close to everything. Definitely great value for money, friendly staff behind the desk as well as around the hotel.

There are so many hotels in and around Waikiki and the Coconut Waikiki Hotel is located centrally while providing a quiet area. I had a great view of the canal and Diamond Head, although it was windy so I was unable to sit out on the deck and enjoy this view. They have a pool but its very small so not a great place to hang out. Don't worry because the beach is only a 10-15 minute walk awa.

This cute little hotel is the best! The staff are so sweet, helpful and knowledgeable of the area. They offer a great continental breakfast. Highly recommend. They have a small pool. Wifi can be sketchy in room but perfect in lobby.

We needed a place to stay for a medical trip and added a day to explore Oahu for our 37th Anniversary. Coconut Waikiki was perfect. Small boutique older hotel. Not crowded and impersonal. Nearby many places via walking. Easy valet parking. Very clean. Comfortable rooms. Delightful staff. Large breakfast. Planning to go back again in March. We live on another Island, but enjoy going to Oahu to shop, dine and explore. Coconut Waikiki is now our go to place. Highly recommend.

This wee gem of a hotel exceeded all my expectations. Whilst an older property it has been updated with a contemporary vibe. The king room was well appointed with quality amenities. King rooms face the canal and can be noisy because of road traffic - to be honest I just got used to it. Breakfast was fine with protein options. Towels chairs and buckets and spades for the kids at the beach. One short block to the major bus routes. What really sets this hotel apart are the friendly and knowledgeable staff.

We visit O'ahu at least a couple times a year from the Big Island and we wanted to try a new hotel with a lower price than the one we often stay at. We were very pleased with the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. The lobby was bright and welcoming and our room was a good size and very clean. We were upgraded to a mountain view and had a balcony overlooking the Ala Wai Canal. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. What stood out for us the most were the little things. When rain was forecast, we asked the front desk if they happened to have umbrellas and they handed us each one. In our room, there were four complimentary Keurig cups and the bathroom even had makeup remover cleansing cloths, q-tips, and cotton balls along with the usual soap, shampoo, and conditioner. We were very pleased with the complimentary breakfast, though it ends a bit too early for those who might be wanting to sleep in on their vacation. The location is great since it's not noisy (except for the minor construction project going on right in front of the hotel), but the shops and restaurants are still an easy walk away. We were happy with the 1/2 off valet parking for kama'aina. We would definitely stay here again!

This is an older hotel, but well maintained with clean rooms. The staff are friendly and very helpful, we were first timers to the island and needed advice on where to go and how to get there. They were always willing to help us and provided good advice. We spent some time on the beach and were able to use beach chairs and an umbrella provided by the hotel at no charge. If there is a downside, the hotel is located nest to a busy street, but that turned out to be not an issue for us.

Staff were friendly, location was perfect, room was clean and spacious and had all the essentials. Would definitely stay again! The free popcorn and tea and coffee making facilities was just an added bonus

Very good located hotel near the Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. Visit Pau Hana food truck market inly 5 minutes away! Ala Wei Blvd. Is a little loud but ok after a while. Beds are very comfy, we liked the hotel a lot.

Very happy with our stay. hotel is in good location in waikiki. great price for room considering the amenities and how expensive the area is. staff was friendly and helpful (saved us a lot on cab to airport!).

My husband and I chose the Coconut Waikiki Hotel for our recent 3 night stay in Honolulu because we wanted a decent hotel for a good value, which is exactly what we got. If you want to be right on the beach, or want to be pampered with luxurious resort amenities, go ahead and spend $350 a night to stay at one of the big beachfront resorts. If you want a clean room with friendly staff at a reasonable price that leaves you plenty of money in your budget for activities and fine dining, this is a great choice. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach (about a 10 minute walk); they provide towels for free at the desk. We didn't plan to spend time at the beach other than a brief walk, so the distance wasn't a concern for us. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful. Parking is valet only for $30 per day, which was comparable to any other hotel in the area I looked at; we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for our car. The room was basic, and the bathroom rather small. The only minor complaint was a slight musty smell in the bathroom, which I think was coming from the shower curtain; everything appeared clean and the towels were definitely fresh. There was construction going on next door, and you could hear some road noise from our room, although they provided complimentary ear plugs, and even though we went to bed early we were not bothered by noise at the time we were going to sleep.

Exceptional hospitality - we received a welcome email a few days prior to our arrival with tips, weather, and an offer to help with any arrangements. Super friendly upon arrival and in the morning the concierge remembered my name and our room number. Super impressive. The lobby has been updated and is fresh and fun with great places to hang out... during one pass through there was a family hanging out in the library area while a group of young travelers were sharing wine at a large table in the middle room - great energy! The bed was comfortable and the room has been renovated in the same fresh style as the lobby - but still showed its years. The location made for an easy walk to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. We didn't have any problem finding street parking directly across from the hotel along the canal... All in all a good experience with exceptional hospitality.

Our first trip to Honolulu and we were very satisfied with our accommodation at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. We had outstanding service from the staff who were always on hand to give us a friendly Aloha or information we needed. The hotel is older, but took nothing away from the cleanliness of our rooms or the facility's. It was a pleasant walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Breakfast, infused refreshments and popcorn in the afternoon included in the package. Our 11 night stay included a upgrade which we were grateful for. The bonus for my husband and i was the super comfortable mattresses we slept on in both rooms. Great value for money. Would definitely stay at the Coconut in the future.

Our week at The Coconut was more than we could have expected. Infused water, tea and coffee available all day. A good breakfast is provided. The unexpected was chairs, umbrellas and towels for the beach were offered. Go for the mountain view rooms - definitely worth it. Very friendly helpful staff.

This is a terrific spot. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. The location is great. A short walk to the beach and main strip of restaurants, shopping and sights. But, at greatly reduced cost and congestion. You are known here, not like the anonymous traveler in the mega hotels on Kaulakua Blvd. The rooms are clean and the property is well maintained. Buffet breakfast is perfectly fine.

The staff here and great and can’t say enough positive things about all of them! The breakfast is decent especially because it’s free. Most hotels in Waikiki don’t include breakfast so it’s a plus for the price. Also loved the popcorn. Rooms were clean! Only thing that I wasn’t a fan on was the loudness from Ala Wai Blvd. I move a lot so the earplugs they have on the room fall out. Also I prefer a closer location to the beach. It is about a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach. But this is all things that are out of the hotels control. The air conditioner is the only thing I can complain about since it rattled a lot. Need to hit it to stop. It wasn’t a huge deal though. The price we for was amazing and they upgraded us to a mountain view room. If we got that price again, we would definitely stay here again.

I was pleasantly surprised with this place. It actually delivered a lot more than what i expected at a very reasonable price. We had a kitchenette but we're also given breakfast daily. ( Downside is you get there before 8:30 am) But they leave tea and coffee all day plus iced teas and pop corn for their guest. Their pool is heated so it's always nice and warm for swim, there's a small gym, out door games at the back. Plus, you get beach towels, or umbrellas to use at your convenience if leaving for the day. The Location is great as you're not paying premium rates as a resort next to the beach but you are walking distance from everything. (shops, beach, buses, canal ect). I must mention that the staff are quite good but i must make a special mention of Issac who made our experience in Hawaii much more pleasant by providing us with so my local info that he saved us from over spending on overpriced tours or pointed out buses and local attractions that we might have not thought of.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was perfect! The rooms are a little older, but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was more than we expected, and we really enjoyed the popcorn & flavored ice waters in the afternoon. The courtesy beach towels & chairs was a nice touch. We would definitely stay here again.

Arrived at the hotel, greeted by friendly staff (Jessica - super nice and helpful). Upgraded to a mountain view. Unfortunately, very noisy ( we live in a quiet suburb ) and couldn't get to sleep due to street noise. The windows are a louver design, and don't seal, so noise is a problem. Earplugs provided, but not comfortable for us.Requested a room change with Isaac ( great guy, always helpful and cheerful ). Moved to another room and had no further road noise issues. Airco can be a bit loud, but was ok.Room was good, soft pillows and bed was good. Had a fridge and microwave.Bathroom a bit small, but was ok. Looked clean enough. Shower worked well.Some finishing touches would include modernizing the airco and upgrading the windows to double glazing.Breakfast was ok, we normally only have toast and jam, so was happy enough, we found the selection to be typical of US breakfasts.Popcorn in the arvo was good.Valet guys happy and very helpful. No problems with driveway access.Pool was heated, so was nice to have a swim when weather was a bit coldish.Overall a good stay, enjoyed our time there.(Special shout out to Jess and Isaac for being so helpful - and to the young guy with the awesome hair...)

Hotel was well maintained, clean and comfortable. A little bit noisy from traffic.Did not appreciate the additional resort fee of $25.00. This was definitely not aresort hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous. Enjoyed the Lanai view of surrounding canal. Breakfast was adequate but could have had a better variety.

The staff and overall feel of this cute hotel makes you feel right at home. Staff is very friendly and the lobby with breakfast in the morning feels cozy. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of Waikiki and the shops - perfect for exploring by foot. Although the hotel does appear to have been re-modeled with modern accents, the room itself did still show some wear and tear, esp. the bathroom and the noisy air conditioning. Would have liked a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Great deal, however, for the price. Would recommend hotel as place to stay for my economical friends.

The hotel is located in a very central place,. The beach is about 5 minutes' walk. Breakfast provided in the hotel is good enough for the day and we enjoyed staying in this hotel!! The main road leading to many attractions is just a minute away from the hotel and very many eating places are available near the hotel.

Nice place to stay. My room: City View Queen, 2nd floor, facing West, middle of building. Note: All room reviews are for this room only. Least expensive room offered. Call the hotel direct for the best rates.Hotel is at the corner of Ala Wai Blvd and Lewers St. The reason I mention this is that both streets are one way. The driveway entrance to the hotel is on Ala Wai Blvd and is small and difficult to see at night, so if you miss it, you have to go around the block. I suggest you come in on Lewers St. which has less and slower traffic. When you get to Ala Wai, turn left (if you go straight, you'll end up in the canal) and immediately make a left into the sloping up driveway. Staff was very courteous and Hawaiian friendly. Hotel was clean and water pressure was great. Parking is valet with in and out privileges. Valet service was great. Wait time to get my car was very short (less than 5 minutes) the multiple times I needed my car.If you don't like wall air conditioners due to the noise they produce, this is not the place for you to stay. Nice large TV. View of my room facing West, is just a large high rise apartment building. Could see the canal and mountains if I went out on my balcony and looked to the right. My room was cozy, but since I was solo, that wasn't a problem. Noise level wasn't too bad. Some vehicle noise from Ala Wai Blvd. Some neighbor noise from apartment complex on West side.  A continental type breakfast was available. So if you want to get a little something before you head out, this would satisfy you need.The location is close enough to Waikiki to walk to which is great since parking is difficult to find. A little far to walk to the Ala Moana shopping center (about 1.5 miles). If you like exercising, running or walking along Ala Wai Blvd along the canal is nice. Use something like Google Maps/Earth to see the area.In closing, I would stay there again.

Pretty much impossible to get past the staff without being greeted. We booked the executive suite and it had two full bathrooms which was very nice and made it easy for my family to get ready. This place is very clean and well cared for. Breakfast is a bit on the bread side. Lots of rolls, breads, waffles and cereal. Eggs were institutional so inedible after the first day. Probably could switch to a better brand. Coffee was great and my son enjoyed the popcorn that never seems to stop. Location is easy to get to anything. Walking was nice and lots of restaurants and shops in the area. I'd say the staff and management made the difference here at the Coconut. Good solid hotel.

Although old building, the hotel lobby is clean, fresh and staff is helpful. Rooms are good and very practical. The only issue was old Aircon (working though) needs replacement. City view from balcony was just nice and relaxing. The breakfasts were great. Keep it up Coconut Waikiki Staff. It is Value for money. I will definitely recommend stay in Coconut Waikiki while in Waikiki.

Very nice lobby and staff. Front clerks are very helpful. The rooms are a bit dated yet stylish. The smallest bathroom in any hotel I have ever stayed.Very close to the shopping and walking distance to the beach.

My family and I needed a 1 night booking.Being that we had been given great service in June 2017.In agreement all family members decided to stay at Coconut Waikiki Hotel.The size of the room a spacious suite and suitable for a family of 5.The room was very tidy and clean.My family and I liked the idea of 1.5 bath.Plus pillows and mattresses were comfy.The location was excellent and close to manystores to which I enjoyed shopping.The amenities were plenty that of a swimming pool, games area, fresh popcorn and flavored water in fountains. These are just a few of many available amenities.The thing we liked best is being treated in a very friendly manner by front desk staff.The least that breakfast be available till 9:30 in the morning.The Coconut Waikiki Hotel is certainly a place of stay that I would recommend to others.

This is a wonderful boutique hotel that is tucked away from the noise and bustle of main Waikiki, but close enough to walk to. I selected the Coconut Waikiki Hotel based on other reviews and the fact they offered breakfast and do not have a resort fee (hard to find!) But I was won over by how helpful the staff were and the fun atmosphere of the hotel. For example, prior to my trip I received an email from the manager asking if I had any questions. I had a rough itinerary in my head of what I wanted to do so I shared that - Jordan replied back to my email quickly suggestions for activities, tours, and even walk-able restaurants! We ended up trying a few and were not disappointed. Overall, this is worthy of the hype!

The hotel is fantastic with its cheap price. The hotel is clean, the staff is kind, and even provides breakfast. In addition, it provides simple cookers such as microwave, dishes, spoons. Finally, there are many board games for my kuds.

Nice location a few blocks from the beach. The hotel surpassed our expectations. Breakfast had plenty of choices. Flavored cold water, coffee and tea throughout the day was a nice treat. Fresh popped popcorn was fun as well. Super sized checkers, chess and a few other outdoor games brought out our competive spirit!Our room was clean and spacious. Everything we needed was available from umbrellas to beach towels. The staff was professional and kind. Looking forward to our next visit.

The rooms were extremely clean & I can't say enough about the friendliness & helpfulness of the staff. Jessica, James, Isaac & Robert were all top notch! Fairly comprehensive breakfast bar which did not include any meat options but pretty much anything else you would want.

Great location and in easy walk to all areas. The beach is in close walking distance and the local venues are easy to walk to to grab a meal or drink. Bus routes near by so access even without a car is easy. A great place to stay, clean and comfortable and very friendly staff to aid you in any way.

Our first impression was that we had walked back into 1975. The decor was quite dated and there were a couple of things not working the way they should have. However, it was exceptionally clean, the service was excellent, and the things that needed repair (the sink stopper) were done as soon as it was reported. All the amenities were there and the room was spacious. The best was the location: a 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and all the restaurants, retail and nightlife was at our fingertips. I would return.

The location of the hotel is pretty good except for the car noises at night. Probably because we were facing the road side, so we could hear loud noises in the middle of night. However, the overall service of the hotel was very good. I really like how popcorn and drinks were provided in the afternoon. For breakfast service, maybe could extend the time from 6:00~9:30 instead of 8:30. I am thinking probably not a lot of people can wake up by the time.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. While the bathroom is on the small side and room could use an update, it was a great place to stay at a great value. Nice choice of breakfast food, clean and within a 10 minute walk to the beach. Lots of shopping and restaurants in the area as well. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful as well. Isaac was the best! Would definitely stay there again.

I loved my whole stay at this hotel. The room was great and had a balcony with a beautiful view. The staff was so nice! Everything is close by to the hotel so it’s so easy to get to where you want to go. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone stay at Waikiki. I will be coming back here when I book another trip to Hawaii.

This hotel was exactly what I needed. Great area for families, couples, or solo vacation trips. Very safe area. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Many amenities as well, made the stay very comfortable.

Small, clean rooms and one of the rare locations that include breakfast!Isaac at the front desk was so pleasant and helpful. Pool was warm. Traffic is a bit noisy but they were aware of that and left ear plugs for guests.

We just spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is a hidden gem. It is a comfortable friendly place to stay that is 2 blocks from the main tourist area. While not super fancy, they make you feel super welcome. Great value staying here.

We've looked at quite a few of the other reviews and concur with most. We're pretty fussy as we run a B and B in Cambria, Ca and an Airbnb as well. We ended up staying here after a bad experience with a condo rental nearby. They took us on short notice.It was a refuge and we were here about two weeks. FYI, book directly with the hotel and avoid the resort fee. Being a boutique hotel you really feel like people care and are not just a bunch of of pr flacks. They know what tourists need, such as beach chairs and fresh towels, and they are always available. Only a few blocks from a stunning beach and near all amenities. The one issue we have is with the breakfast, the eggs are powdered, not real, and the fruit offered is not fresh but frozen. If they would remedy these two things, the place would be hard to beat for value and consistency.

We chose to stay with the Coconut Waikiki Hotel based mostly on the value, location and amenities. Although the building is somewhat older, it’s obviously been remodeled and maintained well. We had a mountain-view room overlooking the canal and views of the mountains. It was enjoyable to sit on the balcony and take in the views. Our room was equipped with the usual small fridge, microwave, wet bar sink, Kuerig coffee maker, cups/saucers/forks/knives, etc, TV, desk, hair dryer, clothes iron, etc. Although it’s a small property, they still have an outdoor pool, dining area, sitting area with games and a nice size lobby. My only disappointments were the in-room coffee was not replenished daily (you’re given 4 Kcups upon arrival but any after that cost $2 each) I was able to find a box of Kcups at a local grocery store but even that was a little difficult to find. My other disappointment was with the complimentary continental breakfast - the choices were not changed from day to day. If you are not stay for more than a few days, it would be fine but we stayed 7 days and by the end of our week we were searching for more variety. Overall, I’m pleased with our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. It was a great choice to stay within a reason budget, centrally located (close to the beach and great shopping/activity areas) and the staff was super friendly and welcoming.

We had a great time at the Hotel Coconut. The location is perfect to visit Honolulu/Waikiki für travellers. It´s in the heard of Waikiki next to the channel. The staff is very friendly... We look forwart to our next visit to this great Hotel.

Had several email exchanges ahead of arriving to get the best for our trip and the staff that replied were always spot on. Lovely greeting message on arrival on their blackboard and room was clean with a canal view and a balcony.Good breakfast and hotel provided beach towels and beach chairs (ask at reception) for use on the beach - great extra touch.Launderette in basement and this was helpful and cost $2 in quarters only for a large machine.Would definitely return again.Tip - book direct!!

We couldn't find anything to complain about. The suite was SPACIOUS, so much so that it was too far to watch the TV from our bed (not a bad problem at all). The mini fridge, sink, and microwave was convenient. Having an extra bathroom really helped also. The staff are so nice, and theyre always available to assist. The free breakfast really helped us grab a quick bite before heading off for the day. The valet is expensive ($30/day) but we were able to find street parking at most a few blocks away. It can get a little noisy with street traffic but nothing to keep us up at night. The AC unit works, and as it is right next to the bed, really helps cool you down quickly. All in all, a GREAT value compared to the other hotels in the area. The location was perfect, just a quick 10 min walk to the tremendously busy main shopping streets of Waikiki.

The Coconut Waikiki is a boutique style hotel offering comfortable accommodation and a basic but adequate continental breakfast. Popcorn, coffee and tea are available from 15.00 to 18.00 every day. Our room had a small balcony with a superb view overlooking the canal towards the mountains. The road below is busy both day and night and can be quite noisy but this is to be expected in a large city. Ear plugs are provided by the hotel should you need them. The hotel is only a 200 yard walk from the main shopping malls, main bus routes and a wide choice of eating places. Rooms are well appointed with a small kitchen area which includes microwave and fridge. The large king size bed provides a comfortable nights sleep. We were pleasantly surprised to find a small gym offering a basic range of equipment. Staff throughout the hotel are warm and friendly and we would certainly recommend The Coconut Waikiki to potential guests.

Our room overlooked the canal and there was always something interesting to watch. The room was very clean. It had a frig and water was provided every day.It seemed to have originally been designed for 1 bed. With 2 beds, the closet and drawers were hard to access. It was very difficult to use the safe as it is in the closet. Breakfast is included and was good. It is the same every day. Popcorn and munchies are provided in the afternoon and there is coffee/tea/flavoured water available all day..There are many restaurants in the area. Isaac, at the front desk was very helpful. We made no use of beach towels etc.so the fee was a rip-off.

We stayed two nights--one night each at the beginning and end of a cruise around the islands. The rooms and amenities were very nice, and the staff was very attentive and friendly. Welcome to the aloha attitude!

The staff is Very friendly :) breakfast included and is very good !Room has own kitchen! So convenient ! Location is very good excellent toursValet parking .very close to the beach towels and beach chairs are provided .

Stayed1 day, before we went home. Everyone very nice! Hotel very clean! Was able to check in early. Great place to stay, everything is in walking distance, nice restaurants, shops and nice walk to the beach!!!!

Very clean hotel style room, very comfortable & close walk to Waikiki beach. We only stayed 1 night between arriving in HNL & cruising, so was perfect for our family of four overnight. The staff were extremely helpful & friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Smaller Hotel with all of the amenities and a courteous staff within walking distance of the beach. Clean smaller room with limited Kitchen area. Bed was comfortable, nice flat screen TV, and free breakfast daily. We really enjoyed being away from the crowds and in this Hotel, across the street from the canal for easy access to walking or jogging.
user_name:
Annette T
Twin Falls, Idaho, United States

review_body: For the price, this was a good deal. Parking is a challenge - either on street or pay for valet. The rooms are a little outdated, but comfortable. Outside was noisy, but they did provide a couple of packages of ear plugs by the bed. Breakfast was average, nothing to write home about. It was nice to be able to walk or take a rented bike over to the beach and the night spots along Waikiki. I don't think I will stay here again, but I am picky about my hotel rooms.

Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a week. As most hotels in Waikiki, it is a little dated in terms of interior, but you aren't spending most of your holiday in your room anyway. Location is great, as you are not too far from the main strip, and you are only a couple blocks away from the beach front. What this place does, it does well. From top to bottom, the staff on site is excellent! Would definitely stay here again.

Hotel was very nice for the price. Rooms had an extra sink and small bar area with a refrig, microwave, coffee maker, coffee and small table. Very comfortable new bed with nice pillows. Excellent helpful staff, included breakfast was okay not great but always had ice water and popcorn available. My only complaint was our room faced the street and was loud traffic noise, we ran the fan on the air conditioner to drown out the noise. Hotel was within walking distance of Waikiki Beach, shopping, etc.

We stayed here for one night on late night layover from Oahu to the Big Island. The hotel is a short trip from the airport and is located right next to a canal with a walking path -- great place for a morning walk or jog. The hotel is pretty basic, but everything was very clean, beds were good, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. We needed to get something printed out and they spent a long time helping us do this using their computer -- all with a smile. There is a nice breakfast in the morning as well. Would stay here again.

We come to waikiki often, we were just here in November also, and we always spend my birthday here. Well this year was a very special and I won't soon forget. Issac, Jessica, Mike and all staff, you rock!!!

Coconut Waikiki is a welcoming, comfortable hotel that provides great value for the price. Staff are extraordinarily helpful and friendly. The reception area is comfortable and bright; with board games, flavored water and free popcorn in the afternoons. The pool is small but functional. The location is superb - close to the Waikiki action but a couple blocks away from the worst of the chaos. My room was large, light and comfortable, with a balcony overlooking the canal and the mountains.Downsides: outdated air conditioner and lots of traffic noise.

The location is good. It is near the Waikiki Trolley's main station if you are keen on using them. But I would not recommend it if it is winter time as it gets windy and cold when you are on the open road. I suppose it is different in the summer. The hotel is not near the edge of the ocean but we knew that. The hotel is clean with the exception of a little bit of mold in the shower which should be an easy fix if they want to use some bleach or chemical to it. The breakfast was OK and the free pop corn in the afternoon is a nice touch. The wifi was fine. It is interesting that they provided disposable ear plugs on the night table but we did not need them. The air conditioning is on the loud side and if they switch to a new unit, that would be wonderful. They provided 4 pillows which is good as you can certainly use them when you want to watch the flat screen TV in bed. The bed is fine but the rest of the furniture are on the old side. This was our first time in Honolulu and I would stay here again. The ABC store is a short walk. If you use the regular bus, it is only a block away.

We had the penthouse for a week over Christmas and New Years. Unfortunately during the rain storm our entire unit leaked a large amount of water, so much so that the paint began to bubble on the walls.We had difficulties getting our room serviced and the internal phone did not work and was never repaired. The kitchen and reception staff were lovely as always.

Clean and efficient with everything you could need. Breakfast was a bonus and the staff are very knowledgeable about the local area and how to get around. Great placement and awesome views of the mountains. Close to all conveniences but out of the hustle and bustle. Great for families or couples. Bonus surprise for my husbands' birthday. You guys rock.

First of all, if you're looking for a quiet place to sleep, this is not the place. We were "upgraded" to the mountain view side, which was nice, but the traffic noise was hurrendous! On top of that, the original air conditioning unit installed when the hotel was built years ago was super loud, you needed to sleep with earplugs. The Ikea quality of furniture is beat up and shows much wear. However, the bed and pillows are very comfortable. As far as the breakfast included with your stay, save yourself the hassle and disappointment and go to the Hilton Hotel down the street for the all you can eat breakfast buffet for $12 with made to order omelettes. The few times we needed the staff, they were helpful and friendly. The location is close to shopping, the beach and lots of great restaurants. Overall, this hotel has potential, but it could use some TLC and a few more upgrades.

Excellent service prior to our arrival (thank you Donovan) and surpassed during our stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our time including the delicious popcorn daily treat, lounging by the pool and playing chess. Our suite was more than accommodating for our needs - perfect for our family of 4. We found the hotel was a perfect location to the beach, canal, shops, and restaurants. We were able to store our luggage prior to our check in and after - much appreciated. We highly recommend Coconut Waikiki -I wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting the area!

Beautiful location, about 10 minutes walk to the beach. On the way to the beach, you will pass a nice little shopping strip, Waikiki Beach Walk. The hotel itself is clean, bright and spacious, albeit a bit on the tired side. The complimentary popcorn was a beautiful touch, and I love the infused water choices they have alongside the complimentary coffee and tea. Breakfast was a good variety of continental fare (scrambled eggs, waffle, yogurt, granola and other cereals…)The room was spacious with a balcony, although the bathroom was a bit small but functional. I love that the 4 complimentary Keurig k-cups (tea and coffee choices).

We had a nice stay in Coconut. Every day a good breakfast. Friendly staff. Near the center of Waikiki, a few minutes walk. The last day we could leave the car and our suitcases in the hotel, so we had also a good last day.

Pretty boutique hotel in very good location, near the most popular Waikiki’s Road and easy to reach. The staff is very friendly, ready to meet your needs with a smile. Rooms clean and confortable. Good breakfast and excellent value for money.

We stayed over the Christmas holidays and a little ways past New Year’s. This is my third stay at the coconut and I’m hoping to stay there again next year. This hotel is quiet and a little up out-of-the-way. We had a lovely view over the Alawai

A lovely hotel filled with warm and welcoming staff who go the extra mile to cater for your needs. The added extras in our room like fresh rose petals, wine and nuts were so thoughtful. Our room was so comfortable and spacious with beautiful views of the mountains and canal. Breakfast was great and only a 10 minute walk to the beach and shops/bars. Hope to come again soon!

A good hotel with clean nice rooms and a good breakfast. Service was friendly and the overall price for a good location in Waikiki is reasonable. I gave it only 4 stars because, the breakfast although good was a rush, with everybody clambering over each other to get their items in a short time. Breakfast should be lengthened by 1 hour to 930am to make this a pleasant experience.

Sometimes 5 isn't the right number of stars. I wanted to pick 3.5, but you can't. The Coconut Waikiki worked fine for us. It's a pleasant place, in a nice location, and the staff is friendly. We didn't avail ourselves of the continental breakfast, but it looked ok, if you're happy with cereal or a bagel and coffee. I would dock the 1.5 stars on the following grounds: They give you 4 starter Keurig cups (none of which were actually just medium roast coffee...we had a decaf, a dark roast, a creamy vanilla thing, and a green tea.) After that, you pay $2 a pop, so we just bought a box at Long Drug. Seems a little chintzy not to supply 2 coffees/day. Also, the light switch in the bathroom worked 20% of the times you pressed it, due to an improperly secured electrical box. The sink faucet was loose and wiggly. All of that stuff is live-withable, so no big deal.

We recently stayed at the Coconut Waikiki hotel over the holidays (family of 3) before and after our cruise. The hotel is located conveniently as it is walking distance to Waikiki beach, the main streets, and local bus stops. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, they were very kind to us and went out of their way to help us. There is continental breakfast in the morning and complimentary beverage and activities in the lobby all day which was difficult to find in Waikiki. There is also a pool, fitness room and the hotel is fully equipped with WiFi in both rooms and the lobby. The view from the 6th floor was breathtaking. Overall this was a great experience for my family and I, we will be returning and recommend this hotel to others as well.

Nice & clean hotel, friendly staff & walking distance to everything.Definitely recommend. Front desk staff helped with tours and with public transportation.Breakfast was good not overrating it but at least it was convenient.

We stayed at this hotel before we went on a cruise. The location is great, right down the road from shopping and food services. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Thank you so much to the staff for making our first trip to Hawaii pleasant!

We stayed at 6 floor front the street. The room is still noisy because the window didn’t avoid any sound.When we intent to ask for another room, the staff is a little impatient to say the no room is avaible. He didn’t try to provide any solution. We are dissappointed.The staff on the day we checked out is nice. However, this stay didn’t meet out expectation.

I met our son in Waikiki to join him on the USS Nimitz and travel to San Diego. I needed a room for one night only and found this Hotel. This was my first visit ever to Oahu and I am very happy that I stayed here. I had checked out reviews here and trust my fellow reviewers, good call. Nice location and a great room. I'd be very happy to come back here and spend a few days.  The front desk people were extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who likes a clean, comfortable room at a reasonable price.

Lots of street noise: not the hotel's fault but it does hurt sleep quality. Room not ready: our suite wasn't ready at check-in time (or even 90 minutes later) and the fellow at reception didn't seem to regard that as a priority. We had just 28 hours to spend in Waikiki and had paid for two nights so we could have a room for the night and use the room until 7:30 pm the next evening when we left for the airport. We wanted to unpack, change our clothes and go out exploring and we lost almost two precious hours of daylight. A second disappointment was the lack of fruit at breakfast (runs from 6:30-8:30, we got there by 7:15). Other than the coffee, it is the only thing we would have eaten and since fruit appears in hotel photos of the breakfast we expected it to be there.The room was clean, space was good, furnishing was comfortable. Great to have a half bath in the suite (in addition to full bath) and a fridge and microwave. This is a convenient location for a stay in Waikiki and I would consider staying there again.

without doubt one of the best hotels i and my family have been on. The people working there were very helpful, the rooms were great and great breakfast (tho wished there was cheese ;)) anyway, hopefully we can come back one day. ALOHA :D

Had hesitated on writing a review as all the others reviewers had addressed my own experience. I would like to add that my very favorite experience of the coconut waikiki was that it was a well deserved reprieve, an escape from the total craziness of beach and shop areas...just a quick stroll to this crowded, hectic, tourist filled mayhem if one needs, but always a welcome "bit of home" to return to at the coconut waikiki. A restoration of the spirit!

nice hotel at convenient location, close to everything! walking distance to shops, restaurants & local attractions! professional & friendly staff willing to help & provide information when needed.nice city view from the room balcony!

I had booked trip months ahead hoping for at least a partial view of canal/mts but was given a room facing back into apts with junk on lanais. Not a pleasant view. Requested different room but told none available for my stay of 6 nights. Have stayed a number of times at this hotel but probably not again to get this inferior room. Staff is very nice.

Good location and excellent service. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My daughter needed to print her homework sheets and all she needed to do was just emailing an attachment to them. They also helped me print boarding passes. Breakfast is not as good as anticipated. I rate it as 4.5 round up to 5.

A very clean and up-beat Hotel. Located on a side street on the Ala Wai canal. Rooms nicely decorated and very clean. They have a very good Continental Breakfast, never go hungry. Staff is very friendly and lots of fun to talk to, nice local people.

We could not have been happier with our choice of places to stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and the location was very good. Breakfast buffet was a plus. Didn't use the pool or workout rooms, but they looked well-kept.

We only stayed for a night but this place was perfect. The rooms were nice and clean with a balcony and good view of the mountains. The pool area was clean and had lots of fun giant games like jenga, chess, checkers, and connect four. They give you free popcorn in the afternoon. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to the beach. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs which is super convenient! The staff at the front desk are so nice and accommodating! If you call directly to book, they give you a discount on your stay and waive the resort fee. This hotel is an amazing deal! Highly recommend!

The hotel is situated close to bus lines and a couple of blocks away from Waikiki beach and Kalakaua Avenue, the main shopping strip. It is next to a canal with a lovely walkway - great for morning walks! The view from our room was stunning. It was noisy at night so the ear plugs were helpful, or you could use the A/C to drown out the noise from outside. Staff are friendly and knowledgable. There is a pool and a small gym in this hotel, neither of which we used during our stay.The breakfast was decent, however it would have been better if there were more dairy-free options, or vegan options. Perhaps if dietary restrictions are mentioned at booking the hotel could accommodate them. The housekeeping was subpar in my opinion. I don't believe the bedsheets were changed often or the bathroom cleaned thoroughly, however I'm sure the hotel would have addressed these issues if raised.

This hotel was a great find on my first visit to Oahu. The room and amenities were very clean and service was excellent. It's truly service with a smile any time of the day; from the valet, the front office, to the maids everyone was super helpful and friendly. We stayed for 5 nights and the service was never wavering during the whole period. The room was equipped with everything we needed and the hotel even supplied free earplugs should guests be bothered by the traffic. We did not need to resort to using them, but if you are a super-light sleeper you may. Getting a hotel that offers valet parking is definitely a plus, even though you pay $ for the service. Another plus is the free breakfast. It is buffet style, but includes waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, and a selection of bakery items as well as scrambled eggs every day. You can sit in the dining room on two long tables sharing with other guests, or retreat to the privacy of the patio. The atmosphere is casual, and we ate breakfast here every day. If you want more variety or meat for breakfast, there are a number of restaurants in walking distance. I never felt unsafe, even walking from Waikiki beach to the hotel once it was dark, but I would advice to use common sense, especially when traveling on your own. While the hotel is away from the main drag of Waikiki beach, many of the tour companies have stops around this area of Waikiki and will pick up passengers by request. There's a bus stop at the end of the block which was very useful in getting to Honolulu sites. The front office staff is very knowledgeable on bus routes. Just ask.

I ended up cancelling my reservations at the Hilton and nabbed a sweet deal with the Coconut Waikiki Hotel last minute (2 weeks prior to be exact). I stayed with my Mom and kiddo for 11 nights. I was a little worried I might regret the last minute switch but now I am so glad I cancelled my reservations at the Hilton. The staff at Coconut Waikiki were very pleasant and helpful, by far the best I've encountered in any hotel. Both the hotel and my room were clean, and comfortable. The room was the standard room with 2 full size beds, I did like that it had the Keurig, fridge, and microwave. The lobby was decorated nicely for Christmas, which was a nice touch considering we weren't home for a majority of December. The breakfast is typical of most hotels, although another protein source would've been nice. They do offer powdered eggs every morning, yogurt and fruit, with an abundance of carbs: cereals, oatmeal, croissants, bread, and a waffle station. I'm not complaining because most hotels in the area I was looking at didn't even include a breakfast. Every afternoon in the lobby they make fresh buttered popcorn with toppings, they have at least 4 different flavored waters (1 was tea) to choose from. This was a nice treat, especially when you need a snack to hold you over till dinner timeYou are 3 blocks from the beach, less than two from some great shopping and restaurants, but biggest benefit is you are a little out of the way of the crowds and traffic. I did stay on the tenth floor and with the AC on I didn't have any traffic noise wake me up (they do have ear plugs in the room). This leads me to another point, the bed and pillows were very comfortable! I may be 34 years old but with 2 herniated discs and some arthritis in my lower back, I always worry about how well I'm going to sleep, I'm happy to say I did not wake up to roll over 7x.They have a small laundromat downstairs which was another great commodity, especially for a 10 day trip! It costs $5 per load (wash and dry), they will happily exchange your cash for quarters at the front desk. I packed a few laundry pods to have on hand, glad I did! The valet parking is very convenient, I'm not the type who likes to depend on public transportation or stressing over finding a parking space. So the $30 a night was worth it to me. As mentioned before, we were walking distance to just about everything which was great because if you like some great craft beer or cocktails, you are walking distance from the Yard House and the Maui Brewing Company! This was nice when my clean and comfortable room started to feel too small with both my Mom and kiddo in it ;) I only drove the car to visit my friends on Hickam AFB or go sight seeing. The location was perfect in my mind. Thank you for making my stay positively memorable while visiting friends and family! Any future trips to Hawaii I'll be booking here again, as well as highly recommending you to my friends and family who may bet travelling to the island. Mahalo

Hotel was very clean, our room looked practically new. Service was very friendly and helpful. Located a few blocks from city bus lines on Kalakaua Ave. which has a lot of shopping and restaurants. We were on the fourth floor facing a major noisy road, but with the A/C on we heard very little. Would definitely stay here again next time. They have an outdoor pool and fitness center.

Coconut Waikiki is everything you could want in a hotel. The hotel was clean, and exactly what the pictures look like. The flavored waters and popcorn in the afternoon were a great treat between adventures. The only time you knew there were other guests were when you’d see them coming or going, we never heard anyone when we were in our room! So nice!! What’s more important than all of the above was how wonderful the staff was, always willing to help, always sweet and treated you like you were the most important thing going on in the moment! I will recommend Coconut Waikiki to all of my friends traveling to Honolulu! Best place we’ve ever stayed!

We stayed in two rooms - one with the side view and one facing the river/canal. The one facing the canal was awesome with the mountain view and the morning mist. Hotel was nice and clean. Kids enjoyed the free popcorn. Pickup sites for the Go Oahu card tours were close-by. We enjoyed our stay here.

I really enjoyed staying with you.Room and services were perfect.I really would like to back to you next time in Hawaii. The size of hotel are perfect as well(10 rooms at one each floor).I also like interior in the room. I felt like stay house not hotel. It was so comfortable be there.I really recommend your hotel for all my friends.

This was our first time to the island. I noticed good reviews while researching the property and it was rated at a decent price. When we arrived at the hotel we were promptly greeted by staff. The staff were the best part of the hotel. Everyone was polite, friendly, and informative. Our room was clean, but the bathroom is in significant need of an upgrade. Our shower was rather gross. There are also some hidden fees that make the hotel not so decently priced. I paid in full ahead of time, but found out upon arrival that there is no parking at the property. The only option was valet which was $30 a day. On top of that they tacked on a daily resort fee when I arrived. This hotel is definitely not a resort and lacks the amenities that other nearby hotels offer for slightly more. The location was great. Only 10 minutes walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Overall we had a pleasant stay. It was just a little annoying to have hidden fees and no parking available (which isn’t advertised on the website).

The staff at the Cocunut Waikiki were extremely helpful. The room was extremely clean and the break was excellent. Although not directly on the beach, I would go there again. Very close to public transportation. We were even given a room upgrade with a great view and king size bed.

This hotel is great value for money! The staff were so friendly and welcoming and surprised us with a gift for our honeymoon. Easy walk to the beach and hotel is nice and quiet away from the main streets. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting Waikiki.

We were pleased with the cleanliness of the property and the relaxing atmosphere in the lounge with the Christmas decorations.Breakfast met all our needs and was a great start to our day.The staff were very friendly and accommodated all our requests.We would have preferred to stay on the canal side but no rooms were available during our stay.

While the hotel may not be on the beach directly the large room, breakfast options and desk help (Jessica!!) make it worth the short walk to the shore. The hotel has beach chairs, towels and small sun umbrellas to make your time on the beach more comfortable.

The room is very spacious and comes with a small kitchen top with microwave.There is a long bath in the bathroom and our kids love it.The complimentary breakfast is simple and nice. Our kids enjoy making their own pan cakes.There is a small outdoor swimming pool and a gym room.The staffs are very friendly and welcoming.Overall, it is a very pleasant stay and we will come back if we return to Honolulu in our next trip.

very nice and clean place to stay. convinience to beach, shopping and restaurant. very close to all highways.close to all sightseing places to. highly recomend this place to anyone looking for clean place to stay.

Had a 3 night stay before heading up to the north shore. After a sleepless overnight flight we were delighted to find out our room was ready on arrival. Jessica on the front desk was helpful & efficient getting us into our room & into some much needed sleep. We stayed in a mountain view king which had an amazing view over the canal and out to the mountains. The Lanai was a great spot to enjoy an afternoon drink and the view.We did find the traffic noise a bit of a distraction but not overbearing and earplugs were provided for lighter sleepers.Breakfast was sufficient but perhaps a little variety would be good.Overall a good stay & would happily return.

Great hotel, great amenities, and great location. The only issue was a noisy room that didn't allow for late sleeping once the traffic outside picked up. But overall a terrific hotel and one I would recommend.

We arrived early in the morning and the staff went out of their way to prepare a room for us. This boutique hotel has fantastic service and very friendly staff. We particularly liked being a short walk from the beach, so there was less tourist activity. The hotel provides a great value for being on Waikiki Beach.

Very friendly people. Great service. Very clean, both rooms and lobby area. The hotel is a boutique hotel. It is a bit dated in it's style, but adds to the charm. Parking can be a problem if you don't valet, which costs $. The price verses other places is very good. It's not right down by the beach, but within a 10 minute walk. Shops and restaurants are 3-10 minute walk. The only draw back at all for us and our friends was the air conditioning struggled to cool the room.

Clean hotel noisy on Sunday nite we were on the cannal side Not so noisy on Monday nite nice staff worked for our needs good value for our purposeWould recommend for short stay Room nice but noisy hard to sleep with traffic noise

Staff were very friendly and accommodating- hotel is in a great location in Waikiki to shopping dining and nightlife. It is a great value for the price. I will be staying here again on my next trip to hawaii

Centrally located hotel that offers a lot of value for the your money Staff are super great, very friendly and very helpfulHotel is clean and has many free add ons so ask staff about themIt's in a quieter part of the tourist section of town next to the canal

We lucked out with street parking, saving us $25-$35 for the night. Our flight got us to the hotel about midnight. Desk clerk helpful in assuring street was fine until 7 a.m., he was going to let us park for free the next day during the daytime. Our room was a good size, our view beyond the next door apartments was the Ala Wai canal, and the morning drizzles were followed with a lovely rainbow in the distance. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise, cereal, toast, coffee, etc.Morning clerk did not honor the free day parking that the night shift offered, we had planned to explore the area, but with no parking we ate quickly, packed up and left(less than 10 hour stay in total). Day shift DID let us leave our car a short time.Convenient location, nice staff, medium breakfast, parking difficult or pricey, FREE WIFI, room and mini fridge etc. good, would stay here again :O)

The boutique hotel is so great. I checked in pretty late in the evening and they upgraded me to a suite. The room is huge and clean. There are nice tea 24/7. The hotel is also conveniently located, with 10 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach and 5 minutes walk to the main shopping street.

Stayed at Coconut Waikiki Hotel from Nov 28th - Dec 6th 2018. We had a late flight, so we didnt get to check in til 11pm. Note doors are locked after 11pm so we had to wait for the receptionist to come back to the desk to let us in. But once she did, she went over details with us. For the cost per night it was totally worth it. Room was a King, but they upgraded us to City View. We mostly chose this hotel for price, location and Kitchenette. We have a 23 month old son, so Kitchenette was key for Milk. Our room had everything we needed, coffee maker, microwave, small fridge, sink and cutlery. No complaints with room.Facilities were great - we didn't use the pool but it was heated. The best feature for us was the sandbox outside - for quick trips for our son to play in. He also enjoyed the oversized boardgames in the back as well. We also enjoyed the complimentary all you can eat breakfast daily. You had options of eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, fresh waffles, cereal, toast and more. Also a key bonus was the hotel had drinks and popcorn after 2pm to help yourself too.Front desk staff was super friendly and helpful. Hotel had chairs, beach towels, umbrellas and sand toys for you to borrow.Location - was about a 10 minute walk to the beach, 5 minutes to bus stop and 10 minutes to shopping plaza.Would definitely stay in this hotel again!

The whole staff was very friendly and always smiling and ready to help. Accommodations were very nice! The rooms were very clean and the view was amazing. Located so close to so many shops and great restaurants. The beach was only a few blocks away. We liked the quaintness of the hotel and felt like we were their special guests. We would recommend the Coconut Waikiki Hotel to anyone!

we stayed at the coconut hotel waikiki for six nights in november and i have to say it was great the staff were very friendly and helpful expecially jessica and issac the room was great clean and could not fault it would gladly reccomend the hotel to anyone and would stay here again

A very nice hotel in short walking distance of Waikiki beach. Near all the shops and restaurants.They a very nice breakfast and free tea and coffee all day.Very nice staff, valet parking and swimming pool.The only thing was that you could here the traffic in the morning.

Great location and great staff. Enjoyed the included breakfast and overall hospitality. Walking distance to many places in Waikiki. Rooms were small but sufficient. Will always check this hotel whenever I am planning on visiting Waikiki

All of the personnel were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel is kept quite clean throughout, including the guest rooms. We stayed for three days and nights and our room was cleaned well each day. The bathroom was very nice and everything worked properly. My only problem was with the bed; it was much too firm for me. I didn't mention it to management, but should have. We'll come back again.

Everything was perfect. We really liked the room and services. Everything was clean. All staff were really professional and helpful. (The only thing that I can say was not perfect, was breakfast. It was good enough but it could be better)

Of all of my travels throughout, have never been so pleased. Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Perfect location also. I would have paid four times their rate just to stay here, but the rate was extremely reasonable as well.

This hotel is one of the better boutique hotels in the area. No pretensions, just what you see is what you get. So very friendly, clean and amazing staff. Could not have asked for a better location or room!

I normally do not do reviews but had to for this hotel.After stressing online over the choices of hotels, I finally picked the Coconut Waikiki Hotel.BEST DECISSION EVER!This hotel is within walking distance to restaurants, shopping and the beach. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We booked the city view with two double beds room. The view from our balcony was amazing, it also included the mountains. Rates for the rooms very reasonable too.If or when we return to Hawaii, we WILL be staying here again!!

We stayed here the first two nights we were in Hawaii and were very pleased. Nice clean large suite and it was nice to be a little away from the main part of Wakiki. Easy walking distance to the restaurants and shops. The staff was very nice.

We were very happy with this hotel, great service, great room, great continental breakfast, walking distance from many resteraunts and stores, valet had our car ready by the time we were at the front counter, we will gladly stay here again

My friend and I loved the Coconut Waikiki. The location for us, was perfect; away from the hustle and bustle of the main street but central to everywhere we wanted to go. The value is fantastic, breakfast daily, the pool, gym, games and common areas in the lobby were all wonderful and the hurricane popcorn and beverages available daily in the lobby were something that set it apart! Our room was clean and a good size, my only complaint was that for me, the pillows were not comfortable, so I removed them. They also had beach towels available for guests to use! I really enjoyed my stay and when I return to Waikiki, I'll be staying at the Coconut!

I planned on staying for one night but due to some complications, I was unable to. The staff was very nice even though I cancelled the day of the reservation. It was very easy to make a reservation and it was easy to cancel. I did both the same day! Even though I didn't stay there, the staff was very kind and I would recommend looking into this hotel.

This is our second visit to this hotel. We stayed here last year and when we knew we were travelling to Hawaii again we had no hesitation in re booking at the Coconut Waikiki. Wonderful staff, great facilities, close to everything . No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

We just wanted couple of days to unwind from a busy 5 week tour before heading home. The hotel was perfect - lovely helpful staff great location close to shops and restaurants and a short walk to the beach. The upgrade and wine was awesome.Thankyou

Free upgrade to a roomy suite with 2 small balconies was nice. Warm and welcoming staff especially Isaac who greeted us and a young man who brought our bags up - maybe named Robert. Really genuine smile. Lovely view to the mountains and overlooking parkland and water. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Very good internet. American style continental breakfast was included. Not in the frantic busy part of town but easy to find on a main street in easy walking distance of everything we wanted (we didn't have a car). Highly recommend it for comfort and warm ambiance.

Sue and I were married at Ft. De Russy chapel 11/18/1967 and have stayed at the Coconut Waikiki several times since then. On this occasion, Issac asked about our reason for coming and when we told him we were returning guests and celebrating 50 years of marriage, he immediately upgraded us to a 2 bed room with a mountain view and it was perfect. Also, when we arrived the Marquee in the lobby read Happy 50th Wedding Anniversary George and Sue, and in our room was a special bottle of wine and chocolates and a card congratulating us on our occasion. We loved our room and all the friends we made at the hotel. We can't thank them more for making our stay so special

We got this room on sale and it was well worth the price. The free breakfast was amazing, small but had lots of options and was delicious and fresh (makes a huge difference having free breakfast each morning). Staff was friendly and nice. It was a 10 minute walk to the beach but its a nice very easy walk downtown, the staff will provide beach towels, chairs and umbrella if needed. Everything was great, we enjoyed our time. The only reason we are not giving 5 stars is because the rooms are a bit run down but they are clean and no bugs, we are not picky especially with the great price we got.

Great service at this hotel. The front desk staff were all exceptional, knowledgeable, and super helpful. They helped saved what was a very rocky start to the trip and made it awesome by the end. Thanks for being so great!

This sweet boutique Hotel is in an excellent location! Many nice shops on the way to the beach! Lovely staff! Breakfast was yummy! Would go back in a flash! Easy location for my friends to come and collect me. View is super from 10th floor! Nice trade winds blowing!
user_name:
Kathleen N
San Juan Island, Washington

review_body: We have stayed in this hotel several times already and returning there is always like a homecoming for us. It is located conveniently close to the beach, restaurants and shopping but far enough from the noisy party zone. There are less than 100 rooms I believe, so the place is mostly quiet and calm. Only during breakfast times it can get a little busy in the lobby area. The rooms are rather small but they all have lanais. It is worth it to pay a little extra for a mountain view room facing the Alawai Canal. The hotel staff is very friendly and welcoming and represent the true Hawaiien spirit to us. We will surely come back on our next trip to the Islands. Mahalo

My family enjoyed our stay here at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel so much we started planning our trip back before we even left! Isaac and the rest of the staff were amazing and extremely welcoming as my daughter, wife, and I entered the lobby area. We were met with warm smiles and details of our stay (all the amenities!) were explained immediately. Recently renovated, the ambience was very relaxing and the main lobby was always a delight to walk through as we came and went. Our room was super clean awaiting our arrival! We had an anniversary earlier in the week and, to our surprise, a few items were left for us for the special occasion!Again, the staff was amazing, very helpful, and answered all of our questions. So much value for all we had to pay, we will definitely be back. Thanks again CWH, Isaac and staff! Book it NOW!

Good place. Easy to visit Honolulu Waikiki and to access by car. Difficult to park with car in the street. Vallet parking expensive.Good rooms. Good beds. But noisy from the cars in the street. Good service. Breakfast ok.

The address for this hotel is listed on Lewers Street, but the entrance to the valet parking is on the cross street called Ali Wai Blvd. Valet is $30/day, there is no self parking garage.We arrived at 11am but check in wasn't until 3pm. The hotel allowed us to valet our car right then anyway, and they also checked in and held onto our luggage for us. We thought this was awesome because we didnt have to worry about moving our car every 2 hours to avoid a parking ticket. It was great to have the majority of our luggage checked in and safe so we could take our back packs with out towel and swim suits to spend the day on the beach. Easy walk to the beach and back to the hotel.When we checked in, another couple was being helped. That couple had booked with a discount that is only meant for the locals. The hotel managememt allowed them to check in and keep their discounted rate even though they weren't Hawaii residents. I thought that was kind of amazing of management.Our check in was very easy. While my boyfriend talked to them I followed my nose to the free popcorn bar. Every afternoon this hotel hosts a free popcorn bar. It was excellent too.Our room was clean and plenty big. This hotel isn't fancy. It's a smaller hotel on the canal side of Waikiki which really helps at night when you want to sleep because there is less tourist noise from the streets. Our air conditioner worked great and we loved the water pressure in the shower. We stayed in room 505 and had an amazing balcony overlooking the canal. We loved spending time on it during the sunrise and after dark.There is a small pool on site with a lot of lounge chairs and tables. They also have a family area by the pool with giant games to play. I spent time in the pool and it was relaxing.This is a hotel for those who want to feel safe, have quiet at night to sleep, have good air conditioning, a comfortable room, and don't need 5 stars. We felt the money we paid for the value was perfect.The only true complaint I have is about their tv system. It wasn't great.Because this is a boutique hotel, the employees remembered us and were very kind and engaging to us. We appreciated how great they were to us and how welcoming.We recommend this hotel.

We went to Oahu back in March-April, enjoyed our visit and our stay at the Coconut Waikiki that we decided to go back to the island and stay at the Coconut Waikiki again. I cannot emphasize how great the service is here each time. The mountain view from our room is one of the things I miss about this place.Shout out to Isaac for helping us book our stay the second time around. Also, Donovan and Jessica for always answering our questions and greeting us each time. They are professional, but also so laid back that at times, it felt like we were at home. Laundry service is provided in the hotel--we were about to go to a laundry mat along Kuhio until Isaac stopped us haha. Thanks for that!In short, great stay, great staff. Free breakfast 6:30-8:30am, free hurricane popcorn daily, and the flavoured waters! I miss it so much

The hotel was nice enough. We stayed here 2 nights. I don't care for wall unit air conditioners as the air usually blows directly on me and I get sick so I didn't like this about the hotel. Otherwise, it was a nice hotel. The free breakfast was pretty good. It was a close enough walk to the beach and they offered beach towels and a beach chair to take.
user_name:
tilis1011
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff is so friendly and helpful. The location is good and the price very reasonable. The room was clean and the beds really comfortable. Room comes with fridge and microwave. The hotel is older and room air conditioner was not as efficient as central air. Mountain views are worth the extra money. And higher floor rooms provide a better view and quieter accommodations however we like the convenience of low floor and are used to city traffic noise.

We stayed for 8 days. We booked from their website directly and got an advance purchase discount of 25% and waived the resort fee for booking. This was my first time in Hawaii and my birthday, so on arrival Jessica wrote a lovely BD card with chocolate for me and she let us check in at 8:30 am. We had a little problem that we couldn't lock the balcony door but soon Jessica sent maintenace staff to fix it promply. Jessica and all othrer receptonists helped with all our requests.The view from room was wonderful as we could see both the canal and a beautiful mountan and night view.The room was very clean, comfortable and the little kitchen with sink was useful. Double bed was very comfortable too.  Breakfast was nice and my mum realy liked the popcorn service every day between 2pm to 6pm.It is located within walking distance of the beach, main street and the bus stop.We realy enjoyed staying in this hotel and had a wonderful time with the staff.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming. We particularly liked the email that we got a few days before our booking saying how much they were looking forward to our visit and whether we had any particular requests.They followed through with this service when we arrived and called us by name every time we passed the reception.

Very nice hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean and comfortable. Convenient location, to restaurants, beaches, bus. Only slight complaint is street noise with the mauka side rooms.We would definitely return.

We were greeted by an extremely lovely and friendly hotel receptionist after a nasty journey from the airport. She was very helpful and even upgraded our room to a suite which completely made up our time in Honolulu. We were only there for a few nights and we were gutted we didn’t book longer. Ear plugs were provided for a busy street down below as well as a little kitchenette, two bathrooms, comfortable sofa and great aircon. Everything was up to date, modern and clean. An insightful ten - fifteen minute walk for Waikiki beach and a lovely view of the canal. The walk to the beach is so easy and well instructed by reception staff. They helped us contact our airport transport and supplied us with beach towels free of charge. We have been recommending this hotel to everyone we know and will be always. If we ever come back (we are hoping we do) Coconut Waikiki will be our first port of call! Thanks guys!!

The room was a cute boutique style. We were given a room facing a busy street but ear plugs were provided. It was still hard to fall asleep with the constant traffic. This is about a 10 min walk to the Waikiki area. Continental breakfast was good and valet was always super quick. It provided us with convenience. My only other complaint was that the bed was hard as a rock.

Quite a bit for your money (booked on-line at 40% discount) and includes breakfast. Need some updates to the windows as they don't block outside noise. Staff was great, provided chairs and items for the beach and were always willing to help.Good value for the price.

Very nice staff. I really liked that Jessica(front desk worker) texted me prior to arriving in Honolulu. The room was a king room with the mountain view. The air conditioner worked great. the cleaning staff respected the do not disturb sign on the door. The continental breakfast was good. The late afternoon popcorn snack was appreciated. The hotel is located just a quick walk from the main strip of shopping. The trolley to go to Ala Moana mall is just at the end of the block. I really enjoyed my stay here and if I ever do come back to this island I will be staying here. What a great hotel

Just a quick trip into town for business. Not a bad little botique property especially for the money. Resort fee of 25 a little pricey since there are no real resort like amenities. Staff was professional and room appeared fairly clean if you did not look to closely. Proximity to everything in waikiki is awesome and probably the best thing about this hotel.

Personalized service. Staff very friendly and helpful. A board in the lobby that welcomes the arrival of daily guests, anniversary and birthday greetings. Cozy hotel that is a few blocks from beach and Main Street. 24/7 coffee, tea and flavoured water in lobby. Daily popcorn available in lobby in afternoon. Rooms are very clean.
