Continental breakfast is good enough. Only minor problem is the noise on street during the night ( motorcycles revving).

The staff at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel were great. They upgraded our room to an executive king (very large room with 1.5 bathrooms, mini kitchenette - microwave sink and mini fridge), couch and two balconies. They were helpful when we checked out but kept (and later returned) beach towels and chairs in the afternoon and even provided me a stamp to mail a postcard from their own reserves. The valet hustled and had our car waiting for us when we got down from our room. Our room was clean and the bed quite comfortable. The breakfast was nice as well as the popcorn and refreshing waters. Overall great value and experience with a great team.We did not use the pool. It is small but adjacent to outdoor facilities that look great for families. I think most people go to the beach though!Although valet parking is the only option and is $30/day with in and out privileges, if you're lucky you may find parking on the one-way main road the hotel is on. We were able to get that one day and opted for the valet the other day.

My wife and I recently spent a week at the Coconut Waikiki after booking direct using the hotel's Advance Purchase Special (check it out... price was good, no resort fees and free room upgrade if available when you arrive). PROS: Upon arrival, we were upgrade to a Mountain View King room, which was very nice. The room itself was clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the air conditioning kept the room at a comfortable temperature. It also had a microwave and mini fridge. The location of the hotel is great. It's about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and easy to access by car. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. They even have beach towels and chairs that you can borrow for the day. There is a complimentary breakfast from 6:30am - 8:30am, coffee and cold water throughout the day and popcorn in the afternoon.CONS: The breakfast is very carb heavy (waffles, cereal, pastries), which is typical for a continental breakfast; however, some fruit or protein options would have been great. We only ate breakfast at the hotel a few times during our stay. The room only had a stand-up shower (no tub), if that matters to you. The bathroom door often closed on it's own and a couple drawers in the dresser were sticky. The only parking available is valet and costs $30/night, which I understand is typical, but you should be aware of before booking. Also, if you're sensitive to traffic noise, the hotel is on a fairly busy street. They do provide free ear plugs in the room.OVERALL: I would definitely recommend the Coconut Waikiki to friends/family and would stay again. Thanks for an excellent stay!

Lovely hotel. Breakfast was ok but far too many sugary options and no healthy options except for eggs (which didn't taste real). I was upset with the amount of disposable cups used not just here but throughout Waikiki. No glass or cups or reusable options. I bought my own reusable cup (which was huge - could not find normal sized) and utilised this for the whole trip. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly.

Our room was small, facing a condo building with junk on the balconies. The location is good, and quiet. The A/C a bit noisy. Breakfast is nice, but the same food, and it closes too early. The water and coffee is great to have all day. The staff was friendly and helpful.

We really loved staying in this hotel. The location was perfect. All the staff were friendly, it was very clean and the great buffet breakfast was a bonus. As was the constant complimentary coffee and cold drinks throughout the day and popcorn in the afternoon.

great hotel, b'fast was great with lots of choices. The only two things I would change is the AC doesn't cool the whole room so would position it on the wall instead of the window. Double glaze the windows as the noise at night was so noisy.

Just have to say it was our first time to stay in this hotel ..and it was fantastic the staff members especially Jessica and issac were fabulous anything we wanted to know they helped us and also were great to talk to ...the hotel rooms were 10/10 the bteakfeast everymorning was brillant always betwwen 6.30am till 8.30am not far from the beach everything is around you main shopping centre aloh moana is like 15mins walk ...we would stay here again 10/10 thanks guys

After finding The Coconut online for our first trip to Hawaii, we were pleasantly surprised. Great location, well priced and friendly helpful staff. The motel was clean and well appointed. Our mountain view room gave beautiful views. Highly recommended.

My second time staying here and it was as nice as I remember. It was my partner’s first time at this property and he thought it was great too. It’s a quick 2 or 3 block walk to the main boulevard with a great bar a few doors down — shout out to The Bacchus!!It’s a clean place, with very friendly staff. Only downside was the breakfast. Not a very good selection of breakfast items, and coffee seemed to always be out. All in all, a great place and we’d recommend it.

The staff was friendly and helpful. They answered my inquiries and responded quickly to any issues. Their beverages and every day afternoon treat... popcorn with arare... I love it! The location is close to the shopping center and beach. :-)

Waikiki can be a bit naff and touristy and many of its hotels and establishments have a "80's heyday" feel to them. They may be worn, weary and dusty, giving an abrasive holiday feeling that just doesn't feel right. Not so at Coconut Waikiki, where revamped rooms sporting a witty, colourful finish await! Add friendly, informative staff and a bang for your buck amenity fee that includes free tea, coffee, popcorn, fruity flavoured natural water and a bonanza breakfast buffet and you're looking at a special place in downtown Waikiki. Free gym services are also in the mix - a small but decently equipped fitness room is the perfect place to burn some of the calories from the overly rich American diet! The hotel is located 10 mins from the beach and close to Waikiki's famous shopping centres and attractions. The only minor drawback here is the noise from the cars on the street but earplugs are provided and you are in a capital city so this can be expected. Plus, when everything else is tip-top, this really is a negligible concern. Highly recommended and Mahalo to the great staff here!

Had never been to Hawaii before and was surprised on how well I did in chosing hotel. A clean hotel with friendly staff and a good breakfast. Would have been nice with some bacon in the morning but waffles, coffe and toast worked as well.

優點：有迎賓咖啡飲料爆米花有簡單早餐，但只到08:30也太早了吧！房間很大還有雙衛浴離免稅店近，離沙灘遠缺點：隔音不好非常吵，離馬路太近，根本睡不好房內空調更吵，床頭會提供耳塞出發前已有發信確認能否寄放行李2晚，要去茂宜島後再回來飯店領取飯店回覆可以付費寄放直接在飯店寄放行李Aloha,You would leave the bag and payment with us when you checkout.It will be returned to the hotel in the morning when you come back.但....我們當時ㄧ早退房詢問行李寄放事宜飯店櫃檯回覆沒有這樣的服務，我拿了郵件給他看，說再幫我們問問，結果確回覆說因爲你們回來時沒有再住我們飯店所以沒有提供你寄放行李服務，我可以接受這說法，但無法接受我都已事先發郵件確認，為什麼沒有在郵件先告訴我付費寄放行李的前提是必需再住他們飯店的。如果事先說清楚會更好。

Our stay at Coconut Waikiki was a short one but a great one. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly and Coconut Waikiki has everything you could possibly need and more (including board games!).The rooms are clean and even though I'm a super light sleeper, I didn't have any issue with the traffic noise. We were on the 10th floor so I imagine that made a difference and would recommend that for other sensitive sleepers. It's in a great location, close to shopping, public transport and restaurants and valet parking means you can also rent a car to explore the island on your own.

Most of the things that the hotel can control they do well - very nice breakfast, friendly staff, comfy beds, nice TV, popcorn, small but nice bathroom (sliding door didn't slide). The only knock is the noise due to the proximity of the hotel on Ala Wai Blvd, which is the main east-west one-way along the canal. It is common to have loud motorcycles, sirens, and boom cars come past the hotel and since the windows and doors are not tight the sound is loud in the room. I ran the air conditioner as loudly as possible, which helped some. Also, tough to slide the door to access the lanai.

Traveling abroad in a few years made me nervous and speechless. First day, I wanted to ask a few questions about the employee who worked in the afternoon, but I did not speak English. Then the clerk treated me with an unfriendly attitude. I felt very uncomfortable. I felt very uncomfortable.

A good hotel, with clean, spacious rooms close to all the main areas of Waikiki. Staff were really helpful and the breakfast was a real bonus. The only reason I haven't given it five stars was that the room wasn't very well sound proofed so we did get some noise from outside at night.

The location is perfect, only 10-min walk to Waikiki. And it provides breakfast and tasty popcorn and various refreshment, which is very time/effort-saving. Valet parking is also efficient. Highly recommend!

Our room was great. The hotel is not on a busy road which was great as the main streets in Waikiki are crazy. Our room had a small balcony which gave us opportunity to sit outside if we wanted and we were able to put our swim suits outside to dry. It was a long walk to get to the beach but not hard to get around with the buses. The staff was great in advising places to eat and how to get to places by bus.
Great stay with thoughtful staff.Value and location. Great touch with the breakfast and refreshments. Would recommend to anyone. Walking distance to beaches, shops, and restaurants. I can't complain.

Coconut Waikiki Hotel was reasonable and clean and had a good location that was near the center of Waikiki. And though I lisned that Ala moa was not safty and I cared it, it was no problem because I came back to the hotel by ten in the evening.

Took my wife on a surprise staycation to the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. A few days before I got an email from Jordan the Director of Guest Experience reconfirming the reservation and wondering if we were celebrating anything. I emailed him back that we were celebrating my wife's birthday and if there was anything he could do to make the stay extra special, it would be great. Got their early on the day (around 10am) and Jessica who was on duty told us that the room was not ready but that she could call us when it was and that she could store our bags and even call us when it was ready! She was super friendly and while were walking around in Waikiki, we got a call around 1pm telling us it was ready with a great upper floor location, our bags were in the room and all we had to do was get our keys and go to the room. Room was awesome, on the 8th floor and on the quiet Lewers side! But what was really great was that in the room was a hand-decorated customized birthday card and box of chocolates from Jessica downstairs! It was such a sweet gesture (who does that anymore???!!!) It was truly something special to see in the room. Back to the actual room itself, it was huge (as the older refurbished hotels are), king bed, 1.5 bathrooms, wet bar with plates, microwave and good size fridge. Even had a Keurig coffee maker! Both bathrooms were nice and spacious and the bathroom amenities were pretty good. Ran downstairs to get the afternoon hurricane popcorn (nice touch) before going back out to the beach. They also had beach towels and beach chairs we could use. On our way back we could see that they had a book sharing library and board games we could borrow (most of the books were in German or dutch LOL). Room was nice and quiet and the A/C was actually a tad too cold (had to turn down the A/C). We had a nice view of the mountains and the Ala Wai Canal and could take great pictures from our two balconies. I had seen that the hotel on-site didn't advertise their gym on the paperwork but had seen it on the website. Woke up at 6am and found it; small but totally usable with free weights, 2 treadmills, 1 cycle and 1 stepper. Good enough for my 45 minute workout and no one was there! Continental breakfast was impressive. The usual suspects were there with cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, granola and they even had scrambled eggs and made to order mini waffles and coconut syrup (that was the best!). Next day we decided to hang at the pool. It was a small pool (and I thought it was supposed to be heated but it wasn;t) but since we were the only ones there the whole time we were there, we didn't mind! They even had giant board games in the back lounge area of chess, jenga, dominoes and even a sand pit to build sand castles. To be honest, I was extremely impressed with what the Coconut Waikiki Hotel had to offer for the money: huge rooms, with wet bar/kitchen, great bathrooms, included breakfast and fun things around the property. But a big part of our great stay was the hotel staff especially Jessica and Jordan. In this day and age you truly remember great customer service! Even when we left the hotel around 3pm the person on duty even wished my wife a Happy Birthday again! Mahalo Nui Loa to the the Coconut Waikiki Staff! It was a great stay!

I booked a five night stay at the Coconut Waikiki, directly via their website so secured a great deal by taking the advanced booking option. My flight arrived early in the morning into Honolulu so I took the early check-in option which meant my room was ready for me as soon as I arrived at the hotel As I'd just come off a 9-hour flight, it was great to get straight into my room, have a shower and a small rest before heading out to enjoy the splendour of Waikiki.The room I had was on the 10th floor and my room looked out onto the Ala Wai Canal - there is a small balcony so I could sit outside if I wanted to. The room itself was huge (as well as spotlessly clean) with a king-sized bed, plenty of space for my luggage, an in-room safe and a kitchen which had a microwave, fridge, and a coffee maker, so self-catering is an option. The bathroom was a good size too with a shower. I did have a problem with a leaking cistern initially but that was resolved with a call to the front desk.Speaking of the front desk, they were all incredibly friendly, but particularly Isaac who always had a friendly smile and was happy to help out with any queries. The front desk also provide beach towels which can be used for the hotel's swimming pool or if you wanted to take it to the beach. Breakfast comes with the room rate and it's an excellent continental buffet selection - cereals, granola, fresh fruit, yoghurt, scrambled eggs, toast and waffles along with fruit juice and tea/coffee and it runs from 6.30-8.30am and there was always an abundance of breakfast, even when the hotel was full of guests. During the day, there's complimentary flavoured water for guests in the lobby and in the afternoon complimentary freshly made popcorn.I really couldn't ask for more from the hotel and I will definitely stay here again on my return to Waikiki. While it's not right by the beach, it is only a short stroll there and it's in very close proximity to loads of great eating and drinking places (particularly on Kuhio Ave and Lewers St), there is an ABC Store 2 minutes walk away and the bus-stop for the local bus service (The Bus) is also just outside the ABC so it's so easy to get around. This has been a great find for me and I can't recommend this as a great-value option for staying in the beautiful Waikiki area.

Your hotel has set high standards for hawaii for us. Even though we were there for only one day it was amazing. Thank you. I was wondering what was the $100 charge for? Or is it getting refunded? if so when? Can i please know.

For the price, this place is a good choice. Location is terrific, rooms comfortable and very clean, breakfasts okay, and the service from staff is excellent. They work hard to accommodate special requests, respond fully to tourist type questions, etc. and generally go out of their way to help travellers. Isaac, in particular deserves special mention for his assistance.

We stayed for 3 nights. The room was very comfortable and had a nice view of the hills. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast (included) was adequate. Overall it was very good value for money

Jordan (Director of Guest Experience) is nice! They try their best to accomplish our request! And the room is also wonderful! Clean, spacious and comfortable! Nice location. It's not far for walking to Waikiki, don't try driving.Only one person at the front desk, so you might need to wait for a while. Small swimming pool but not bothered us because we love beach more. Breakfast was not fancy but fair enough; however, popcorn in the afternoon is nice!:)Overall, It's truly worthy. We'll stay again if we come back to Waikiki

Coconut Waikiki is a real lovely, comfortable and convenient hotel. My husband and I stayed only for 2 nights only and could have easily stayed longer.The hotel has been renovated to an up to date boutique design. Check in was friendly and speedy - maybe the front desk knew we were tired from our travels. Our room was cozy, clean and spacious. The king bed was firm but still comfortable. Bathroom is an average size but had been updated.Breakfast is wonderful addition. 2 waffle griddles, assortment of breads; scrambled eggs, cereal, fruit and yogurt.The hotel really knows how to treat their guests. They will also provide (based on availability) beach chairs, umbrellas and towels for no additional charge. I also did see the front desk provide a toy pail for a toddler.Location is great. It’s probably a 5 minute walk to the Waikiki Strip (Waikiki Boardwalk, Sheraton, Moana - very close by) and 25 minute walk to the Ala Moana Mall along the canal.Highly recommend this hotel for service, location and value!

Our 1 night stay at this property was comfortable and pleasant. Located on a side street a few blocks from the beach and crowds of Kalakaua Ave, within easy walking to shops and restaurants. The lobby is comfortable and well designed, the included breakfast was sufficient to start the day. Room was clean, well designed and has everything needed for a restful night.

Very friendly and clean hotel. Excellent location and breakfasts were delicious. Thoroughly recommend this hotel for the very accommodating and friendly staff. They made our Anniversary very special with a beautiful bottle of wine and chocolates.

My friends and I stayed at The Coconut Waikiki Hotel for our 5 day vacation/ wedding trip to Hawaii. Initially we drove around the hotel twice trying to find the entrance to the valet as we missed the small entrance the first time. The entrance is immediately around the corner once you make the left turn on Ala Wai Blvd while driving on Lewers St. The daily valet cost is $30 which is comparable to many hotels in the area. We were greeted by the friendly staff upon arrival and check in early for our room. We booked the Penthouse Suite. They informed us that there is daily breakfast in the dining/ lobby from 6:30-8:30am. Breakfast consisted of waffles, eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, and cereal which is pretty typical for places I've stayed at.When we got to our room we exited the elevator and went up one set of stairs to get to the Penthouse Suite which has a floor to itself. The Penthouse Suite included two bedroom (one queen, one king bed), a queen sized pullout couch, two bathrooms, and balcony which had a nice view of our surrounding area as noted on its website description. The living room and dining room is very spacious and was set up very nicely. Both bathrooms were spacious and was ideal for getting ready for the wedding or even to just get ready for the day.One of my favorite characteristics of the Penthouse Suite was the air conditioning. Each part of the suite had its own unit. I turned down the thermostat in my room to a somewhat chilling temperature while my friends in their own room or the living could use the heater or leave it at a moderate temperature.The hotel itself is a nice walking distance from the Waikiki Strip, the International Marketplace, and various food places which is nice because there isn't much street parking from what I have noticed.I'd like to thank Isaac and the rest of the staff at the hotel. Our time in Hawaii was about 70% planned, 30% spontaneous. Isaac down at the front desk was very helpful and offered suggestions and tips about where to go, what to do, and what to see in Hawaii. The valet staff especially as we were consistently coming and going to the hotel multiple times a day. Hope to be back sometime!

Hotel was nice and clean we had the view of the mountain no ocean the staff was very friendly breakfast was only serve to 8:30 wished it was longer the gym was okay they serve popcorn and drinks throughout the day for free

I really enjoyed my stay here at the Coconut Waikiki. It's about a 10 minute walk from the beach and beach towels are available upon request. There is a laundry facility on the property. The breakfast is full of options!! There's popcorn every day. There is a small quiet pool if you want some down time and don't feel like walking to the beach. The staff was also amazing. Very friendly, nice and helpful. My room was decent. It was clean and ear plugs were provided to block out any traffic noise. I would definitely stay here again.

I stay here every chance I get. Its centrally located, has a very friendly staff and the rooms are well taken care of. BEDS ARE COMFORTABLE TOO!! They've redecorated which adds to the charm of the hotel and they've added mid-afternoon extra's to add to the staying experience. I really can't say enough good things about the hotel. I always feel welcome when I arrive.

The staff was very friendly. Cutest place too. Close to the beach, & other shops & restaurants (walking distance). My boyfriend & I really enjoyed our stay here. Very comfortable. Will be coming back here again soon

This hotel is small and comfortable, with friendly and good service. We had stayed another night at the Marriott, which was fine but huge and more expensive. Our room was a nice size, and had a mini-kitchen which we did not need, but could be handy for someone staying longer. Our balcony faced the mountain, which was not bad because we saw the most beautiful rainbows up there. The included breakfast was a plus, and the hotel is only a short easy walk from the beach, all the shopping and dining places, and the bus, which we took to Diamond Head. We would stay here again.

Excellent hotel accommodations and convenient location. Wonderful complimentary breakfast every morning. Staff members are all friendly and very helpfu with much Aloha spirit. The lobby is nicely furnished and comfortable and there is flavored drinking waters, coffee, hot water for tea, etc.. which is available 24/7. This is my home away from home! Also, the Valet service is EXCELLENT too.

Pics of the view from my room on 9th floor. The breakfast was a nice touch to get your day started...waffles, yogurt, cereal, eggs, muffins, bagels, croissants, fruit, OJ and coffee. I already had a great experience calling in directly to Coconut Waikiki to reserve my room. They were able to give me a better rate than booking.com and Trip Advisor. Isaac (front desk) was a huge part of my great experience. He was not only friendly but knowledgeable about current offers that helped me make a better reservation choice. I also interacted with one of the breakfast staff and she was also friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Valet costs 30 dollars a day...whew! However, our car was brought promptly each and every request with a big smile! I tipped every other time due to the cost and frequency of my comings and goings and would have tipped more if it wasn't for the 30 daily cost. Big Mahal to such great people who work at Coconut Waikiki.
user_name:
Odyssey638009
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Returned to stay at Coconut Waikiki in early September and already can't wait to go back! The staff are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are a great size so you feel like you can spread out and have space to yourself. The breakfast available in the lobby has a bit of everything, plus there is popcorn available in the afternoons. The hotel is in a great location- 2ish minutes walk from heaps of buses and about 10-15minutes from the beach- so you feel like you are part of the action without constantly being surrounded by the crowds. After such a lovely second trip, we are already planning to visit again next year!

The staff was awesome, yummy breakfast in the morning, beautiful location: you can't pretend more!I suggest you to talk with the crew and take the tips they'll give you: they're gonna give you maps, bus line tracks, and all the other things you'll need.Wonderful experience, highly recommended

Yes the rooms that face the street are load. How is that the fault of the hotel ? Great location for sending the wife's to shop. Just down Lewers is a large street full of high end shops. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Jennifer the guest agent was especially helpful. Helped with storing our bags for check in and advice on where to go close for sites. I would recommend this hotel for location and price. There is road noise in any downtown Hotel. Double pan windows or not..

The hotel is well located at Waikiki Beach. The rooms are ample, but those at the front side are noisy. Take care if you need to Park a car. They charge $30 a Day!!!!! Almost the same price of the rental daily rate!

I recommend your hotel! The staff was beware of all.Position of the hotel is near the Vaikiki beach. Maybe a little noise, but over the night was good and traffic are minor. Is safe.We had everything what we expected.

My husband & I stayed in this hotel In May and June this year on our way to and coming back from Dominican Republic , the staff were lovely , very helpful ,the room each time was clean had everything we needed for a short stopover , unfortunately the breakfast area was not very good at att , it was cramped no room to even get food I would rather go to a nearby cafe , apart from this nice hotel lovely staff , close to everything .

The hotel matched our critera: value for money close to Waikiki beach, but still quiet. We were happy with our room: it was sufficient in size and although it was located in front of the two lane street, it was not really loud. We arrived very late (around midnight) and on the two mornings we had there, we had to leave before breakfast. Darwin, the night shift manager, was very patient with us and even took care that we got something to eat/drink before we left for Pearl Harbor/Hanauma bay despite the breakfast had not opened (so before 06:30).

I like this hotel.This is my 2nd stay at this hotel.I can't see the sea,but Ican see a beautiful city view.The staff are very kind.The room is aiso very easy to use.I can hear a little car sound,but I don't mind.I wont to stay again next time .

Very clean rooms, excellent service and good location. The staff are very welcoming and enjoy working for the Hotel. Breakfast is included which makes it convenient. Liked the fact the Hotel offered Valet Parking.

Our family of 3 really enjoyed our stay here at the Coconut. Perfect size hotel of 10 stories, so not too big and not too small. All staff were very helpful, especially with shops, tours, transport etc. Situated next to the Ala Wai Canal, the outlook was scenic and out of the main pedestrian traffic. Only 10 minutes walk to the CBD and beach. Hotel offers a lovely buffet breakfast which is included with your stay. Only downside was the noisy aircon and pool heater was not working.

The staff was amazing from start. At the time of booking the gentleman booking my room very friendly and very knowledgeable. Well staying at the hotel staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was a relatively good spread and I loved the snacks and board games they had throughout the day

Coconut Waikiki Hotel is always a great place to stay. Was very impressed with the pre stay welcome emails and attention to detail while there. Very friendly staff and the continental breakfast was fresh and tasty.

I really enjoyed my stay here. Staff was friendly and helpful. My room was clean and cozy. The complementary breakfast every morning was a plus. Hotel is walking distance to restaurants, shops and the beach. They also provide beach towels! For a boutique hotel, I thought that they were very generous with their amenities. I would stay here again.

As first time visitors to Hawaii, we were so impressed with the welcome and then Hurricane Popcorn. We loved the greeting board and terh hints and tips from staff on where to eat, shop and how to catch transport.

Staff and location were biggest pluses, upgrade to a larger suite was a plus, breakfast and the pool area were adequate, noisy a/c the only negative. Our first stay in Waikiki so have no other hotel to compare it too, but would stay here again.

We stayed here four or five years ago when it was a Best Western and loved it. When we were planning for this trip our research showed they still had a great price. Staff is friendly and helpful. Got a Mountain View room and it was set up well. Breakfast was just okay. Typical hotel fare. Staff let us store our luggage while we explored. So this was our 2nd stay and we wouldn’t hesitate to come back. Do be aware that parking is valet and cost $30 a day.

From the moment we arrived the staff at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel made us feel welcome. From a welcome sign when we entered the premises to a special note from the front desk employee. The hotel's breakfast and pool were simple, but all that was needed. The staff was helpful in directions and getting us around and making recommendations. We enjoyed our stay and were most impressed with the hospitality of the employees at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. Thank you for such a lovely stay.
user_name:
mimi3783
Seattle, WA & Isla Mujeres, Mexico

review_body: Nice hotel. Very helpful and kind staff. The hotel was a little bit off from the beach. Not very good breakfast and the poolarea was not satisfing. The room towards the canal was noisy due to traffic. The ac was very loud.

We enjoyed the friendly and efficient staff, comfy bed and very spacious room. On arrival we were given a free room upgrade ~ thank you very much for being so thoughtful. The complementary breakfast was a little lacking in variety. Great location.

Make sure you put your valuables in the safe and that it is properly locked. Room doors are left open while being cleaned, so anyone has access to anything you have in your room. I would highly recommend the mountain view. City views appear to be into windows of close-by high rises. The pool does not appear to be heated, but kids will enjoy it. Breakfast is good, drinks available all day. Hawaiian popcorn in the afternoon was a treat. Staff is friendly and you can meet many interesting people in the comfortable lobby. Bathroom is quite small but clean. Beds are very comfortable. Earplugs are supplied because traffic noise can be loud if you like to sleep with the balcony doors open.

Thank you Jessica and Isaac for your attentive service during our stay. Room is very clean and with good equipment. The only downside (and reason for not giving five points) is, that the hotel is quite noisy with the street and airconditioning.

Clean , friendly service , breakfest was fresh and hot each morning close to amenities and buses , love the mountain view , will advise friends and family to book at this hotel when visiting waikiki thanks

We chose the Executive Suite which was spacious, clean and comfortable with 2 bathrooms and 2 AC units that keep our room cool. The hotel staff were very professional, and caring. Isaac the manager was so helpful with recommendations as well as being attentive to whatever we needed. The free buffet continental breakfast was good...along with the flavored water, coffee, tea that were available to guests all day. The afternoon popcorn was an added boost. The hotel staff also provided beach towels and chairs for guests to take to beach. When my husband and I returned from the Sunset dinner cruise on my birthday evening, the staff left a birthday gift for me in our room. This show of love really warmed my heart. The hotel location was close to Waikiki beach, just a few blocks away from the beach, great shopping and the pick up for the Luau package we selected.

While the price was nice, I was a bit disappointed by this hotel. I had put in a request prior to my stay (in response to an e-mail and text from a hotel employee) for a room with a view and my request was not even acknowledged. I found the room, especially the carpets and curtains, to be quite dirty and the service below what I hoped for. However, the breakfast service and quality was quite good and the location was convenient.

The staff was amazing!!!! They were very nice and helpful. They made the stay worth while. The hotel is a little dated but a cozy place to stay. Breakfast was good. The hotel is a little walk to Waikiki Beach but other than that it was a great place to stay.

Wonderful hotel downtown just two blocks from the main strip and Waikiki beach. Staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and clean and the complimentary breakfast was quite impressive. Perfect location close to shopping, restaurants, and beach. Also short cab ride to Diamond Head park, and only about 25 minutes to Airport and Pearl Harbor. Other hotels are closer to the beach/strip but not worth the extra money. This is the best gang for the buck in Waikiki.

Amazing place, great location, really good breakfast, and very clean.The hotel was right next to the rental bikes, beach, and shops. Employees were very nice.Rooms were cute, balcony had amazing views. Linen was clean and soft. Breakfast was very good, warm, attended to the whole time we were there. My only complaint is the shower head. Ok pressure but was old and had water stains all over it.

This hotel was great on every account - nicely renovated lobby, clean rooms with AC and a fridge, and friendly staff! We arrived very late, but Donovan at the front desk was friendly and welcoming. The location is great - a quick walk to shopping and the beach. Oh, the breakfast was awesome too! You can't go wrong staying here.

Great service, great rooms and great breakfast. If you like smaller, boutique type hotels, this is the place for you. It is not at the ocean, being a few blocks from it, but it does overlook the canal and mountains.

Hotel clean & quiet. Quiet compared to the hotels that line the beach. A little car traffic noise, but didn't bother me. A few block walk to Waikiki beach and bus transportation. A little dated but clean. We stayed on the mountain side, nice view. I would stay again.

This hotel was recommended to us by our travel agent and it has certainly lived up to that recommendation. Our room is well equipped with a small kitchenette. There is a complimentary breakfast every morning with as much as you can eat. Free coffee and tea is also available. The receptionists are absolutely brilliant and very knowledgeable.

Great staff! Very helpful and friendly. They go out of their wayh to help. Rooms a little old, but perfect for price and location. Quickly able to drive out of Waikiki. Karaoke studio block away! Fun!

Stayed there before and after cruise a couple of days. After the cruise stay we got upgraded to a room with a balcony and river view. If rooms available early check inn of late check out is an option for a 20 US dollar fee. Staff is friendly and correct especially the girl with the blond hair. Rooms have a fridge and a microwave and a Keurig for special coffee blends. Tv has a lot off channels to choose from. A plus is also the continental breakfast in the morning. If you book direct no resort fee is charged. If you book by phone or e-mail maybe you get a even better rate. Definitely recommend this place. Wifi is very good.

We stayed a total of four nights at the hotel and enjoyed excellent hospitality from the staff. The hotel is nicely located for walking access to Waikiki and the nearby beach front and we had no difficulties finding our way around, despite never having been there before. Assistance from the very helpful staff was always available.The only issue with sleeping was due to not being used to the climate and the air conditioning unit in our particular room being quite noisy.

We loved our stay, it was a home away from home.Very closed to all amendments & staff were wonderful.The breakfast started our day off well & a big pick me up in afternoon we looked forwardto wonderful popcorn & cold refreshing drinks.

My wife and I stayed there for one night on our honeymoon trip. The staff was very friendly and texted me two days before our arrival date. The price and location of the hotel was great and the breakfast was also included. You will need to pay for valet parking. The hotel also told me that we can try to find free street parking along the Ala Wai Blvd and we found one. We definitely recommend this hotel.

The place was great. The beds and pillows were much better than those on the cruise ship we were on before coning here. The room was excellent. We would go back there any time we are in Honolulu. The breakfast buffet was really good, although the are could have been a little larger. Otherwise all was good..

Stayed at The Coconut Waikiki Hotel for 5 days. The hotel is way much better than described. It's very clean and the staff is very attentive. They have a free continental breakfast and free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. Issac and Donovan are great host. They are friendly and helpful. The hotel is a quick walk to the beach and restaurants. I recommend The Coconut Waikiki Hotel to anyone looking to stay away from the busy beach district. It's quiet and peaceful.

Great location for shops and beach, lots of amenities nearby. Good breakfast and friendly staff. Room came with earplugs because it was very noisy next door but earplugs worked so not a problem. Wouldn't stay here for long but good for a couple of days.

Close enough to Waikiki beach walking distance, but far enough from the Waikiki congestion. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was just enough to get our day started. Rooms were a bit small but it was perfect for a trip in this area. We stayed here to take advantage of the location and fair price, not to spend time in our room. Great view, comfy/clean bed, great local shops and places to eat!

last minute booking due to the hurricane Irma, had a fab time and was ideally located! All staff very helpful and friendly and a bonus of free popcorn between 2pm-6pm! Would 100% return should we decide to go back to Waikiki!

Room was mountain facing, and an upgrade from City room.Noise of traffic sometimes quite distracting, but as was not in room that long it did not really bother us.Room had fridge, microwave and a coffee maker that included 4 free coffee pods.Room also had a safe, which always comes in handy.

This was our first time vacationing in Hawaii so we didn't know what to expect or what we'd need as far as hotel accommodations. This location was perfect! Waikiki beach and the main strip with shopping and restaurants was within short walking distance but it was more quieter and less crowded than the main strip. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Isaac and Jessica both helped us out a lot with recommendations and figuring out how to make the most of our brief stay on this island.If we come back, we'd definitely stay at this hotel again.These pictures were from our balcony and front entrance to the hotel

My wife and I recently stayed here for our 10th anniversary. From the moment we entered the hotel there was a sign on a chalk board congratulating us and welcoming us. The room had a beautiful view facing the canal and mountains. It was very clean and comfortable as well as very quiet. The location is excellent, as it's close enough to walk to all that Waikiki has to offer without being noisy. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. There is a simple but decent complimentary breakfast everyday as well as popcorn, cold drinks and coffee everyday in the breakfast area. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was going back to Waikiki and highly recommend it if you are looking for an excellent value accommodation and quality service.

Front desk staff is first rate in all respects. Continental breakfast is very nice, all day coffee and hurricane popcorn in the afternoon a real bonus. Mountain view room recommended. Traffic noise a bit of an issue for sleeping but earplugs helpfully provided offer some relief.

The air conditioners are the in wall type and noisy. Bed pillows were all high/thick and not what we normally use so we did not sleep well. The continental breakfast provided was quite adequate for the price.

This was an amazing experience. The customer service was outstanding and we couldn't have picked a better place to spend the night for our wedding. We arrived really late and the check in process was quick and because they had room we were upgraded to an executive suite!! They dropped off a bottle of white wine and chocolates to congratulate us. The room was amazing, and it was so quiet, clean and comfortable which was perfect for us since my husband and I were so tired from our day we just wanted to rest. When we woke up in the morning we had a chance to get breakfast and there isn't too many hotels in Waikiki with complimentary breakfast so this was really nice. I loved that there were mini waffles! We asked if we could check out later and they were able to give us an extra hour. One more thing that just made my day was that they had toothbrushes and toothpaste for the guests if needed at the front desk, the last hotel I went to didn't have that and I always forget to bring mine from home. That's not something I think about packing when I'm getting married. Overall, I haven't had an experience like this for awhile.

Stayed at the hotel for 1 night as part of my honeymoon package. Room was nice, tidy and bed was comfortable, especially after traveling for 17 hours from the UK to get to Hawai'i! Only stayed 1 night so difficult to give a full review although Staff were very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was very good.

We found the staff to be friendly, especially Jessica, the room spacious and clean, the mountain view balcony was great, the shower was excellent, and the complimentary breakfast the best we've ever had at a hotel.

The free continental breakfast is a major plus, along with their hurricane popcorn and fruit infused water. The hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful. Hotel is clean and staffs are nice. Location is great and there are free beach towels and chairs for rent.

I've stayed at this place with my family at least 5 times and the employees are the main reason we come back. Everyone is so nice there and the rooms are clean and comfortable. There are days I just spent lounging in my room and it was so nice and relaxing. The rooms have small sink kitchen area and balcony which is very nice and at no extra charge. Great place to stay!

This is a hidden gem and all you really need if you are an outgoing kind of guest or family. While this is not high end, it is a nice room, clean and the breafast is fun in the mornings...plus free papers, coffee, popcorn and a very nice staff. I stay here when doing inter island business now.
user_name:
Mike D
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

review_body: loved my stay - wish i could have stayed longer !! great room, great staff and great amenities made this a great place to stay! The offerings of drinks, food and popcorn make this property great value and sooo kid friendly. Absolutely recommend! Thank you to Isaac at the front desk for making this a great vacation !

Great location, service and the best continental breakfast I have had in all my travels. Has a self service laundry real bonus when travelling from different places. Jessica the receptionist was so friendly and knowledgeable. Rooms were very god. Hotel just a little noisy from road traffic.

The AC was noisy at first but you got use to it for the service, location and price it was well worth it. The shops and restaurants are close by and the river is at your doorstep. Transport system great used the buses to get around with no problems.

Coconut Hotel excels in client service. Staff are knowledgeable and courteous. The location was ideal and suited to all the sites we wanted to see. The front desk person during the day was knowledgeable and recommended us wonderful places to see and things to do while in Hawaii. Duration of our stay was for a week and breakfast that was served was the same daily. The hurricane popcorn though was excellent. Overall, their service was very good!

I only stayed at the Coconut for 2 nights, but it was very nice. Room was large and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel was located close to the beach and the centre of Waikiki which made it easy to walk around.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our 1 week vacation at the end of August. We loved it. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We were the last to check in at 10p and they had our room key ready and waiting and greeted us by name. The room was decent for the price, equipped with a bar fridge, and kitchen sink. The continental breakfast is fantastic with a waffle maker, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, cereal, muffins, etc. There is 24 hour coffee and popcorn from 2-6p. The location is really great. Close to the canal and 5-10 minute walk to the beach. We loved that it was a little outside the really touristy area, but still close to everything. The pool wasn't heated the day we went in, but it wasn't a big deal. There was an extra daily hotel fee that wasn't included in our initial booking, which we weren't expecting. It ended up being a little more expensive than we expected because of the hotel fee, but definitely still worth it.

Wonderful 3 nights stopover between Sydney & NYC. Clean, convenient hotel with friendly & helpful staff. Flight arrived well before 3 o'clock check in but room was ready in very short time. Great continental breakfast. Thank you all at Coconut for great stay.

Nice room with great view of canal. Good to have breakfast included.Shame to have a fancy coffee machine in the room but no kettle, which was limiting. Was very disappointed in the vast quantities of throw away plastic and paper for the breakfast, no environmental impact considered at all. The breakfast itself was ok, there was plenty of fresh fruit, most cereals were sugary. Coffee very mediocre. Breakfast self service and a bit hostel like. The valet system for car parking at $30 a day was a shock on arrival as was the 'amenity charge' for use of pool, wi fi and breakfast. Better to just get a proper price at the outset, it meant it wasn't such great value after all.

What a great place to stay, with a great lobby and chill out area with couches and books and games. We enjoyed the free breakfast buffet - (it can get busy so get up early) and there were nice touches like the iced lemon and fruit teas on tap all day, and also the Popcorn in the afternoonThe Staff were very friendly and Helpful , especially "JESSICA" and" ISAAC"The hotel has a excellent location which is central to all the shops and easy walking distance to the beach and has great views towards the CanalWe would definitely recommend this place to other travellers and we will book this place for our next trip back Thanks from the Burch & He-Burch Family...

We had an enjoyable vacation in Hawaii and Coconut with polite staffs was part of it. We prefer book the free breakfast Hotel. Coconut breakfast was OK. The mall Pool and fitness were available as well, we used them twice and they were OK, even though there were no people there.

We decided to end our trip with a couple nights in Waikikki and we are glad we chose the coconut. Great staff, clean place. We utilized the breakfast, we did not utilize the other amenitities. 5-7 minute walk to the shops, 8-10 to the beach

Very good with a reasonable breakfast and close to everything within walking distance to the beach and restaurants and shopping and tourist buses. I would recommend Coconut Waikiki for all those reasons.

Confort beds and amenities, oustanding service, location. The only thing i ll Recommend is to change the powder eggs to real eggs for breakfast From my reservation in april my questions were answered and fast return emails. Good advice for activities , helping with booking and even checking in for my flight..awesome.

When I purchased tickets the Coconut Waikiki was one of the best over all values in the price point I was looking at. There's a complimentary breakfast and wifi. I would be nice if the resort charges are included in the total fee.

Fantastic hotel for our family! Hospitable and friendly staff....good rooms wi fi...good breakfast,room service brilliant...location superb for shops and beach yet away from the madness...cannot fault this hotel!

I really recommended this hotel. The staff was good. The breakfest was really nice but it will be nice that it start at 6 am. Overal, we really love staying at this place for our trip. The view of our "city view" was really really nice.

We stayed with you prior to our cruise and also one night after the cruise , lovely peaceful spot but very convenient to everything.great staff friendly and a homely place to stay.Hope to return one day .

the hotel is very near to the beach and they provide towels to the beach.It's very clean,the frontdesk are very nive and helpful.The lobby always have drink for people.The room is very quite,and the breakfast is very nice.

Nice to be in a smaller hotel. View across the canal. Unfortunately the air conditioner was noisy at night and quite a lot of road noise. Pool was great to use once we had been out all day. Swimming towels supplied which was a bonus.

If you want a large room, (ours was King), great service and breakfast, stay here, the rooms are a bit older but great, the staff are amazing, very central, you don't need to pay top dollar. Isaac and Jessica were amazing when we arrived very tired from long flight.

We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to our cruise.The hotel is very clean, has free wi-fi, complimentary breakfast that is pretty extensive and comfortable beds. There was also a kitchenette in our room that if we had been staying longer would have been great.We didn't use the amenities very much as we were only there for a short time. However we appreciated help with walking directions to the beach, a restaurant recommendation and the loan of beach chairs and towels for the afternoon.Staff was very professional and helpful. Only downside was the expensive valet parking as they don't have a self-park lot and street parking wasn't available when we arrived. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay and would definitely come back again.

Staff was very friendly. They have free WiFi. Fresh juice and water in the lobby. Fresh popcorn in the evening. Complimentary breakfast that includes eggs, toast, fruit, granola, and cereal. Cute lobby with couches and board games. Small gym. Great location. Walking distance from shops, bars, and restaurants. Heated pool but it is very small. No hot tub. They lock the doors at a certain time of the night, which is great for safety, I just wish they let me know. I was shuffling in the dark for my room key and the front desk person was hesitant to open the door. Would stay there again!

It was destination: Hawaii for our long planned family reunion with groups flying in and converging in Waikiki from various parts of the world (Australia, Macau, Philippines, New York, Maryland). I did not have any notion of how our accomodations would be because the reservations/planning were made by my sisters. I must admit I was impressed at how welcome the staff of Coconut Waikiki Hotel made all of us feel. A friendly staff (hello James, Isaac, Robert, Jessica and the others), nice clean rooms, proximity to the Waikiki Strip, and to ABC Stores (hehe), great views of the Canal and the city, penthouse views - all make up the ingredients of a nice, great hotel. I felt we were not staying at a hotel - more like a home-tel. Iwe were made to feel at home!I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family! Please continue making your guests feel at home and maintaining the standards of good hotel service.

Great location just two blocks from Waikiki and most of all, extremely friendly and helpful staff, at a great rate.As others have said, from reception, Isaac included, they were so helpful, with where to eat, what to do and generally with conversation which gives the place a real family feel.Cleaners were always busy from before dawn to dusk. Was great to have a self service laundry downstairs and rooms were spacious.

We passed a goog holiday at the Coconut! At the reception, Isaac was very kind and felt us at home! The Room was Clean and confortable. Also the breakfast was good and with a Full choice. The time tor breackfast is from 6.30 to 8.30... for us it was very Early especially at Holiday. The hotel Give you towels and chairs for the beach.

Spent 2 weeks here in May 2016 and loved it. First visit to Hawaii and really liked the fact that breakfast was included and hotel was not right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Staff were great, always very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this to anyone looking to have a nice family break away

We were upgraded to 10th floor with great mountain view. They also surprised us by champagne and hand writing card. The breakfast was delicious as well. The only problem was the noisy air conditioning.Overall it was a pleasant stay with reasonable rate around Waikiki.

I got tired wato go in waikiki and we are trying to find a place to sleep with and i find coconut waikiki hotel and I am comfortable with it and they giving discount too and the guy named Darwin is awesome his very polite and comfortable to talk with and his a approachable person. I am a satisfied customer for their customer service.

Accomodation was clean and tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful.The only issues we found was the aircon struggled to keep the room cool and was very noisy.Traffic nosie was a bit loud as well, but not to the extreme that you couldn't sleep.Good thing about Coconut Waikiki was its not a huge hotel like some of the others where you just appeared to be $$ to the place. The staff made you feel welcome and were very accommodating.

For once a hotel that retained a friendly/homely atmosphere. Whilst getting excellent service you feel like one of the family and not a guest. The provision of coffe/tea facilities in the lobby area enables you to leave your room and rest in a lounge like area.

I booked 3 nights in the Coconut by my travel agency- We arrived from Europe by rental car late in the evening ( 9PM ) on saturday - We checked out early in the morning (7 AM ) on tuesday-Thus less than 48 hours of Valet parking and though we had to pay for 3 days of parking- 3 X 30 dollar per night = 90 dollar / This I find it not correct at all!For the rest the hotel was OK

A year ago as we were planning our family reunion in Hawaii, i took the liberty to research for a decent/family friendly hotel. While browsing the hotels in my tripadvisor app i spotted Coconut Waikiki Hotel. Overall the reviews are above average. After further research i suggested to my family the hotel. My sister-in-law Margaret did the legwork coordinating with Rick. Coconut hotel is a good place to stay. Friendly staff and a hand written note to welcome guests. Our room was clean. Breakfast was abundant and constantly monitored and re-stocked. Five to ten minutes going to Waikiki Beach. Option to borrow beach towels. Great service from the Staff. Thank you Rick, Isaac, Jessica, Ronald, Robert and the rest of the Staff for taking care of us. We will definitely recommend the hotel and we will be back!
user_name:
gailm651
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is good to us. One block away from trolley stop, bus stop, and small supermarkets. Walking distance to beach, shopping area. The room is compact and cozy.The comlimentary snacks and breakfast is simple but enough!The front deck is warm, friendly, and helpful.(especially a young man with black hair who always greets us with a bright smile and is always willing to answer our questions and helps us.)

Where do you house 27 people coming from different parts of the world to have a family reunion. Thank God my sister found Coconut hotel as Rick was super accomodating to make sure we were all happy. Location is good..accessible to the beach, stores and restaurants and yet not in the maddening area. We loved the penthouse which served as our HQ. Rooms were clean...thank you Aida!.Loved the readily available infused water and coffee especially arriving from a late night out. Self serve laundry was really helpful!Staff was SUPER...James, Darwin , Isaac, Jessica and all the others were all very helpful in making our stay picture perfect. Valet guys were also very helpful ...Will definitely recommend this hotel!!!ALOHA & MAHALO
user_name:
Babicon
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff was excellent! Everyone was very warm and welcoming. I liked the room, in spite of it being small. It was cute and quaint and the location was really good! However, I gave it an average rating because of two problems with my stay (and it was probably MY fault, because I didn't say anything to the staff at the hotel). First, there were tiny little ants in the room on the desk (that was right next to my side of the bed). I killed a few, wiped up their trail in the hopes that they wouldn't return, but they did. Second: the bathroom/tub smelled mildew-y. I don't know if it was the shower curtain or the tub, but it smelled funny. Again, I feel bad that I didn't say anything, because maybe they could have fixed it...but I didn't give them a chance. Sorry, Coconut Waikiki! :'(

We really enjoyed our stay at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. The price was very affordable, and there were lots of amenities, breakfast every morning, and our room was very clean. The employees and receptionists were always smiling, pleasant, and asking how they could help us. We would recommend the Coconut Waikiki to everyone and we will be back. Mahalo!

I was genuinely please with my stay however l felt that the breakfast time was far to short, starting 6.30 until 8.30am, not enough time for a sleep in. Also the change over seating at breakfast was not good. Would have liked kettle and provisions of making our own tea and coffee in our rooms.

I have stay in many hotels over the years I have been coming to Waikiki I rate this as one of my best it is very very clean large rooms lovely breakfast included and the view is beautiful it's not a large hotel they made us feel welcomed from the moment we stepped in the door the staff is a credit to them many thanks

My wife and I honeymooned at this hotel for a week in August and had an excellent stay. The staff put some complimentary wine and chocolates in our room to help us celebrate the special occasion. The continental breakfast included (scrambled eggs, cereal, yogurt and fruit, a waffle station, and pastries).The room itself was clean and comfortable. The staff was quick and helpful. We had a wonderful time.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Jordan had contacted me and I told him it was our honeymoon and requested for a quieter room due to my disability. The room was fine and facing the riverside but the noise was insane during the late evenings. After reading reviews about other couples having their anniversary and honeymoon. We did not receive anything extra. No upgrade to executive suite. We requested for a late check out since our flight didn't leave until 10:30pm and was denied. We didn't receive champagne or chocolates. Looks like they only do it certain guests not their overseas guests traveling long way to Hawaii.

I needed a hotel room for just one night, coming over from Maui to meet up with my boyfriend who has been working over on Oahu for the last month. I was contacted prior to arrival by Jordan asking if there was anything he could do to make our stay more memorable so I replied that we would like a late check out ( which was listed as a benefit to booking as a kama'aina direct their website ) aa well as a quiet room on an upper floor. Also the night before I checked in I checked in with Jordan to inquire if there was a bathtub in the room and he replied "Yes!", so I went and bought some bubble bath as it was our anniversary.... When I check in Issac helped us and he informed me that a late check-out would not be possible as the next day they were close to full occupancy. I also learned we were on the 4th floor - there are 10, so not quiet the upper floor I was hoping for, then when we got to the room, I quickly realized that there was no bathtub. I was still in good cheer, the room was clean and equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, silver wear, hair dryer, iron & ironing board, toiletries.... I send a quick text to Jordon to let him know that he was mistaken about their being a bathtub and that unfortunately there was no late check out or high floor available. I quickly got a call to the room from Isaac at the front desk saying he received my message and could I come down he would like to get me into the room I wanted and make our stay memorable. When I went downstairs Isaac apologize and he offered us an upgrade to an executive suite which had 2 bathroom and a bathtub. He also gave us the late check out we wanted ( 2pm) and had sent up a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates for our anniversary. The executive suit room 408, was still on the 4th floor, Isaac had explained he unfortunately was not made aware of my initial request for a high floor and there were none available ~ was a nice sized room, with a couch, I presume with a fold out bed, two air conditioner units, and a bath and 1/2... the only less then appealing thing about the room was there was black mold? on a section of the ceiling in the bath tub/ shower bathroom.I am so appreciative of Isaac's care and customer service, the coconut Waikiki Hotel is lucky to have him on their staff, he is a real gem! We would stay here again, if the need arises. Oh, and the continental breakfast, was great - scrambled eggs, make your own waffles, yogurt with fruit,,, toast, cold cereal, tea and coffee as well as OJ and water... it was a nice bonus.

no words could explain on how our experience went, just imagine a family of around 30 people from all over the world would converge in a hotel, booking 7 rooms was not as easy but when we got there we were greeted like it was our home, being upgraded to use the Penthouse just to fit 30 people to gather and not disturb other guests, location was amazing with the Canal and very close to the shops. I wouldnt resist in booking here again, and you should do the same! thank you very much!

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki hotel for four nights and were pleased with this lovely hotel. Staff were very helpful and welcoming. The rooms were well appointed, ours had a view over the canal and mountains. The bed was very comfortable and the balcony appreciated.Breakfast was included and was varied including make your own waffle options, fresh fruit, cereal, bread, pastries and eggs. Flavoured chilled water and coffee was on tap throughout the day and popcorn available in the afternoon. We didn't use the swimming pool - but we did make use of the laundry room. Pleased we didn't go for the more expensive sea view hotels - we had all we needed at the Coconut Waikiki !!

Very nice hotel and they give you good service! Breakfast was excellent but little too early when you are on holiday.Jessica and Isaac assisted us with car rentals, timetable for buses, and etc. Our visit in Honolulu was great and memorable.

We had a very nice stay at Coconuts. The staff is cheerful and helpful. A relaxed, comfortable hotel. The renovated rooms are fresh and roomy. The location worked for us. We liked not being in the thick of Waikiki. Easy getting the car in and out was easy. Short walk to the International Market Place and other Waikiki spots.

This hotel is close to shops, restaurants and cafes we were able to walk to every where we wanted to go. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had requested a room on the lower floor which they gave us and I was able to use the stairs as I don't like using elevators so I was happy as! Our room was very clean and comfortable, the only crictisim was the air conditioning unit was located by the bed so we could not get the full benefit of the cool air. We would definately stay at Coconut Waikki again.

The hotel was very clean. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel was close to shops. Breakfast was provided, it was very nice, large variety of foods to choose from. Loved the fresh fruit they had

Arriving at the hotel was a 10 minute walk from Kalakaua avenue, staff was amazingly nice and got us checked in immediately.Room was nice but i will say those airconditioners were really loud and we were close to Ala wei boulevard but this was remedied with ear plugs.We kept saying "we are going to IHOP" for breakfast but their continental breakfast was so good we got up early every morning for it.Not too busy and if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua avenue but it be close enough to walk there i HIGHLY recommend this place.Their staff are super nice and helpful but also give you the privacy we all crave sometimes.Would have been 5 stars but the pool heater was not working but they were in the process of fixing it.Top Hotel and a cheap price.

Although my husband, son, and I didn't actually stay in this hotel (we live in Oahu), we came here everyday to meet up with our family for our daily reunion activities. What struck me most was that the front desk staff (Jessica, Isaac, James) were always courteous and attentive to our needs. I was also impressed by the readily-available flavored water, coffee, tea, and the afternoon popcorn! The parking attendants Mike and Junior were very quick to park and get our cars. KUDOS, of course, to Rick Oberdalhof, the Assistant General Manager, who was instrumental in making our family's stay smooth and unforgettable! MAHALO!!!In the future, when we have more family and friends visiting Honolulu who will be in need of a place to stay, I'll not hesitate to recommend Coconut Waikiki Hotel! Again, many thanks!!!Lillian N.

Without doubt one of the favorite hotels in Waikiki. Upon arrival, 30 of us coming from different parts of the world, were warmly welcomed by the staff and manager. The staff were extremely friendly. Rooms and bathrooms were cleaned everyday, had a great view from our rooms. Location was great as its only a walking distance to all the stores, restaurants and beach.Note, this is not a 4/5-star hotel or so, but the atmosphere is so special that it really felt like home to ud. All respect Rick Oberdahloff, Director of Sales and Marketing and Kudos to his gracious staff James, Isaac, Darwin and Jessica who did a great job of making our stay a comfortable and memorable one.Recommending this hotel 100 percent.:)

A nice little hotel near the main thoroughfares of Waikiki. Excellent helpful and courteous staff, clean spacious room, simple but good breakfast. Staff was especially helpful in fixing a reservation glitch at check-in and made us feel very welcome. Can highly recommend.

This hotel was absolutely amazing I would definitely recommend staying if you're visiting Oahu! We stayed here for a week of our trip and wished we stayed for the entire trip instead. Included breakfast each morning was brilliant and delicious!!

What can I say but WOW...Not easy to please a 30 people family reunion group having different tastes, likes and opinions but we were all in unison when we say this Hotel made our reunion more comfortable, smooth and in a way, memorable. What a great job by their staff and their management..In fact they even upgraded some of us to suites when we came the second time. I have to mention James - Mgr, Isaac, Darwin (and another Lady who I could not remember her name) who handled the front desk and who were so friendly and helpful and of course Rick the sales director who facilitated our accommodations...Would highly recommend this hotel.BTW. location was great since its only a few blocks from the waikiki strip with the all stores, restaurants and beach.

Room was spacious with a decent view of the river. Room had AC and 1.5 bathrooms. Comfort of bed was adequate. Late night crowd (cars and people partying) could be heard from the room on Saturday night, but all other nights it wasn't an issue. Continental breakfast and complimentary WIFI was very much appreciated. Location is great, at the end of where all the action is, but still very much walking-distance to the main strip.Staff was always courteous and helpful. Storage of luggage upon check-in but before room was ready was very much appreciated. Beach towels available for use at the beach at the front desk. If renting a car, be sure to ask front desk and they will recommend Shaka Tours (which will be able $60 less than what you'd pay if booking directly with a car rental company). Only con - cleanliness - one of the light switches in the half bathroom had noticeable dark coloured gunk on it (as if it had been accumulating over time...). Upon use of wet wipes, this gunk was easily removed. Wet stains (hopefully just from water) could also be seen on the table where the TV sat atop.  Wet wipes also came in handy then. The TV remote however, is designed to be wipe-friendly : )

Good staff is there. I am not good at English, but they are very kind. Because of there, I have got to love Hawaii more.And, they have good and convenient location. (Near from beach, bus stop, and shops. Beautiful view on the riverside.)

My siblings and I decided to have our reunion in Hawaii as none of us have ever visited. As we were a group of 30 people from New York and Maryland from the US, Bacolod and Metro Manila from the Philippines, Macau and Barcelona, Spain - our first requirement was a good and reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki. And we were so glad to have decided on the Coconut Waikiki hotel. All arrangements prior to our trip was efficiently handled by RicK Oberdalhof, the Assistant General Manager through email. We needed 7 big rooms and He offered our group very good rates . On arrival date, We were pleasantly surprised that one of the rooms was upgraded to the penthouse suite as Rick thoughtfully realized that our group needed a big place where our big group can socialize with each other. He also made sure he met us one morning to welcome us personally to Hawaii.The rooms were clean and serviced everyday. The view that I got was the Canal view and it was gorgeous . It was so nice to start our day with the view of the sunrise.It was a short 10-15 minute walk to the beach and the shopping. There are several good restaurants just a few steps away. The service we got especially from the Front Desk was amazing. Kudos especially goes to James Asuncion , Jessica and Isaac who were always there to answer our questions and attend to our needs . The parking attendants were also so helpful.A big plus is also the free continental breakfast which had a waffle bar. It helped to start our activity filled days with a full stomach. There was also free flowing coffee and infused water the whole day. And a bonus every 2pm till 6pm, there was free popcorn !Upon our return to the hotel after 5 days, most of our group were upgraded to the mini suites!How fantastic is that ! A part of our successful Reunion in Hawaii is definitely the Coconut Waikiki stay.Thank you again for a wonderful stay, Rick !

Great hotel & nice staff, two in particular (Isaac & Jessica) were fantastic having all the answers to my questions and were so helpful.Room was spot-on and it was so nice to stay there, nothing seemed to be too much trouble.Big thanks to all for making us feel so welcome and at home.John Crowder.

The staff at coconut Waikiki were always available and helpful. Well done and I will be returning to your hotel due to the great people working there. The rooms were clean and comfortable and all services available.

Stayed here for the first time last week, and will definitely stay again. Isaac at the front desk was extremely pleasant and helpful. It was so refreshing to be at a smaller hotel that emphasizes offering great service to their guests.Thanks Isaac!!

A really nice hotel. Great staff. Well located to the beach (Waikiki) and the shops. The room was clean whit free water. Coffee and flavored waters at all times in the lobby. Continental breakfast included. We would love to come back again :-)

Nice place, well located (bus, beach and shopping) and courteous and helpful staff, clean and tidy hotel. We enjoyed coffee and flavored waters available at all times, also appreciate beach towels service.

We really enjoyed Waikiki beach and the hotel which was ideally located. Whilst the room a/c was very noisy we did manage to get used to it. The help provided to obtain a hire car was excellent. The self service laundry was also very useful.

We had a great time with Coconut Waikiki Hotel. It's a small hotel with exceptional service. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Continental breakfast included. They offer to give us towels, beach chairs, even sand toys to the beach for free. Will definitely go back again.

Family enjoyed this hotel and can't wait to go back. Loved the room size and amenities, staff was very helpful and friendly. Had an 8 year old with us who enjoyed the heated pool and the game/reading nook and afternoon snack in the lobby. Noticed other families there also. It's about a 10 minute walk down to the beach/main Waikiki shopping/dining area and our room did not have a view, but the location is easy to get to and the hotel seemed quiet despite being near the busy Ala Wai Blvd. No restaurant in the hotel but we enjoyed the breakfast in the lobby, and our room had a convenient microwave, fridge and counter (we brought back take out).

We were a big group to travel with many kids. We had meeting at lobby at night. Staff was so helpful for many ways. Also offering free breakfast was so nice. Wonderful staff. Short beach towels but they were very helpful.

Average hotel. Average price. Not bad location. Nothing bad, but nothing that great either. I'd stay there again if I got a good deal. Wouldn't recommend because you can get a much better hotel for the same price.

Very good hotel, close to the center, excellent service, very clean. The breakfast was very good. Unfortunately our room was on the road, which is very noisy during the night. This was the only negative part.

For a reasonable price (compared to those closer the beach), we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel accommodation (inclusive of breakfast) - but also importantly we received high quality service and the hotel staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Recommend as an option without the big price tag.

This little gem has wonderful views across Ala Wai up to the hills and is so worth the short extra walk that takes you a couple of blocks north of the frantic 'strip' along Waikiki beach. It's an older building but has been largely renovated so everything pretty much works OK. There is coffee and flavored water available all day in the lobby, with quite a decent breakfast on offer too - this is usually included in the room rate.The rooms have a small kitchenette; very convenient for snacks and cold drinks while sitting out on the lanai enjoying the view. The beds are extremely comfortable, the wifi is fast and reliable, there is a laptop sized safe, and plenty of drawers in a dresser but there isn't much hanging space in the small closet - I never find this a problem since all you need in Waikiki is shorts and tee shirts.I visit Hawaii a couple of time a year and always enjoy my stay at the Coconut.

It was our second time at the hotel and we were pleased with the slight changes in the breakfast menu. The seating outside the breakfast area is great, however the water dripping, presumably from the aircon units outside the rooms, is still a problem to be addressed.The additional seating & loungers by the pool are great, as is the games & seating at the back of the outside area, fantastic idea, thank you.Aircon units in rooms are still very noisy, however the complimentary ear plugs were appreciated.All in all, great hotel, fantastic staff , great price for the area.

Hotel is near a very busy road with heavy traffic day and night. Sound insulation is poor with peak noise levels at 95 dB early in the morning inside the road side room with curtains and windows closed. Sources are cars, trucks, buses, motor bikes. Problems exists all over Waikiki. Poor standards.

The location is good, near to the bus stop, and easy to go shopping. The staff are friendly and helpful. The equipment is sufficient in room: microwave, dish, coffee, fridge, and a small balcony that you can sit there to view the mountain and river. Although the sound insulation is not very well, you might hear noises from the street. It is acceptable for me, and they also provide ear plugs. I have a nice stay here for 5 days with comfortable and clean room.

Good hotel, easy access to restaurants, bus routes. 10 minutes to Waikiki beach.Clean room, good service, friendly and helpful staff. Air conditioner noisy, but ear plugs provided. Nice to have continental breakfast provided.

The hotel was nice and clean overall, but I did spot a couple little roaches in our room. I really did not like that there was no free parking for guest, we had to pay $30 extra a day for it. But the staff was so friendly it made up for it! Great service!

This is a very nice hotel! It's in a great location, away from the crowded portions of Waikiki. The staff are WONDERFUL. In particular, I thought Jessica, Ronald, and Isaac (front desk) and Mike and Robert (valet/bell) were excellent -- so professional and friendly! Ronald was the man when it came to restaurants and trip directions. He tirelessly prepared so many trip directions for potential sites of interest, many of which I visited. Jessica had lots of great insights too and was very friendly and helpful. Isaac was the one who cheerily welcomed me with a card and personalized greetings, Hawaiian style! Mike was a great valet, as was Robert -- always had my car ready when needed. The variety of iced, fruit-infused water was great, as was the popcorn. The breakfast was good, but rather crowded. The lobby area was very nice and airy. The evening popcorn was great. The beach towels and chairs were a great addition. Some minor items for improvement:- the breakfast area gets very crowded. It might help to at least make the hours 6:30-9:00 or 6:00-8:30 instead of 6:30-8:30 so that some can beat the rush- the a/c control in the room is confusing and a directions sheet would be helpful- some of the bathroom cabinets don't close right and the lower shower knob didn't quite work.
