These should be tested out after each guest stay - the checkout staff were not half as good as the others mentioned above. They were professional but not particularly helpful. They were generally fine, but perhaps some consistent training might help. Overall, the Coconut Waikiki was a great place! I enjoyed my stay and would come back again.

The room was clean. The amenity was enough. There are nice restaurants near the hotel.The air conditioner is too near to the bed, so I had to wake up in midnight with cold wind.Anyway, it was comfortable stay in Waikiki.

Fantastic location close to town and next to the canal. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. View from balcony the canal and the mountains. The room very clean and comfortable bed. Good kitchen with a fridge and microwave and plates,bowls,glasses,mugs and cutlery all there for your use.

Enjoyed the staff recommendations, some great restaurants nearby. Great breakfast (fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast and waffle bar as well as juice, coffee and tea). Nice common space with games, outdoor seating area, small pool and gym. Not a bad walk to the shopping area and beach (10 min).

Great hotel, nice staff, clean and a great breakfast. Good spot for exploring Waikiki, Honolulu, Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head etc. One minor point during our stay was traffic noise. Traffic is quit loud.

Our family of four adults stayed one night at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel to break our long journey from NYC to Sydney Australia. We found the Coconut Waikiki to be an excellent choice for our stopover. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us beach towels to use on our quick walk to Waikiki beach for a refreshing swim. Snacks and cool drinks in the lobby when we arrived in the late afternoon were a welcome bonus as was the breakfast the next morning in the lovely outdoor terrace. The staff also arranged a set price taxi to take us back to the airport the next morning with only an hours notice. All in all, the staff made our stopover stress free and enjoyable.

I have been coming to this hotel since it was a Joie de Vivre, and before that a Best Western. It suits my needs, and there are good things, and some things that many would consider not quite good. Here’s the lists, you decide:Good: -From the front desk, to the cleaning staff, to the valet parking, everyone is super enthusiastic and very helpful, chock full of the Aloha spirit.-The front desk has free beach towels and (small) beach chairs for free. Just pick ‘em up, and return at the end of the day!-When I’m in paradise I don’t eat at the hotel breakfast, but it looks very well subscribed, and it’s good for grabbing a banana or Danish to tie you over till you get to “Eggs & Things.” In the afternoon they have ice tea, cucumber water and popcorn…really nice after a long day walking about Honolulu.-The parking is SO convenient. Compared to 20 min wait to valet park, or even self park, at the Hawaiian Hilton; at the Coconut you just drive up the ramp, and Mike’s always there to take the key. We called down just five minutes ahead each morning, and presto, our car was always there and waiting! (I’ve waited more than 30 minutes in that sea of cars at the Hilton!) Some people resent the $30/night valet parking…well, every boutique hotel costs around that, get over it!-The total cost, after all applicable taxes is literally half the cost of the Hawaiian Hilton! I completely understand if your goal was to come to Hawaii and look down at the beach, but you can also stay here and in less than 10 minutes, walk to the beach.-I recommend the mountain view side, worth the money. The view of the Trade Winds blowing the clouds over the mountains is truly hypnotic. Avoid the “city view”, it ‘s looking straight into an apartment complex. Also 5th floor and above are better because the street traffic from Ala Wai Blvd. is less noisy and bothersome.-The rooms come with a little bar sink, you cannot believe how great that is for getting ready when “her majesty” is monopolizing the bathroom sink.However:Having stayed here under two previous owners, I was hoping that now that the Coconut is an independent, that more things would be updated. Some of the nitpicks I’m going to list (or all in total) might be a deal breaker for you, but I feel obligated to let you know.-It says it has a pool, but it’s tiny, and right by the entrance with room for about four people to lay out.-In our room our dresser was showing its age, the drawers no longer shut easily or stay shut.-The louvered windows and sliding doors have not been replaced. Good double-paned windows would go SO FAR towards outdoor knocking down street noise. Also, in our room the control crank was broken on the end louvered window, and though it was closed, it was not cranked down tight. That, combined with the fact that the hallways are not air-conditioned (!), served to create a little venturi of hot air that would come in under the (fire mandated) gap on the door, over taxing the room AC unit.-And (in our room) the AC unit was a newer, smallish, home-type bedroom window undersized unit so it had to give its all every moment to keep the room cool. In the morning it’s no big deal, but at night it was way too loud! It would have been nice to have a decent hotel-sized commercial unit. (In fairness, others in our party happened to have a commercial grade unit in their room.) You know you're not be in for a quiet evening when management provides ear plugs ahead of time (see pic). The AC unit had a “Sleep mode” but neither that nor “Energy Saver” mode could keep up, so it was full blast all day and night.-Plus, the somewhat bad installation of the AC unit (see pic) left a small crack on one side which let out a lot of our precious cold air! -Also, when they installed the thru wall AC units, why did they not plumb the condensate line? This problem is so long standing that hanging out on the balcony is not a nice experience because of all the green algae on the tile growing from the constant runoff of the AC condensate. The rails have holes in them from the constant drip, drip. The staff know all about it, they have to put an umbrella over the valet stand to shed condensate from the 10 floors of balconies above. This drives me a little bit crazy, it wouldn’t be very expensive to fix!-The bath tubs have plastic PET liners in them, so they are nice and clean and white. BUT, they are sitting over steel tubs that over time have given way in places. As a result, you spend all your time in the shower being so careful, because a step over an unsupported section causes the whole tub to loudly pop in and then out, like the world’s biggest coke bottle if you step on the wrong spot!-When it was a Joy de Vivre hotel, it had the cutest aqua, blue, and blue-green color scheme that was so unique, and the cheerful colors just made you happy looking at it. I felt like I was somewhere different and special, I felt like I was in Hawaii! The new color scheme is now very conservative in brown, off-white, red and gold accents, but is a move in the wrong direction, so blah-h-h.Does that all sound bad? If this were a hotel in Paris the locals would give an incredulous glare and say what are you complaining about? So I would probably stay here again, but if (for you) these kinds of things outweigh the Good, you’ll have to go somewhere else…and pay more, and probably get less friendly service.

The Hotel is 10 minutes walking distance from beach. The rooms are clean and new renovated. Service is very friendly. Breakfast was good. Only negative was the loud traffic noise from the street. A good alternative for smaller budget.

Our family stayed here for 3 nights in their executive suite. The lobby is real cute and modern. The front desk was nice and helpful. Their free breakfast was real good. The small pool was nice and warm. The size of the pool didn't bother us since it was just us in the pool. There's games outside in the back where we played life size checkers and Jenga. Daily cleaning service was a plus (without requesting service). I say the only downsize was our room and the long walk to the beach (some parts of neighborhood is sketchy). Our executive suite was really roomy. The room had modern furniture but the room still look outdated with wall AC units. It also had an odd smell that I can't describe. The balcony is small and felt unsafe for my toddler. I think the building use to be condos. I'm not sure if I'll come back with my family here. We rather pay a little more to be closer to the beach. I recommend this place for older children or all adults. You definitely can't beat the rates here!

Overall this is a very good accommodation. The only minor criticisms are the breakfast self service area gets very crowded so the hotel should relocate the coffee and cutlery stations to free up space. Also the heated pool is to warm to be refreshing in the summer time.

We could only stay here for three days as we were flying on to another Hawaiin Island, but needed to visit Pearl Harbour and take in an Island Tour. The Coconut Waikiki hotel was in a good location and just a few minutes walk from the centre of Waikiki, and about 10 minutes from the beach. The hotel staff were really amazing, very friendly and so helpful. Breakfast was excellent, though would recommend either eating very early or leaving it till later as it does getting very busy between 7:30 - 8:00am. Hotel has a small pool and a few sun beds and chairs and provides free towels for guests. Eating out in Waikiki is wonderful and the choices are unlimited. Speak to staff for their recommendations and ask them to book for you, as we tried Dukes on beach front and were told that there was a 1 hour waiting time for a table.

We stayed here for 10 nights as part of our honeymoon. Great location, near shops, restaurants and a short walk from the beach. The staff made us feel welcome and were always very friendly and there to help. We will be staying here next time we visit.

This is a very nice hotel located in a perfect spot in the Waikiki area. Close to the beach, close to the Honolulu "Strip", tons of restaurants and activities within walking distance are just part of the reason to stay here. The main reason...the staff and the little things they offer. No need to bring your own beach towels, they supply them for you. Pineapple tea, cucumber-mint water, Orange-blueberry water every afternoon for you to drink, from 2pm to 6pm they have "hurricane" popcorn, this is a must to try! Anything you need or ask for, they are their to accommodate. Our group of 26 loved it there.

We had a great stay. Fabulous location and extremely helpful and friendly staff. We arrived early morning before check in time and reception were so kind in finding us a room that was ready. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and set us up for the day. Our two teenagers loved the free popcorn and the flavored waters- we also appreciated being able to make a cup of tea and coffee at any time. Nice touch with the coffee maker in the room as well and the fridge was great so we could store drinks and snacks.This isn't a five star property but is clean and the beds are very comfy. Our only 'minus' was that housekeeping was a bit hit and miss, with 4 people in one room it would have been nice to have 4 towels, 4 plates, 4 glasses etc etc ahead of time but that's a small complaint. We will stay here again on our next trip to Waikiki for sure.

With our 2 boys both young adults was our staying at the Coconut Hotel super. The room was clean and big enough for the 4 of us. The view at the mountains and the canal was great. The breakfast was simpel but oke. Eating outside in the morning was something extra.

In short, great staff and good place to stay. Location wise, around 5 minutes walk to the main street and there is a ABC store nearby for grocery shopping. Room wise, big enough for couples or family with one kid. People wise, always friendly and helpful.

We spent two nights at the Coconut Waikiki just before our wedding. I've been to Oahu on four previous trips but have never stayed in Waikiki. I have to say the and their amazing staff made a great impression and I would happily stay with them again. The hotel was clean, well maintained, and had all of the amenities you could wish for. Plus the hotel is close to everything so you really wouldn't need to rent a car if you're planning to stay local. A big thank you to the staff of the Coconut for making our stay so memorable and for the lovely bottle of wine in celebration of our wedding. We will be back.
user_name:
Denelle B
New York City, New York

review_body: I wanted to do something special for our 8th year anniversary. Duran Duran was in town, so we flew from Maui to Oahu. Since I don't know Honolulu/Waikiki very well, I relied on TripAdvisor to steer me in the right direction on a place to stay. Coconut Waikiki Hotel seemed to be highly recommended, so I booked us a couple nights. I mentioned our special anniversary occasion upon booking and they went way above and beyond to make our stay extraordinary! It started with a detailed reply from Jessica with a list highlighting points of interests and events happening during our stay. Then upon our early arrival, we were welcomed with aloha by Jessica and Silvia who gave us spot-on recommendations for nearby grinds to make our tummies happy while they were getting our room ready. Shootz, they really styled out our room! Everything was spectacular with special attention to all the little details. Not to mention the quality and generous amenities (included) like the breakfast buffet, comfort station, exercise room, pool, mid-day popcorn... You can't find exceptional service and value like this at the bigger, over-priced hotels. We were welcomed with personal attention during every interaction. I notice this kinda stuff because I have been in the hospitality industry ever since working in my dad's restaurant at age 11. If ever in Waikiki again, this will forever be our place to stay. A BIG mahalo to everyone that made our stay awesome!

Smaller hotel, great staff and breakfast made this a real treat. No bar or restaurant as such but a great place to stay. Rooms comfortable, beds great. Staff really helpful and very friendly. Location was excellent for trolley and city buses.

SUCH a CUTE place! It was our anniversary, and when we arrived they had us written up on the board wishing us a happy anniversary, so cute! Was greeted very warmly by reception, they accommodated us leaving our bags there as we arrived hours and hours earlier. Front desk was uber helpful and nice with bus route and Waikiki trolley explanations. We came back and checked in and our room was absolutely too cute, with rose petals and champagne! Our view was on 7th floor overlooking Ala Wai canal view, very pretty. Whole hotel remodeled and VERY cute and beachy, just exactly like the pics. They have 4-5 flavored chilled waters and teas and coffee downstairs at all times to drink, popcorn in afternoons to snack on, lobby tv/couches, continental breakfast with waffle maker and eggs too every morning, 24/7 workout room I used, small pool we used which was very cute, games outside, and a doorman. Our stay was fantastic. Had an iron and hairdryer in closet, we got the mini kitchen (small fridge, sink, microwave), had a pod espresso maker in room (super bonus points for that). Overall I would definitely stay here again. Within walking distance to everything to eat (IHop, ABC, etc etc good restos), and to beach.

Staffs were kind and friendly. And the room was neat and tidy. So, it was nice stay.But It was about 15minutes on foot to the beach. I felt a little far from the beach. So, once went to the beach, it was not easy returning to the hotel.

We thought the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. It was great you could take chairs and towels to the beach which was only a short walk away. However, the disappointing part of the stay was the lack of sleep we experienced. The road outside was very noisy and the air conditioning unit was also very noisy even though the staff sent someone to try to make it quieter. We tried using the ear plugs that were supplied but they didn't help a lot.
user_name:
Larry C
Nelson-Tasman Region, New Zealand

review_body: This hotel right on the canal was fantastic! The customer service was amazing and you can tell that people are genuinely happy to see you there. From emails a day prior to the awesome assorted tras and popcorn this hotel has so much to offer besides just the hotel room. Giant games were fun and the pool was warm and inviting. They even got my mom a gorgeous flower and chocolates for her birthday (the reason to be in Waikiki) I offered to pay but they told me not to worry about it! For the price and the size of our suite with 2 bathrooms it was incredible. This hotel has to be the best one I've ever stayed at in terms of service provided versus the price and value. I will be returning here! The location is far enough back from beach front to be quite and peaceful. The scenic Hawaii tv channel is something I need to have at home! I cannot say enough nice and happy things about this hotel other than - try you will enjoy not rating in one of those corporation based gigantic hotels. This boutique style one is my new thing!!! Five stars and more if I could!

Fantastic location. 15 minute walk to Wakiki Beach. Lots of bars and restaurants close by. Lovely amenities in the hotel. Had room overlooking Lewers St. so it was loud at night. Otherwise, a wonderful stay.

The title of my review says it all. So why not 5 stars? Just because I reserve these for those precious pearls one rarely finds. But the 4 stars are well earned. After a long flight we had a warm welcome and right away got some inside information on where to go when heading up north ( Thanks! It all worked out perfectly!). The room was spacious with two bathrooms for the four of us and extra coffee to get ankick-start the next day. Breakfast was surprisingly well asotted. From bacon&eggs to fresh fruit to croissants, they had it all. A quick dive in the pool and then off to the nearby stores and Honolulu beach. Since the hotel is so close to the old Royal Hawaiin, it's in a perfect spot for the best sttip of the beach. See you again next time around!

Staff was very accommodating. The room clean and comfortable. Very good laundry facilities. The hotel was within walking distance to the main part of Waikiki, including restaurants, beach and shopping.

My family truly enjoyed the friendly and welcoming environment we received at Coconut Waikiki Hotel. We were fortunate enough to spend time with Ronald Neri who is a local that will greet you at the front desk. Ronald meets all expectations of the hotel and goes above and beyond in treating you and your family with the most amazing hospitality. Ronald is a great representation of Hawaii and we will absolutely be returning for his great hospitality! Corpus Christi, TX

Coconut Waikiki Hotel would be the best little hotel in town if only the AC could be upgraded. It was very noisy and not terribly efficient. Other than that, we loved our stay mainly because of the staff. You have a wonderful team who made us feel so welcome and special. Congrats to them!

Great Value! It is very close to everything, you can walk into town for shopping and many restaurants. the rooms are quite comfortable and includes breakfast. Everyone that worked there was very friendly and helpful.

We stayed for a week, here a really pleasant place to stay , central location overlooking the canal and mountains , rooms were clean and tidy well equipped and we had breakfast included too .Plenty of choice to eat lobby got a little crowded some morns though , staff were very friendly and helpful overall a nice stay thanks

We've stayed at Cocnut Waikiki 3 times now. First time was under different ownership, and I was a little anxious that some of the charm would be lost. But under Great Western, the hotel has maintained it's boutique feel. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. Our room was lovely, facing the Ala WAi Canal. The breakfast buffet is ample, with great variety. Cool lemon, fruit infused water available always. I like that by being on the Canal side that the traffic and tourist noise is diminished. Excellence and affordabile.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki for just an overnight stay but must comment that all the staff were very accommodating and willing to go the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable. Jordan, our guest experience manager was amazing and worked with us to accommodate a last minute change so that we could fully enjoy our stay. Check in was smooth and the accommodations were modern and comfortable. The only reason this experience rating is not a 5 star is because of the lack of on-site parking, the street noise below and the air conditioner noise. I would certainly recommend this hotel for its staff and location.

We moved to this hotel after a week-long stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach resort. Price was almost half of what we paid at the Hilton, and yet we were impressed by the courteous friendly staff, clean rooms and the provided breakfast. There's a heated small but enjoyable swimming pool and the hotel itself is in close (walking) vicinity of all major Waikiki needs (busses / shops / restaurants / beach). The only minor niggle is that city life in Waikiki can be noisy and the windows do not block a lot of noise (as they're made to allow ventilation). Overall we highly enjoyed our stay in this hotel, and especially liked the very friendly staff and complimentarities (breakfast, coffee / tea / popcorn, etc.).

We recently (mid June) had a holiday in Hawaii for a week. We stayed in Coconut Waikiki Hotel. I must admit we were impressed with the warm welcome we received right from the arrival. As our flight landed very early, we requested for a possible early check in. Wayne and Lizzy who were at the counter were very responsive and without hesitation they arranged a couple of hours early check in.All the staffs were very nice and helpful. The location of the hotel is just what we wanted with beautiful lake front and very close to all the amenities and transports.We will recommend Coconut Waikiki Hotel to our extended family and friends

This Hotel is great for location with wonderful helpful staff, great breakfast and pool. Its down side is its very noisy on the roadside rooms we were in 608 and felt like at one stage I was sleeping on the street. I had to ask for ear plugs which the staff sent to our room.

There were small, personal touches that made this hotel stay more memorable than other staycations I've had. 1. The personal thank you card sent by the desk clerk simply for staying there.2. The local popcorn mix that was fun and whimsical. 3. The no-hassle towels, gym, beverage bar. 4. The decent Continental breakfast provided. The small things matter.

Coconut Waikiki had a block for my friend's wedding. Courteous, professional service, let us check in a bit early. Always clean and housekeeping did a good job. I was never up early enough for breakfast, but my husband tells me it was good. My only recommendation to the hotel would be to have breakfast end later than 8:30 so late sleepers on vacation can get some. That being said, the popcorn, drinks, and other services in the lobby were great.
user_name:
firecomrade
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great motel great people who nothing was any bother to them .Always seemed happy and one young door guy had a pernament smile from ear to ear which tends to make your day.Clean rooms great view towards canal and great free brekkie if all allows will be back!!

We arrived at 9am and were given access to our room straight away which was amazing. The hotel has had a nice refresh, Isaac was very helpful with directions and maps and general info. We also received a personal welcome letter on arrival which I thought a nice touch.Value for money this is the best I've found in Waikiki. Central, clean with spacious rooms, good amenities and friendly staff.If you're on a bit of a budget, I would suggest this is a great option.

we stayed there for 2 night and the Hotel was very clean, friendly professional staff and they always gave a warm smile and were happy to be working for the Hotel and the guest. Smaller boutique hotel close to all the action. they let us use towels and beach chairs for the beach at no cost. Breakfast is also nice. I understand they are rated in the top 10 for Waikiki Hotels. Thank you.

Hello, My in-laws just stayed at this hotel end of June. Can I just say how great this hotel is? They were celebrating their 60th b-day and 40th wedding anniversary and the hotel went above and beyond! They wrote their names on the marquee, they had wine and treats upon arrival and a room with a great view of the channel! Pros: close to beach, free breakfast that they said was great!, games in lobby, daily activities (ukelele lessons), free chairs for Beach use! Free popcorn and tea in the evening! Cons: zero cons honestly Do yourself a favor, stay here the rooms are clean, close walk to everything, staff was friendly, clean pool, amenities are great!! Will recommend to everyone!!  Thank you Coconut Waikiki!!!My in-laws had a great time! The manager is top notch and wonderful!!

We had a very good stay there. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They called you by name and always inquired to how your day was. We knew in advance of the parking and this seems to be commonplace for many areas so we were not surprised or disappointed by it. They provided towels and chairs to use at the beach and found answers for any questions you may have had. The only disadvantage was the breakfast area. It would be great if the area was a little larger but other than that, I would stay there again and recommend it to everyone.
user_name:
cathy m
North Kansas City, Missouri

review_body: I will start off by saying, this hotel was very good to us. After our booking was made we realised we had made a mistake and switched the wrong months into our booking (June-July). We immediately sent an email, and they got back to us very quickly to let us know that they had updated the booking request even though they usually wouldn't allow it. This saved me heaps of money from potentially losing the booking. Prompt and excellent service. The hotel itself is located in a nice part of Waikiki, away from the major hustle and bustle whilst being close enough to walk practically everywhere. Easy public transport nearby too. Fantastic breakfast and complementary popcorn in the afternoon and beach towels/chairs available too. Pool could've used a clean but still nothing to complain about. It was also heated! All in all a great place to stay.

We stayed here for two nights before going on our cruise. This was an unexpectedly lovely hotel. Every member of the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. As we arrived, we noticed the ramp in front of the hotel is very steep. We just mainly used the steps. The hotel was close and central to much of Waikiki. We could walk to the beach in 10 minutes and to many of the restaurants and shops. The front lobby is bright and sunny. The couches were modern and comfy. I loved the two long tables for breakfast. The hotel provides free continental breakfast. This includes eggs, toast, pastries, cereal, milk, juices, waffles, yogurt, and fresh fruit. In the afternoon, they provide flavored water and ice tea. We loved being able to fill our water bottles before heading out. The bed was comfy and the room clean. We would definitely be back.
user_name:
MyPinkTeacup
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel locates in an excellent location. However, it didn't have self-parking, so I had to use valet parking which cost me $30 per night. The staff told me I could park on the street, but it was always full. The staff was great though.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place to my friends and family. The only disadvantage was the parking. A family member came to visit me and it was difficult for her to find parking in that area. It took her 20 minutes to find a parking spot.

We can't fault our recent stay at the Coconut Waikiki. The building and room was exceptionally clean, the facilities were great and the location was easy walking distance to everything we needed. The best part was the staff. Everyone was super friendly and helpful-particularly Wayne, Ronald and Isaac. They went above and beyond to help us with information and were even able to retrieve my bathers that had blown off our balcony and into a 5 storey tall palm tree! Wayne was also fantastic with our daughter and would say hi to her by name. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

We had a week in Waikiki at the Coconut hotelStaff were great, very helpful if we needed anything. Ronald had some great suggestions for food eating places. Two favourites were Heavenly and the Eating House. We hired bikes and went round Diamond Head. We took a bus round the Island. We swam in the beautiful warm sea.We shopped until we dropped. It was busy but very relaxing too. Hint: stay on the mountain side of Coconuts as it is a bit noisy on the river side but up upgrading is in the pipeline for double glazing windows so we were told. Also no added extra taxes at coconuts total bonus.

We stayed for 3 nights at the Coconut Hotel, Waikiki in June. It was our first trip to Hawaii and I usually do my own bookings on the internet however, the prices were so inordinate that I went to the travel agent for advice. Alas, she missed the mark. We discovered we were looking for something like the Hilton Village or Moana Outrigger so the Coconut came as a disappointment. While the Executive Suite was spacious and clean it and the hotel are pretty dated (especially in the bathroom). The corridor outside our room smelled of mould or some such. The breakfast was both free and a free-for-all. I advise you eat elsewhere. But our main gripe was the noise from outside. Ear plugs had been provided in anticipation. Even so the noise level every night was incredible - so be warned! Lewers Street is a fairly seedy area too. On a positive note the staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable too but would I return to this hotel? Afraid not.
user_name:
Peter B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed there a couple of years ago. January 2015. Couple os blocks off the beach right across from the Ala Wai Canal. People were wonderful. Breakfast was free and very good. Valet parking was efficient. Room was upgraded without asking. Going back this winter and may stay there again. Wife likes to try different places.

The people were great, the location is GREAT (only a block from the ocean and super close to tons of restaurants, bars, shops, and anything you could ask for. The only cons I can think of are 1) the pool is small but we aren't pool people when such beautiful beaches are around, and 2) the continental breakfast is not very good but it's free so what can you expect. Overall, we had a great stay and I'd highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the Waikiki Beach area.

We had a great stay at this centrally located hotel. Our time on Oahu was made exceptionally better thanks to Ronald at reception who gave us a huge amount of suggestions and advice on the best things to do on the island. I would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to friends going later in the year.

We have recently stayed at the Coconut at Waikiki. Front staff are lovely and hotel is a little gem in amongst the bigger name hotels. Clean rooms with every amenity. It has a heated pool and they provide towels and chairs for the beach even. Only downside is the air con was a little noisy. Definitely would stay there again. Great little bars and eateries close by.

I just happened upon this gem of a hotel quite by accident. We received a welcome email from the Jordan the day before our arrival, asking if there was anything he could help with. When we checked in Ronald also gave us a very nice handwritten note. We were in Honolulu for my husband's surgery at Kaiser, not a fun trip. I was alone most of the time I was there but the staff took very good care of me. From the front desk guys, Ronald, Wayne and Isaac, each one without fail made me feel like family. The valets Mike and Robert who asked everyday how my husband was doing. The breakfast buffet was taken care of by Shadelle, who kept the food flowing with a smile on her face, even with some rude guests. I don't know how she did it! Excellent staff!The hotel itself is very welcoming and clean. The room I had was spotless, had everything I needed - refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, sink, dishes, silverware and a nice table to sit at. A small balcony overlooking the canal was perfect for my morning coffee.They have free popcorn in the lobby and 4 different flavors of refreshing water, 24 hr coffee and tea service. A nice pool and a gym.I can’t say enough about the staff and the excellent customer service that make you feel like ohana.If you want to see true Aloha stay at this hotel.We will be staying here again and again.

We only stayed one night (literally 8 hours!) since we were on our way to another island. The location seemed good, restaurants within walking distance.The room was very decently-sized, with a beautiful view. The staff at the front desk were helpful and called us a very early morning cab to the airport. Also, reasonably priced! We appreciated that since everything in Hawaii seems to be insanely expensive!

The staff were very pleasant and courteous. It was our anniversary the day after our late arrival and they took care of ordering roses for my wife with very short (same day) notice (Wayne and Isaac at front desk). Free Continental breakfast was pretty typical hotel fare (waffles, cereal, etc). Rooms were well maintained and clean. Valet parking was prompt and efficient.

We received a welcome email from the concierge the day before our arrival, and on our arrival they knew who we were without saying our name. Ronald gave all the info we needed and after arriving in our room rang to see if everything was ok. The room was what was expected with a lanai and view of the canal, very clean and hot water instantly in the shower. They have a "popcorn happy hour " from 2-6pm in the foyer and 4 different flavours of refreshing water. Water with lemon, one with apples, one with peaches and a mint flavour. Nice and cold to drink after coming back from a big day at Waikiki. There are two lifts and no waiting to get to your room. Very quiet room facing the street with no traffic noises. I would recommend Coconut Waikiki and note that it is 10 minute walk from the beach. It is on Lewers Street with lots of eating places and well situated.

Picked this hotel mainly based on the good reviews here and it did not disappoint. Great value especially when compared to the hotels located on the beach side and let's be fair, 10mins walk to get there through shops doesn't even feel like a walk (at least, that's what my girlfriend used to tell me...;)).All staff are super friendly, free iced tea and soda as well as popcorn is served during afternoon hours and the hotel even has its own little pool. You also can rent beach towels and chairs for free.We booked a room facing the canal and mountains which boasts great views from the balcony, but was not exactly quiet at night. I guess, the higher up your room, the better.All in all, definitely a place I can highly recommend and would stay again at.

Our stay at the hotel was very good. The staff was very helpful from pointing out the nearest restaurants upon our arrival to storing our backpacks for a few hours before our transportation to the airport picked us up. The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast buffet needs some improvement. The coffee was poor, the mini danish were stale and the orange juice was sour.

Stayed here for 8 nights and was not disappointed! After a looooong flight from Australia we had booked two rooms and arrived before the check in time at the hotel. They advised us that only one room was ready at that stage and would we like to get in it until the second one was ready also. This was very much appreciated as we were hanging for a nap and a hot shower.The staff were VERY accommodating. They confirmed some tours for us that we had booked and even included a little map of meeting places etc for the tours. The room was nice. Good quality bed, TV, bathroom etc and we were upgraded to a mountain view which was beautiful!After reading the reviews about the free breakfast I was a bit concerned about it but I didn't have to be. There was always plenty to eat and while it's not a huge variety, it's free and has all the basic stuff you could want or need to get you through till lunch.The only reasons I marked this hotel 4 out of 5 was because while the breakfast is good it's only from 630-830 so if you want a free feed you have to be up early or you'll miss out. The other thing was the yoghurt is left out on the bench as opposed to being kept refrigerated and as such I ended up getting food poisoning after eating it and was sick for the next 48 hours. Why something like dairy isn't better kept is beyond me but then again maybe I just had bad luck.The room also had panel windows I assume to let in fresh air etc but this also lets in a lot of street noise.Overall I would stay again in a heartbeat. The hotel is in the perfect location and is great!

The staff are so welcoming and friendly, and they really go out of their way to make their guests feel special. The hotel is clean and has a nice modern decor. There are also a lot of little perks, like complimentary popcorn and fruit-infused waters, and the ability to make your own waffles for breakfast.Parking is valet-only, but very fast and the same price as self-parking at the big lots near the beach.

So this hotel is not on the beach and you will have to walk a few blocks to get to the beach. However I greatly enjoyed many small details that made this a wonderful stay. My room had a kitchenette complete with microwave fridge dishes coffee pot sink etc. in the lobby there is hot coffee and hot tea and a variety of infused iced water available 24 hours a day. They serve popcorn in the afternoon in the lobby. Breakfast is listed as "continental" but I would say it's "continental plus". With S nice variety of fruits, pastry, eggs, waffles and cereal. I haven't had a balcony overlooking the mountains. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful anytime I needed anything. They will provide beachtowels for your outings and trips to the beach. There are many shops and restaurants in walking distance. And while many of the tour agencies do not pick up at this hotel they will pick you up from a hotel within a block or two.

Wow, what a wonderful hotel! Mahalo to all the staff for making our stay so wonderful and enjoyable! Your hospitality, warmth and kindness is much appreciated! This small boutique hotel was just what we were looking for. With breakfast and wifi included, it was a very short walk to the shops and the beach.

I was having trouble finding an economical hotel in Waikiki and came across the Coconut Hotel. The staff in addition to extra offerings like round the clock water/tea/coffee and afternoon popcorn were a hit!

Chose this hotel on Agoda, for a quick one night in transit - very impressed with decor, location, vibe and helpfulness of staff - outdoes any of the 'big names' by a mile in terms of being personable. Will definitely be staying here again next time passing through Waikiki

I stayed here on a business trip. The hotel is in a good location to walk anywhere one needs to go in Waikiki. Good facilities. A fair amount of families, so good for them. Nearby good restaurants and bars. Traffic can be noisy at night and morning, and I wore earplugs to sleep.

If you are looking for a place that does not need to be on the water, this is it. A small 5 star service hotel with tons of amenities and friendliness. Ronald at the front desk went above and beyond to suggest places to visit and eat. He also called ahead to secure reservations and transportation. Hotel was clean. Offered 24 hr complimentary NA beverages. Breakfast was decent and included as well. I would stay here again with no concerns.

The hotel is very well presented and quite well located within the heart of Waikiki. The staff were all courteous and friendly, accommodating my young family and myself. Our room and amenities were great and gratis popcorn and tasty drinks in the hotel lobby was definitely and extra not expected but greatly appreciated. We cannot thank the staff enough for making our stay warm and welcome. PS, a special thanks to the staff for finding our babies blanket we had accidentally left behind after our checkout, keep up the great work!

Our first time staying here and definitely not our last. From the time we arrived and checked in until we checked out we had awesome customer service! Our room (executive suite) was big, with a king size bed and fluffy pillows. We also had a sofa with a pull out bed. Our room came with a microwave, mini fridge and complimentary coffee and tea. Every morning in lobby there was a continental breakfast and in the afternoon there was a popcorn station which my kids enjoyed. Hotel has a nice pool, bbq are and gym room. The best part of our stay was the amazing customer service. Thank you Wayne, Isaac and all the staff at the Coconut Waikiki!

Loved everyone and everything associated with this Hotel. Highly recommend the Coconut Waikiki to anyone traveling to Honolulu. The staff are amazing and extremely friendly and helpful. Our hotel experience was an absolute highlight of our holiday.

We stayed here for 2 nights on a stop over to LA. The hotel exceeded expectations for the price. The room was spotless, modern and had comfortable beds with massive fluffy pillows. It included a fridge and microwave. The lobby area is lovely which includes a games and continental breakfast area. Popcorn is available from 2-6pm which delighted the kids. They also enjoyed the pool. There is a well equipped gym too. Outside is a large BBQ area and utensils and plates are available on request. Everyone gets a personal welcome on the notice board which also includes weather info, tips on local sites and a Hawaiian word of the day. The best part was the fantastic customer service provided! Thanks Ronald! Everything is a short walk from the hotel with the trolley car stop just around the corner. A fantastic place to stay.
user_name:
Amanda2281
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The service was awesome, very friendly and helpful. The room is very clean. Location is strategies, close to nice shopping center and 3 block from beach. Cleanliness and service was the features that we like most. The only thing we didn't like was the noise from the street that happened sometimes around 5:30 in the morning till around 10:00 in the evening.

All what we would expect from such hotel have been realized. Lobby service was perfect, room was clean and amenities were enough. A valet service is also proposed by the hotel and we appreciated because it is difficult to park his own car at Waikiki. The hotel is close to the beach by walking. I recommend this hotel for a cool stay at Honolulu in Waikiki.

Great welcome at reception, even late at night. Good location not far from the shops and restaurants, looks out over the canal, only a 10 minute walk to the beach. Only a small pool (which is slightly heated) but big enough? Great room very comfortable, air conditioner is loud but you get used to it. Continental breakfast which is a great way to start the day and makes it ease not having to look for breakfast first up, free coffee and tea all day. All the staff were very helpfull and friendly and we would definitely stay at the Coconut again.
user_location: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand
user_name:
JackieandMunch
Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand

review_body: Compared to other hotels in the area, this hotel was perfect for our needs at a lower price. It was more than I expected, good location, friendly staff and very comfortable beds. The breakfast was excellent and had an outdoor dining area which we took advantage of.

Me and my friend had a fantastic stay. This hotel is great. We had a huge room (executive suite king), which was clean and comfortable. We even got an e-mail before arrival with information and the offer to ask questions. Noise: as it is Waikiki, it is lively. You hear the sound of the street, but nothing more. It was as quiet as possible, and I had a wonderful sleep. Location: It is not first row, but beach is close ( short walk). Lots of good restaurants and a lot of shops are quiet close. Staff is nice and helpful. My friend and I really enjoyed this stay. I can really recommend this hotel. Thank you coconut Waikiki for a wonderful stay.

Our room faced the canal. Great view! The customer service is excellent. The breakfast offers typical free breakfast fare The rooms are very clean. Kuerig coffee maker, microwave, and fridge. Walking distance to all popular tourist spots. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel just for one night. We were amazed how charming this little hotel was. We loved the graphic and art design of the hotel and everything was nice and clean. We will be back for sure!

While the hotel is what you would expect from a small boutique hotel, there are a few things that pull down my review. The pool is extremely small, basically a large hot tub. And while there is a small, adequate gym, the downfall is that people are constantly coming in and out just to refill their water bottles, which gets to be annoying and disruptive. If management would just add a water filter machine in the lobby, this will solve the problem. Free continental breakfast is nice, but consist of just a waffle maker, yogurt, associated toppings, and cereal. Location is a little farther from the main strip and beach, but it's just a short walk to a number of restaurants and the new International Market.

Rooms were nice. Air conditioner very loud, so we slept with ours off at night. Good location and not far from the beach or shops. Nice breakfast and friendly staff. We felt it was good value for money.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Although we did not ask for it, we were pleasantly surprised that our room had an amazing mountain view. We were on the 6th floor. We slept comfortably. The sound of traffic outside was not a problem at all. I didn't hear a lot of honking, no rowdy pedestrians. We got a good night's sleep every night. The next morning, complimentary breakfast was provided in the lobby. The staff was super friendly and very helpful.

We enjoyed staying at Coconut Waikiki Hotel. Service was very good. The staff always gave that little extra, and the popcorn was very appreciated by our kids. Breakfast was OK, and the location very good. Value for money and service were great!

really convient !Because it is our honey moon vocation, we also got a card to congratulate us, let us feel so kind.And there is a microwave oven and refrigerator in the room,and serve free coffee 24 hrs.

We really were not expecting something this great for their offered price. My wife and I got the corner room with a great view. We really recommend to anyone trying to find a great place for a low budget.

My friend and I have just got back from holiday at Coconut Waikiki Hotel. We both had a amazing time, the bed was comfy, the room was clean and the customer service was superb! No matter what time of day it was, the staff were always happy to help answer our questions and ring around for us for whatever we needed. When we made the booking, we requested a room on a high level with a view- and we got a room on the top floor with a amazing view which was fantastic! Love this hotel and will definitely be back!!

Staff service exceeded my needs. Prior to my arrival, the hotel's Senior Guest Experience Manager got in touch to give me some tips about the weather, food, shopping and let me know about the hotel's amenities. During my stay, all staff were friendly and accommodating and happily answered any of my questions and requests.The room was simple and tidy. There was noise floating up from the street. Earbuds were provided, however, the noise did not bother me so I didn't use them. I used the gym a couple times during my stay, very simple equipment, but it easily suited my needs. I also used the self-service laundry while I was there. This was handy, especially after getting sweaty using the gym and from hiking the nearby Diamond Head Trail.The location of the hotel is handy to transport and the beach was only a few blocks away. Most tours don't pick-up from this hotel, but the nearest collection point is only a short walk away. I would happily stay here again when visiting this island.

My partner and our friends (another couple) stayed at Coconut for 4 nights. We found the service to be fantastic, and they did all they could to accommodate us.Prior to arrival we received an email from one of the customer service managers asking if we had any special requests they could try to accommodate. This was great as it prompted us to request adjoining/close rooms.On our arrival we were told they did not have any rooms available that were close however the penthouse was vacant so they upgraded us to the two bedroom suite. We were very surprised and grateful for this gesture!The penthouse was spacious and great to share with full kitchen and washer/dryer. Would have been handy to have some washing powder in the room so we could easily do a load of washing though.Our bedroom was good although the position of the AC meant it blew directly on our bodies so it was impossible to have a comfortable night sleep with it on. We had to open our bedroom door and put the AC on in the lounge so it would blow into our room. The pillows were also enormous and if you like a flat pillow like me, BYO. I ended up using the couch cushion as a bed pillow as my neck was aching. They did not have any other pillows in the hotel to offer.Breakfast was great - a continental with cereals, toast, eggs, juice, waffles etcOverall location was great, only 10 min walk to everything. Although our bedroom had a few downsides the friendly and accommodating staff made up for it.

Small hotel and very friendly service. Good facilities. Continental Breakfast was great. Service desk was helpful. Only issue was rattling air con unit that spat out water outside and fell into the outside tables.

The hotel was ok but very expensive. In most other cities around the world a hotel like this would be half the price or even less. That said, accommodation, dining and drinking is very expensive all over Honolulu.

all of the staff were so welcoming and answered any questions we had! each day there was a small frame at the front desk that gave info on their favorite things to do and eat in hawaii.. it led us to a few amazing restaurants and beaches! the hotel provided a personal touch on everything.hotel room:the room was clean, very roomy, and super comfortable. we were on the side facing the street so i can see complaints about it being noisy, but the hotel provided earbuds in the room if you wanted it. we didnt mind the noise. there was a welcome card personally addressed to us and they provided anything we needed.other services:valet was $30 a night. there is free street parking but it was rarely if ever open. there are meters but we didnt feel like putting in coins every 2 hours. they made it really convienent for us. they offer complimentary breakfast but we didnt take advantage of it because there were so many food places we wanted to try! though it looked really good and it was always busy in the morning! even with all the beaches in oahu, we decided to try the pool for a few hours.. it was soo warm and perfect! they also have popcorn daily and flavored water/tea in the lobby.location:i loved this location vs. being right next to the beach. we oftne traveled all over oahu to take advantage of our time here, so it was convenient for us to be near the wakiki beach/shopping area (walking distance in my opinion) when we wanted to be but also able to get out of the city without getting into too much traffic. i despised driving near that beach area with all the tourists/pedestrians and parking troubles. we honestly felt like we got the most bang for our buck at this hotel! we would definitely stay again whenever we come back to this island!

Great staff, good breakfast, and comfortable room. My fiance and I spent a week in Waikiki. The hotel is near the strip and two beaches. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that would like to save money by not being directly on the beach.

Coconut Waikiki Hotel is within easy walking distance to the beach and zoo. While older the 10 story building is well maintained and spotless. Indoor and outdoor breakfast buffet area and free cold ice tea and other drinks and Hurricane popcorn in afternoon were excellent. They offer garage parking and organize shuttles and taxis. Best of all was the very kind and competent reception staff: all but Silvie who gave each guest a personal note in pretty handwriting and Lizzie were particularly attentive. Definitely would stay here again.

Good and supportive staff, with average breakfast and good rooms but noisy street next to hotel, reception was very helpful and answered all questions and request for travel and transport. Used also cloth cleaning, with support of hotel staff was ok

A great place , handy to everything , very good breakfast and great staff service from staff was outstanding . They new the area very well and went the extra mile to help Would certainly stay there again .

Coconut Waikiki has a friendly staff that is always helpful. It is conveniently located near lots of shops and a short walk to the beach. One perk of staying here was the laundry facility. They were also able to hold our bags since we had a late flight our last day.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room had everything you need and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Housekeeping was good.If we came back to Hawaii I would use this hotel again.

This hotel is absolutely wonderful. When I first checked in, the staff were friendly, helpful, and let me know that my room had been upgraded from a City Suite to an Executive room. But what really made my day/week/month was when they told me "my request had been accomodated."Let me explain:When I booked the hotel room, I wrote a silly request under the "notes" section. "Could you please build me a pillow fort? I'll tell all my friends. It would make my day."Submitted the reservation and thought,"This is silly, I'm an adult woman asking for a pillow fort. Of course they won't do this."YES, THEY DID.This pillow fort was glorious. Made from a ton of fluffy pillows and a 2X4, with a lovely sign that said "Welcome to Fort Coconut" on the front. It was like sleeping in heaven. On top of this and attentive people, I had a handwritten letter on the desk in my room thanking me for stopping by. I had the time of my life. Whenever I return to Hawaii, this is the only hotel for me.If you're looking for the best time ever, stop here. You'll never want to leave.

Was looking for an affordable place to stay for a few nights after disembarking from our cruise of the Hawaiian islands. What a find! Staff was so very helpful and friendly. Renovations were beautifully done, rooms were very spacious and clean. Also, so handy that they had washers and dryers that we could use for a small fee after getting off the cruise ship. Traffic noise was a minor issue in early evening but not an issue at night when sleeping. Also, only had a window air conditioner rather than central air but the air conditioning worked great so no complaints. Location was fantastic, only a 2-5 minute walk and you were in the heart of Waikiki beach shops and restaurants. Shuttles to airport can be easily arranged to pick you up and drop you off at the hotel. We easily took a bus out to Pearl Harbour to see the sights. Highly recommend this hotel.

I have read many positive review of this hotel and I confirmed it. I'm very satisfied to choose this hotel. Location is great, safe and easy to go to anywhere. Room is spacious, clean and comfortable. Free wifi is strong. Complimentary breakfast has good selection, if adding bacon or sausages, that will be better. Staffs were super helpful and friendly (Staffs...You all are wonderful! Thank you). I will certainly return and highly recommond this place.

Stayed here for one night when connecting to another island. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room had great energy. Whilst the location is a bit of walk to the beach, the price reflects that. Would definitely go back and stay longer.

Not really anything bad to say about our stay here . Excellent customer service from booking via emails right thru to our last day actually was sad to leave ! Lovely breakfast included in the hotel price . Room was spacious and clean , with daily room service . Location slightly back off Main Street which I liked as not so busy but still within a 5minute walk to beach , shops etc . We stayed here for 6 days then went to another well known resort and have to say that resort left a lot to be desired compared to the coconut . Would like to thank all the staff that we dealt with at the coconut for their service. Only downside to this hotel was that we couldn't use the balcony as the air conditioner from above rooms were leaking onto our story making everything wet unfortunately as the view from the balcony was amazing and would've liked to enjoy sitting out there . But overall 10 out of 10 . Would book here for our next visit

I was so happy we stayed at the Coconut for our honeymoon in Waikiki. A great location on the canal to have a view of some body of water, as most Waikiki hotels aren't even on the beach anyways. A short walk to the beach, and they provide towels and chairs to bring along. Continental breakfast was extensive and much more than we needed/expected! Staff were excellent and very helpful, and there were many added little touches we appreciated-chalk board greeting, daily fancy water and popcorn snacks in the lobby. Room was very clean as well which was most important to me! Overall great stay and value considering how expensive Waikiki can be! Thank you Coconut!

Great place, great location and awesome staff. We stayed for 5nights. Its super central for discovering Waikiki beach and Honolulu. And the people are just lovely! We had a great time and the free Popcorn in the afternoon was just the icing on the cake

The hotel is nice, not far from the sea and the city center. The staff was kind and smiling. There was coffee,water and ice tea during the day and pop corn during the afternoon..lovely idea!! I was at the second floor, the room was a bit noisy, but I sleep well.Thank you to all the staff!

We only spent 2 nights in Honolulu but we loved to stay at the Coconut Beach Hotel. Good continental brekfast, friendly staff and few minutes walk from waikiki...just enough distance to not feel the crowd even being in thr middle of the action. Excellent value for money.

This hotel is great in Waikiki which can be an expensive place to stay. It was reasonably priced compared to others in town, included breakfast and was within walking distance of the main strip. The room was large and had a kitchenette too. There was also a small pool, gym and washer/dryer. The pool isn't for sunbathing but with the Hawaiian beaches around you don't need it to be. Front reception staff very knowledgable and helpful...

A lovely hotel for our pre-cruise stay in O'ahu. 10 minutes from the beach, this hotel is situated with mountain and city views.Upon arriving we were upgraded to a mountain view room which was nice. The room was very clean and spacious with coffee making facilities and air con. The breakfast was very nice with scrambled eggs, make your own waffles, coffee and other continental items.We found the check in staff both friendly and informative and we even had a personalised welcome card from the front desk manager. Our only comment would be that our room was very noisy and the hotel should look to invest in double glazing or sound proofing. The air con also was very loud. It's a shame, as the rest of the hotel,facilities and staff were amazing. Given all that we would still highly recommend this hotel.

Currently staying and writing this review, we could not be happier.... relaxing, close, breakfast and the sweetest staff !!!!!!!! We are holidaying from Australia and expect clean up to date. This is exactly what we got,great staff,Beautiful breakfast yay

Great service. People were very friendly and the facilities were good. Good access to the beach area as well. The only very small thing to be improved is, the breakfast area is rather small in the peak breakfast time.

We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of May and cannot praise it highly enough. The hotel is clean, fresh and tidy; our room overlooked the canal and mountains and was very spacious. It's a 15-20 minute walk from the beach and you can walk along the main shopping road past all the malls and restaurants on the way. There are also bus stops on the corners which offer services for a lot of routes around the island making it easy to get around.The staff were exceptional throughout our stay, everyone was friendly and welcoming. When you returned to the hotel each day they asked how your day was but you could tell it was because they were genuinely interested in what you go up to, and they were always on hand to offer advise and share their knowledge of the island to make sure you get the best out of your stay.

We had a wedding ceremony in Oahu in May 2017. Most of our guests were hospitalized in this hotel. The hotel was excellent in terms of the service, breakfast and customer experience. We have strongly recommended this hotel to our other friends. The only issue is the pillows that are too thick and not enough elastic, which should be improved in the future.

All was very good but room faced a noisy street. Service excellent particularly Isaac. Location was near the action which was desirable. Good complimentary breakfast. Liked having washer and dryer on site

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Coconut Waikiki. The staff were delightful: very helpful and kind. Rooms were spotless and comfortable. Yummy coffee in the room. Excellent complementary breakfast in the hotel foyer.

In line with the comments found here, this hotel is really good and the service is outstanding. The breakfast is a plus but changing it maybe some days would be a good idea. It is good start for the day but the same all days.Otherwise we are impressed with everything.

The coconut hotel is a nice and clean hotel, located 5 min walk to the Waikiki shopping areas and 10min walk to the beach. The breakfast was nice - everything needed for a good breakfast. A pretty cool with free popcorn in the afternoon.

The room allocated to us was more than adequate for three people. We had just come off a cruise so the size of the room compared to the one on the boat was huge. The room had a nice view of the nearby river. The location is good, close to the Royal Hawaiian Centre. The staff were excellent, very polite, friendly and helpful. They made our short stay in Hawaii worthwhile. Wouldn't mind returning one day.

After arriving after midnight were checked in quickly to spacious rooms. Breakfast was time limited 6-30 to 8-30 so only just got down in time. But the staff were really friendly and helpful always greeted you with a genuine aloha and a smile. The only downside​ is occasionally traffic noise if your a light sleeper.

I reserved a room with with 2 double beds, and it came with a microwave, large fridge, and kitchen counter area. The beds were comfortable and bathroom quite nice. )I believe the hotel had recently been renovated.) We were on the top floor and had a view of the canal from a small lanai. The window air conditioner was a little noisy at first, but aren't they all? The hot/cold free continental breakfast was perfect to begin our day. Hurricane popcorn was served later in the afternoons and cold beverages were available 24 hours/day. The pool, though smaller in size, was perfect for my end of the day swims! The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. When I needed to request my car, from their garage, it arrived within a couple of minutes (at any time of day). I am truly looking forward to my son's graduation next year when the entire family can return to celebrate.

I stayed at the Coconut Waikiki for about a week and it was a really nice place to stay. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff and the breakfast was included and really good - with fresh fruit, yoghurt, etc. Healthy and good. It's in a good location. I preferred to have a room in the back of the hotel which was quieter and the staff were really accommodating with any needs. The only thing which was slightly difficult was the noise from traffic, but since I stayed at the back part of the hotel, that was really helpful. The front desk also has ear plugs I think which they give out (I guess for those staying on the view side of the hotel where traffic noises are more frequent) but I had my own and didn't need them.

This place is quaint, cute, economical, snd off the beaten path about 5 blocks from the beach among apartment buildings. It's one of the few places that offer free breakfast and no resort fees. They do charge for parking. They have the friendliest staff I've ever met. They have free popcorn, use of free beach chairs and use of free beach towels, along with water and tea all day. They have a guest laundry for $2.50 and sell laundry supplies for a dollar. Understand, it's old and things fall apart, but they come right up and fix them when you call. We had trouble with the shower, the toilet paper holder and the patio door, but they all got fixed. Your room will not get cleaned and towels replaced unless you ask. There's a kitchenette with a sink, microwave and refrigerator. The beds are comfortable and we slept very well, but we had to keep the air conditioner on 60 in order to cool the room. If you are expecting spectacular, this isn't your hotel. If you can deal with a few minor hiccups and the reality of life, you will enjoy this place alot. We did!

fMy husband and I stay here for ten days and would definitely stay here again. The service was great, staff was very responsive when we needed anything. The valet service was quick and courteous. Breakfast was great. Popcorn and special drinks were fun every afternoon. We loved the fact that this hotel provided beach towels and chairs at no additional cost. Loved the room decor as well - very light and beachy feeling.

This hotel is very conveniently located and the price is right. It is near to some great restaurants. It is clean, comfortable, and quiet. If you have a car it is easy to get to all roads leading out of Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. The room we had was very, very spacious with a kitchenette, bathroom and additional powder room. The bed was very comfortable, and would have been great to sleep in - had we of been able to get a good night sleep. The windows and door seals allow the noise from the street below in and it is UNBELIEVABLY noisy on a weekend. Part of the windows are louvred and I checked on more than one occasion, as I was sure the window or sliding doors were open. The staff are friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is basic and a little repetitive, but certainly adequate and beats paying top dollar for breakfast on the street. The popcorn machine is a nice touch in the afternoon. Although complimentary don't be fooled, as they do charge a $20 per night "resort fee" which pretty much negates the complimentary items.The hotel is close enough to the action and easy to find. Perhaps if we had a room on the other side of the building the noise may not have bothered us. We considered asking to be moved and in hindsight we should have, but hate to be a nuisance. Overall not too bad a place to stay, we just left exhausted from little sleep.

We had a great stay at the Coconut Hotel. The staff were fantastic - warm, courteous and so helpful. They gave some great recommendations and a personal greeting on the chalk board when we arrived was a nice touch. They have some nice amenities - breakfast daily which although mostly continental had scrambled eggs and fresh made waffles too. We used the pool alot more than we thought we would, it was slightly heated which was so relaxing after walking around Waikiki all day. Fresh made popcorn in the afternoons and tasty flavoured water too. Rooms were basic but very clean, great air-con, well-equipped kitchenette with comfy beds and pillows and ours had a superb balcony view over the canal. Thanks Team Coconut, we would def stay again!

At coconut Waikiki hotel was awesome and we would definitely reccomend this to anyone as well as coming back and staying! Although we found our bathroom wasn't the cleaniest, but definitely didn't have a negative outcome on our stay with you. See you next time

thisi is a very good hotel in waikiki and we have had a very pleasent time in Hawaii. we had 2 rooms with vey clean and nice equipment. Also the reception and cofee bar surroundings.We do hope to have chance to stay here again.

Good location 2 blocks from the main waikiki stretch. Not too noisy and if you're lucky you'll find free parking along the canal. Also close to convenience stores and shopping. Morning jog along the canal is a fantastic way to start the day!

Very neat and tidy hotel in a great location. Our room facing the canal was noisey, and we needed ear plugs to keep the road sound down. Maybe an inside room would have been better(no view).The breakfast is appropriate. Pop corn being provided of an afternoon is a good snack. All up good staff and a convenient location.

We had a great stay at the Coconut Waikiki - the rates were fantastic for what you got. When we arrive, there was fresh popcorn and a variety of beverages in the lobby. There is a great gathering / game area and a fabulous breakfast there as well. The pool is heated and they have chairs and towels for you at the front desk which is just steps away.Parking is valet only at $30 per day so figure that into your budget.The rooms were very good. Clean, well kept, comfortable beds. Nice TV, microwave and fridge. They have complimentary waters and coffee available.Overall, excellent hotel. We only stayed on night before going on to our resort but I would certainly recommend this for an extended stay. Easy walking distance to everything downtown.Last, but not least, was the staff. They were exceptional in their customer service. There was a handwritten welcome letter waiting on our arrival and everyone could not have been more accommodating. Well done!

Everyone is so friendly and nice!! I love the 'word of the day' on the board downstairs haha. Will 100% go back next time I visit Oahu! Thanks everyone, you made my first time in Hawaii amazing! From everyone downstairs at the desk to the valet (Hi Ron and Robert!) to the hospitality staff, everyone is so awesome! We got upgraded to a mountain view which was super nice!

The hotel was very personal. The staff are very friendly especially Sylvia and was very helpful. The workers that did the valet were so kind, always ready with a smile. The front desk staff were instrumental in helping my family carry off a wonderful surprise for me. The service staff especially Aida kept my room clean and made sure I had everything I needed. The continental breakfast was on the money with plenty of choices. The afternoon snacks along with the flavored water was a nice refreshing touch. The location was near enough to everything that you could walk. I would definitely stay there again.

Great hotel only a couple of blocks from the beach. We had planned an active holiday and didn't want to spend a fortune on a resort when we knew we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room, so the Coconut was perfect for us. The hotel is older, but it has a cute quirky vibe and our room was clean and comfortable. The staff were great – friendly, efficient and accommodating. The free breakfast was a real bonus given food prices in Waikiki. There was some traffic noise, but we were tired from full days and had no trouble sleeping. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the aircon unit in our room was quite loud, but we found we didn't need to use it (we are used to a hot climate though). All in all, a great find –would definitely stay again.

Went here for our honeymoon stay. When we arrived they had upgraded our room to a suite. Told them it was our honeymoon and they brought up champagne and chocolates. Staff was helpful, polite, and willing to go the extra mile. Hotel was newely redone and super clean. Walking distance to ocean, shops and great food. Would definitely stay here again!

From the moment we walked through the door Issac and the rest of the staff made us feel very welcome and. Like family.The rooms were spacious and clean, bed comfortable.It is located beside the canal and about 4 blocks to the beach. The free continental breakfast was a plus, best scrambled eggs, waffles, fruits, breads, crossaints, Cereal, oatmeal, juices, coffee, teas etc.Free wifi, laundry facilities.Pool was small , but did the trick.People complain about the resort fee and the valet parking charge, but it is clearly stated when u book, read the fine print people!!!!!!! Most hotels have resort fees!,,,If u are looking for a 5, star fancy resort on the beach, this is not for u. This us a very affordable hotel, clean and comfy, nothing fancy, with wonderful staff.We will definetly be returning!!!!!

This hotel is a hidden gem. All the staff were very helpful and organised shuttles for us. Breakfast is good and there is sufficient choice for a few days. The small pool is also a bonus but we never used it, why would you with the beach around 5 mins away. Our room was great, with a sink, microwave and fridge. There were some comments about a sketchy area but we felt safe the whole time. Our view over the inlet and mountains was worth not being right in the centre of everything? The beds and pillows were amazing such good nights sleep which is not always possible. I can't fault this hotel at all.
user_name:
Chris W
Bishop Auckland, United Kingdom

review_body: If you like to discover the Island, the Hotel is a suitable hub. The rooms are okay and clean. At least there is a very simple breakfast - Would call it: just a little nourishment. Around 10minutes walk to the beach. Negative: disturbance by the cars in the streets.

Located 2 blocks off main drag but traffic noise quite bad due to louver windows. Good continental breakfast included and friendly staff. Not most modern hotel but rooms comfy and clean. Close to tour pickup points.

This is the first time that I have had the pleasure of staying here and I was pleasantly surprised. My room was very clean and I was fortunate to have a beautiful view. The staff was amazing and accommodating. Isaac made my beach day perfect with a chair and towel. I couldn't wait to have my daily fruit infused water. The valet drivers were also really great in getting my car quickly or leaving it out when I needed. I look forward to our next trip and staying at the Coconut.

The hotel was very clean and bright. The staff at the front desk and valet were very helpful and friendly. when asked about recommendations for restaurants around the area they had wonderful suggestions.

Overall great experience there! Very nice and friendly staffs, free breakfast, The room is very nice, cleanand good size room. Hotel is old but they keep it up very nicely and stylish. Location is close to many shops and restaraunts. We had a great time there.

Perfect location, great hotel, staff was friendly and helpful. Great complimentary breakfast, and valet parking. Room was super clean, had a fridge, microwave, and sink. Nice view from balcony. Definitely stay there again

Lovely boutique style hotel close to the waterway and about 15 minutes walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Very helpful and friendly staff at reception. Nice spacious room with great amenities. Buffet breakfast was lovely and you had the option to eat in or on the patio. Only negative was the proximity to a busy road and some traffic noise at night. Would certainly stay there again!!

The scenery is very good, from the shopping place very close, Dfs tax T square, have big street, meet the shopping desire, there are many famous restaurants around, the whole life is very convenient, and Hawaii will be selected here

The location of this hotel is within walking distance to everything, but far enough off of Kalakaua and Kuhio (the main drags) that it is quiet and peaceful! Right off of the Ala Wai canal, beautiful morning and evening walks give a break from the hustle and bustle of the beach and cosmopolitan city. Staff was all fantastic, friendly, and a lovely breakfast each morning, and afternoon snacks and flavored waters were always available. There is a lovely common area and they provide lots of games for use in the lobby. Room was very clean!!

We loved this hotel. Comfortable, clean, stylish. Very professional staff. Excellent location. I highly recommend. Nice view of the Valley and mountains. Nice warm pool. Great for Kamaaina. We will stay there next time we travel to Oahu!

was an awesome stay. my first trip to Waikiki, liked the smoking areaeveryone was polite and friendly. food for breakfast was varied and deliciousthe pillows you use are awesome!!!! what kind are they? I need to get one for home

Rather than do the very long return trip from Australia to Seattle through LAX, we schedule in a two-day layover in Honolulu. Cuts down significantly on air travel time and helps with jet lag. We found the Coconut Waikiki Hotel on a previous trip and enjoyed the stay there so much, we returned again this time. The staff here are incredibly friendly and helpful. The establishment is clean and well-cared for. The rooms were comfortable and the location was just off the main drag of Waikiki, perfect for walking everywhere. We will return to this hotel again on our next pass through Honolulu.

We stayed here after a cruise ,I could not ask for a more pleasant hotel,the staff were very helpful,the room excellent two double beds kitchen,iron and board ,safe .The hotel has a laundry room,very useful,small pool,excellent breakfast just right to start the day exploring,10 minutes walk to the beach l could go on .I would recommend everyone give this hotel your consideration when booking a hotel in Waikiki .Excellent value,Excellent staff Excellent location

Friendly, helpful staff. Free breakfast was a help since food prices in Hawaii are high. We also enjoyed the infused water when returning in the evening. Easy walk to beach, bus stop, or across canal. Book yourself and they wave the resort fee.
