Walking distance from Waikiki beach. Central to everything. Nice, clean rooms. Fantastic service!! The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki. :) We will definitely be back.

The staff at the Coconut were all very helpful and friendly. In a good location with lovely canal and mountain views and only a short stroll to main streets.I was impressed that the hotel management allowed one of its staff to bring their child to work with them occasionally proving that it is a family friendly hotel. I would stay there again.

Do you want a "meh" hotel stay where staff barely acknowledge your presence, or do you want a super personal experience where the staff are FRIENDLY and the hotel has though of excellent little touches (popcorn happy hour, beach towels, free wi-fi, little maps with marked runs around diamond head for athletes, individually wrapped Q-tips in bathroom) that not only makes you feel like a valued guest, but makes you feel at home while on vacation? I'll take the latter! The Coconut Waikiki is an amazing boutique hotel and we stayed here for the tail end of our honeymoon - we could not have been happier with our choice and only wish we had planned to stay longer. From the message welcoming us as newcomers to the comp beach towels, to our AMAZING room PLUS truly first class staff from start to finish, we very much felt like we were appreciated and taken care of. Walkable to all the shops and food. We will definitely be recommending the Coconut to all of our friends and family and cannot wait until our next stay!!

LOVED the Coconut Waikiki! Great location on Lewer street ... nice quiet street off the main busy shopping street, very walkable to shops, beach and restaurants. Continental breakfast every morning was delicious, lots to choose from, and the heated pool was so nice to relax in at the end of the day! We got upgraded to a suite which was very spacious and well appointed! Would definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Waikiki - it is a little gem!

The staff at this hotel are EXCEPTIONAL!! They truly go the extra mile to make you feel welcome and tend to your needs. We arrived very early in the morning so to avoid having to wait until check in ( as our room was being cleaned from the previous holiday makers) , we were offered a FREE room upgrade with earlier check in! What outstanding service!! I've traveled to many countries and around my own country (Australia) and have NEVER had service like this before (Lizzie you are a true gem!) All the staff were beautiful, from Lizzie to Wayne, Isaac, Ronald, Sylvia, Mike, Robert and the lovely staff who cleaned the rooms each morning and the breakfast staff too! The delicious free buffet breakfast consisted of fresh waffles, boiled or scrambled eggs, toast, fresh fruit, muffins, croissants, a variety of breakfast cereals, porridge and orange juice. All day, there was free coffee, tea, hot chocolate, a variety of iced teas and in the afternoon, free popcorn too! The pool was heated so made night swims a joy and the location was excellent! Its only a short stroll to the centre of Waikiki, with all the restaurants, shops and of course, the ever stunning waikiki beach.The rooms are exceptionally clean, modern and a decent size. If you require any information, the staff are better than google!!! They know all the best places to visit, advise on the best way to get there and will print off information for you! They are always chirpy, willing to chat and ever so friendly, at all times of the day or night. They all truly encompassed the aloha spirit and we look forward to returning to Hawaii and the beautiful Coconut Waikiki Hotel.

Excellent hotel, value for money. Staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. Loved the complimentary drinks,popcorn and beach towels. Excellent location, very closeto shops, restaurants, beaches and bus stops.

I had my doubts about this place, frankly the name threw me. I now have no reservations about this cute, homey hotel. The real seller is the charming and ever helpful staff who go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Nice pool, solid wifi, and always available coffee make it easy to enjoy the place...plus a simple free breakfast buffet that can help stretch a budget. We'll be back.

Can't praise the hotel enough. Have been bragging about them since we got home. Spent months on trip adviser, choosing a hotel. I was worried we'd get a lemon. Couldn't have been better. Isaac and Wayne were amazing hosts, they answered my many enquiry about tours and what was worth the money and what was not. They saved us a heap of money with their suggestions for transport etc. Room was perfect and so big compared to other hotels. Free wifi, free breakfast (lots of choice) free popcorn and iced teas. Our bed was so comfortable we stripped it off to find the make as we slept like babies. We were warned about Waikiki being noisey at night but we had no noise problems in our room on the street and gorgeous views. Room was super clean and had everything we needed. We are coming back.

Spent two nights here on our way to San Fransisco. Very pleasant room, clean and comfortable, great king size bed. Staff were really welcoming and helpful, especially as we arrived early. Breakfast was ample with a good range on offer but you need to be aware that it finishes at 8.30! We were able to walk to the beach quite easily and local bus service was close by.

This hotel has almost everything you look for at a decent price: good location( only 2 blocks from public transportation and other main attractions), good size clean room with microwave, fridge and some cutlery. Complimentary water bottles are delivered to your room daily, very nice breakfast, great afternoon snacks and drinks. Eating area is roomy and spotless. Reception area is spacious with strong wifi signal. Best of all, the staff there was so wonderful during our stay. They went out of their way to make you comfortable. As we had a very late night home, they allowed us to check out at 2pm at no cost. We had ample extra time time to get ready to leave and we really appreciated the staff effort. Will definitely come back to this hotel.

Amazing experience and I couldn't have asked for more! They will take care of you and I know you will have no regrets. Silvia, Ronald, robert and all of the staff members we encountered were fantastic, I will be pleased to come back and stay with you!

Great first impression! Lizzie, Ronald and Guia were always smiling! Loved the room and amenities especially the 24hr water and coffee. Free Popcorn too! Room big enough for the 4 of us. Definitely coming back!!!

I had wanted to stay in a boutique hotel, and the Coconut Waikiki was a perfect choice. Charming, the location was just what I needed..access to Waikiki, but easy to get out of Waikiki ( I lived in Hawaii for decades, and spent much time seeing friends.) I found the staff to be unbelievably friendly and helpful, and they just exuded the aloha spirit. My room was clean and nicely furnished, and the view of the Ala Wai Canal was beautiful. There are not many showers in Waikiki that are step-in rather than tub-showers. For an older person a step-in shower is a must.. This was one of my main reasons for choosing this hotel. Also, I did not want to be in a large hotel with hundreds of people milling around.

Location great, can walk to everything, staff helpful and friendly, included breakfast a plus, air conditioner a little noisy and not very efficient. Staff assisted with minding our luggage for a day. A good stay would recommend.

Room was clean, but awfully small. No fridge or microwave. Having to buy coffee for the coffee maker at 2 bucks a cup is kind of flaky. The balcony is a nice feature, and we enjoyed sitting out there in the evenings.

The hotel is a very cute, boutique hotel about two blocks from the strip. It’s a perfect distance so you’ll have peace and quiet, but also access to all the great restaurants and shops. We took advantage of the continental breakfast everyday and loved the organically flavored waters and hurricane popcorn. The staff was EXCEPTIONAL and staying there felt more like staying at friends than at a generic corporate hotel. I have to give a special shout-out to Issac for taking care of us, and we thought Robert the valet was also great! We would definitely come back to the Coconut Hotel Waikiki on our next trip to Oahu.

we can only praise the hotel for many reasons including complimentary 'everything'. clean rooms, helpful staff, very good price, fantastic view from room balcony. the location is only 15 minutes walk to beach and plenty of local buses near hotel, heated swimming pool, very filling comp breakfast.my only comment would be there is no local tours counter at hotel. .

Great hotel, friendly staff, complimentary everything, heated pool, clean rooms, fridge, fantastic room ours with view, very good value for money, close to everything. We would stay there again for sure

We stayed at coconut waikiki found the location very central to most places in waikiki , the staff were very helpful ,although a bit noisy on the canal side and a/c noisy we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again

My stay at the Coconut hotel was wonderful. What a friendly place to unwind. Wayne and Isaac at the front desk had great suggestions and truly showed us all their kind Aloha spirit! Thanks for the hospitality

exceptional value and a very helpful staff. The location allowed for easy access to shopping, sites and the beach. I would recommend to anyone to stay at the Coconut Waikiki. No complaints our stay was very enjoyable and the morning breakfast was very good.

The hotel is a 10 minutes walk from the beach and very close to the main street with commerce and restaurant. The room itself was OK (nothing fancy but nothing bad either). The pool is small and very hot which made it great, as we had a full day of rain, for the kids to have fun. What I really liked were all the little amenities the hotel offers to the guest: Nice continental Breakfast, Flavored water, coffee and tea available all day, Hurricane popcorn, and most importantly very nice people at front desk. It is not a luxury hotel but all the effort are made to make you feel good. The only negative point for us, we found it to be a bit noisy early morning, not the hotel itself but the surrounding. We stayed 3 nights and worked well for us.

The Hotel had a pleasant staff and the rooms were average. The sliding glass door needed work to be opened. Also, If you rend a car it is additional 30 a day to park at Hotel . There is street parking but limited. Hotel is not on the beach but just a 2 block walking distance.

During a layover on the LONG trip from NY to HI, I received a call from the front desk of the Coconut Hotel asking if my reservation of 2 rooms for my family trip would be alright with upgrading for free to the penthouse because they were not able to accommodate us in two rooms next to each other. WHAT? Of COURSE we were ok with that!We love the hotel! The pool is small but we love the warm temperature and it is in the shade which I appreciate. We took our 10 mo old baby swimming in it for the first time. We had the whole pool area to ourselves.Free breakfast with make your own waffles and toppings! All day coffee and iced tea and infused fruit water, and fresh popcorn everyday in the afternoon.Isaac at the front desk is so helpful! All the staff members are welcoming, kind, and helpful! We loved the Coconut Waikiki Hotel!
user_name:
Deniseiscool
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful; the best I've ever experienced. Our room was well furnished and comfortable. My only complaint is that we did have ants in the room in and around the bathroom area.

We spent our 26th wedding anniversary here and the staff at Coconut Waikiki had gone above and beyond to ensure our stay was memorable. The hotel location is the best, close to everything but yet far enough from the hustle and bustle. This hotel by far exceeded our expectations. Coconut Waikiki will be our home away from home each time we are back in town.

The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the beach, not too far and the walk through Waikiki is pleasant. They provide you with beach towels and beach chairs if you want. The thing that we really liked about this hotel is the customer service. Everyone was so friendly, and willing to help with any request... even helping to crack open a coconut in the middle of th night. The front desk people were really nice and friendly, especially Silvia who went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable during our stay. We had a really great experience and would highly recommend this hotel. Thank you coconut Waikiki.

Very awesome, enjoyable stay, loved the free breakfast, and relaxing room view the front desk gave us,excellent staff from valet to front desk , and not to forget the clean room and cheap hotel price. Thanks much!!!

Very friendly and homely hotel. Extremely helpful staff. Nothing seemed a problem to them. Loved the breakfast and popcorn. Least liked the traffic noise in the bedrooms at night, had to sleep with earplugs some nights.

Our first time in Oahu and we stayed in this beautiful boutique hotel. The location is great, 5-10 minute walking distance to restaurants, shopping areas and the famous Waikiki Beach. Their continental breakfast is delicious, but the room views are the best. Hotel staff is super friendly and helpful We will definitely return to Oahu and to this hotel. Mahalo!

We stayed here for a week as part of our babymoon, and enjoyed our stay! They gave us a complementary upgrade to mountain view king, which helped my wife be much more comfortable (esp the kitchenette), offered free beach towels/beach chairs/umbrellas, and had a nice afternoon snack of popcorn for those lazy days. They even helped us find a prenatal certified massage place, which we took advantage of!

Overdue review but it would be remiss not to sing the praises of this little gem! Staff on the front desk were exceptional - polite, informative & super friendly. Helped with recommendations for where to eat etc.Location is prime - not too close to be constantly bombarded with noise but easy walking distance to beach, shops & trolley stop. What more could you want!To have a coffee maker & microwave for all those leftovers from huge American portion sizes was a

Couldn't fault the excellent service here especially Issac on front desk. Rooms were good although need a bit updating, bathrooms small but serves the purpose. The biggest problem we found wih this motel and the only reason for the average review was the rooms with a view face a main road with a set of traffic lights, the windows were only single glazed and also some louvre windows which means noise gets into room easily. I was sleeping wih industrial strength earplugs and it did little to reduce horrific traffic noise. After 2 nights we asked to be moved to a room at the side with no view which was alot quieter. So if you are a light sleeper make sure you ask for a room at the side of the motel not facing the amazing view☺

Room were nice and well kept, had an awesome view of the mountain, I loved it. The staff were awesome, they never failed to make us feel welcome. Bus stop is 2 mins away, It is also a 10 to 15 min walk from the beach so if walking a little bit is not a problem for you then this hotel is for you.

Excellent place to stay. Excellent staff. Easy walking distance to everything. Nice view of the mountains. Great popcorn. Breakfast is also included which helps. Very clean and tidy. Porters are ver helpfull as well.

The property is within 10 minutes walk from Waikiki beach and the congress center. The room was on the small side, but with a small balcony. The first room I got had a broken closet door, wall lamp and shower, but I rapidly got a new room. The pool and pool area were small, but comfortable and nice for a lunch break pool time. There were 24h coffee and water (with orange, cucumber or icetea taste!) in the cozy lobby, and in the afternoon there were fresh popcorn. Good free internet in the whole building (except fitness room and parts of pool area).

Overall very nice hotel, exceptionally friendly staff, breakfast was good, complimentary 24h non-alcoholic beverages were definetily a plus. My room (8th floor facing the canal) was very clean and spacious, which also applies for the bathroom. Only downpoint: Despite being in a relatively high up room, this would not have worked for me if I weren't able to sleep (and sometimes during the day just sit) with earplugs (Note that I had asked for a high up/quiet room during booking). I was actually surprised at the discrepancy between how nice the room was and how inadequate the windows/sliding doors were despite being close to a 3 lane street with 24h traffic. Disclosure: I am used to german engineering when it comes to (public) infrastructure...Yet Again, as it was not a big deal for me personally (I didn't try to ask for a different room) I had an overall pleasant stay.

Stayed in Waikiki for a few nights with my husband to explore the area, I hadn't realized how much of a city area it really is. As others have mentioned, the windows do not shut tight and you can hear noises from the street below. One night we heard several people arguing very loudly from our bed. It also doesn't allow the room to completely cool with the air conditioning. But overall, a nice stay.

The stay at Coconut Waikiki Hotel was comfortable. AC was really cold. Felt awesome! Sliding door to the lanai was broken. Was difficult to open. That's something that needs to be fixed so guests can have access to the lanai. Overall, great experience and would recommend to others.

This hotel is in a very good location within walking distance to most places of interest in Waikiki as well as close to bus stops. It is not a resort style accommodation so the pool is small but heated very well and it is about 15 minutes walk to the beach which we didn't mind. A small but sufficient breakfast is included which helps to keep costs down for food. All staff are very helpful and the wifi is great. It was our third stay in this place and we would not hesitate to return for our next visit to Honolulu. The rooms are spacious enough with great beds and we had mountain views which we enjoyed.

My wife and I came a long way and we had a great experience at the Coconut Waikiki, staff are extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are big enough for two, clean, bed is very comfortable and pillows just perfect. If you do not mind walking to shops and beach is certainly value for money and would certainly recommend it, complementary breakfast and free internet adds to the experience. May 2017

I spent 5 nights at the Coconut on a business trip. The hotel is just OK: clean and more or less conveniently located for Waikiki. However, it feels very old, with many layers of (shiny) paint, peeling off at places, like a cheap motel. The windows don't close tight, so you hear all the noise from the street --and it faces a very busy street--, so you end up waking up at 2 a.m. by music blasting from cars: not nice at all.The breakfast is also just OK, with mini-waffles, pastries, fruit salad and cold cereal. They also had some mushy yellow stuff that was labelled "eggs", but it tasted like eating a sponge, and I wasn't the only guess that threw it away (and I _never_ throw food away). I guess I shouldn't complaint, since the breakfast was "complimentary" (well, after paying a $20/night "amenity fee").The pool was really small and I ended up not using it, so I cannot comment on it.The only good thing was that the staff was quite friendly, especially Mike.Overall, it was "just OK" and definitely not a good value for the price. I would not recommend this hotel, and will not stay here next time I'm in Waikiki.

Coconut Waikiki was just the best hotel. Amazing helpful staff, great breakfasts, clean and comfortable room, no hassles with wi-fi, lovely warm pool. Bliss...The only thing i didn't like was the air conditioning blowing on to me in bed. Needed it to cool the room but it would be better to be positioned elsewhere.

This second time I stay in this hotel. I tell you it is very nice hotel you can expect from warmness of Hawaii. Friendly staff, very good breakfast, and great service. Only down side is that they need to work on their work out room. Exercise equipment need lot work and out right dangerous to get on. Other than that it is great hotel to stay in and my wife and I will definitely come back.

Friendly personal (esp. Lizzy), room with kitchen, very nice view to the river and hills, good breakfast, possible to sit open air.Air condition in room1005 needs revision, very noisy, had to switch it off.

Very welcoming staff, great amenities i.e. snacks, infused water, games for the kids. Unfortunately we weren't there long enough to try the continental breakfast. They even had an umbrella to loan us when we needed it!

Helpful, welcoming and a sincere desire to make your stay enjoyable pretty much sums up the attitude of the staff.Great stay in comfortable clean rooms with a spectacular view of the camel. Fantastic for people watching while sipping your morning coffee.

I loved our room in the coconut Waikiki Hotel, we had a balcony room on the top floor had plenty of space and a 5 minute walk from the main strip. The staff were very friendly, and the facilities were amazing. The only downfall to it, was they had a breakfast bar setup however, there was no buffet breakfast. But Brekfast was included.

We stayed here for 8 nights and booked the place based on recommendation from our Travel agent.He was right!Good value for money!Large clean roomsQuiet part of WaikikiAbsolutely fantastic staffNo hesitancy to recommend this hotel

The staff had location knowledge and were very accomodating. The rooms were very comfortable and the hotel was close to everything. We enjoyed our stay so much, planning to come back again for another holiday.

Wow are we impressed with the Coconut Waikiki Hotel! Considering it is more of a 'budget' Waikiki option we couldn't have been happier with our choice. Please see my points below as to why staying here is the best choice you'll make when going to Honolulu.- Good location, close to major shopping strip, market places, food and only 3 blocks from the beach (10 minute walk). All local trolley and bus stops are within a 5 minute walk.- Great staff and friendly service. It was our wedding anniversary the week we stayed and not only did we receive a hand written card congratulating us, but a greeting on their daily welcome wall AND a free upgrade to a massive suite!! Complete with sofa bed and 2 bathrooms! Very spoilt :)- Fantastic continental breakfast! All you need for a good start to the day. Tea, coffee, waffles, toast, eggs, cereals, fruit, pastries all included. - Daily free salted and buttered popcorn from 2-6pm. Such a nice touch!! - Small heated pool and free towel and beach chair hire.Thank you to all the staff for a lovely stay. We will certainly be returning!

Stayed for 1 week in April. Free breakfast was great and reception had a great atmosphere. Staff were very friendly. Room was small but clean. Aircon unit was very loud and old so we didnt get great sleeps. Room didnt have a fridge to keep drinks cool, so wasnt ideal in the hot weather.

Very friendly hotel .conveniently situated. Excellent service. Rooms clean and modern. Staff are very friendly and can not do enough to help you. The only down side was that the bathroom was a little small. Would certainly recommend it to anyone.

This is a smaller hotel that works hard to provide a relaxing and fun stay. The vibe is nice. Staff very friendly and accommodating. I had a bicycle with me which they found a safe place to store each night. Thanks Mike! The popcorn in the afternoon, Hawaiian-style, was fun. My room was small but immaculately clean. And a huge flat panel tv. Good location.

2 blocks from the 2 major shopping streets, can see the canal from your balcony. I went in January of 2015. It was still beach weather. If you want warmer beach temperature then maybe you should go after march.

A very pleasant hotel with plenty of character. Enjoyed the intimacy of the lobby with other guests. The gym and swimming area were both very good. Location is not bad only a short walk to the main street in Waikiki and the restaurants and bars, Beach is accessible as well.

This Hotel is hands down the best hotel in Waikiki...Friendly staff that go above and beyond to make your stay unforgettable. Robert is the best and happiest person you could meet in the world so kind and helpful..Dont MISS out if you want to enjoy your yourself and feel like family..

I have stayed at many hotels when we come to waikiki, but not the last time! I am so glad we stayed here. The rooms are comfortable,but what makes this hotel are the staff! They make you feel like family. They make this hot #1 in my book. I'm so impressed with the coconut I have canceled the hotel I was going to stay at in Aug to come back to the coconut ! Best kept secret of waikiki.

The staff is professional, on the ball, and very friendly. Upon our arrival we were greeted with smiles from the doorman, and Issac (at the front desk) was very attentive in making sure we were happy with our room. The rooms are clean but because the hotel is situated right in the heart of Waikiki and within walking distance to the beach, some rooms can be a bit noisy. So, If you want quiet, it's best to tell them. The pool area is really smart and comfortable. Also, everyday the staff write greetings and guests' celebrations on a huge 10' x 5' blackboard. I had forgotten it was my wedding anniversary, and when Silvia found out, not only did she write it on the board, she sent a bottle of wine and chocolates to our room. Very cool. It's also nice to have a buffet breakfast in the hotel, and the afternoon popcorn is terrific. My husband and I would stay here again.

My husband and myself just returned from a wonderful stay at the Coconut Waikiki. The hotel is very clean and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful - even printed our boarding passes for us. This is a smaller hotel located within walking distance of all the fantastic shops and restaurants in Waikiki. There was warm popcorn waiting for us each afternoon as well as all day refreshments. The complimentary morning breakfast was delicious and always fresh. Our next visit to Waikiki will definitely include a stay at the Coconut!

This hotel was well situated and looked,over the canal and up to the mountains.Staff were excellent. Couldn't do enough for you. Well priced. Will return. We are actually going back in a few days. Popcorn is great.

We had a beautiful stay. Of the many positives, one was our stay in the Coconut Waikiki hotel. The hotel was beautiful. It had an excellent location, close to the beach, it was very clean and had a helpful staff. The breakfast was very good as well as the popcorn in the afternoon. I would recommend this hotel.

If you want great service, come to the Coconut Waikiki hotel! We were always welcomed with friendly greetings from the moment we arrived until our departure. The staff went out of their way to meet our needs. The lobby had a great relaxing atmosphere and there were always treats that we would look forward to each day (The hurricane popcorn and refreshments!) The location was also ideal for us as it was not too far from the beach, but it was a great distance away from the busyness of Waikiki. We were also upgraded to a nicer room with a mountain view the moment we arrived and that was just the cherry on top! I highly recommend this place!! We plan on coming back and staying here again :D

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki hotel for 8 nights/7days and we honestly loved everything about it. The staff were extremely helpful and hospitable with our needs and always provided a friendly greeting when we would leave and come back. The lobby was beautiful and the refreshing drinks they provided everyday was great for us who are not used to the hot weather. The location was also great because it was situated closer to the canal, so it wasn't so loud and busy and we had a great view of the mountains each morning. We will definitely come back here when we go back to Waikiki.

service great could not ask for anything better nice clean room swimming pool. gym. I would like to thank silvia and wayne at front desk'. good breakfast nice location close beach close to shopping bus service restaurants. a nice place to stay.dianne and bill austrailia.

Staff is very nice and greeting they will take care of your needs right away . Room is very comfortable and clean. My 7 nights here were awesome , i would like to thanks the staff for making our trip even better . Next time we are in Hawaii we will for sure stay there again . Aloha

Right from the get go this hotel was a treat. Very helpful staff. A complete breakfast was appreciated. The room with two double beds was clean and even had some kitchenette tools to help make the stay practical. We'd come back here for sure.

This HOTEL is well located for shopping, bus service and restaurants. About a ten minute walk to the beach. Staff wa very courteous welcoming, and eager to help. Good choices for continental breakfast.

I had a last minute stay-cation in Waikiki for 3 days and everything was wonderful. The staff were very accommodating and friendly, the hotel was clean and homey and the atmosphere was relaxing. I loved how personal the hotel experience felt, they had so many goodies waiting for us both in the lobby and in the hotel room; Complimentary bottled water, coffee/tea in the room along with a microwave, mini fridge and dishes and silverware (very convenient).The hotel even had complimentary breakfast, snack time, and 24-hr refreshments in the lobby. We will definitely be back!

Coconut Waikiki is a very comfortable and welcoming hotel a couple blocks away from the craziness of Waikiki. I liked that it was a little removed from everything, and enjoyed the short walks to and from restaurants, shopping, beaches, etc. The amenities are very nice and our room was very comfortable. We opted for the king room with view, and the view of the mountains was superb. The bed was very comfortable. All the staff at the Coconut were extremely professional, friendly, and quick to offer help and suggestions. I'd highly recommend this hotel - I think it's a great value in an area in which that is not easy to find. My only suggestion/request is to keep the continental breakfast going a bit later!

We stayed just one night before heading to Kauai. Everything was wonderful. Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location and super comfy king sized bed! Flavored waters in lobby, popcorn machine, and clean rooms!

Just stayed at this lovely hotel rooms a little noisy but you are on the main road wonderful view looking over the canal breakfast is included if you're up before 8.30 had it twice enjoyed both times rooms lovely maid service a bit hit and miss but just called down to the reception for fresh towels pool area lovely had a dip in pool lovely and warm I would recommend this hotel reception staff very helpful

We just stayed at the Cococnut for two weeks and thoroughly enjoyed our time at this hotel. From the front staff, Lizzie, Isaac and Ronald, to the cleaning and kitchen staff, it was thoroughly enjoyable. Rooms were very clean, and staff always pleasant and acknowledging. We love this hotel and will surely be returning. Enjoyed breakfast everyday also.

Great central location and awesome staff always helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Isaac and Lizzie. Loved the daily room service. Breakfast included meant we got up earlier to get breakfast and then got going out the door afterwards. Lovely pool, comfy bed. Ideal for our needs. My hubby a smoker - hotel smoke free but a nice designated smoking area which was much appreciated.

Really nice clean hotel.Offered us complimentary upgrade and bottle wine and chocolates as well as a message on the notice board on arrival.Really great service and friendly staff also.Breakfast is basic but has all you need.Rooms really clean and located within 5minute walk of the beach and all main shops and restaurants etc.

Everything about this hotel was great--the rooms, the breakfast, and most importantly, the staff! Everyone was super friendly and super kind, always going out of their way to help out in any way they could. My family and I stayed here for 3 days and then went on a cruise, and the manager was nice enough to let us return after our cruise so we could hang out for a few hours before our flight--we were allowed to enjoy all the facilities for absolutely no charge! I would definitely go back here again!

Stayed for 6 nights. Really like this hotel. It's a more personal experience than the mega strip hotels. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Room was lovely and had an amazing view of the mountains/canal. Also nice and quiet. If you want 24hr room service and a bland faceless experience then stay at a mega resort.

Excellent service from check in to check out. Great staff! Great location. Many places to shop, dine, drink and enter onto the beach within a short walking distance. Delightful breakfast each morning and wonderful "hurricane" popcorn each afternoon.

We stayed here both before and after an NCL cruise, total of 5 nights. Very conveniently located for the shops, beach and buses to anywhere on O'ahu. Clean rooms with fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee machine, toiletries in bathroom. Super continental breakfast each morning and complimentary coffee and various flavoured water urns throughout the day with popcorn too. Guest laundry, small swimming pool and valet parking. All you could want for a stay in Waikiki.The staff are all very friendly and helpful - nothing too much trouble.

We liked the Coconut, it was convenient, as you can walk or take the bus everywhere. The room was adequate, beds were double beds,not queen in our room, the pool was too small for us. We were happy with the friendly service, the breakfast, the good coffee, the juice, fruit etc.The popcorn was nice. We would certainly come again. Tip; when you take the bus, get a transfer, same price, but you can get off somewhere, look around, then take another bus to your destination..Hawaiians are friendly people..Also read Hawaiis history by the Hawaiian queen Liliuokalani, to find out about Hawaiis history

Aloha, Stayed here for one night for my boyfriends birthday. Found it on booking.com, but if you're local please book directly with the hotel. =)Fast friendly check in: the two gentlemen in the front were awesome! I didn't catch their names, but Mr. Kaaihue and Mr. Rapoza I believe (sorry if I got those wrong)? Mahalo for your awesome service and also the upgrade. =)Free wifi in the roomsFree continental breakfast (so much easier than going out for breakfast in Waiks)Loved the infused waters and tea in the lobbyFree popcorn (you can make your own hurricane popcorn too! Hello!)The weight room is open 24hours (sorry, I never used it)There are some books, an ukulele, and board games if you just want to chill out in the lobby.Beach towels are available if you need it (and its pretty colored).Our room had 1.5 baths (no waiting for someone to use the toilet. Also ladies, great for getting ready and not having to fight over counter space. Kitchenette with Keurig and 4 cups of coffee and tealocation is right in the middle of Waikiki. You can just walk down the streets to restaurants / bars. or if you travel in either direction, at least you're in the middle. Only thing is the noise from the club might be a bit loud. My boyfriend said that he could feel the bass from the club down the street shake the room (I only heard the a/c and cars driving by). I also wish the pool was in a sunnier spot or even a little bigger with a jacuzzi, but all in all it was a great first time experience here. I'll definitely come back and definitely recommend it to others. ~Mahalo for your hospitality

Our family stayed in the penthouse and loved it! It has two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, dining room, living room and a large balcony with an amazing view. We loved hanging out on the balcony. One of the bedrooms also has its own balcony with a beautiful view. The hotel staff was very welcoming and accommodating. They were always so pleasant. The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping and complimentary continental breakfast is provided every morning. Great boutique hotel in Waikiki!

Aloha. I and my family been to Coconut Waikiki Hotel from April 1- April 7 2017 . We received a very welcoming greeting when we stepped in from the on shift front desk on April 1 around 11:00pm. We received a hand written card from Lizzie. All hotel staff were nice and friendly. Special shout out to Lito Pineda who even offered us a crib for my 10 months old baby and shout out to all valet specially to Mike. They're awesome. Room, room service, breakfast, huricane popcorn, flavoured water, staff everything in this hotel are absolutely awesome. We enjoyed our first trip in Hawaii. We'll definitely recommend coconut waikiki hotel to our friends and family here in Canada. Big thanks to all staff for being so nice, friendly and accomodating. Double thumbs up

We booked this hotel on our very last night. We didn't need anything fancy, just a comfy bed. The lobby looked very modernos and liked it had just been remodeled. Lizzy greeted us as soon as we opened the door even though she was on the phone. She was able to walk us through the whole process of the room, parking and surroundings. When we got to our room, our keys weren't activated properly but it just so happened that an employee was waking by who was able to help us. He was able to show us how to operate everything in our UPGRADED room and called for new cards to be ready for us. The following morning we were greeted just like the first time. The two gentlemen at the lobby helped us with all of our bags and wished us a safe trip. Very friendly staff!!!

I really enjoyed staying at the Cocunut Waikiki Hotel. The room was very nice and clean and the staff were really friendly. I loved the complimentary popcorn and fruit juice. Breakfast was a nice spread as well.

We arrived at the Coconut and were told that our room was not ready, so we waited in the lounge area for about an hour, which we didn't mind as we were reading a book.Then we were told that our room had been upgraded to a suite. Well when we looked at the room, we were more than happy with it. Big double bed, two bathrooms, big spacious living room area and a kitchen and a fridge also. After reading reviews on trip advisor, we picked this hotel due to the location, as we were hoping it would be quiet and it was!!Also if you want to stop in one of them big high rise hotels on the front, then it would take you over 20 mins to get out of the hotel, once you had got in the lift, etc. The Coconut hotel is fab, lovely rooms, quiet locations, very personable and friendly staff, especially Wayne, Ronald and Silvia. Anything you asked, they couldn’t do enough for you!!!Breakfast was really nice too, choice of cereals or porridge, tea, coffee, fruit juice and water, also there was boiled eggs, toast-jam, waffles and fruit. If you want a small, cosy, personable hotel with friendly staff and a good breakfast, then please choose this one and you will not be disapointed!!!!

Great location if you dont mind the walk like we do. Very very clean. Awesome front desk help. Great quick breakfast i will stay here time and time again. This hotel can give you a great mountain view that is all lit up at night

The hotel does show it's age. The room was rather dated and in much need of repair. I was upgraded to a mountain view room, which it could have been, but I needed to lean over the balcony and look backwards to get that. Otherwise, it was a city view room. The room was a good size though, but storage in the bathroom is always limited. The mattress was very firm. There isn't much nearby, but walking to stuff doesn't take long 5-10 minutes.While it was nice to have the complimentary continental breakfast, it was usually pretty packed in the mornings and some things didn't get replaced as quickly. If you go, a half hour before it ends, then you will not find much of anything except bread.

The hotel is comfortable and conveniently located for Waikiki, and the staff was very friendly and wonderful. We had a great stay. Some parts of the building could use an upgrade, but overall, we were satisfied. The staff really went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time.

Stayed here for 3 weeks as a couple for our anniversary. The day before we were due to arrive we got an email from manager Jordan Cesneros, checking in and offering assistance with the best way to accommodate us during our stay, that was very thoughtful. We stayed at the same hotel 2 years earlier around the same time. We returned because our first stay with this hotel was one to remember, they upgraded the room we booked and the staff was always super friendly and helpful. I'm happy to say that nothing has changed this time, we got a GREAT room! Thanks to Jordan :) And everyone here was just as friendly as they were 2 years ago. We LOVE Honolulu and are planning to spend more anniversaries there and even spontaneous trips, so you guys can expect us to make much more trips to your hotel :) Thank you for making all our stays at your hotel a good one, we really appreciate it!

The staff embody the 'Aloha' spirit. Always with a smile on their faces, and ready to assist. They make every stay here truly special.We've been here 5 times already, and can't wait to get back.Loved everything about our stay. Great value. Your're not too far from the Waikiki strip, but far enough not to have the hustle and bustle right causing a disturbance out your window.

Very family friendly staff was awesome rooms were perfect size wish they had better breakfast like rice and eggs and some kind of meats.. wish they had a kiddie pool but other then that its a great place to stay...

This was our 3rd time staying, and we will return. We know the hotel location, rooms, & amenities better now. I have stayed here as a solo traveler, as a couple, & in December, will reserve rooms for family. Value is good. Hopefully, their pricing won't go up & up.

Walking in to a friendly face and a cold drink was lovely. We arrived to see our room had been upgraded for our honeymoon to the top floor Level 10 in a Mountain View Room. It was spectacular. The perfect clean neat room we needed, fresh linen and towels when requested. The staff were always happy, friendly and extremely helpful. We will certainly be back! Thank you!

Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is within walking distance to restaurants and the beach. Continental breakfast was good. It is a little noisy at night but your in a commercial, busy city, so you need to take the good with the bad.

Lizzie was an amazing host she is the sweetest! Would gladly recommend it to everyone! It was beautiful view. Everything was perfect and people were nice! Husband is beyond determined to only stay in that hotel everytime we visit.

Very enjoyable stay, my wife and I were there for four nights. We had an early check in , 11am, which was most appreciated after a night flight from Australia which arrived in Honolulu at 6am. We were given an upgrade and the room and view were excellent. The hotel staff were fantastic, as first time visitors to Hawaii they answered all our many questions and proved to be a great source of information and guidance.The lobby and pool areas were smaller than we expected but more than adequate. Breakfast hours of 6.30am to 8.30am were our only problem but the fare was fine. The complimentary tea, coffee and other drinks that were available all day plus the afternoon popcorn was a nice touch.

Every thing about the hotel was perfect except for the noise. Why aren't the windows double glazed? our room 504 faced a busy road with constant traffic all night. The breakfast was more than adequate, staff were pleasant and helpful, room was clean and spacious.

Stayed for 8 nights in a city view room. Although not a fantastic view, we were protected from the traffic noise and also the wind, when it picked up. Generous breakfast included, and tea and coffee always available. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and stored our luggage until our room was ready after an early arrival. Very convenient location, away from the crowds closer to the beach, with several inexpensive restaurants nearby. Close to main bus routes and eat walk to shops and beach.

From the time of check-in to check-out, the staff and rooms were exceptional. The rooms were very clean. The parking was a little interesting but no problem with our choice. We would stay there on our next trip to Honolulu.

Good location, very clean facilities and generous breakfast. Great value for money in Waikiki just 5 min away from all the hustle and bustle and walking distance from the beach . Beach towels and chair are complimentary. Book direct from their site. You won't find anything better in this price band. I strongly recommend.

We loved the hotel. The only comment I have is that the noise from the road was quite loud, making it difficult to sleep. Aside from that, the room was lovely, and the bathroom was nice and clean (although the shower didn't drain properly). We appreciated the free refreshments. Thanks for a great stay.

Six years ago my wife and I stayed at the Coconut and loved it. On a recent trip to Honolulu my wife and I decided to try staying in different accommodations. They were terrible. We decided to get out of there and move to the Coconut. We are so glad we did. The staff is professional and friendly. The property is clean, modern, and quiet. And the included breakfast is wonderful!We will never stay anywhere else in Honolulu!

Enjoyed our stay immensely especially the hot pool. Seemed strange at first having a hot pool in Hawaii but what a relaxing way to finish a long day shopping, eating and site seeing. Perfectly situated oout of the rat race but close enough to walk to beach and shops. Very clean and well revived rooms. King size bed very comfortable. Would recommend to anyone especially older friends.

This hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach. The staff could not be nicer. The guys and girls at the front desk could not be more efficient or helpful.The whole building is spotless. Ample continental style breakfast served daily. (You must try the hurricane popcorn, served in the foyer at 2pm).Save yourself the huge expense of staying at one of the larger beachfront hotels, this place is everything you need.

Everything during our stay was exceptional. We had a higher floor and they graciously gave us an available executive suite upon our arrival. Lucky us! It was roomy and had a great view of the canal and the mountains. The room was very clean and we felt/knew we were in a hotel where the management prided itself on their product. The hotel was close to everything and allowed us to walk to most of our preferred destinations. We would definitely stay here again!

Called the hotel to advise them of our late arrival. They assured us it was not going to be a problem and to arrive safely. Front desk and security were friendly and had answers to my questions. Lobby was very nice and clean. The elevators worked well and the corridors were also very presentable. The room was superb. It was very clean and spacious. It had modern furnishings and very comfortable beds. It had a small kitchenette, free wifi and a nice TV. It wasn't too far from the beach and there are many restaurants that deliver.

Really enjoyed our stay here. As older travellers it was very convenient for us to get to beach, shops and restaurants while being a bit out of the rat race. The heated pool was a pleasant surprise as it can get windy and chilly later in the day and was a relaxing finish to a busy day shopping and walking around Waikiki. Rooms very well maintained and really lovely staff, really a home away from home.Aloha to all

What we likedFriendly staff.Great breakfast included, not just donuts and coffee.Wheelchair friendly.Room was great, 2 bathrooms, one with a roll in shower, lots of room.Two blocks from major bus stop.Easy walking distance to beach.What we didn't likeDriveway is crowded for loading/unloading.We eventually had to go home.

WOW ... What a great property My sister was staying there for her birthday and i really wanted to make something special... I contacted the hotel and thanks to the FANTADTIC Silvia Drew and Jordan Cesneros she had a marvellous stay/they put a picture of all our family and a bottle of champaign in the room.They went beyond our epectations to make sure she had a pleasant stay.THANK YOU ALL

Three of us spent 12 days at this hotel and loved every moment of it. The rooms were clean and well serviced. The staff were exceptional and the location and facilities were of a high standard. Recommend this hotel to everyone

Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, the rooms were comfortable with more than usual for the price, had a microwave and sink and some crockery and cutlery. The room was sound proof and with balcony door shut street noise was minimal at night.The hotel is situated close to the beach, shops and restaurants. Will definately be staying there again and highly recommend it as a great place to stay.

We had a great stay at Coconut Waikiki. The staff were fabulous and rooms were exceptional for the price in comparison to other nearby hotels. As a budget traveller going around the States for 2 months, I found it very good for money. Waikiki is also very fun The town itself is quite spread out across many blocks and is easy and safe to navigate both to and from the hotel.

My wife and I have an incredible time and the staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome. I would love to stay there again. We didn't want for anything. Upon arriving, we were greeted by friendly faces and staff that were eager to help us with all our questions.

Great hotel & within walking distance of Waikiki beach & great restaurants. Staff very friendly & helpful. Beach towels & great beach chairs available @ no charge. Breakfast also included. Staff even arranged our taxi to the airport in a Cadillac. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Stayed here for 5 nights this past weekend. Enjoy the location, right at the corner. Staff were nice and attentive. Rooms are clean and comfy. The staff upgraded us from 1 queen bed to 1 King bed. Thank you so much! The hotel is nearby many close restaurants which was fantastic! I can go grab a light snack if I had to.The only thing I dislike was the parking. $30 for valet ??! That is nuts, knowing that my rental car was already expensive. I think Coconut should have self parking and maybe minimize the amount for valet. I find it frustrating that I have to turn in my car to rest in my hotel for an hour and come down having to wait for them to get my car out.Their resort fee is about $20 dollars a night--which it was fine, but for a decent okay hotel, I don't think resort fee should be applied. I may give Coconut another chance when I visit Oahu again.

Very comfortable bed and wonderful pillows. Nothing fancy about the place but very practical. They had nice touches like a popcorn station. You can also do coin operated laundry which I very much appreciated. Good Kamaina rates.

This is only my 2nd review on Trip advisor so that should tell you that my experience was THAT amazing that I MUST provide my feedback and appreciation for this hotel. Location-5 blocks to Waikiki beach, walking distance to ANYTHING you need!Parking- Valet parking with speedy service makes your trip very convenient. All hotels charge parkingAmenities- FREE yummy flavored water in the lobby all day, and FREE popcorn every afternoon. REALLY good FREE breakfast too!SERVICE- The staff at this hotel feel like family to me now! They are SO professional, kind, down to earth, helpful, reliable, a few times I left something I needed in my car, and they brought it up to my hotel room for me! They gave me free bottled water when I arrived and when I left! They offered their fridge for my daughters birthday cake, with forks and plates too. FREE beach towels daily, and a small gym if you ever feel like working out on vacation. POOL- the pool is heated and is often empty so you don't have to feel like you're fighting crowds as you would in downtown Waikiki and any other large hotel chainROOM- include fridge and microwave, and dining area, and lanai. everything you need, nothing you don't. Get a canal view if you can, it is so beautiful in the morning!Above all, I recommend this hotel because it is small and you really get the boutique type service and attention that makes a world of difference in a busy city like Waikiki. It is a restful quiet place you can go at the end of the day and feel like you are home. Enjoy your stay!!

Best Hotel for family. A clean , friendly efficient staff,the location is great .The breakfast was good and the pool nice and relaxing.A short walk to shopping, beach and restaurants.We love this place to stay in Waikiki.

Just wanted to say a massive thank you to all at this hotel (special mention to Isaac he was awesome) the night staff kept me and my baby company in the early hours while he wouldn't sleep. The day staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were perfect and had everything you needed. The breakfasts are superb! Not a negative comment to add... they even sent my hair clippers on to my next hotel when I left them behind! Again a massive thank you! We hope to return!

An amazing hotel with excellent service from the staff - they really made us feel like friends and not just another guest. The location is great - easy walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and the bus. The breakfast was good and the pool nice and relaxing.

We enjoyed our stay at Coconut Waikiki Hotel. It was great value with breakfast included and only a short walk to shopping, beach and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay again.

A clean hotel, friendly efficient staff, parking is valet only and it's $30 per night. They include breakfast, but it's not very good. IHOP, is just down the road.... overall , it's okay for a night or two, but not for an extended stay....need I say more?

Cannot recommend highly enough. Location perfect. Walking distance to everything. The hotel itself has the most welcoming feel and Isaac greeted us with such warmth. His recommendations for eating were spot on. Everyone here seems to take delight in making you feel welcome and happy to be here. The hot popcorn with all the fixings every afternoon was a delight as was the lovely flavoured waters available to try on a hot day after walking around. A delightful experience and one that we will revisit again and again. They also made my birthday feel very special.

Wonderful location for walking to beach, restaurants, shopping, and TheBus. Nice breakfast with fresh fruit, eggs, cereal, oatmeal, fresh waffles, toast, yogurt, juice, tea, and coffee. Also enjoyed the afternoon popcorn.

I absolutely love this hotel. I want to leave a great review but then it will be so busy, I might not be able to get a room for the next time we come! My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at the Coconut Waikiki. All the staff we talked to during our stay were always sooo friendly and very helpful, this is what makes or breaks a great hotel in my opinion! Isaac at the front desk was the first face we saw and gave us a complete rundown when we arrived, he seemed to always be around to give us info and tips. Breakfast bar lady that was there throughout the week (forgot her name), she was so sweet, always so cheerful and kept replacing all the food as people plowed through....she was always on it, love her! Gina did a lovely job making up our room and was so sweet with the little notes we left. Unfortunately I can't remember all the staff's names that helped but they were ALL great. It is conveniently located close to the downtown core, easy walk to everything you will need. The local bus is very handy and took us everywhere we needed to go for $2.50, $1.25 for my daughter. You can ask for a transfer when you pay for your ride and then can pop off and back on again for free within the time listed on the transfer. We did rent a smart car for a few days to see some areas further away on the island but the bus could have worked too, just takes a bit longer. This hotel offered a GREAT breakfast with lots of options which made it sooo worth it. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The provide little extras like popcorn in the afternoon and fruit infused water you can enjoy. We filled up the little water bottles (nice size to pack around and so cute!) they provided in the room and always had infused water with us when out and about. There is a Keurig in the room with some complimentary tea/coffee options. They also provide beach towels and beach chairs at the front desk, so nice. Love that checkout is at noon, you don't have to be in a panic to get out on your last day. They were able to store our luggage on checkout day as our flights didn't leave until later that night so we could still go enjoy the day. We had a balcony with a bit of a view of the water channel that runs right behind the hotel and is a nice early morning walking/running area. The pool was lovely for when you're not at the beach. It is a great temperature to play and relax in. They had air conditioned rooms which in my opinion is mandatory if you want to be able to sleep in Hawaii!Only con would be: the room we stayed in had a couple of spots that could have used a paint touch up (by the wall sconce and light switch in bathroom had been painted over and was starting to come off) I think the hotel had recently had some renos so I figured it more of a reflection of the reno company and their lack of attention to detail. It didn't matter to us as that had no negative reflection on the stay we had.

It was our first time staying in Coconut Waikiki Hotel, and I must say its the best hotel I stayed so far... the place, the workers, and breakfast was AMAZING! I would recommend this hotel to my friends and families. And I would like to give credit to Sylvia (receptionist) who helped us get a room for my friends. She is very friendly, job well done. Excellent service. (:

The location was great! We were very close to the bus stops and shopping. Waikiki beach was within easy walking distance and yet we were far enough away that it was not as expensive.The complimentary breakfast was great!The staff was WONDERFUL!. Ronald, Jordan, Silvia, Rick and Lizzie were very helpful, accommodating and informative.

From the moment we made our reservation and drove up the driveway, we experienced wonderful hospitality, the staff were warm, welcoming, and helpful. The hotel is bright, clean, and beautiful, they have a workout facility and the best little pool off the lobby. They have a great breakfast where you can eat in or out. Our mountain view room was beautifully decorated and comfortable. We were celebrating our honeymoon, and after staying in different places across the islands we were relieved and happy to be spending our last weekend in Hawaii at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel. It's also located perfectly in the heart of Waikiki close to the beach, restaurants and shopping.

Stayed here in December for 6 nights, the staff were absolutely fantastic and couldn't be more helpful. The location is amazing, walking distance to everything without being right in the hustle bustle. Rooms are small but fine for 2 adults and the view is really nice, yes a little noisy but so what. I absolutely loved my stay here and for the price we paid it was great value for money. Will recommend to my clients for sure!

Very friendly and helpful staff at a nice hotel. Second time we have stayed here and enjoyed both. Complimentary Breakfast Buffet made for an easy start to each day. Airconditioning in room quiet and cool.

This is a boutique hotel where we stayed for one night. Staff was very helpful and hotel is reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in price. Bed and room was clean and comfortable. Our room was facing the canal which runs along a main road so it was a bit noisy at night. Otherwise it is walking distance to beach, shops and eateries.

Loved this boutique hotel along the Ala Wai. Very friendly and helpful staff that go out of their way to make the guests feel comfortable. Wonderful breakfast, comfortable rooms with lanai and great location. Very pleased with our stay. We will be back!

We traveled with a large group and found the hotel staff very accommodating (and patient!) with our group. Rooms were spacious and clean, Just a few minutes walk from the beach, and just far enough away from the noise of the main street, best of both worlds, really. The fresh popcorn each afternoon was a hit and the 24/7 iced flavored water was a great touch. I would definitely recommend this place.

I came out to Hawaii to visit my boyfriend who is stationed there in the army. Picked this hotel because it was reasonably priced for the Waikiki area and I was interested in being in that area so I was near a lot of things to do while he was working during certain days.I am not big on spending a lot on a hotel room when you really aren't going to spend much time in there, which is one of the reasons why I loved this hotel so much. Great pricing for the area, but still offered a lot of services to the customers. I really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning. You got a variety of cereal, fruit, oatmeal, and you could make your own waffles. There was juice and coffee for those who like coffee. I also really enjoyed the fresh popcorn each afternoon! The hotel was centrally located and you could easily walk to different shops, beach, and certain attractions. Staff was knowledgeable about the area and provided a lot of information about how to get to places and the best things to do while you were there. Overall great experience, and will return!

We would like to thank Rick the hotel Manager at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel in Honolulu & the entire hotel staff very much for a totally awesome, positive experience! We will be back! I def recommend to anyone! Awesome super heated pool too! Friendly staff, clean and comfortable. #teamwork #waikiki #honolulu #hawaii

My review is for hotels at this price point. This is not the Ritz or Four Seasons. And not on the beach. It is not a resort with six pools. (They actually have one pretty small pool) So, you pay 60-70% less. What you get is a spacious clean suite type room over looking the canal and a short walk to the beach. 3 block's to City bus stop and 4 blocks to the hop on/hop off bus/trolley. Lots and lots of shopping and restaurants in this area. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. I doubt that many people regret booking at the Coconut Waikiki. I know that we didn't.

The Coconut Waikiki is a comfortable hotel conveniently located within about 15 minutes walk from Waikiki beach. The staff were all genuinely very friendly and helpful. The room was modern and spacious with lots of storage. The bathroom was a little cosy and the air-conditioning was quite noisy. The self service continental breakfast (included in the room rate) was excellent with plenty of choice. Unfortunately, the maid service didn't seem to know about the hotel's "help us conserve" programme so the towels were changed daily, even though we had hung them up as requested. Our only significant gripe was the car parking - $30/night was excessive. Excellent WiFi in the room.

What's not to love about Coconut Waikiki! Conveniently located within an 8 minute walk to Waikiki Beach - just far enough to walk off the delicious complimentary waffles included in the fresh, ample breakfast! The property is clean, light and spacious. The team are fantastic.

We thought this was the prefect fit for us. Excellent location, everything we needed and great price. We would stay here again if we are ever in the area. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

Simple European style, good service, nice rooms, in downtown Waikiki. Beach towels and chairs when needed is a nice touch. Staff provided good restaurant and activities recommendations. Valet parking is super fast.

We just had the best week in Waikiki made all the more pleasurable by the wonderful staff at this hotel. The front office staff were amazing and made us feel so welcome. Our visit to the shopping centres/outlets were great as was our visit to the amazing Pearl Harbor. If you are in Waikiki you must try a Malasada (Portuguese Donut)these are found at Leonards Bakery on the way to Pearl Harbor but be prepared for a huge line-up. But thanks to Ronald at the front dest we got them without waiting from a little caravan at the Waikele Shopping Outlet, without a doubt the best thing you will eat this year!!!

Great hotel. Staff was very nice and helpful. I arrived early and it was my first time to Hawaii. I got a upgraded when I arrived. Rooms where just as nice and clean as pictured online. I liked that you could check out beach chairs and towels. Nice view of the city from baloncy.

I only stayed one night, after a week on Kauai, but the service was excellent. They kept my bags for me as I was not flying out until late in the evening. They arranged at shuttle ride to the airport, and had water/coffee/popcorn available, as well as Wi-Fi.

Great service. Great breakfast and lobby refreshments. Awesome service. The hotel was very clean and located away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach so it is nice and quiet. Lovely staff who gave us great tips on heaps of areas to visit.

We stayed for 1 night after our stay in Kona. This place is a nice place to stay friendly staff.We had an executive suite which was very spacious , clean and we both had a bathroom was fantastic. The bed was comfortable and nice pillows. While the place is a little on the older side and a bit further away from the beach would recommend.

The Coconut Waikiki had extra friendly service, and was located a 10 minute walk from Waikiki Beach. It is two blocks from public transportation. The rooms were an average size and updated, attractive and clean. The breakfast that is included is good with an attractive area to eat outside or inside. The only negative was that our room faced the freeway and was noisy, so a tip would be to ask for a room on the pool side.

We stayed here a full week on a working trip to Honolulu. This hotel is on the far side of Waikiki, that is, on the other side from Kapiolani Park and the Honolulu Zoo, and it is also on the other side from the beach, which is a fair walk away. There are ample compensations if you are seeking something other than a place in the middle of the action. The room with two double beds that we were given was large and sunny, with a lanai facing the A La Wai Canal, which made for a pretty view, though being on the second floor traffic noise was constant. It had a small kitchenette with sink, microwave and refrigerator, and the closet also had a small safe, all useful features.There is a $20 daily "amenity fee" and if you bring a car, you must use the hotel's valet parking service at a cost of $30 per day (plus whatever you choose to tip the cheerful valets), but there are a lot of amenities--included breakfast every morning with free newspapers, beach towels if you need them, plus water, coffee and popcorn constantly available. Internet was free and worked fine. I enjoyed the large and airy common spaces on the ground floor, and the unfailingly courteous staff. This hotel isn't a dirt cheap bargain in terms of cost, but you get what you pay for.

The rooms are comfortable with plenty of cupboard/drawer space for unpacking. All rooms have balconies. The dilemma is that the good view, overlooking the Alawa canal (spectacular daw reflected in the water!) is also on the noisy side. The first night we couldn't find the air conditioner (it was behind a chair at the bottom of the balcony window) and had to leave the window open, which was too noisy. No problem once we found and used the air conditioner. Adequate continental breakfast is included. There is no garden, though there is a closed-in patio area and a little pool. Much better to walk over to the beach. We noted that most of the rooms in the skyscraper hotels in most of Waikiki just look into someone else's room, which made us all the happier to have our gorgeous canal view.

We've stayed at Coconut Waikiki twice. While it's a bit of a walk to the beach (about 10 minutes), it's still a great location if your goal is to explore Waikiki and do some shopping and dining. It's much more reasonably priced than most other hotels in Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and the beds and pillows are actually pretty comfy (I'm used to hotel beds being too soft, so this was a pleasant surprise).

Nice little hotel, staff very friendly and accomodating. My flight got in early and my room was ready despite initially check in mid afternoon. Gardens beautiful, room very clean and over looking canal which is pretty.

The boss was very kind, and staff is super helpful. Made our stay in Oahu a good one. We had troubles with our reservations due to self mistake. They was able to accommodate us still. Overall would really recommend

Reasonable price for the location with excellent service and most amenities available in such a small hotel among the towering ones. Very close to all the actions in the Waikiki area. Close to the river bank. Only issue in Waikiki is there is no public parking spaces

enjoyed our short stay,the staff are very helpful and informative. Very clean accommodations, all you need in a room. It was very nice having refreshments available threw the day and the centennial breakfast was good. Location was very good and close to all main attractions. Would stay here again if I am in Hawaii

Everywhere is expensive in Waikiki but I found this place to be good value and with good service. The rooms a pretty nice with kitchenettes, and the staff is nice. There is breakfast included each morning and free beach towels. Also there is popcorn to snack on in the lobby and some spa waters. Only negatives were that our balcony looked onto some apartments, and the people look straight into your hotel room. Also we were supposed to have a view, but we're only on the 8th floor and there was absolutely no view. On top of that an elevator was out of order our entire stay so took extra time to get up and down, also our key cards kept deactivating making it frustrating to get into our room.Overall it was a nice stay, and good quality for the price. Will return if the price is right in the future.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is smaller in size than the skyscraper type hotels and not directly adjacent to the beach and that was great for me and my travel party. It was also more affordable that most other hotels we looked into. Breakfast is served every morning to get your day started on the right foot. Water and coffee are provided 24 hours per day. The staff were always friendly and helpful in answering any questions we had. The room decor is nice and simple. My room provided a fridge, microwave and small sink in what I called the kitchen area. The bathroom is small but functional. I would definitely return to this hotel on a future visit.

Good value hotel. Not to far from restaurants and beach. Staff were very helpful with advise on trips and what to do whilst we stayed. Nice continental breakfast. Spacious rooms and nice and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff were so friendly and helpful, available 24 hours. Great to have a self service laundry facility. Not far from the main area of Waikiki which was just a short walk away. Room was clean. Will be back!

Wonderful helpful friendly staff....very clean, great complimentary breakfast....only 3 blocks to Waikiki so quiet but very handy, overlooking the Ala Wai canal and the mountains. Pool area nice to relax in!

I and my parents had really good time at coconut waikiki hotel. The room was clean and had fantastic view. My mom absolutely love that scene, she said "This view is better than that from diamond head." The breakfast was simple but delicious and all day coffee was great either. Staffs was kind and willing to help us. The most impressive thing they gave us was a bottle of white wine and letter which were made to congratulate my parent's 40th wedding anniversary. I think the location of this hotel is not convenient but also beneficial for whom looking for reasonable hotel. The only disadvantage of this hotel is that it's so noisy at night because of wide road near by it. Sports cars and motorcycles made crazy noise :(

For the price this hotel is a steal. The place inside is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. They offer a continental breakfast, flavored waters, and popcorn in the lobby. It is centrally located, close to shopping, buses, beach. The only issue would be the location of the AC. It was low to the ground, beside the bed. And the shower is built so that you shower in almost standing water. Overall, we had a good stay there.

My stay at Coconut Waikiki Hotel was wonderful. The staff was always helpful and willing to go the extra mile. The room was extreamly comfortable and nicely decorated. There was a very nice breakfast every morning as well. If you book on their website the resort fee is waived. All in all I will be staying here again in the future.

We just arrived to find out hotels.ca didnt make it clear until after booking there is a $20usd fee per room per night. The coconut website said there was complimentary parking to arrive and find out its $30usd. This room is equal to a HoJo at best. That's being nice. So for over $600 Canadian for 2 rooms for one night I'm sure we could've stayed somewhere nicer. I don't want to walk on the carpet without shoes. Breakfast is over by 9 which seems very early to us. We just wanted a low level but clean room. It is definitely low level. Clean....debatable. If you are purely looking for location than this is your placeI wouldn't recommend this place. There must be somewhere that is at least a step up for the same price. Supposedly we got a discount. We are only here for the night so won't be using the pool. Our view is of a parking lot

We absolutely loved staying here, the breakfast was great. The all day coffee and teas were fantastic. Our son loved the free popcorn between 2 and 6. Room was great, staff were very friendly and helpful. They made us feel very welcomed. Can't say enough about the staff as the service was outstanding. The location is great and near all facilities including buses and is a little bit away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Center. AAA+++

Perfect hotel. Great service from all staff. They're happy to google directions for you and will give you handy tips as to where it's best to shop for certain items. So lovely and extremely helpful. Breakfast surpasses what the website says.And the afternoon fresh hot butter popcorn is the bomb.And that pool is just lovely at the end of the day.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Coconut for a week. We were greeted with a handwritten welcome in the lobby, and a free room upgrade, which were all lovely touches to our experience.Hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful; I have never had this level of hospitality back home. A special shoutout to Ronald who took care of every need and issue that came up on our holiday. He even wrote us an annotated map with suggested food spots. Location is so convenient: walking distance to Waikiki beach, restaurants, The Bus, and shops (got to love those ubiquitious ABC Stores!). It was a little noisy from traffic and nightlife.Amenities are good. WiFi was fast. We loved the heated pool. The free continental breakfast was fantastic, including a fancy waffle maker, fresh fruit, and yoghurt (I think we were luckily in the middle of the breakfast upgrade transition). All day iced infused water, tea and coffee were great. I would have loved to have a kettle in our room, as I drink a lot of tea at night. Our room was lovely - clean and comfortable and spacious. Housekeeping was mostly great; there was occassionally a missing face towel or bath mat on some days, but this didn't bother us. The AC is quite loud, though, and a bit temperamental (sometimes it'd switch on, sometimes it wouldn't).This was our first time in Hawaii and we were so pleased and impressed with the service from this hotel; we'll come back again one day hopefully!

Location : Was perfect! It was close to everything the beach, shops, food and bus stops! Hotel Staff: sweet, friendly and very informative. They were such a delight to see every morning. Hotel: The room was small but cute. Our age air conditioning was quite noisy. We enjoyed the game room, while waiting for the rain to pass.Breakfast: The waffle bar was delicious! All in all we definitely would stay here again we love this hotel it was amazing!

Ideally located for.main shopping areas (and budget convenience -ABC )Clean , spacious room .Bonus of continental breakfast .Value for moneyFriendly, polite and helpful staff .Many thanks , particularly to Ronald .

Great location in a street that provides convenience stores (ABC Shops etc.) a food court in a shopping mall, bars and a night club then ends to the wonderful beach. The hotel it’s self is very nice & clean with very friendly staff. The room was great and when I go back, which I will I’ll ask for a room with a river view. Free tea, coffee and juice light drinks like ice tea. I highly recommend the Coconut Hotel.

The room was terrific. Everything was clean and new. Street noise was the only drawback, through the louvered glass windows, but we managed. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The continental breakfast was terrific. All day snacks also. We liked this hotel a lot.

Nice and clean with big rooms! The hotel looked nice everywere. Nice and helpfull staff. Good location and you get a lot for the money. Nice free little breakfast, free coffee, waters and popcorn. Nice little pool, easy laundry access and fitness room. Valet parking was 30$ pr day, which is cheap in Waikiki. Will stay there next time for shore!

We stayed at the Coconut Hotel on our second time back to Waikiki for 7 nights and our stay was just perfect. The hotel was located in a great location close to everything Waikiki has to offer. The staff are very warm and welcoming always available to offer to help and greet with a smile. Shout out to Ronald, Sylvia, Lizzie and Robert. Rooms are just what we needed with a mircrowave and fridge for convenience, housekeeping was daily and the view of the mountain was great to wake up to each morning. The hotel knows how to cater to guests with complimentary continental breakfast, the waffle maker, coffee throughout the day and popcorn in the afternoon! Thank you to the team at Coconut Waikiki for an amazing stay!!
