The Coconut, was a lovely hotel. Walking distance from many shopping experiences, and some food gems we found! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless. The waffle bar was a yummy part of their free breakfast. They have yummy fruit flavored waters available most of the day.

From a welcoming email a few days before our arrival to arranging shuttle pick-up to get us back to the airport, the staff at the Coconut were committed to doing what they could to make our time with them a pleasure. This boutique hotel is bright, tastefully refurbished and comfortable. The bed and linens are lovely. Breakfast was adequate but it seemed we were there one day too early to experience the upgraded version of their complimentary offerings. The hotel is in a quieter part of Waikiki very near the Ala Wai canal where people stroll, run, or even kayak.

From beginning to end of our stay, the staff of the Coconut Waikiki went beyond any expectations of service. We were very impressed with all aspects of our stay. The rooms were very good, the reception area perfect for our needs.

The hotel is located near the canal and walking distance to Waikiki Beach, Kuhio Avenue, and Kalakaua Avenue (beach, shopping, and food). Olive & Oliver coffee shop is on the same block and Maguro Brothers (poke bowl) is hidden in an alley across the street. From my window, I can oversee the canal. The location is quiet and safe to walk at night. The amenities included continental breakfast, 24-hour gym, pool, refreshments in the lobby & popcorn in the late afternoon. Ronald from the front desk was helpful on my first day, telling me all I needed to know for my stay. I had a pleasant experience!

close to the main streets of Waikiki .(walking distance) . Prices are fair. Rooms big and clean and cleaned daily. Beds are large and comfy. I think I had like 4 large soft pillows . ZZZZzz. Refrigerator included. Staff were all friendly and very helpful. They have a ditto map ready in hand to show you how to get you were your going local restaurants or other hotels for a show etc. the neighborhood is good and safe. There is a canal across the street that you could walk or jog those extra vacation calories off. Amazed at the amount of healthy people before 7am. The fitness gym is fair considering other hotels. ( same exact equipment:elypticle machine and threadmill. ) there is a self laundry downstairs that was helpful . It's coin operated $2.50 per washer and $2.50 per dryer. Dryers are really good( I know I know for $2.50 it should be yada yada yada) they have change and soap at the desk. I bought my small bottle of tide at the corner store. I think they wash your clothes too. I'm just use to always doing my own laundry. Room has an iron. Looking for breakfast there is a place called eggs n things. (Walking distance) Go before 7am. Looking for lunch or dinner : Slice of Waikiki . Small pizza place takeout window only( take it to your room and relax for a night"you're on vacation ". ( right down the street to your left. next to IHOP) great size slices. Whole pizza you order as you want it. ( light sauce extra extra cheese please with what ever else comes on the pizza thhmmm ) . While you wait for your pizza walk back toward IHOP and cross the street and shop for drinks and snacks. I always go to the store on the corner closest to the hotel. It seems less commercialized even though the prices are still probably the same. There is also a nice little store for drinks even closer if you continue walking towards the hotel. I think it is in a hotel next to ours. Other places I've tried: cheeseburger in paradise has huge burgers and yard house great bar and food (both located on same strip. Both within close walking distance ) more places just gps restaurants nearby then TripAdvisor them ;). Anyway things to do: north shore shark adventures picks you up at the hotel between the pizza place and IHOP I mentioned earlier. Yes swim with sharks !! It's safe I wouldn't do it if it wasn't:). The sharks are swimming by the boat and cage looking for chum that the fishing boats usually drop when their done fishing. The sharks could care less that we were in the water with them. But to see them up close is amazing . I saw old hooks on one and gashes on a tail of another one. All over 8 ft long . About 8 sharks on this dive. Pretty cool . Book the earliest first trip!!! Take a large towel to dry yourself and because it was cold that morning. Also definitely extra clothes and a plastic garbage bag in your book bag. Plus a gropo or whatever underwater camera you have with a wrist cord so you don't loose it. Have fun! Magic of Polynesia. Magic show plus fire stick twirling. Great show pay for the deluxe and get the steak dinner that comes with the show. Had better steaks but the show was amazing. Free drink included I had the island favorite LAVA FLOW. Basically it's a pina colada with strawberries mixed into it. You don't even taste the liquor. You poor unsuspecting bastards. lol I could drink those for days. I always go to this hotel. It feels safe . Would I prefer the ritzy hotels along the beach front hells yeah. But I'm saving my money for the adventures. I just needed a place to crash nearby for the night. Coconut Waikiki Hotel never disappoints.

We stayed in an Executive King suite with our 2 young children and it was perfect for us. The staff were excellent and we enjoyed the breakfast every morning, especially the waffles. We also loved the popcorn in the afternoon and the readily available drinks all day. The pineapple ice tea was a favourite with our family along with the hurricane popcorn. Great location, short walk to the shops and restaurants and the beach.

Really enjoyed our stay at Coconut. They did everything possible to get us into our room ahead of checkin time. Bed was comfortable and the room just fine. Staff were very helpful and made our stay. Appreciated the continental breakfast and all day tea and coffee. Very personal property in handy location to city, transport and restaurants

We stayed in an executive suite on the 10th floor. Very clean and comfortable with plenty of room. A lovely view over the canal to the mountains. A 5-10 min walk to shops, restaurants and Waikiki beach front. Also 5min walk to The Bus stop so an excellent location but out of the hustle and bustle of the front. Some traffic noise at night but not enough to disturb our sleep. Breakfast was good but some fresh fruit and yoghurt would be appreciated. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Not having to pay a daily resort fee is an added bonus.

As mentioned, the staff was excellent, room was very good, clean, very quiet, and bed was very comfortable. Location was also very good, close to shopping, restaurants Would recommend a stay for several days, room was equipped with table, fridge, microwave, coffee maker so it was possible to have some food in the room.

Can't beat this place. Great continental breakfast, good rooms, close to everything. walking distance to main stores and waikiki beach. Great staff, very helpful front desk from directions to tours and restaurants. Cannot beat this price point in waikiki.

This is a nice hotel to stay the location is in close proximity to shops, restaurant ,beach ,bus stops, the breakfast is very good, the staffs are friendly and helpful, there is a heated pool and exercise room

The room was tiny, the carpet was dirty and the sounds of street racing out front went on until the wee hours. Continental breakfast was okay and service was good. This hotel is a fair distance from the beach.

We stayed here prior to our cruise. Mid range price hotel, and we upgraded to the mountain view. Clean, comfortable, spacious, comfortable beds and linens. Breakfast is included, but was minimal if you are big eaters.Great location with easy walking distance to many things in Waikiki. We didn't care about being on the beach. If you do, check other hotels. We were happy and I would recommend.

After a lot of research into hotels in the area we booked to stay for 6 nights on our first visit to Waikiki. We were not disappointed. A great little hotel with a microwave and fridge in each room but if you are from England take a travel kettle only a coffee nepresso machine in the room. We were on floor 8 and had a really good canal view the noise from the road did not bother us. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Lizzie, who printed off maps and our onward boarding cards. The staff helped with tours as well. Good breakfast,plenty for all and hot coffee available all day. A very good place to stay. I would highly recommend it, off the main hotel area, but within easy walking distance of the beaches and the shops.

As my first stay in Oahu, I'm so glad I made the choice of to stay at the Coconut. Lizzie made me feel right at home and even upgraded my room when I checked in because my original one wasn't ready. My executive suite was clean, spacious and inviting. I loved how literally every staff member I passed not only smiled but verbally greeted me. I definitely I felt like this hotel and their lovely staff take every step to ensure your comfort. Thank y'all for spreading the spirit of aloha to me! It is also super nice to be close enough to all the shopping centers and restaurants but not to be completely surrounded by traffic. Just a hop, skip and a jump away from all that you could need.

Stayed at the Coconut Waikiki as part of a travel package (flight/hotel). Chose Coconut Waikiki as it was the least expensive package. Hotel did NOT disappoint! About a 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach/stores/main tourist area....15 min walk to Hilton Hawaiian Village/shops/restaurants. Faces the Ala Wai Canal with beautiful views of the mountains and sunrise (if you get the city view rooms). Only 10 rooms per floor, you rarely heard other guests. Traffic along Ala Wai Boulevard can be a bit noisy at times, but not enough to keep from sleeping through the night. Room was clean and nice and bed was VERY comfortable! Staff was always friendly and smiling and willing to help! Would HIGHLY recommend!

i tought that the location of the hotel was located in the perfect spot. it was so easy to get to all of my destinations. i would always recomend this hotel to all of my friends and family. Your staff treated us very well and made my stay very comfotable and one to remember. thank you for the memories.

Our room was very comfortable especially the bed. Plenty of room,but the bathroom was a bit small. Still, it never really bothered us.Amenities were plentiful. Anything used was always replaced in the service.Nice clean room.Walking distance to main part of town. Not far from bus stops, restaurants, beach etc.All of the staff were very obliging & helpful.Front desk staff, Lizzie & Sylvia, were extremely helpful whenever we asked directions, places to eat etc.Always with a smile.

Rooms were pretty clean, and the complimentary breakfeast was very ample and selection was good. Did not have a chance to swim in the pool but read that it is heated, which is a nice option being that the weather was very cool when we stayed. Would've allowed the kids to swim if we had known it was heated.

We had the Executive Suite on the 10th Floor for 5 nights, and we totally enjoyed our experience, from beginning to end!Very clean, great hospitality, no problems at all. Comfortable, family-friendly, great breakfasts, pool warm & inviting, nice view.We will definitely go there again.

Friendly and clean hotel with continental breakfast. Just a few blocks from Waikiki but located in a neighborhood setting. Our room faced the Ala Wai and park across the water. Easy access to bus transportation.

Very comfortable and really clean nothing was to much trouble for the staff,we were greeted with a smile all the time.breakfast was included and had everything we wanted.hotel was just off the main centre so was not noisy and was easy to walk into the centre.

Hotel staff were extremely friendly. Lobby is very nice and fun to hang out in. Continental breakfast was above and beyond.. eggs, waffles, good selection of cereal. oj and coffee. Pool was small but very quiet and enjoyable. Rooms were clean. close enough to all the action.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki for three nights two weeks ago. The hotel is in a great location. It was a 10 minute walk to the Beach and only about 5 minutes to great shopping areas. It is a small hotel and for the area of Waikiki Beach very reasonable. The staff gave us great recommendations for restaurants in the area. We had a very nice room, and when I let the staff know that we were to arrive on my husband's birthday, he received a nice treat in the room with a card signed by many of the staff members. The only negative I would say is that the breakfast did not have any fruit which we thought was a bit odd being in Hawaii. But I would highly recommend this hotel.

It is a 'low budget' hotel and that's it. Swimming pool is very small. Rooms at the river side are noisy. Breakfast is very poor. The hotel is more a hostel than a hotel. For europeen travellers i sugest to spent a few dollars more for your hotel.

A comfortable and clean hotel. Within an easy walking distance to the main shopping strip and Waikiki Beach. Good value for money, with free wifi and breakfast included. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Very friendly welcome by staff who are very helpfulThe hotel is immaculate throughout and is very comfortable and quiet.The location made it easy to get around as you are close to most things including a bus stop makkng it easy to get to USS Arizona Memorial (Pearl Harbour) and many other places.A continental breakfast is also included.Highly recommend
user_name:
Amanda C
Biggin Hill, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Booked online for single room, fair price for time of year. Had to upgrade room as initial room too small, staff GREAT, pool small but heated and a nice refresher after an ocean swim, location is close to all things Waikiki.

Worst service. Rude workers did not understand anything we asked. Noisy and smelly uncomfortable rooms. Bed was hard. No parkings. Extra $30 each day for parking. I would NEVER recomend this place! Bad service!!

Found this hotel very clean, great room layout, comfy bed. Our room rate included a continental breakfast - coffee, juice, cereals, toast and waffles - a good Basic breakfast but some fruit would have lilifted this to another level. There is a laundry in the basement that guests could pay by coin to use. Good facility and walking distance to Main Street Waikiki and beach
user_name:
Brian Kathy B
Palmerston North, New Zealand

review_body: this was quite a nice surprise. older hotel with current touches. staff was friendly. room was nice. only stayed one night. saw people making waffles for breakfast yet I choose to eat out. I was quite surprised overall

This hotel offer free shuttle or taxi services. My room is facing a river, so choose 607,707,807,.etc and so on. This hotel is very close to ariver, So i and my friednd can walking along the river, the scenery is very beauitful.

All staff at Coconut Waikiki Hotel is wonderful, friendly, welcoming, always had a good advise on where to go and what to do outdoors, super attentive and made us feel very special. The room (we got a complimentary upgrade - mahalo!) was very clean, lots of white with yellow and green accents, comfy bed, quiet A/C. We really liked it.It's a good location in Waikiki, removed from the noise, but close enough to where the action happened. Short walk from the beach, few minutes drive to the Zoo (very nice zoo, by the way).What I liked the least was that there was no parking, but it's really a whole Waikiki issue. Parking is gold. We'd drive around the neighbourhood for 15–20 min in the evening to find a spot, and we were lucky to find it along the canal (free), but it's definitely a hustle. However, for $30/night the hotel offers valet service. What I liked the most about this hotel were the views from our 6th floor balcony, and wonderful staff. Mahalo!!!

Good location, within walking distance to waikiki and army beach (10 minutes) and near to all the shopping possibilities. Very friendly staff. Our room included a little kitchen (microwave, fridge, sink, coffe and tea). The room was nice, very comfortable bed, nice view from balcony over the river (7. floor), daily roomservice, not dirty at all. Breakfast was really simple, some toast, flakes, sweet bakery and boiled eggs, but did the job.

Well managed hotel, room was clean, beds comfortable, WiFi worked without a hitch, location is only several blocks to the main drag. Breakfast was plentiful.The street traffic is a bit noisy at night.

Property was clean and the staff were pleasant. Good location to be away from very busy Waikiki Tourist attractions but close enough to walk to them if so desired. I would stay at this property again if the circumstances were similar.

It's only 3 minutes to the bus stop that can transfer to many tourist attractions.And it takes 5 minutes to the shopping district(including DFS).We lived in the canal view room which gives us a surprising night view.

Stayed 10 days at Coconut Hotel. We enjoyed everything at this hotel, from the friendly staff especially Ronald to the clean and comfortable room overlooking the mountains and canal. We returned each day as if coming home. We would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a quiet relaxing atmosphere, only 5min walk to the beach and shopping

Great staff very friendly and helpfull. Room good. Small breakfast choice but good an1d fresh.has pool and small gym. Central location but not to close to the crowds only 3 minutes to town and shopping short walk to beach.

We stayed in the mountain view room which was absolutely perfect, loved the coconut, great staff that were always helpful and always welcoming and the location made it much better being only a 5 minute walk from the centre, so you could enjoy both the craziness and beauty of waikiki.

Spent a weekend at Coconut Hotel, and could not have asked for better service. The valet staff, front desk, and all others were extremely friendly and helpful. We asked for simple ideas for dinner spots, and they delivered. Just a short walk to the Waikiki hustle and bustle and the beach. Quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The views of the canal were wonderful. I will definitely stay again and recommend it to all others!

Stayed for ten days at the Coconut Waikiki and I must commend the welcoming and friendly staff that work there! Always happy to help out and go above and beyond. It's not a huge hotel so the service feels much more personal. My room felt very clean, and was a nice size as well. Having a balcony and view looking over the water was a nice touch. Bathroom and amenities were very clean and maintained, no complaints. Hotel itself is perfectly positioned, walking distance to pretty much all of Waikiki, plenty of things to do. You pay for what you get, except at the Coconut Waikiki where I would say you definitely get more than what you expect from your hotel. My only minor complaint is the breakfast is a fairly standard - cereal, toast, egg, etc... But really it's no big deal considering you can walk to so many great restaurants nearby and get food! Price is great as well, honestly I would 100% stay here again next time I visit and use the extra money on shopping at the outlets!

The room was nice and roomy. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful and gave good advice on places to visit while in the area. Very conveniently located near the canal and not far from Waikiki Beach. I would readily stay here again if I was in Honolulu.

The size of the room was nice. I just had the sense that the room wasn't clean; all the corners seemed dirty. One of the shelves want installed properly in the bathroom and my stuff fell off of it. I left a granola bar on the tv stand and there were ants on it when we got back to the room. The bed was comfy and I liked having a balcony.

What a nice place to go!! It's about 1 km from downtown Waikiki and of the beach. We had the mountain/canal view and it was very nice. We shopped around to find a reasonably priced car rental and rented one for the week. With the great suggestions from the very friendly Ronald at the front desk, we were able to visit many beautiful places! Sally-Rose at the front desk was very helpful as well and very mindful of her guests! We felt that she really cared about our stay and could talk with her for hours. (The way you would with a friend you'd had for years). Sylvia was always there to make sure we had everything we needed too! Mike and Presley were always ready to help us with our car and with the doors... It was nice to see the staff interact! Chantel (not sure how to write her name) was there most mornings to refill the continental breakfast. She was on top of it!! I don't think she ever stoped moving! She was very friendly too. We felt like we were right at home! It is nice to know that they are renovating the place as well. If we have the chance to go back to O'Ahu, we wouldn't hesitate to go back to this hotel!!

Lovely small hotel with a wonderful, friendly staff. They were always helpful and pleasant. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. It had a good breakfast and was an easy walk to many places.

I enjoyed my stay at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel and would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting. Clean and modern boutique hotel a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach, 5 mins to shopping district with public transportation to all major attractions at your doorstep. I also enjoyed the fact that breakfast was provided. Staff were very attentive and helpful. The bed and pillows were super comfortable as well. Great value for money.

I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of my trip to Hawaii for the Lunar New Year. My travel buddy and I stayed in one room and her mom and sister stayed in another. This hotel was not too fancy but there were so many things that made it a great place to stay. The free breakfast was one thing; I was so impressed by how many different choices there were every morning, and I always started my day with a full tummy. The rooms were spacious, the beds comfy, and everything was very clean. The Keurig machine was also a great addition. So many great places were within easy walking distance, which was awesome. And there were a lot of Bus routes that passed the closest intersections so if you couldn't walk to the place you wanted to get to, you could always take the Bus.My only complaint would be that their pool is kind of dinky. We never used it because it was small and didn't look nice. But we also didn't treat this hotel as a resort where we would hang out for hours at a time, so I'm not really concerned about the pool. The staff members I encountered were always very friendly and happy to help me with whatever questions I had. Thanks for a great stay, Coconut Waikiki!

This Vacation I had at Coconut Waikiki Hotel was very good.There was a main street near, it was able to walk and it was very easy to access by car.Moreover, breakfast was also good because it is offered.However, because there is no coffee pot in room, I had to use hot water in the lobby.Nevertheless, there is a microwave oven and a fork / spoon / knife so that a simple meal can be cooked in the room. Oh ~ Free WIFI is also provided. <- This is really important to travelers.However, I chose Mountain View, which was very loud and cold.Eventually, on the third day, I asked to front staff change my room.The other room that I could not change on that day but changed the next day was Street View and was also noisy too,It was much better though. The scenery outside the window was similar to Mountain View or Street View.And, the shower is a little bad, please refer to the shower head is rotated, but it is fixed.^^ ;;

I stayed here with my husband and 1.5 year old baby. We had a very good stay in the executive suite. The hotel is very short walking distance from the beach, close to many wonderful restaurants, and also near the canal, which is a great place for a quiet walk compared to the main strip on Waikiki. They had beach towels you can bring with to the beach and there is always drinks out during the day. Note, there is no regular water after breakfast, only flavored waters and delicious pineapple tea. We stayed at the executive suite and the room was spacious and nice and clean. Bonus was the 2 bathrooms, which made life easy with a baby who is sensitive to noise and we could still use the bathroom when she was sleeping. Room equipped with microwave and fridge and sink, basic cutlery, and cups. Very convenient when we had to eat in the room or reheat leftovers, and great for baby to have hot food when we had a late day out and had to eat in the room. The breakfast service is a little limited and repetitive if you stay for a longer period. But the staff are wonderful and super nice and work their hard to keep the line full so that we can have breakfast. The hard boiled eggs go fast when they come out!! I wish there were fruit options, even whole bananas and apples to grab would have been nice.We booked through hotels.com, which stated cribs were free. However, when we called the hotel to reserve one, I was told it was a 20 dollar charge each night. That is really steep for a crib, when it is necessary for a baby to sleep in!! But, luckily, it was in my booking confirmation that the crib would be free and they did not charge me! Also, I called ahead to reserve but when we got there our first night, there was not one available. We did get one the next day, but be sure to call well in advance to reserve.

Love the location. Good walking distance to beach. Great room. Just one thing be good if you did a bit more of a verity of food for the breakfast, other than that ok. Friendly staff. Will be booking again to stay with coconut Waikiki.

I stayed here from 18th Jan-24th Jan 2017, first trip to hawaii for my birthday! We arrived late around 10.30pm. Lady at front desk was lovely, we were upgraded to a bigger room on the third floor. The room was excellent. Huge bed, double sofa bed and two bathrooms as well as a kitchenette area. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful and when asked they gave us tips of good places to eat, visit etc. The location of the hotel was perfect for me. Close to the bus stop to get to places like downtown, the palace, the ala moana shopping centre etc (I wasn't renting a car). And also just a few minutes walk away from the beach and shops. If you are going to book some tours you will most likely be picked up near the hotel, again just a couple of minutes walk away. The breakfast was good too. Included cereals, juice, tea, croissants, muffins, eggs and some other pastries, bread and waffles. The gym has the essentials you would need, treadmills, cross trainer, mats, gym balls, skipping rope and weights. This is not a luxury 5 start hotel so i never expected for them to have a huge gym or a huge buffet breakfast but they did exceed my expectations. If we needed a taxi, they called one for us without a hesitation, staff were helpful an friendly always. Local calls are free from your room which is useful if you are trying to book tours etc. And Wifi is free which is a huge plus.I am already planning to go back and will definitely stay here again and would recommend the Coconut Waikiki Hotel to anyone who is considering going.

I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of a big america trip, we picked it for its location to the beach, and the pool so we could relax. Washing machines and dryers where good and the pool was heated. Good size pool but only for a few people. Their was a guy at reception (ronald I think?) who was super helpful in helping us organize tours and our shuttle service. The breakfast was really average, so we brought fruit from the ABC down the road and put them in the mini fridge. Room service would make this hotel better, but there is restaurants and a IHOP just a five minute walk away if you want food. City view was nice, hairdryers in room was good, bathroom a bit small though, but the room and bed was a good size. Very good location and I would 100% stay again.

Staff was good. Short walk to Waikiki shops, restaurants, etc. Towels provided for beach.Room was large and clean with two bathrooms, but old, needs updating.Too loud from street and A/C. Sounded like windows were open. Could not sleep.

Nice service in general. I can only suggest to improve the breakfast and the table. I think is better individual tables for eating time. Thank you for your kind attendance. Hawaii is beautiful and the people is very nice.

We reserved a room through Expedia, then upon arrival we were shuffled into a different room than we ordered. We did not get the view that we were told paid for. Then we were charged an extra $20 per night which was called the amenities charge. It is hard to budget your trip when they add extra fees without warning.

Arrived early and couldn't check in but were looked after by the staff who kindly held all our gear whilst we went to explore. Upon returning to the Hotel was told that we had been upgraded. An awesome surprise and fantastic way to finish our holiday. Good facilities, nice breakfast and great rates

We were very happy with The Coconut Waikiki. The staff are all very nice!!! Exceptional from check in the check out to valet. Front desk helped me out with printIng our airline flight boarding passes. Even though she was busy, she was very helpful & so nice about it. The Room was small but cute decor & clean. Keurig coffee in room as well as waters. Didn't have the breakfast, but IHOP was just the next block over. Short walk to the beach. Would recommend this Hotel to people on a budget who want a cute, clean, nice place to stay.

We stayed at the Coconut Waikiki Hotel for the second January in a row. The has been some light refurbishment, which makes the lobby/breakfast area even more inviting. The location is EXCELLENT, so central to everything in Waikiki. The views are not great, unless you are at the back, in which case they look our over the Ala Wai Canal rather than the beach (still pretty though). Avoid room 2 on each floor if possible, very tiny. All the others are reasonable sizes (8s are the biggest), with rooms 4 through 7 looking over the canal. Breakfast is from 6:30-9:30 - til 10:00 would be better since so much in Waikiki is closed til 10:00 anyway. The staff are lovely. We will go back there again, for sure.

We didn't know what to expect but our greeting at the front told us immediately we were in good hands. The staff gave good suggestions on things to do and places to eat. What a smooth trip and we will be back soon.

We felt just like home. The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially Sally-Rose who help us very much when we discovered that we had miscalculated our stay and had to leave one night earlier. The hotel was fully booked but Sally-Rose booked us on their sister hotel, Shoreline, for our last night in Honolulu. Since we were travelling with our three children we were very stressed about the situation and we are very grateful for the arrangement they made for us.The room was clean and fresh and we enjoyed the temperature controlled pool. We also found something that we never have found on any hotel we have stayed at, a POPCORN machine. Every afternoon coffee, tea, Ice tea and popcorn were available in the lobby. Very nice!!The location was good with shops and restaurants close to the hotel. Although it was a bit away from the big shopping streets and malls it was quite calm and quiet at night. We DO recommend this hotel if you're looking for a place to stay in Waikiki.

This was a great hotel and worth the money. It is not right on the water but it's in the heart of Waikiki. The customer service from the front desk was amazing. Lizzy was very helpful in getting everything set up for my room. The valet had my car ready for me at the time of checkout. Was very impressed with their customer service. The room was clean and huge. Stayed in room 908. Bright with wide-open spaces. One and a half bathrooms. Nice little kitchenette. Has a beautiful double lanai. Anne is the housekeeper for that room and apparently takes a lot of pride in keeping this place immaculate. I would totally stay here again.

We loved this hotel, the staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were big and clean, we asked for a quiet room and were put on the top floor in a room facing the pool area rather than the main street. We could still hear traffic and some street noise but nothing much and certainly no more than you'd expect in a city.Breakfast was alright, just waffles, toast and eggs so not fancy but it was a real plus to have a breakfast included. There was tea, coffee and a selection of cold waters available all throughout the day and night. At times there was also popcorn available for free in the lobby which was a nice touch.The pool was warm and had nice comfy seats around the pool area. The hotel is about a 10 minute stroll to Waikiki beach and there are shops and restaurants close by. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again and would happily recommend it.We used the valet parking which was $30 a night which seemed expensive however, when you consider that there is nowhere else to park and the ease of dropping your car off right outside and knowing that it was securely stored overnight, it wasn't too bad. We would do this again.

It is near to Waikiki beach. It takes 15 to walk there.The room is clean, but it was a little small.There are a coffee machine, a refrigerator, a micro wave and some kives and forks.When we asked them to prepare for barbaque party, they served the electric barbaque grill with free bottles of wine.

This was our second stay at the hotel, last time was 3 years ago and they have significantly updated the lobby,elevator and rooms. This hotel is cheaper than ones on the beach side but the views are actually more interesting with the mountains, canal racers and city lights at night. It is quite noisy due to the busy street below but that is because we always keep our windows open at night. The free breakfasts are something new since last time. It would be really nice to have some fresh fruit, but they do have juice. The pastries need to be fresher, perhaps maybe not have so many choices and up the quality of the bread, waffles. We liked the sort of goofy free popcorn with little crackers in the afternoons. The newly furnished lobby was a very comfortable to read the paper and just relax. The staff were all very nice and willing to help in any way they could. Since we were in Waikiki for 22 nights we stayed in 3 different hotels just so that we were able to have some variety.

Coconut Waikiki is a gem! It is very clean and modern. Rooms have a kitchenette. A nice continental breakfast is included as well as fruit infused water, coffee and tea are available all day complimentary. Great location - close enough to the beach to walk but far enough that it was quiet. Great little heated pool.

I would like to rate this as good, not just average. First, super friendly staff, we were only there for 2 nights and Sally didn't check us in, but she knew who we were. Rooms were clean, though the bathroom is quite tiny. Simple continental breakfast included in the price, a 5 min walk to the bus or trolley, about a 25 minute walk to the Ala Moana Centre. No bells and whistles, but then you're not paying for them.

The continental breakfast was ok. The room was clean. It was cute seeing our names on the chalk board, but truthfully, the atmosphere was awful. The view from our room was poor. From our balcony, I saw apartments that were worse in the low income residents in the main land. The pool is a child's size pool. We

We stayed for two nights, and found it to be perfect for our family. Our room had a great mountain view and views of the Ala Wai Canal. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are cute and worked well for our needs. The lobby and breakfast areas were charming, although breakfast gets crowded and it is hard for staff to keep up with the demand at times. Our kids liked the pool--it was heated and just the right size for them. The location was great for those who don't mind walking a few blocks--Waikiki Beach, restaurants, and shops were all within a 10 minute walk of the hotel. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel and the room were quiet, so for those looking for a reasonably-priced and convenient place to stay near Waikiki, this is a good choice.

This hotel was one of the smallest in Waikiki and did not cost over £300 per night like most. However, it had a friendly atmosphere and the rooms were just right for us. We spent a lot of time on the balcony people-watching as we faced the canal. The swimming pool was too small to swim in so we swam in the sea, about 8 minutes walk to the nearest part of the beach. Breakfast was fun, trying to get eggs before they ran out ! There are too many expensive shops and restaurants in Waikiki but they are all easy to get to from this hotel. We definitely enjoyed our stay.

We stayed in the Coconut Waikiki for two nights. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. For instance we unexpectedly needed to print, sign, scan and send a document that they immediately helped us with. They made it easy. Check in and check out was easy, no lines, no waiting like some of the main hotels on the beach.We had upgraded to a suite and it was clean, quiet with comfortable king bed, fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Everything we needed. The location is convenient and off the really busy streets. We walked everywhere in Waikiki. It has a small swimming pool which we didn't use. They offer a basic complementary breakfast of cereal, toast, fruit and juice. It's basic but nice.All and all we had a very nice stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Not worth $350 plus a $20 boutique hotel fee. Plus parking for $30. I felt robbed. Not a great breakfast. Would have been happier had I not paid so much. Decent location, close to nice shopping. Nice view, but the hotel is OLD would not pass codes today.

We stayed for 9 nights. The hotel is small but offers many things to make your trip as convenient & comfortable as it can be. Service was great and location is quiet. We went it knowing nothing but what we saw based on reviews but have no regrets. Would definitely stay again!

We stayed here at the start of our holiday in Hawaii and found it to be a great little base to start from. Very tidy, not fancy but clean and nice and the included breakfast was awesome. Just took the hassle out of the first few days when you want to explore. It was about a 10 min walk through the shops down to the beach, so while it is set back away from the beach a bit, it's still really handy to shopping, bars restaurants etc.

So my boyfriend and I came here for a staycation and I loved everything about it! The hotel upgrades us since it was my birthday and we were only staying for one night. the room was Huge!! There was a kitchen, living room area, and two bathrooms one half, one full. I loved that there was complementary breakfast as well! Great customer service and all around great place! Check it out!

The staff at this hotel were first class,very friendly and happy to help. Although nota big hotel it lacked nothing. It was away from the hustle and bustle yet close to the beach and restaurants and shopping areas. A car is not necessary as there are cheap buses and trolley buses. Breakfast was a continental affair but enough for everyone, although a bit more variety would have been good we were there for longer than a week and it was the same every day.

A nice and convenient place to stay in Waikiki. Room was a little smaller than what was pictured on website but it was not a big deal. Also had some ants in bathroom frequently. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and prompt with maintenance issues as well

The Hotel is in walking distance of Waikiki-Beach, theBusStop is 4 walking Minutes away,the Staff are very friendly.Rooms are well serviced,Free WIFI in room and Lobby is available for guests. The Breakfast is sufficient and coffee and beverages are 24 hour avaliable.

The room and bed were comfortable and spacious. The street noise was louder than expected for a "mountain view" as it faced the main boulevard. While it is an older building, it is nicely updated and modern.

Coconut Waikiki is walking distance from everything you want to do in Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are well serviced and comfortable. It was very convenient having breakfast available. The opportunity to use hotel towels at the beach was appreciated.

Stayed here for 2 nights on a quick getaway. Booked this hotel because it was cheap and wasn't expecting much. I was shocked by how great the experience was. Incredible staff. Upgraded my room to a suite which was huge. Gave a free bottle of wine. The whole experience was great. I'll be back with my wife!

This is a beautiful hotel, the grounds are small but well maintained. Staff is amazing. The pool is tiny, but heated. If you book through Expedia, be aware of the $28 a night amenity fee you will find out about on check in. The continental breakfast was processed carbs and boiled eggs, no fresh fruit. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Great hotel in the heart of Waikiki! Will def return to this hotel on my next Honolulu trip.. we received a complimentary upgrade upon arrival which is always a nice surprise.. buffet breakfast is basic but does the job to tie you over; my only suggestion would be to maybe add some fruits.. hotel is renovated but it is an older building.. I enjoyed my stay here very much. Room was clean, all the staff were lovely and helpful and the amenities were pretty much everything that we needed. There is a resort fee, which is a Waikiki norm, but a heads up to those booking on external booking sites that the fee is not included in the price you're seeing online. For those looking for quiet, the windows are panel style so you do hear street noise; remember you're in a city not the countryside, noise is to be expected. All in all a great stay for us! We really enjoyed our time here and would recommend it.

I booked this hotel based on recommendations I saw on TripAdvisor. And all I can say is that the TripAdvisor Community DID NOT let me down on this one. This boutique hotel is a true gem.Minor Cons:1) 5 blocks away from the main Kalakaua Ave (but definitely within walking distance)2) No self-park option. They only provide valet (but at a reasonable $25/night)3) The pool is small (see traveler photos). However, you are there to go to the beach anyway.Pros:1) Modern feel. I think the Traveler photos actually look better than the stock photos that are shown on TripAdvisor. I booked the most basic room and I was impressed with the cleanliness and quality of the bed/desk/bathroom/even the air-conditioner. Unlike many of the hotels in the area, it DOES NOT look tired or dilapidated.2) Room is very spacious. I booked a room with a king-size bed and it definitely had a lot of extra space to move around.3) Solid customer service. Rooms were clean and the front desk was friendly. It is a small lobby area, so I can imagine that check-in and check-out can be chaotic during the peak times, so please plan accordingly4) Lobby area was bright, clean, and a good place to congregate when getting large parties to meet up.Overall, a very solid value. I'd highly recommend to anyone who is planning a visit to Waikiki.

Have stayed in this area before and this is one of the nicer hotels for the price. Breakfast could have been a bit better, but the hotel was oversold so not bad considering the general chaos in the am. Very comfortable room/bed. Good value. Easy walk to beach area and busy shopping district. Issac was very helpful at check-in.

Great customer service - every staff worker was friendly and very helpful. Isaac is very nice and was very welcoming to my family and myself. I would recommend family and friends to come to this hotel.

This hotel was close to the beach and bus station which were important. The entire staff was very friendly. Our room with 2 double beds was on the 10th floor facing the canal and was very spacious. It had a large window with a sliding door onto a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table overlooking the canal. The microwave and refrigerator with utensils, small plates, cups, and bowls were convenient as were the many outlets for charging electronics. The safe in the room that you could set your own combination was a bonus. The 2 elevators were quick, even up to the 10th floor, and we never had to wait long for one or stop on lots of floors. There were games and books to borrow in the lobby for a nice added touch. My only 2 complaints were the noise and the breakfast. We could hear street noise even on the 10th floor! We complained that our curtains were being sucked toward the screen like the windows were open. To their credit, a repairman came to our room within minutes to check but said there was nothing he could do, that the windows were closed. We found that hard to believe since we could hear things as if we had had the windows open and could feel wind blowing. As for the breakfast, most places don't even include a breakfast so maybe I shouldn't complain. Breakfast only included small boxed cereal (get there very early or there may only be 1 choice), bread, pre-made waffles, muffins or crescent rolls (these too went quickly), and instant packets of oatmeal. A couple of days there were hard boiled eggs. The poor lady in the dining area had a difficult time keeping up as there frequently were no spoons, and it wasn't her fault when the food was gone. I wish there had been some fresh fruits from which to choose and also a juice machine. The juice in the pitcher was so watered down with ice. Despite these 2 complaints, I would stay there again.

>from our check-in to check-out , room housekeeping , all the services were excellent - special mention to front desk staff Isaac & Sylvia who were very friendly & helpfull, and housekeeper Teddy & Kristine. >the room was nice & clean and we had a a great view from the terrace; bed & pillows were very comfortable, had a good sleep. >strategically located, walking distance to resto, shopping stores, beach .. Suggestion only- to have more variety in breakfast; we stayed in the hotel for 5n/6d & the same breakfast ... Overall, we are very satisfied & will recommend the place to friends & relatives.

The room was facing the street and was very noisy. We woke up to people yelling on the street several times. We were upgraded to an executive suite which turned out to be a handicapped room. The furnishings were dated as was the hotel.

Great location, rooms are really nice, big, and clean. Breakfast is as light and cheap as you can get for free breakfast. The beach is just about a 10 min walk, and there are some decent places to eat nearby.

I chose this hotel because of its good rating with Trip Advisor and the reasonable rates. Because we had 2 toddlers and a baby, I was also interested in the amenities of a microwave, refrigerator and complimentary breakfast. Everyone was pleased with their rooms. The only complaint was from my daughter who said that she could hear street noise on the Ala Wai Canal side. That's pretty good coming from a group this size. I had been told that it was a 10 minute walk to the beach depending on how many stores in which you stopped to shop. That was probably true. It was also 1 block from an ABC store and 2 blocks from one of the main bus stops. Honolulu has one of the best bus systems in the world. It is monitored with GPS and you can go on line with your iPhone and know exactly what time your bus will arrive. Everyone used it with no problems. The hotel pool was fairly small but for the little ones it was better than the beach because it was bathwater warm! One evening I wanted to have a celebration dinner. I reserved their large grill and patio area. Alvida Supra-Jones, the General Manager, supplied us with BBQ utensils, ice, dinnerware and napkins. She and the desk staff were extremely helpful with all our questions. I was especially grateful when, upset by not finding corn on the cob at Walmart or Sams, was directed to a wonderful big Safeway that had everything that I wanted.

Smack bang in the middle of Waikiki and 2 blocks back from the main strip. Nice and quiet yet central.Considering the prices in Waikiki I think I got valueThe staff were super friendly and the free popcorn in the afternoon was awesome.The hotel was super clean, the room was a great size, the bathroom just a little small.The only thing I would say against it is the breakfast was a bit dismal but if you get it for free that's ok - just on't pay for it.Also our room wasn't as colourful as the pictures.I would totally stay there again though.I was very happy with my choice to stay there.There is a great little Irish pub and Japanese BBQ place on the street.

From start to finish this hotel was personal yet professional and after talking to people we met from bigger hotels ours was definately the best would recommwnd this hotel to everyone!! The relaxed atmosphere made our wedding day even better thankyou it Waikiki xx see you on our anniversary!!
